Leo felt like he was scammed. He had the urge to throw away the freezer to the trash dump at the boulder. Thus, he lightly slapped the side of a refrigerator.
DING
<Would you like to upgrade the equipment?>
Leo paused for a minute. He stared at the fridge and the system window. He had never seen this type of upgrade before.
Curious, Leo pressed the confirm button.
<Upgrading this refrigerator costs 100 years of lifespan.>
Leo frowned. The system gave him prompt messages, but it didn't show what the upgrade could do. He rechecked his balance, wondering if he could afford it.
<Your current lifespan: 237 Years, 11 months, 18 days, 20 hours, and 16 minutes.>
After spending so much on furniture and refrigerators, Leo had 200 years in stock. Leo looked around and counted the fridges.
Three glass-door fridges, two meat displays, and five slide-door chests – Ten in total!
"Do I need 1,000 years of lifespan to upgrade everything?"
Leo clicked his tongue. As he had nothing to lose, he agreed to spend 100 years on the upgrade.
DING
<The Supermarket Showcase Refrigerator has been upgraded to Level 2.>
The refrigerator glittered. The outward appearance didn't change. However, Leo instantly noticed the upgrade.
The electric wire no longer existed, yet the LED light was turned on. Moreover, cool air came out, rapidly decreasing the grass temperature.
"… Wow."
Leo was in awe. The fridge no longer required electricity.
Inspired, Leo touched the second fridge.
DING
<Would you like to upgrade the equipment?>
"YES!"
DING
<The Supermarket Showcase Refrigerator has been upgraded to Level 2.>
Just like that, 200 years of Leo's lifespan was gone. He gazed at the two upgraded showcase fridges and nodded in approval.
Since Leo only had two working fridges, he got busy again. Leo rearranged the black grass and put the rest outside the store. For now, he would eat the leftover food to get his lifespan back.
.
.
Meanwhile, Han Meng returned to the sect and rushed into the tallest pagoda. He got to the top floor and strode into a large hall, where a bald man had been meditating inside alone.
Han Meng brought out the black grasses and put them on the floor. He cupped his fist and reported.
"Father! Look what I've found. I've brought you 50 blades of immortal grasses!"
The bald elder opened his eyes and gazed at his son. He wore a long coat and white robes – The uniform of the sect's grand elder. He had no facial hair or eyebrow, and his wrinkled skin seemed coarse and thick.
When the grand elder saw the black grasses, he was stunned. He kept looking back and forth between Han Meng and the pile of grasses for a minute.
"THAT'S A LOT OF IMMORTAL GRASSES!"
"Yes, father. With these, we can refine so many elixirs. We can increase our lifespan by at least 5,000 years or so!"
The grand elder deeply nodded. He stood up and picked one of the grass blades. Then, he sniffed at it.
Its odor was the same as burnt iron. They were legit immortal grasses of high quality.
"Contact Wu Buyi! Commission him to make an elixir first. If he's busy, ask him to put everything aside and complete this first!"I think you should take a look at
"Yes, father! Hahaha, you are going live for a long time."
"Of course, I will! Anyway…" The grand elder tossed the black grass to the pile. He gazed at his son, "Where did you get these? I reckon the next secret realm's opening is a month away. Nobody should have gotten their hands on these."
"Oh, right. I forgot to report. Great news, father. An expert drops by, and he agrees to sell us his herbs. He seems to be a rogue cultivator that practices the art of life force. He asked me for my lifespan when he offered to sell me these."
The grand elder narrowed his eyes, worrying that his son might have been scammed.
"How many years did he ask?"
"Only 10 years per blade of grass, father! Isn't that cheap?!"
The grand elder's expression brightened. He let out a long sigh of relief.
"We're blessed. He seems to have goodwill toward our sect. Had it been me, I would have asked for 500 years for each grass."
"I think so too! Anyway, let's hurry and make you an elixir. We can't afford to let you run out of lifespan and die before your next breakthrough."
"Indeed. Let's visit Wu Buyi together."
The two men strolled toward the alchemy department, paying their pill maker a visit.
.
.
After eating 40 blades of black grasses, Leo rechecked his lifespan.
<Your current lifespan: 77 Years, 11 months, 18 days, 19 hours, and 45 minutes.>
Leo was annoyed. He gazed at the stockpile in the freezer and counted them. From a rough estimation, Leo expected about six thousand blades of grass.
"I ain't gonna y'all! I ain't a COW… mooo."
Leo thought of the dire wolf. Then, he remembered that he hadn't skinned it yet.
"Right. I drained the blood and removed the guts, but I haven't skinned or butchered it. I can make it into a BBQ!"
Leo went out of the store and inspected the hanging carcass in the woods. The blood had been drained, and the waste filled a plastic bin to the brim.
Seeing the wet junk, Leo thought of the unknown roots in the septic tank. He wondered if that mutated plant could use them as fertilizer. He carried the bin to the boulder.
Upon getting back to the boulder, Leo discovered that it was covered in green vines, which bloomed black flowers. The odor of burning iron and the aurora around it indicated that the vines and flowers were contaminated.
Leo put the bin next to the boulder. He lightly poked the vine, wondering if the roots and the vines were from the same body.
"Ay, yo. Do you happen to eat blood and wolf's guts? I have some in the bin. Are you interested?"
WIGGLE
One of the vines extended and slithered toward Leo. It bloomed a black flower and dibbed the tip of the vine into the bin.
The green vine slowly changed color from green to brown as wolf blood entered its body.
WIGGLE
One of the flowers grew larger, transforming into a large mouth of a black chomper plant. The mouth smiled and licked its lips. Then, it extended its long tongue, scooping the wolf's intestines into its mouth.
"…"
Leo quietly gazed at the plant monster. He used to witness monster mutations and evolution processes. However, he had never seen a mutated plant.
"Oh, boy. What the hell did I create?"
Leo laughed at the black chomper. He lightly patted its head.
The chomper plant grinned. Then, it let out a weird sound.
"Meow."
"…"
Leo's expression changed. He had a funny feeling about this chomper.
"Are you a cat or a man-eating plant? Make up your mind!"
"Meow."
"… A cat, I see. Okay, your name is [Cat], okay?"
Within seconds, "Cat" finished everything in the bin. It licked its lips and then almost licked Leo's face. Fortunately, it pulled back its tongue as it sensed something dread from his skin.
"Good choice. Had you licked me, you would have died."
"HISS!!"
The chomper shrunk back in fear. Leo laughed at it and carried the empty bin back.
Seeing that Leo went back to his cabin, the chomper rested its large head on the boulder. Then, it revealed a mischievous grin.
"Meow!"
More vines and roots spread toward the forest. Nearby trees slowly turned blue and emitted dense fog.

chapters.title: Chapter 9 Florida Man Experiments With Steak, Attracts Vegan Neighbors
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 9 : Florida Man Experiments with Steak, Attracts Vegan Neighbors
Skinning is an art.
Butchering is an art.
But butchering and skinning a mutated animal is another story.
Leo took off his hazmat suit as he couldn't stand the sweat and the heat. He wiped his sweat with his forearm and gazed at the skinless carcass of the mutated wolf.
The muscles were disfigured and black. Many parts were inflamed. A portion of bones was deformed, and smelly puss fluid leaked out from the ribs. No matter how Leo looked at it, the meat was inedible.
Leo sighed and slowly cut the wolf into four sections. He tossed the rotten parts in a trash bin, leaving only useful meats. However, when Leo's hands touched the bones, they turned black and deformed once again.
The black bones turned into soft transparent jelly.
Leo glanced at the pile of transformed jelly. Although he had done this with the monsters in the nuclear wasteland, their jelly bones gave off the pleasant odor of fried chicken. However, the wolf's jelly smelled like SurstrÃ¶mming.
"I wish I had some bread. Oh, well. Taste testing time. I'll buy some sandwich bread from the shop later if it works."
Leo picked up a jelly rib cage and took a bite. His teeth crushed the jelly, and the fishy smell hit his nose. He closed his eyes, enduring the taste and scent of strong fish.
After swallowing the jelly rib, Leo cleaned his palate by licking his teeth. It was not bad. It just lacked something.
"Ah, right. If I treat the grasses like spinach, can it get better?"
Leo rushed back to his store and brought a handful of black grasses. He coiled the leaves around the jelly bone as if it was a piece of sushi and put it in his mouth.
The strong taste of burnt iron blended with the salty fish's odor. Although both were bad, they gave birth to the ultimate salty and fishy sushi.
"DAMN SALTY!!"
Leo almost spat out his food. However, he had several ideas about what to do with them.
"Fine by me! Since you're salty, I'll grind both of you into powder and use you as salt... wait a minute. Speaking of salt..."
Leo stared at the mutated wolf's carcass. He thought of salt brine steaks, and his imagination ran wild. Although he wasn't a cook when he was a human, he had some experience in cooking mutated monsters.
"Brine steaks! How about salting the meat with modern salt from the shop? I can also use these salty grasses and jelly to replace salt, so I'll cook steaks with these and compare the taste! HAHAHA! This looks fun! Oh, wait. This salty thing should go well with SAKE! Oh, yes! I have a side dish for alcohol! HAHAHAHA!"
A wild grin appeared on Leo's face. He wiped the drool on his face and extracted jelly bones and meat.
.
.
Life Sword Sect was well-known as an orthodox sect, which specialized in sword arts and flying swords. They had nothing to do with alchemy and botany. However, that didn't stop the sect from employing master alchemists from alchemy schools.
Outside the west wall was a large farmland that belonged to the Life Sword Sect's alchemy division. This farmland grew spirit rice, which could be refined into grain pills. A courtyard and 20 one-story houses in the middle of the farmland were the workshops of a master alchemist and his assistants. Gao Yan also resided there with his new mentor.
Han Meng and the grand elder, Han Hao, brought the black grasses and visited the alchemist elder in the courtyard. They showed them a blade of black-grass to see his reaction.
Wu Buyi had been working for Life Sword Sect as an alchemist elder for 150 years. He was a nascent soul stage cultivator, the same as the grand elder and Han Meng. He was also bald, but his goatee differentiated him from Han Hao. As for the rest of the features, they looked closely the same as if they were twins.
Betraying Han Meng and Han Hao's expectations, the alchemist master didn't flinch. His hands reached out and picked up the leaf to check it up close.
"This is a thousand-year-old immortal grass. You have it too, I see."
The grand elder Han Hao looked surprised. Also, they heard the keywords.
Someone had it, too?
Han Hao coughed and got to business.
"How about it, Wei Buyi? How many elixir pills can you make with this? Can you make about... five pills?"
"FIVE?!" Wei Buyi, the alchemist master scoffed. "You must be joking! With this, I can make at least 20 if I have the other ingredients! Of course, the success rate will be very high because it's a high-quality ingredient. If I'm trying to make 30 pills, I'm sure at least 20 will come out perfectly! As for the rest, even if they are failed pills, they will still be edible! Put those in an auction, and many crazy bastards will sell their souls to get one!"
Noticing Wei Buyi's confidence, Han Meng and Han Hao laughed.
One pill could increase their lifespan by 100 years and improve their internal Qi by 1,000 years' worth of cultivation! However, Wei Buyi guaranteed 20 pills.
Moreover, they still hid 49 blades of grass with the same quality. If they could force Wei Buyi to turn everything into pills, they would get about 1,000 elixirs!
500 years of lifespan was well-spent. In elation, Han Meng could no longer suppress his facial muscle. He widely grinned as he was over the moon. Han Hao was the same. His expression was the same as Powerball Lottery winners.
They were rich!
Seeing the obnoxious smiles of the father-and-son duo, Wei Buyi clicked his tongue. He could tell that both of them had more than one leaf.
"Tell me honestly. How many immortal grasses do you have?"I think you should take a look at
"What are you talking about?" Han Hao giggled.
Wu Buyi then dropped a bomb.
"Gao Yan has a whole bundle of immortal grasses, and I've promised to make pills for him. If he has a whole bundle, I know you have more. Also, we've been friends for 100 years, Han Hao! I can tell when you're hiding something from me. You always had that stupid smile whenever you boasted about your fortuitous encounters or newly acquired treasures!"
Han Meng looked at his father. The latter's smile was frozen.
Han Hao's expression darkened for a moment before he decided to be honest.
"You're right. We have 50 grasses, including that one. All of them are the same quality."
"I KNEW IT!"
Wei Buyi sneered. He stood and walked closer to Han Hao. Then, the former stared into the grand elder's eyes.
"You know me well, Han Hao. I'm not someone who steals resources or snitches my friends. Just tell me honestly. Where did you get those from? Was it from the same mysterious rogue cultivator in the forest? If you don't tell me, I'll freaking pack up and leave this sect!"
Han Meng deeply sighed. He confessed, "From a rogue cultivator in a forest, yes. I went to investigate Gao Yan's case and found the person. He sold me 50 of these for 500 years of my lifespan."
"Ah, a similar story as Gao Yan's, I see." Wei Buyi was not surprised, but he figured out something important, "Wait a second. If he can leech your lifespan, is he from an unorthodox sect? Is he an evil cultivator? Did he curse you?"
"N-No. That's impossible! His aura is the same as the sect master! He has a bright rainbow aura, and light follows him everywhere!"
Han Hao and Wu Buyi were curious. They wanted to see this person.
Wu Buyi gazed at the grasses. He imposed a condition.
"I want half of the completed pills from these grasses. You provide me the immortal grasses, and I'll procure the rest."
"Half?!" Han Hao frowned, "Look, Buyi. We've brought you the key ingredients. Our share should be higher."
"You punks scammed a righteous rogue cultivator! If you two risked your life to get these, I would have asked only one-tenth of the share! But since you took advantage of someone else's kindness, I'll take half!"
"Oh, come on! What about Gao Yan?"
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm "He's my core disciple, so all pills will belong to him!"
"That's not fair, Buyi!"
"No excuses, dammit! And you, Han Meng! You should have taken only one or two leaves from that person. I'm sure he tested your character and you FAILED, YOU GREEDY PUNK!"
Han Meng lowered his eyes. He felt guilty. As Wu Buyi had said - If the mysterious Florida Man tested him, he already failed.
"I-I'm sorry, senior. I was greedy."
"Haiz. You two are hopeless now. Anyway, since we've gotten the immortal grasses with us, I'll refine everything. Now, the next question."
Wu Buyi glared at Han Meng. He was still angry.
"What's this mysterious expert's name and origins?"
As Han Meng was in front of two seniors, he obediently told everything.
"I-I don't know his name, but his Daoist name is Florida Man. By the way, I've been wanting to ask everyone. What is Florida?"
"..."
Han Hao and Wu Buyi looked at each other. They had no idea what FLORIDA meant.
"What's Florida?" Han Hao asked Wu Buyi.
"You don't know? Hell, if you don't know, how would I know?" Wu Buyi yelled.
"But you're an alchemist. You know more about herbs, plants, and random vocabulary! All my life, I only trained in sword fighting! You're smarter than me!"
"Haiya. You people are useless."
Wu Buyi gave up on the two. He walked back to his chair and sat down. Then, he declared his intention.
"Tomorrow, I'm going to pay that cultivator a visit. I'm older than you, so I can ask him from the source what FLORIDA means. Also, if he owns immortal grasses, I'm sure he has other top-rated plants and herbs."
Han Hao smiled, "I'll go with you. I want to see him too."
"No, if you go, he will definitely be offended because your son took advantage of him. I'm an alchemist. He can't afford to play tricks with me."
Wu Buyi was determined to use his identity as an alchemist to intimidate the mysterious cultivator for information. Also, he believed that this FLORIDA MAN had other herbs than the immortal grasses.

chapters.title: Chapter 10 Florida Man Angers Vegan Neighbor By Growing Plant
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 10 – Florida Man Angers Vegan Neighbor by Growing Plant
SIZZLE
Fishy salty odor mixed with the scent of fresh meat.
Leo flipped a piece of dire wolf meat on the black BBQ grill, which he had purchased from the Online Shopping Store. Five more steak-cut were also placed on the same iron bars, letting off a nice smell from the black charcoal below.
No BBQ party was without a good cold beer. Leo sacrificed 20 years of his lifespan to purchase a gallon of beer and an ice machine. He made a bucket's worth of ice cubes and cooled the beer jar while he was busy with the grill.
Leo checked the shopping menu for some fresh vegetables and seasoning ingredients. However, the price tag intimidated him.
[Lettuce (1pc)] – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
[Spinach (1pc)] – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
[Cabbage (1pc)] – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
[Carrot (1pc)] – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
[Bell Pepper (1pc)] – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
Aside from alcohol, food-related items cost a lot. Beef and pork were worse as the shop demanded 5,000 years of lifespan per pound. Even a package of processed sandwich bread cost 2,500 years.
"It was three zeros less when I was on Earth! What the hell, shopping system?!"
Leo wanted to cry but he had no tears. He pursed his lips in frustration. In the end, he chose to purchase some seasoning sauces from the shop instead. He got salt, sugar, pepper powder, and BBQ sauce.
AWOOO!
AWOOO!
While Leo was cooking, wolf howls echoed in the forest. Leo ignored them and minded his business. He put the medium-rare dog steak on a plate and sniffed at it.
It smelled like a roasted lamb. Although wolves rarely stored fat in their meat, it was juicy enough. Leo cut the steak with a knife. Then, he tested it without sauce.
Surprisingly, it tasted like salmon with a roast lamb odor.
DING
<Your lifespan has increased by one year.>
Leo widened his eyes. He only ate a mouthful of dog meat, but his lifespan increased by a year. He looked at the remaining food and estimated that each steak could grant him about 10-15 years of lifespan.
"Hot damn! I can get used to this!"
Nothing beat good food. Leo added salt and pepper to the steak and gently cut it to fit a small bite. Then, he slowly enjoyed the rare taste.
GRRRRR
While Leo stood in front of his BBQ stove and chew his food, seven dire wolves walked out of the woods and surrounded him. They bore their fangs, snarling.
Leo turned around while he carried the plate of steak. He widely grinned.
"How nice! More food just comes to me by itself. But this can be troublesome. I can't just mutate the rest of y'all, or you will rot before I can eat you."
Leo's refrigerators were full, so he had no place to store more carcasses. Moreover, mutated carcasses rot at a faster rate than regular beef or pork due to the radiation. Leo also had about 40 pounds worth of wolf meat and 20 pounds of jelly bones to work with.
Since it was impossible to eat all seven new wolves and the previous carcass, Leo operated the shopping menu, searching for a large cage for big animals.
He was not disappointed. A large cage for dogs cost only two years of lifespan. Leo picked up black grasses and shoved them in his mouth, replenishing his lifespan. Then, he bought two cages to test things out.
GROWL
One of the wolves sprinted toward Leo and opened its jaws, aiming to snap Leo's neck in half.
Leo tilted his head and dodged the mouth. He leisurely put on gloves and boots so that he wouldn't touch them. As soon as the first wolf attacked, two wolves came for his legs.
"Oh, tactical teamwork?"
Leo put down the plate and kicked one of the wolves. The right foot hit its head, which exploded on impact! Brain and flesh scattered everywhere, causing the six wolves to flinch.
He kicked the ground and instantly seized the necks of two nearby wolves.
The wolves resisted, baring their fangs at Leo. However, the old man patiently dragged the two doggies to the purchased cages. He tossed the two in one of the cages and locked it.
WARRA
Unfortunately, one of them caught Leo's left ankle. The others shifted the target to half-eaten meat on the plate.
"Ah, shit. My damn reflex. I'm getting old."
Leo sighed and looked at the wolf that bit his ankle. Its fangs were sharp and the jaws were powerful. However, they failed to go through the combination of rubber and Leo's tough skin. He grabbed the back of its neck and lifted it up before its saliva or tongue touch his skin.
SIZZLE
The fangs slowly rotted. Leo giggled and gently pulled its fang before the corrosion reached its gum. Then, he tossed it into the second cage.
When Leo turned around, the three remaining wolves backed away. They got the half-eaten steak from the plate in their mouths, and they started chewing it, mocking Leo.
Leo shook his head, "Bad dogs. Oh, well. I have three more mutated dogs to butcher. Oh, I forgot. Make it four. I accidentally killed one."
By the time Leo finished his sentences, the three wolves collapsed. They foamed their mouths, but they hadn't been mutated yet.
Leo walked toward them and checked their conditions. He found the half-eaten steak, which they had vomited.I think you should take a look at
They reminded him of the early days of the nuclear fallout period. At that time, Leo and many humans evolved into mutants as their cancer cells stopped trying to kill the hosts. They became immune to radiation and general ailments. However, they struggled with food issues as no livestock survived the ordeal.
Mutants soon hunted each other for food while Leo only ate rotten plants and poisonous mushrooms to live. He saw how a mutant died due to food poisoning after they ate fellow mutants or mutated animals.
It happened again. These wolves tried to eat a first-stage mutated animal, and they suffered the same fate as the others.
"Y'all are stupid. None of y'all mutated seven times as I did. You will probably die in a day or two because of minor radiation poisoning. I'll probably butcher you first before the cancer cells ruin the good non-mutated meat."
Leo snorted and bought three more cages and tossed the sick wolves in there. Then, he checked the carnage that they had caused.
The steak on the grill was slightly burnt. The dish was broken, and the first piece of seasoned steak was already a mush due to the wolves.
Leo calmly flipped the remaining steaks on the grill. They were slightly charred on one side, but they were still edible.
Leo rested the steak and tidied the place. He put the doggy cages at the front of the store, waiting to be butchered. As for the headless one, Leo hung it upside down next to the store to drain the blood. After the chore, Leo returned to the BBQ grill and resumed cooking.
.
20 minutes later, Leo's belly was so round, and he couldn't eat anymore. He tossed the leftover steak to the trash bin, which would be given to "Cat" along with wolf's innards, inedible rotten meat, and blood.
He went to the stream and scooped a bucket of water to clean the dish. While he was at it, he rechecked his current lifespan.
<Your current lifespan: 128 Years, 11 months, 18 days, 17 hours, and 49 minutes.>
Leo profited a bit from one meal. However, he was dissatisfied.
'At this rate, it will take ages. I can only get 50-70 years per meal. It will take a long time to upgrade every fridge in the house.'
Leo deeply sighed and wished that someone would visit him to purchase the grasses again.
.
.
Wu Buyi floated in the sky, gazing at the dark blue forest east of the city.
In the Sword Saint Boulder Forest, blue trees, spirit grasses, and countless blue plants replaced the greenery. One-third of the forest glowed in blue light.
If the forest was only blue, Wu Buyi would have been overjoyed. However, at the place where the Sword Saint Boulder was located, a sinister aura of a monster stood out like a sore thumb. A thick fog covered its appearance, but the green aurora in the sky didn't hide its presence.
'Green aura belongs to sentient spirit plants or wood-type monsters. I've seen countless tree monsters and man-eating trents, but I have never seen a plant monster that produces fog. Is that the work of the rumored rogue cultivator?'
Wu Buyi got closer to the fog. As he got closer, he sensed the aura of a newly mutated sentient plant. The alchemist let out a long sigh of relief.
'Just a second-stage monster plant. It's harmless to me. A team of outer disciples can take care of that. I'll leave it to the outer disciple division.'
Believing in his strength and experience, Wu Buyi flew over the fog area. When he was above the Sword Saint Boulder, he gazed down, checking what the monster was.
Then, Wu Buyi saw the large black chomper plant on the vines around the rock. It also looked up, smiling at him.
"Meow!"
"…"
Wu Buyi paused and rubbed his eyes. He slightly shook his head to get rid of potential hallucinations. Then, he checked the monster again.
"Meow!"
It was real. Wu Buyi wasn't dreaming.
"What the hell are you?!"
"Meow!"
Although the chomper meowed like a cat, it opened its mouth like a newborn bird, asking its parent to feed it.
Wu Buyi's expression turned dark. He had the urge to uproot this monster plant and bring it back to the sect to study. However, he was afraid of offending the mysterious cultivator here.
"I'll come back and deal with you later. This place doesn't welcome a monster like you!"
"Meow?"
The chomper plant tilted its head, unable to understand the alchemist.
The old alchemist snorted and looked east. Then, he found a wooden cabin near the stream.
"That must be the one."
Wu Buyi ignored the chomper and flew toward Leo's shop.
.
"Meow?"
Meanwhile, the chomper was crestfallen, disappointed that Wu Buyi didn't feed him.
"Meow..."
He was hungry. Even though he had just eaten a lot, he wanted more.
Suddenly, the wind picked up and blew from west to east, carrying the scent of the BBQ and wolf blood.
Chomper drooled. Its vines and roots wiggled, extending and following the scent toward the source. It dragged its body from the septic tank and the boulder, crawling toward Leo's cabin.

chapters.title: Chapter 11 Local Cultivator Suspects Florida Man As Scammer, Gets Scammed
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 11 : Local Cultivator Suspects Florida Man as Scammer, Gets Scammed
After getting more meat sources, Leo got to work. He calmly butchered the headless wolf first and extracted its non-mutated meat. He also spent 100 years of his lifespan upgrading one of the freezer chests to store the food.
Cutting and skinning a wolf wasn't difficult since Leo didn't need to be careful about the quality. After all, he didn't run a butcher shop. The meat was for his rare non-contaminated food. Thus, Leo finished extracting the bones from the useful meat in minutes.
For the sake of the experiment, Leo tried holding the regular bones in with his bare hand.
SIZZLE
Sure enough, it slowly turned green first. A few minutes later, it turned into black jelly.
Leo shrugged and collected the jelly into one of the bins in front of his store. Since he hated salty food, he planned to convert these into fish sauce or feed it to "Cat" later.
After he finished with the headless wolf, he turned his attention to the three dying wolves.
"Alright. Your turn."
Leo approached the wolves. He opened one of the cages and dragged one of them over.
As Leo finished hanging the wolf upside down, an elderly bald man with a goatee descended and landed 10 meters behind him. Leo sensed the stranger and turned around.
"Hello, sir."
"... What's up?" Leo calmly responded.
"My Daoist name is Green Thumbs, and I'm an alchemist from Life Sword Sect. I've been living here for decades, and I happen to notice that you've recently moved here. I wonder if I could know your name."
'Daoist name again?'
Leo wondered if the previous customer recommended his new friend to his shop. He smiled at a potential customer.
'Alright, Mr. Green Finger. Since you've come here, you can't leave without spending your precious lifespan in my store. Let's see if he will buy my black weed, too.'
Leo coughed and introduced himself, "My Daoist name is Florida Man! Welcome! I assume you heard about me from your friend."
"Indeed."
The elderly man stood there, looking at the wolves in the cages. He frowned and stared at the dying wolf that Leo had hung. Then, he glanced at the BBQ stove nearby.
Leo followed the eyes of the old man and glanced at his BBQ equipment. He smiled, "Are you interested in my cooking tools?"
"Cooking tool?"
"Yes. I use this to grill steak."
The bald elder frowned, "You still cook despite your cultivation base?"
Cultivation Base?
Leo had never heard of the terms. He was curious if it was related to the visiting superhuman Daoists in this world. Still, for the sake of maintaining his face and reputation, he chose not to ask for a translation.
"What's the point of abstaining from food if you can live a thousand years? For starters, every person's time is limited. You should enjoy every little thing in life."
As Leo said, he activated the shopping domain and displayed the elder's lifespan status.
.
Name: Wu Buyi
Age: 108
Remaining Lifespan: 852 Years, 4 Months, 20 Days, 1 Hour, and 15 Minutes.
.
"Oh, wow."
Leo was impressed. The previous guy had 700ish years to live, but this one rocked 850 years. Moreover, he was already 108 years old.
He giggled and walked back to his store. He then brought out a bundle of black grasses to show Wu Buyi.
"So, are you here to buy my weed, too? Is it so good that you need some for yourself?"
.
.
= A few minutes earlier, Wu Buyi's POV =
After Wu Buyi left the chomper plant alone, he flew east and found a wooden cabin of Leo. He secretly lurked on top of a pine tree, observing the old man with long white hair and a white full beard.
Leo was busy chopping a headless dire wolf's carcass with his cleaver. From Wu Buyi's perspective, his action looked the same as commoners.
'Butchering? What's for? Cultivators like us can easily survive without food or water. If we really need one, we just use the grain pills instead. We can also digest Qi in the environment and obtain the necessary nutrition. Food only gives us impurities and fiber. It's going to annoy the hell out of you if you enter seclusion and need to go to a toilet or remove the impurity.'
Wu Buyi reprimanded Leo in his mind. He suspected that the latter was a fake cultivator, so he tried to measure Leo's strength.
Wu Buyi circulated his Qi into his eyes, gazing through the bright aurora and colorful aura of Leo. Then, he narrowed his eyes as he noticed something irregular.
A sixth stage cultivator, aka the Soul Formation Stage cultivator, had a distinct colorful aura and presence. As they completed a complex array of their soul and physique, every movement of theirs always burst with vigor and force. A slight touch from them could instantly kill a commoner if they weren't careful, and no cultivators below the 3rd stage could withstand their natural pressure up close.
However, from Gao Yan's story, Leo seemed to be a kind senior with the same aura as their sect master, who was also a soul formation cultivator. With that information, Wu Buyi found a loophole in Gao Yan's testimony.I think you should take a look at
No disciple in the sect could meet their sect master and have a proper conversation because of the master's natural pressuring aura. If Leo was really a sixth-stage cultivator, how did Gao Yan return unharmed after he conversed with him?
Meanwhile, Leo, who was butchering a wolf, indeed had the same colorful aura as the sect master. However, he lacked the terrifying pressure of a sixth-stage cultivator.
Something was not right. Wu Buyi intended to investigate further by making contact with him. He came down from the tree and stood not far away from Leo.
It took a few seconds for Leo to turn around. Again, Wu Buyi found it strange.
Had it been other experts, they would have drawn their weapons and attacked without an introduction. Leo's reflex and reaction speed were too slow.
'Is he just slow, or is he that confident in his strength? I don't know anymore.'
Wu Buyi initiated the conversation first to probe for more information, "Hello, sir."
Leo turned around and smiled at him, "What's up?"
"My Daoist name is Green Thumbs, and I'm an alchemist from Life Sword Sect. I've been living here for decades, I happen to notice that you've recently moved here. I wonder if I could know your name."
"My Daoist name is Florida Man! Welcome! I assume you heard about me from your friend."
"... Indeed."
Wu Buyi slightly raised his eyebrows. He planned to ask about the meaning of "Florida" later. For now, he planned to unmask this suspicious old man.
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm But then, Wu Buyi noticed strange tools in front of the cabin. One of them was a metallic cylinder with leg stands. As for the rest, they looked like containers, made from unknown bright materials.
"Are you interested in my cooking tools?" Asked Leo.
"Cooking tool?" Wu Buyi inwardly sneered. He mocked Leo for relying on cooking.
"Yes. I use this to grill steak."
Testing Leo's character, Wu Buyi asked him, "You still cook despite your cultivation base?"
"What's the point of abstaining from food if you can live a thousand years? For starters, every person's time is limited. You should enjoy every little thing in life."
Lifespan?
At that moment, Wu Buyi almost smacked his forehead. He remembered that Han Meng and Gao Yan said that the Florida Man had one unique ability.
Lifespan stealing?
Life force cultivator?
An unorthodox cultivator?
Wu Buyi leaned toward the last guess as Leo acted strange. Unfortunately, something appeared in front of Wu Buyi before he could jump to a conclusion.
DING
A wall of text manifested in front of Wu Buyi, revealing his own lifespan.
Wu Buyi widened his eyes in astonishment. He ignored the value of his remaining years and tried to touch the texts. However, his hands went through the menu as if they were holograms.
He didn't notice that Leo went back into his cabin and fetched an armful of black grasses to show him.
"So, are you here to buy my weed, too? Is it so good that you need some for yourself?"
Wu Buyi stopped paying attention to his lifespan status and gazed at Leo. Then, he found a bunch of high-quality immortal grasses in his arms.
"T-This..."
A lot of things didn't make sense. Wu Buyi was confused.
As Wu Buyi had too many questions in his mind, he decided to be direct and ask Leo about his doubts.
"Seriously, sir. Who are you?"
"As I said, I'm Florida Man."
Unable to suppress his curiosity, Wu Buyi asked for a translation.
"What does FLORIDA mean, then?"
Leo grinned. He made a hush gesture and teased Wu Buyi, "A faraway place that you can't possibly reach in your lifetime. Instead of wasting two billion years to get there, I suggest you be satisfied with what you have in this world."
"!!!"
Wu Buyi picked up a few keywords. His brain calculated and deduced Leo's origin with the information.
A faraway place?
Two billion years to get there?
This world?
Wu Buyi's breaths became ragged and short. He came up with a wild theory.
'Is he from a cultivator from a higher realm?!'

chapters.title: Chapter 12 Florida Man Worshiped For Being Righteous Scammer
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 12 – Florida Man Worshiped for Being Righteous Scammer
'No mistaking it! He's a cultivator from a higher realm! But…'
Several questions remained unanswered. Wu Buyi couldn't tell if Leo had further ulterior motives other than stealing cultivators' lifespan.
Nothing beat information from the source. Wu Buyi directly asked him.
"Which sect or cult are you from, Daoist Florida Man."
Leo paused. As he had no background, he couldn't say that he came from an organization. Still, for the sake of rapport, Leo decided to be honest.
"I'm alone, mister. I'm not from a sect or religion."
"So, you must be a rogue cultivator," Wu Buyi made progress. He probed further. "Are you cultivating life force? Is that why you need my lifespan?"
Leo was annoyed as this customer asked too much. Still, he wore a friendly mask and came up with an excuse.
"I'm just a wandering weed merchant. I always carry these and exchange them for lifespan. Also…"
Leo put the black grass on the table. Then, he picked up the jelly bone of the wolves from the trash bin. However, he accidentally touched the blood and innards of the headless wolf. Unnoticed, everything in the bin rapidly mutated.
Unaware of the mutation in the trash bin, Leo leisurely showed the piece of jelly bone, "I can also extract these things from monsters. Want some?"
When Leo picked the black jelly bones out, Wu Buyi was surprised by their aura and smell. He walked closer to get a better look, "Can I see it?"
Leo was kind. He let Wu Buyi examine it.
As soon as Wu Buyi sniffed it, he instantly identified the thing.
'Fenrir's bone marrow essence? Where did he get this from?! This is the key ingredient of supreme bone nourishing pills that can even help a patient regenerate their lost limbs!'
Fire in Wu Buyi's eyes was ignited. He rushed to the trash bin and noticed the pool of black blood, black innards, and similar bones in there. He almost vomited blood.
'Fenrir's fresh blood, intestines, heart, and even liver?! Such precious ingredients are piling into this container? Why?! Doesn't this guy know what they can be used for? The heart can be made into dantian enhancement pills to expand one's Qi volume. Fenrir Intestine and Liver are the main ingredients of earth-grade antidotes, and they can even cure rotten flesh! Even the blood can be consumed raw to replenish one's lost blood and Qi. Oh, dear lord. What a waste!'
The alchemist's eyes were bloodshot. He coughed several times, suppressing his spiking blood pressure, excitement, and frustration.
Wu Buyi's voice cracked, "Don't you know the value of these precious ingredients, fellow Daoist?"
Leo shrugged as he didn't think much of it. At the end of the day, these organs would turn into fertilizer for CAT.
"They're just cat food for me."
Once again, Wu Buyi coughed several times because of the heartache. Still, unlike Han Meng or Gao Yan, he suppressed his greed and maintained his clear mind.
"Is this a joke, fellow Daoist Florida Man?! Are you testing me just like you did to my junior?"
Hearing that Wu Buyi know the previous customer, Leo brightly smiled. He thought to himself.
'Indeed, words of mouth and viral are the best marketing method! I guess I need to calm this male Karen first and get on his good side. Then, I can scam him for more lifespan!'
Leo stroked his beard and snickered, "That was not a joke, mister. They have no value to me. But if you really need those things in my trash can, I'll sell everything to you."
"R-Really?!" Wu Buyi's heart almost skipped a beat. He wondered how much Leo would demand such precious ingredients.
"Of course. However…"
Leo hesitated. As the innards, blood, heart, liver, and bones gave him no lifespan, he had nothing to compare its value. Thus, he couldn't think of a proper price tag.
Since Leo couldn't come up with the right price, he pushed the task to Wu Buyi. He tested the alchemist for real.
"I'll let you name the price, mister. But bear in mind, I only need your lifespan. I don't need your money."
"…"
Wu Buyi gulped and gazed at the content in the bin, calculating how many rare pills he could get from these ingredients. He also wondered what expressions his alchemist colleagues would have when they see those precious medicines.
Fame
Glory
Reputation
Thinking of the rewards he could potentially earn, Wu Buyi's blood pressure was over 200. His face reddened, and he sensed a throbbing pain in his neck and throat.
Even though Wu Buyi was overwhelmed by greed and ambition, he was sober enough to think of the consequences of this deal. Since Leo allowed him to set a price tag, Wu Buyi didn't dare to take advantage of this opportunity.
'This is clearly a test for me. Alright. Let's think this through. He came from a higher realm. His aura is the same as the sect master, but he has no natural Qi pressure of a soul formation stage. Well, since he's from a higher plane, his cultivation method might be so unique and mysterious to the point that I can't see through his abilities. As for these resources, they might have come from the higher realm as well. But there's one thing I'm curious about. I clearly saw him butchering the wolf and dumping the innards into this bin. Why did they turn into the mythical beast Fenrir's innards? Could it be…? Oh, right. He must have noticed my arrival, so he must have swapped the regular innards with the Fenrir's one to test me! Dammit. I'm so dumb!'
After a long train of thought, Wu Buyi made a decision.
"Two hundred years!" The alchemist declared.
"Two hundred?"I think you should take a look at
On the other hand, Leo was surprised. He thought that he would get at best 10 years or so from the trash. He raised one of his eyebrows in amusement.
Seeing Leo's complex expression, Wu Buyi broke a sweat. He thought that his offer was too low.
"Scrap that. Three hundred!"
"Huh? Three hundred?"
Again, Leo was stunned. His widened eyes were round, and he tilted his head to the side, giving Wu Buyi a meaningful look.
Noticing the change of expression, Wu Buyi sweated profusely.
'Was that not enough? Hold on a second. How could three hundred years be enough! The Fenrir Wolves are immortal beasts. Only a team of soul-transformation-stage experts can hunt one of them at a time. Of course, considering the expedition resources, 300 years of lifespan is an insult!'
Wu Buyi looked at his remaining lifespan in the floating menu. His breaths were ragged and short as he made the most important decision in his life.
'Screw it. What's the point of living 800 years?! If I'm at wit's end, I can just borrow one of the immortal grasses from Gao Yan or Han Hao to extend my lifespan! I must give it my all!'
Finally, Wu Buyi made his final offer.
"800 years! I'll give you all I have!"
"…"
Leo blinked several times and rechecked Wu Buyi's lifespan again.
'He has 852 years to live, but he's throwing 800 years for the trash? Is he retarded?'
Although Leo needed lifespan to upgrade his store and improve his life quality, his mortal integrity stopped him from stripping this man of his precious lifespan. He purposely counteroffered to make it less painful.
Leo shook his head, "I'm not going to take advantage of you. I'll only take 500 years."
"EH?!"
Wu Buyi's knees suddenly lost all strength. He fell on his butt and looked at Leo, wondering if he passed Leo's test.
Leo continued, "Look at me. Someone like me can't possibly open a shop in the middle of a city. If I do, people will die because of radiation poisoning. I also can't afford to let you run out of lifespan. I still need you to spread the word about my store, you know. Well, since you've shown me your sincerity, I can't let you leave empty-handed. Take the weed with you."
After saying that, Leo shoved the armful of grasses to Wu Buyi and quickly finished the deal, taking 500 years from Wu Buyi's pool.
Meanwhile, Wu Buyi gazed at the bundle of black grasses. Counting them with his eyes, there were more than what Gao Yan and Han Hao had. A few pills made from one leaf were enough to recover his life force!
The alchemist was moved to tears.
'Not only do you bestow me precious ingredients, but you also give me a way to restore my lifespan. Lord Florida Man, you are indeed a righteous cultivator! Someone as kind as you can't possibly be from an evil sect! I was stupid. I should have believed in Gao Yan and Han Meng from the beginning!'
Wu Buyi slowly lowered his head and kowtowed.
"I swear with my dao oath. I, Wu Buyi, will never forget this kindness! I will cross mountains, jump into River Styx, or slay any immortal beast for you to return this favor!!"
"…"
Leo's eyes turned into small dots. He blankly stared at Wu Buyi as if he gazed at a weirdo.
'What the hell did he smoke before he come here?'
Awkward, Leo scratched his head and looked around. Then, he noticed that he had a lot of empty land that could be turned into farmland.
'Right. I can't rely on black grasses as the only merchandise. I should try something else, such as vegetables and fruits. How about growing them here? I'll sell both conventional veggies and mutated ones. Maybe these freaks will like it.'
Leo coughed and came up with an idea.
"Actually, I have a favor to ask. I need to buy something from the city. I wonder if I can commission you."
Wu Buyi looked up. His pupils sparkled as if he was an anime character, "Of course! You can count on me! I'll run an errand for you!"
"Err," Leo was taken aback by Wu Buyi's change of attitude. Still, he made his request, "I need some local fruits and vegetables. Oh, do they sell their seeds? I wish to grow some crops here."
"Crops?"
Wu Buyi widely grinned. As an alchemist, he was well-versed in herbs and plants.
'Ah, is he planning to make a spirit farm here? Come to think of it, the forest has turned blue. He must be trying to convert this useless forest into spirit farmland. If I can persuade him to stay here, the Life Sword Sect can get another source of spirit herbs!'
Wu Buyi rubbed his hands like a crooked merchant, "Of course, sir. I'll go get the best quality seeds for you!"
"About the payment," Leo smiled and was about to exchange his lifespan for gold bars. However, Wu Buyi interrupted him.
"No need, sir! I'll take care of everything!"
"…"

chapters.title: Chapter 13 Florida Man Claims He Deciphers Cat Language
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 13 – Florida Man Claims He Deciphers Cat Language
Wu Buyi collected the grasses and trash bin into his spatial ring. Then, he flew away.
After the alchemist had left, Leo giggled as he managed to get 500 years richer. He rushed to the cabin and upgrade five slide-door refrigerator chests. He transferred the regular wolf meat into one of them and stored the mutated one in another.
The meat storage issue was resolved. Most freezers were now functional, and Leo could start displaying his goodies in the display fridges.
Leo couldn't stop smiling. He danced his way out of the store and returned to the butcher site. However, when Leo got outside, he saw something disturbing.
A walking chomper plant was eating one of the wolves.
"Cat" was here.
As soon as Cat noticed Leo's presence, it turned around to greet him.
"Meow!"
Leo frowned at it since it was eating his food, "Yo, you silly cat. That's my food though."
"HISS!"
"…"
The chomper hissed as it protested. It continued chewing the wolf, savoring the taste of fresh blood.
Leo gazed at the plant and measured its size with his eyes. Its head was about one meter tall and the length was about the same. It barely managed to eat the dire wolf whole, and it struggled to chew the hard bones as its teeth were still too soft.
Seeing how it struggled, Leo offered it a deal.
"Look. I know you're hungry, but you're not supposed to steal unprocessed food. If you let me process it for you, I'll give you the blood and the soft innards, okay?"
"Meow?"
Unable to understand Cat, Leo tried to use the shop domain function if it could translate the meowing language.
DING
.
Name: Cat
Age: 0
Remaining Lifespan: 700 Years
.
The system displayed Cat's lifespan, and Leo almost coughed blood, envious of the monster.
"What the hell?! How is your lifespan so long?! Oh, wait. He's a plant, of course."
Leo suddenly had a sick idea. He wondered if he could extract Cat's lifespan, so he tried to steal it.
DING
<Shop Domain requires the customer's consent before you can extract the customer's lifespan.>
"Tsk."
He failed. Unless Cat allowed Leo to take his lifespan, he couldn't steal it.
Thus, Leo tried to scam it.
"Hey, kitty cat. Look here."
Leo walked toward one of the wolf cages. He dragged the dog out and grabbed it with his bare hand, causing the dire wolf to swell. It stopped moving, and its soul was Isekaied to the afterworld.
While Cat was busy with the regular wolf, Leo hung the wolf upside down and slit its throat, draining its blood. He also cut its stomach and harvested the internal organs.
Looking at the black heart of the wolf, Leo pursed his lips, wondering why Wu Buyi overreacted because of these unusable parts.
'Come to think of it, what was his job again? He introduced himself as… what? Chemist? No, this is a Wuxia world. Chemists don't exist. What was the term again?'
A long time passed since Leo last read a novel or watched movies. He tried hard to recall the word. Leo had a feeling that he almost got it, but it got stuck at the back of his head.
Unable to recall the word, Leo deeply sighed. He allocated the intestines to a new bucket, but he kept the fresh heart and liver in another container. Then, he showed Cat the container with the intestines.
"Kitty, those are too hard to chew. How about something softer? Oh, it won't be free, of course. I'll need to take some of your lifespans in exchange."
"Meow?"
Cat stopped trying to chew a whole wolf. It sniffed and crawled toward the bucket of blood and innards. As soon as one of its roots touched the content, it spat the wolf out and chowed the intestines instead.
Leo shook his head. He walked toward the half-eaten wolf and spat on it.
A few seconds later, the corpse mutated and turned black. Although disgusting, Leo chopped it into smaller pieces for Cat to eat.
Cat finished the bucket of blood and intestine in seconds. It turned around to the half-eaten wolf and discovered the pleasant smell of salty and fishy meat.
"MEOW!"
It hummed and shoved the cut pieces into its mouth. Like a glutton cat, it meowed while it chewed the precious food.
Not having anything else to do, Leo observed the man-eating plant. He wondered if this guy was worth raising as a lifespan farm.
DING
While staring at Cat, the creature's status changed.
.
Name: Cat
Age: 0
Remaining Lifespan: 2,300 Years
.
"What in the hell?"
Cat's lifespan sharply increased. Leo widened his eyes in astonishment.
*BURP*
Cat let out some gas and smiled in satisfaction. It then turned to the hanging carcass of another mutated wolf and licked its lips. Then, it crawled toward it, hoping to get more meat.
However, Leo stood in front of it. He crossed his arms.
"Kitty, you haven't paid me for the meal. You need to pay up."
"Meow?" It tilted its head. It touched its lips with a big purple leaf.
"What do you mean by paying? Of course, your lifespan. You need to transfer some of your lifespans to me in exchange for the food. If you don't give me lifespan, I can't keep feeding you."
"Meow, meow? Meow!"
The chomper suddenly smiled. Then, Leo received a message.
<Your lifespan has increased by 2,300 years!>
"OH… HOLD ON A SECOND!! That's too much!"
Instead of being overjoyed, Leo instantly noticed the problem - Cat just gave him all of its lifespans!
The plant rapidly withered. Cat looked exhausted, and its movement speed was as slow as a sloth.
"Meow…"
Not allowing Cat to die, Leo grabbed the heart and liver in another bucket. He fed the liver to the plant. He also squeezed the heart like a lemon to give the chomper some more blood.
DING
.
Name: Cat
Age: 0
Remaining Lifespan: 200 Years
.
Cat's roots, leaves, and vines regained their luster. It swallowed the liver and blood as if it had never eaten anything for days.
The plant let out a long sigh of relief. It wearily purred and nudged its head against Leo's stomach.
"You dumb cat. I want your lifespan, but you don't have to give me everything! Well, since you already gave me a lot, I'll keep feeding you. You don't have to give me anything anymore."
"Meow?"I think you should take a look at
"Yes, I'm adopting you. You're my cat now."
"Meow!" Cat licked Leo's face.
At that moment, Leo realized something horrible. Once again, Cat innocently made a huge mistake.
Leo's skin was radioactive and poisonous. Touching him meant instant death or rapid mutation!
'Did it just touch me? Oh, crap! NOOO!! It's going to mutate and die, dammit!''
Leo held in his head in panic and despair.
If Cat ran out of lifespan, Leo could simply replenish it by feeding it the mutated wolf's blood, meat, or organs. However, he was helpless when it came to mutation.
Leo shut his eyes in regret, not wanting to witness the torturous moment of his first pet in 50,000 years.
A minute later, Leo sensed a nudge at the back of his head. A soft head of a plant bonked him.
"Meow!"
"…"
"Meow, Meow!"
"Huh?"
Leo turned around in shock. Then, he found the chomper plant, which looked the same as he remembered him.
'He is unaffected?'
Leo's trembling hand reached for Cat's head. He gently touched it and slowly stroked it. Surprisingly, the chomper purred.
"…"
No mutation occurred. The chomper plant remained the same.
"You, you're not affected by my radiation?"
"Meow?"
"What is radiation? Dammit, it's poisonous air. If you touch me, the radiation poisoning will change your DNA structure and disable your healing abilities! Some of your cells will riot and try to French-Revolution you from the inside. In short, all nutrition you have in your blood cells will nourish cancer cells and mutated DNA, turning you into a disfigured monster!"
"Meow, meow?"
"HOW DID I KNOW?! Listen here, you little shit. You're looking at the lottery winner from the Fallout world. My DNA structure got reconstructed seven freaking times. I freaking died and came back to life seven times, okay? Let's not make you repeat the torture I went through."
"Meow, meow-meow?"
The chomper plant licked Leo's face and nudged its head against his. The latter stopped talking and facepalmed.
"You're right. I'm an idiot. You're immune to my radiation now because you evolved… DAMMIT, how did I understand your freaking language even though every word sounds the same?!"
"Meow <3"
Leo covered his face and squatted. He felt like he was about to become crazy. Since the plant was immune to his touch, he patted Cat and deeply sighed.
"Oh, well. Whatever. Do you still need to eat more?"
"Nom-Nom Meow <3"
"…"
.
.
After the hectic incident, Leo dug the soil next to his store and allowed Cat to plant its roots there. The chomper happily enjoyed the nutrition in the mutated soil that Leo often stepped on.
In the end, Leo mutated another wolf and donated the innards to the plant, but he kept the heart and liver for emergencies. Its lifespan increased to 1,500 years. As for two mutated wolves' meat, Leo chopped them into small cuts and chilled them in the freezer chest. He also upgraded the three remaining freezers to make them active.
With over 2100 years of lifespan in his account balance, Leo started planning to upgrade his shop further. He touched one of the supermarket refrigerators to check if he could upgrade it again.
DING
<Unable to upgrade. Require Humble General Store Level 3.>
<Please upgrade the Humble General Store to Level 3.>
"…"
This was the first time Leo heard about this condition. Confused and interested, Leo lightly touched the wall of his store, wondering if he could upgrade it.
DING
<Will you upgrade the Humble General Store to Level 2?>
<Upgrading requires 1,000 years of lifespan.>
Leo stared at the messages for several minutes due to the utter shock. Then, he yelled.
"Damn expensive! It's just level freaking two! What about level 3? How much does it cost?"
No answer came from the system. Once again, it left him in the dark.
Leo was not an idiot. If the level two upgrade required 1,000 years of lifespan, the level 3 upgrade might cost him 2,000 to 3,000 years, depending on the system's cheapskate algorithm.
Leo postponed the store upgrade for now as it wasn't necessary at the moment. He walked out of the building and looked at the three healthy wolves in the cages. He widely grinned.
"Stay there obediently, and I'll butcher you tomorrow."
The wolves barked at Leo as if they understood his intention. They tried to break the cage, but they ended up hurting themselves.
Leo ignored the wolves and proceeded to the area behind his store. It was an empty plot with a few tall pine trees and bushes. However, because Leo used to walk around here with bare feet to uproot the grasses, the soil was dark. Some parts emitted green smoke as if some chemical substances had been buried there.
Although Leo could manually plow this area and turn it into a radioactive vegetable garden, he had another idea of what he could do to this place. He started counting his steps.
"3…4…5… Ah, crap. These stupid trees are on the way. I want another 10 x 10 blocks as a backyard farm."
Leo hugged the pine trees that stood in the way of his future farm plot.
CREAK
Like the Hulk, Leo uprooted the massive tree by pulling it off the ground. Then, he tossed it to the side and patted his hands as if it was an easy task.
Cat witnessed everything from start to finish. It shivered in fear, imagining itself being uprooted by Leo.
"Meow!"
Like a scardy cat, it came out of the ground and climbed the store. Then, it sat on the rooftop, warily staring at Leo.
After bringing down an entire pine tree, Leo moved to another one, using his bare hands without any protection. The blue tree turned black and was pulled out from the ground one after another.
When Leo finished his job, he got seven mature pine logs lining up in his backyard.
"If this is a resource-gathering game, I might need to chop these logs into lumber. But since they are mutated, are the leaves and nuts edible?"
Leo proceeded to collect black pine leaves and nuts. He wondered if he could sell these things to Wu Buyi or his friends again.
'Come to think of it, I might need to interrogate that last guy. What the hell is he going to use the innards for? Chemistry? No, what was it again?'
Leo scratched his head. While he was in deep thought, he saw a mosquito fly by. Because of his reflex, he clapped it without looking.
'Clap? Hand claps? Clapping hands… Full Metal Alchemist? AH! ALCHEMIST!'
Finally, Leo remembered Wu Buyi's occupation. He smacked his forehead.
'Right! Alchemists! Those Chinese martial arts novels are crazy about those alchemists. They can turn every little thing into pills and medicines… wait. Pills and meds? Drugs?'
Leo narrowed his eyes. He began to grasp why Han Meng and Wu Buyi were crazy about the black grasses.
'Alchemy, is it? Wait, isn't there something similar in the system shop?'
Leo opened the shopping menu and switched the tap to [Shop Domain System], where he had purchased the cabin from. He rechecked the list of buildable structures.
One of them was an alchemist workshop.
"Hohoh?"
.
Basic Alchemist Workshop
Requirement – Humble General Store Level 2
Price – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
Space – 10 x 10

chapters.title: Chapter 14 Florida Man Claims Coriander Juice Is A New Coffee Blend
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 14 : Florida Man Claims Coriander Juice is a New Coffee Blend
"What a coincidence. I have enough for the level-2 upgrading and the workshop. But seriously, even if I have the workshop, I have no clue about pill-making and alchemy. Also, I need to clear the backyard."
Although the workshop was expensive and the pill-making method was unknown, Leo was motivated. He resumed clearing the bushes and trees, making room for the new building.
As Leo was done with the large trees, he turned his attention to the smaller bushes, starting with the dry and thorny ones. With bare hands, he grabbed the thorny vines of a hard bush and pulled them out.
HISS
A snake suddenly jumped out of the bush and bit the back of his hand. However, its fangs failed to penetrate his skin. Still, it spat poisonous substance at Leo.
Despite being bitten, Leo leisurely grabbed its tail and tossed it toward an empty area. A few seconds later, the snake swelled like a balloon and died from the mutation.
Before Leo could process the snake for meat, a certain cat scooped the dead snake with its vines and put it in its mouth. The chomper plant happily ate anything that contained blood.
Leo scratched the back of his hand, swiping the liquid away as it made his hand itchy. He resumed pulling bush vines, enjoying his little adventure in his backyard.
When the sunset, Leo stopped working. He looked at the vines, which were hardened and blackened because of his radiation. Because of boredom, Leo grabbed the longest vine and cracked it like a whip. It caused a crisp sound as the tail hit the ground.
"Oh, yeah. Leo Belmont is gonna hunt you Dracula down."
Fantasizing himself as the main character from the Castlevania Series, Leo randomly swung the vine whip around.
CRACK!
RUMBLE
The whip accidentally hit a pine tree 30 meters away, cutting it in half. The tree fell and caused a loud noise in the woods.
"..."
Because of the loud noise and the broken tree, Leo flinched. He stopped fooling around and coiled the thorny vines. Then, he silently hung it on the back of the store, keeping it as a toy.
Unfortunately, his free time was cut short. From the corner of his eyes, Leo discovered a flying man in white robes approaching at a high speed.
"Ah, crap. Here we go again."
The visitor was none other than Wu Buyi. This bald man slowly descended and landed in front of the store.
Leo stopped what he was doing and walked to the front of the store. Then, he noticed that Wu Buyi had brought 30 baskets of fruits, vegetables, and herbs.
Wu Buyi looked up. Despite being in the dark, his eyes beamed in green light as if they were a spotlight, brightening the area in front of the store. As soon as he saw Leo, Wu Buyi cupped his fist.
"Oh, hello, Sir Florida Man. I wasn't planning to disturb you. I'm here to deliver the fruits and veggies that you requested me."
"My request?"
Leo paused for a moment and remembered that he asked him to buy some fruits and vegetable seeds from the city.
"Oh, right. The veggies. Thank you very much. How much are they?"
Wu Buyi quickly waved his hands, "You don't need to pay, sir. You've already given me plenty. This is not even half of what I owe you. Oh, this is all that I can find within half a day. I'll visit the neighboring towns to gather more for you."
"..."
Leo didn't hate free food. He nodded and let Wu Buyi do whatever he wanted.
Looking at Wu Buyi, Leo remembered the alchemist subject and the wolf's blood. He asked the old man directly.
"By the way, mister. What do you need the wolf's blood for? Is it for a... cultivation pill?"
Wu Buyi dryly laughed in embarrassment, "Truth to be told, yes, sir. For me, Fenrir's blood and innards are extremely rare ingredients. We couldn't find them anywhere on the mainland no matter how hard we tried. Only the soul-transformation-stage cultivators can risk their lives to get them from a mystic realm. With the blood and innards, the Life Sword Sect will thrive, and even I will benefit from them."
'Fenrir's blood?'
Leo raised his eyebrows in amusement. Then, he asked further to make sure.
"What about the grasses?"
Wu Buyi confessed, "Ah, those? The immortal grasses are the key ingredient to the legendary immortal pills that can extend our lifespan. Wait, I thought you knew about them."
Leo snorted and waved his hand, "Ah, I just wanted to make sure if your culture is the same as mine. Don't worry about it."
Wu Buyi laughed, "Of course. You must be surprised since you've come from a faraway place. Culture shock is a thing. Anyway, is there anything else I can help you?"
"..."
Leo had another doubt. He glanced at the three dire wolves in the cages.
'So, the radioactive weeds are immortal grasses? The mutated wolves are called Fenrir? What the hell?'
Probing for more information, Leo pointed at the dire wolves in the cages. He asked Wu Buyi, "What about them? Are they Fenrir, too?"
Wu Buyi looked at the caged wolves and burst into laughter, "Of course not, sir. They're just regular animals. They're not even a spirit beast."
"..."
Leo had the urge to mutate them in front of Wu Buyi, but he chose to keep it a secret. He mimicked the alchemist and cupped his fist.
"Thank you mister for the fruits and vegetables. You've really saved me."
"That was nothing," Wu Buyi laughed. "Anyway, I'll be going. I'll revisit you again after the trip."
"Sure..."
Wu Buyi took off and left. He disappeared into the night.
.
.I think you should take a look at
While flying in the dark sky, Wu Buyi laughed in a good mood. After leaving the store for a minute, he looked back to check the conditions of the forest.
The fog got thicker, and it concentrated around Leo's cabin. As for the area around the Sword Saint Boulder, no fog was present. At night, blue pine trees glowed in the dark, bringing color to the plain forest.
Wu Buyi widely grinned.
'The trees start to evolve. Sir Florida Man must have been using an artifact or his ability to convert everything around him into a spirit farm. If my theory is correct, a new spirit herb farm will appear in the forest. If better, he might convert those fruits and vegetables into something new. Also, judging from his demeanor and style, his specialties should be in the botany field. Hehehe, if he's really a botanist, I should invite him to the annual alchemist gathering at the end of the year. I wonder how the other alchemists from Death Sword Sect and Pacifist Sword Sect will react if they know that we have a botanist from the higher realm here.'
Wu Buyi started humming and returned to the Life Sword Sect.
10 minutes later, he got back to his residence and found Gao Yan sitting in the herb garden alone, staring at a sprout of a herb.
Curious, Wu Buyi landed behind Gao Yan. Then, he uttered.
"Is that herb that interesting?"
"Ah, master!" Gao Yan jolted and stood up, "Disciple is studying the spirit coriander. I read from the encyclopedia, and the book said that it had a pleasant smell. I just want to try sniffing on it. And then, I notice that a new sprout is growing at night."
Wu Buyi nodded in approval. He taught Gao Yan a lesson that wasn't in a book.
"Coriander herbs are usually used in cooking. But for that spirit coriander, we commonly use it as an optional ingredient to suppress foul odor because of its pleasant scent and its neutral Qi nature. When we put them in a cauldron to refine pills, it automatically harmonizes the rampaging fire Qi and wood Qi in the ingredients. Many rookie alchemists rely on them to increase their refining success chance because of their traits."
Gao Yan was enlightened. He smiled for a moment before his expression looked gloomy. He seemed depressed.
"But disciple can only use wood Qi. I can't use fire Qi like the other alchemist disciples. I don't know if I belong here."
After coming here, regular outer disciples respected him. However, the other alchemists ignored Gao Yan, and they refused to share their knowledge, making him depressed.
Noticing Gao Yan's inferiority complex, Wu Buyi smacked the back of the disciple's head
"You fool. Your constitution has a high aptitude in wood Qi, but that doesn't mean you can't cultivate fire Qi in the future. When reaches the golden core stage, you can cultivate a secondary elemental Qi. By then, you can use both fire Qi and Wood Qi, and that is when your advantage shines! Your dantian will condense something called "Wood Essence" and it can be used to refine precious herbs that Fire Qi specialists can't do! They will naturally kowtow and beg you to help them refine their herbs in the future! Don't look down on yourself!"
Once again, Gao Yan was enlightened and motivated. He bowed to his master.
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm "This disciple will keep that in mind! I'll work hard!"
"Hahaha! Maintain that motivation, and you'll quickly learn so many things. Come. Let's go have some tea. I'll teach you more about herbs."
The master and disciple duo continued to chat as they walked back to their residence to rest.
.
.
Meanwhile, Leo checked the 30 baskets of vegetables and fruits. 25 of them contained only cabbages and potatoes. Four were filled with bananas, and the other one was full of corianders.
Interested in the new goodies, Leo carefully picked up one of the cabbages with his bare hand. The green veggies instantly turned purple and emitted red smoke.
Leo sniffed at it, wondering what a mutated cabbage tasted like. Strangely, its odor was the same as regular cabbages.
He peeled its skin and chewed it. It was soft and sweet like freshly boiled vegetables. Also, it had the aroma of Earth and freshly cut grasses.
"This is awesome! I can use this to replace sandwich bread."
Leo finished the cabbages and waited for feedback from the system.
DING
<Your lifespan has increased by five years.>
It was worth the wait. Although eating the entire cabbage made him full, he got something out of it.
Leo put on his gloves and carried the cabbage baskets to his store. He put them in the fridges, filling the rest of the slide-door chests to the brim. Afterward, he returned to check the other goodies outside.
The potatoes were a no-brainer. Leo carried the baskets to the middle of the store and left them there as he couldn't preserve them in a freezer. Bananas were also the same as they came in green. Leo had to wait a few days before it could turn yellow and become edible.
After Leo put the banana and potato baskets in the store, his attention turned to the coriander. He brought them into his store and arranged everything in one of the supermarket display fridges. After all, these delicate herbs required a chilling and humid temperature to preserve.
When Leo finished tidying everything, he picked up a stalk of coriander to get a closer look. Strangely, everything in this batch produced strange blue air, and it was warmer than usual.
"Huh? Aren't they the regular ones?"
Curious, Leo plucked a leaf and put it in his mouth to taste it. As Leo had expected, it had a strong scent of green herb that hit his nose. However, it had an extra flavor.
There was a faint lingering taste of coffee beans at the tip of his tongue.
Although the herb didn't reward him anything, Leo raised his eyebrows in surprise. He had forgotten how the coffee tasted like after the nuclear apocalypse, but he got to savor the bitter aroma once again.
Moving to tears, Leo looked at the remaining coriander. He held his hands in prayer.
"Bless Jesus for giving me coffee coriander! I'll grow them well!"
Leo bit his lower lips and mustered his courage. He picked another coriander stalk with his bare hand, converting it into a mutated plant. The stalk and leaves instantly blackened, and its strong aroma exuded throughout the store. The stalk's temperature rose, and it produced white smoke.
The scent smelled exactly like hot black coffee!
Without hesitation, Leo rushed into the storage room and brought out a cup of water. He put the mutated coriander in the cup for an experiment.
As Leo had predicted, the water turned black. It was also heated up because of the mutated herb's natural hot temperature. Without hesitation, Leo slurped the black water.
The rich aroma of black coffee made his pupils dilate. He almost dropped the cut and the hot water as his theory was correct.
Leo got himself a coffee, a mutated coffee!
"HALLELUJAH!!"
Leo was never this happy. His voice was so loud that birds in the vicinity woke up and flew away from their nests.

chapters.title: Chapter 15 Uncle R. Enraged As Florida Man Cooks Fried Rice Using Raw Pine Nuts And Leaves
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 15 : Uncle R. Enraged as Florida Man Cooks Fried Rice Using Raw Pine Nuts and Leaves
DING
<Your lifespan has increased by one year.>
With just one cup of coffee, Leo's lifespan increased by a year.
Ten minutes later, Leo finished his first coffee after coming to this world. After today's experience, Leo could give a piece of advice to everybody.
"Never drink coffee at night, ever."
Leo was wide awake. His eyes were bloodshot, and he had the urge to continue working all night. Fortunately, he was sober enough to restrain his workaholic nature.
Although having mutated corianders were awesome, Leo couldn't convert all of them at once due to storage limitations. The supermarket fridges could lower the food's temperature, but they could not suppress the mutated coriander's burning hot traits.
Leo still held the coriander stalk that he had used to make a cup of coffee. It still produced hot air and white smoke. He could also sense its high temperature from his skin. Judging from the feeling, Leo estimated that the herb was about 60-70 degrees Celsius.
'How the hell do I store this thing? If I put it in a fridge, the fridge will be broken. But if I leave it alone, it might catch fire. But if I directly eat this, I will waste the free coffee generator... Ah, damn. I'm stupid. I can just drop this thing in a pot of water or something.'
Leo held the coriander stalk in his mouth while he operated the system shop. He purchased a set of glass pots and a table. Then, he arranged the table next to the south window and put the pots on it. After filling the pot with drinking water, he dropped the herb into the container.
The water bubbled as if it was instantly boiled. The water blackened and emitted a rich coffee aroma.
Leo brightly smiled and covered the pot with a glass lid. He then admired the 4-liter pot, which was filled with coriander coffee.
"Coffee machine, done! Next, time to upgrade the store and put that workshop on."
Leo put his palm on the wall.
DING
<Will you upgrade the Humble General Store to Level 2?>
<Upgrading requires 1,000 years of lifespan.>
"Yes."
It was time for some upgrading as the store had no source of light or electricity. Leo couldn't stand working in the dark house alone at night.
As soon as Leo confirmed the upgrade, the ceiling became taller. The poorly placed windows transformed into displaying windows, and fluorescence light bulbs appeared. They automatically turned on, illuminating the interior in the dark night.
EEEEEEEEEEE
The buzzing hum of fluorescence lights was so loud that it annoyed Leo. However, the store was brighter than before.
DING
<Humble General Store has been upgraded to Level 2.>
<New Construction Options!>
Leo flinched for a moment as he felt like he had heard that quote from somewhere else long ago, but he couldn't remember. He ignored the voice and inspected the changes in his store.
Aside from the display windows, the wooden floor and the walls seemed sturdier. No wind leaked into the building anymore. However, as no ventilation existed, the air in the store was stale.
Without circulating wind and air conditioner, Leo was dissatisfied. He opened the front door, back door, and a side window to let the airflow. Then, he walked out of the house.
The moonless sky provided no source of extra light. Everything outside was pitch black. Fortunately, the purple fluorescence light illuminated a small area around the building.
ZAG-ZAG-ZAG
The chomper plant on the rooftop seemed to be active at night. It crawled down from the roof and disappeared into the forest.
The weather outside got colder at a rapid rate. Leo pursed his lips as he found the chilling weather nice and refreshing. He had been living in the dry freezing world for 50,000 years, so a humid and chilly night was like a warm breeze to him.
As Leo couldn't sleep, he strolled to the backyard to resume his work.
For the entire night, Leo manually cleared the field for his workshop.
.
When one indulged in an activity, that person's concentration would be heightened. However, that person usually forgot about time. Leo was the same. He got absorbed in the field that he didn't notice the sunrise. By the time he finished arranging logs, it was already 8 AM.
The backyard was cleared. Leo opened the shop domain menu and purchased the alchemy workshop.
.
Basic Alchemist Workshop
Requirement : Humble General Store Level 2
Price : 1,000 Years of Lifespan
Space : 10 x 10
.
The requirement was fulfilled. The icon of this building brightened, and Leo had enough lifespan to purchase it.
"Let's see what you can do."
Leo did not think much. He purchased it right away to explore the alchemy secrets. After he pressed the confirm button, the same top-down view and grits appeared in his menu, allowing Leo to choose the location of the shop.
He moved the 10x10 blocks to the back of the general store. He aligned it for a moment before he pushed the alchemy workshop further back by five blocks, giving spaces between the store and the workshop for a road or a pathway. Then, he pressed enter.
RUMBLE
A new one-story wooden building appeared. At a glance, it looked like another cabin. However, a quarter of the building was an open-air patio with a huge black cauldron at the center.
Leo inspected the new building and looked inside the black cauldron. There was nothing in there but the smooth surface of the black pot. While checking the new goodies, Leo accidentally touched the pot with his bare hands.
DING
A new system window floated above the cauldron. It displayed a menu, and a few buttons were highlighted.
.
Basic Alchemy Workshop Level 1
[Upgrade] : 1,000 Years of Lifespan
[Research New Ingredient]
[Pill Making]
.
Leo was amused. He ignored the upgrade button for now as he couldn't afford it. Thus, he pressed the [Research New Ingredient] button to see what it could do.
<Please put an ingredient into the cauldron to research.>I think you should take a look at
"..."
The system didn't tell him what kind of ingredient it needed. Still, Leo had enough clue to start. He walked to the fallen pine tree and picked up mutated leaves and a raw pine nut. Then, he put the nut in first.
He received a feedback message right away.
<Will you research this unidentified nut?>
"Yes, please."
As soon as Leo confirmed the research, the pine nut in the cauldron vanished. Then, a progress bar appeared, hovering over the cauldron. Under it was a timer, counting down the completion time. It only took 10 seconds to complete the research on the first item.
<Research completed!>
<You have discovered Iron Pine Nut!>
<A new pill recipe has been added to the encyclopedia.>
After the message, another system window appeared, displaying the brief detail of the item.
.
[Iron Pine Nut]
These nuts can only be found in a densely Iron Pine Forest in one of the mystic realms. It is commonly used as the main ingredient for Iron Grain Pills.
[Pill Recipe : Iron Grain Pill]
One - Iron Pine Nut
One : Any Starch
Fire Qi
*Optional* - Any Iron Element Catalyst
.
Upon noticing the pill recipe in the detail window, Leo started enjoying this. However, there was one troublesome issue.
"What the hell is [Iron Element Catalyst]?"
Leo scratched his head in confusion as he had no one to consult. Then, he looked at the pine leaves in his hand. Without thinking much, he tossed it into the cauldron and pressed the [Research New Ingredient] button.
Again, it only took 10 seconds to complete the automatic research. The result was shown.
.
[Iron Pine Leaf]
