Iron Pine Leaves are one of the rare iron-based catalysts, which can be found in an area with the thick iron element Qi. Mixing 100 leaves with any iron-based pill ingredient increases the completion success rate and the pill quality.
[Traits]
Increases the Iron Grain Pill's pill-making success rate by 50%. Increases the quality by one major tier.
.
"What a coincidence. Hehehe."
Leo rubbed his hands. He learned a lot by just reading the information from the system window. He closed it and wore his trusty rubber gloves. Then, he entered the store through the back door.
A minute later, Leo came out with a basket of raw potatoes. He put it next to the cauldron and went to the black pine trees to collect black pine leaves. When Leo returned, he carried an armful of nuts and several branches of pine trees, full of black leaves.
The ingredients were ready. Leo operated the cauldron menu and pressed the other button that he hadn't tried yet.
[Pill Making]
DING
<Please choose a recipe.>
The window prompted him to choose a pill recipe from the list. However, it only showed one item as Leo only found one recipe so far.
Leo didn't care. After all, he only had the ingredients to make one type of pill anyway. He chose the recipe, and the cauldron menu displayed the images of the required ingredients.
Not even looking at the images, Leo tossed a black pine nut, pine leaves, and a raw potato into the cauldron. The images of iron pine nuts, random starch, and leaves turned grey. However, the fire icon was still bright.
DING
<Please inject Fire Qi into the cauldron.>
"Fire Qi? Wut da hail is Fire Qi? I only know fried rice!"
The system hit him in the blind spot. Leo was confused and helpless as he had no idea what Fire Qi was. As he had no idea, he tried something silly.
Leo went back to the storefront, where the BBQ set was. He lighted a piece of coal on fire and carried it with tongs. After coming back with a lump of burning coal, he threw it into the pot.
DING
<Detecting irrelevant material. The material will be removed from the cauldron.>
The burning coal was ejected from the pot. It was sent flying and landed on top of Leo's head. Fortunately, the fire couldn't burn his hair or his skin.
Leo was annoyed. He took off his gloves and grabbed the burning coal with his hands. He spat at it and doused the fire instantly without burning his palms. Then, Leo complained.
"What the hell is Fire Qi? Argh..."
In frustration, Leo tossed the lump of coal to the fireplace under the cauldron.
DING
Suddenly, the cauldron lit up. The fire icon dimmed, and the system prompted him, requesting his permission.
<Ingredient substitution detected.>
<Will you use Fire Essence, Water Essence, Earth Essence, Wood Essence, and Metal Essence instead of Fire Qi?>
<Note: If you use higher-graded ingredients as substitutions, the success chance will increase, and the quality will improve.>
<Note: If you use additional Qi or Essence of other elements, you might get different pills than the pills from the recipe.>
"Essence? Wut?"
Leo frowned and looked at the half-burnt coal, which had been spat on. It emitted a foul burning iron scent, which was the same as the black grasses.
"My spit is Essence? Wut da hail?"

chapters.title: Chapter 16 Florida Man Addicted To Nutting In Forest
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 16 : Florida Man Addicted to Nutting in Forest
= Life Sword Sect, Alchemy Department =
In the morning, Gao Yan woke up early and read a basic alchemy guidebook that he had received from Wu Buyi. He was interested in the applications of Wood Qi and Fire Qi.
He skimmed through the trivial parts until his eyes caught on to the topics that he was interested in.
'Ah, found it! Here... Alchemy is not about burning everything in a pot into charcoal. It's about the choice of elemental Qi and ingredients. An alchemist has to pay extra attention to the element circles because each element gives a different result. For example, fire Qi promotes earth, weakens wood, and dominates metal, but insults water. Okay, this much I know. But what is "Insult" anyway?'
Gao Yan continued to read further. Then, he started to get confused as the relationship table sounded bizarre.
'Wood Qi promotes fire, weakens water, and dominates... earth? Insult metal? Huh? Metal Qi creates... water?! Weaken earth, dominate wood, and insult fire? What?!'
The disciple scratched his head as he had no idea what "Insult" in alchemy term meant. He flipped the pages to the glossary section in the book. Then, he found the translation of the word.
Insult in the alchemy term translated to "Harm". For example, fire evaporates water. Water destabilizes earth. Earth rots wood. Wood dulls metal, and metal conducts fire (heat).
Gao Yan flipped back to the section that he had left off earlier. He started taking notes as every element had a different effect on another element. Although he didn't understand the hidden meaning of the description and the relationship table, Gao Yan felt like he broadened his horizon.
'Alchemy is profound. So, there are things that Wood Qi and Fire Qi can do best, but they can't refine everything in the world. I wonder if I have to rely on other alchemists if I have to refine water pills in the future.'
Gao Yan continued reading. At the end of that chapter, there was an annotation, made by Wu Buyi. The latter wrote it for Gao Yan.
[An alchemist only needs two types of secondary elemental Qi to refine every element. In common practice, average alchemists cultivate fire Qi, wood Qi, and metal Qi, so they can refine almost every type of high-graded pill and some superior pills. Master alchemists usually spend centuries cultivating the third and even the fourth secondary element Qi to be well-versed in every field.]
[An alchemist can choose to become a specialist by relying on only two or three elements, or they can become the jack-of-all-grade by spending centuries in cultivation. It's about personal career choice in the end. But if you ask me which is better, I'll pick the jack-of-all-trade route. You might waste a few hundred years getting stuck at the nascent soul stage and trying to acquire one more element Qi. But trust me, the investment will be worth the blood, tear, and sweat. Not only will you thrive as a top-tier alchemist, but as a cultivator, you will also be invincible!]
[Also, legends said that an alchemist with all five elemental essences can turn simple grain pills into elixir. Even my mentor hasn't achieved that state. You should strive for that. Set your goal high, and you will never be a failure even if you fail to achieve that goal.]
Gao Yan was grateful for the notes. His motivation skyrocketed once more.
"Alright. Time to cultivate and reinforce my wood Qi! I must condense my dantian and reach the foundation establishment stage within a year! Before I'm 25, I must reach the golden core stage!"
He closed his book and put it back in his clothes. Then, he returned to his room and sat on his bed.
Inside a water pot on a desk next to his bed was a blade of immortal grasses, which Wu Buyi had brought from the outer disciple courtyard to Gao Yan's room. Although there was only one blade of immortal grass, it still filled the room with wood Qi.
Gao Yan closed his eyes and meditated, deeply inhaling the warm vapor in the air. His body grew warmer as his blood reacted to the nutritious energy.
.
.
Meanwhile, Leo was clueless about what essence or Qi could do to the pills. He stared at the system messages and rested his hands on his hips in frustration.
'Meh, what's the point of overthinking something I don't know. I'll just YOLO this thing and see how it turns out. There is nothing to lose anyway.'
Leo shrugged and let the alchemy workshop do the work. He pressed the confirm button.
DING
The black cauldron turned white, and a metallic lid appeared out of nowhere. It covered the pot, and a timer appeared.
<Refining pills. Please wait...>
<Time remaining: 59 Minutes, 58 Seconds.>
"..."
Leo's expression turned dark. He thought that the pills would come out instantly.
"One hour to make stupid drugs!? Seriously? I ain't going to sit around and wait!"
Had any alchemist heard Leo's remark, they would have fumed with rage as one hour of pill-refining was considered a lot faster than average. A newbie alchemist always fumbled for six hours to make simple non-elemental grain pills for the first time while experts still needed two to three hours to make elemental pills.
The workshop slowly counted down. Leo scoffed and carried the ingredients back to the store in disappointment. While he was at it, he cracked an iron pine nut and popped it in his mouth.
The nut was rock solid, but there was nothing in the world that Leo's teeth couldn't destroy. He crushed it and savored the iron-like flavor.
It tasted like human blood. However, Leo got something useful.
DING
<Your lifespan has increased by one year.>
"One nut per year?"
Leo's eyes gleamed. He dropped the basket of potatoes and carried an empty container outside the store. He rushed to the fallen pine trees to collect more nuts.
An hour quickly went by. Leo stopped nutting (collecting nuts) and returned to the workshop to see the result.
The cauldron was black again, but the lid was gone. 30 colorful pills floated over the pot, waiting for Leo to collect them. They came in seven colors : Red, blue, green, yellow, black, purple, and white. Each round pill was an inch thick.
"Oh, neat. 30 balls at once?"
Leo purchased a large glass bowl for this occasion. He reached out to pick up the floating pills. But as soon as he touched one of them, the workshop system informed him of the result.
<Workshop has refined 2 Inferior Fire Grain Pills, 1 Inferior Water Grain Pill, 3 Inferior Wood Grain Pills, 19 Lessor Metal Grain Pills, 1 Inferior Earth Grain Pill, 3 Inferior Poison Grain Pills, and 1 Inferior Elixir Grain Pill.>
<Pill Encyclopedia has been updated.>
"Wut da hail?"
Leo frowned and glanced at the seven floating system windows around him. Each displayed the effects of the pills.
.
Lesser Metal Grain PillI think you should take a look at
- Satisfy the hunger for 48 hours.
- Improve blood circulation and internal organ efficiency by 15% for 48 hours.
- Increase lifespan by two years.
- Increase Metal Qi by two years' worth of cultivation.
.
Inferior Fire Grain Pill
- Satisfy the hunger for 24 hours.
- Increase muscle strength by 10% for 24 hours.
- Increase lifespan by one year.
- Increase Fire Qi by one year's worth of cultivation.
.
Inferior Water Grain Pill
- Satisfy the hunger for 24 hours.
- Quench the thirst for 24 hours.
- Increase lifespan by one year.
- Increase Water Qi by one year's worth of cultivation.
.
Inferior Wood Grain Pill
- Satisfy the hunger for 24 hours.
- Strengthen the bone marrow and skeleton by 10% for 24 hours.
- Increase lifespan by one year.
- Increase Wood Qi by one year's worth of cultivation.
.
Inferior Earth Grain Pill
- Satisfy the hunger for 24 hours.
- Stabilize your dantian for 24 hours.
- Increase lifespan by one year.
- Increase Earth Qi by one year's worth of cultivation.
.
Inferior Poison Grain Pill
- Satisfy the hunger for 24 hours.
- Add poison to the blood circulation.
- Decrease lifespan by one year.
- Increase Poison Qi by one year's worth of cultivation.
.
Inferior Elixir Grain Pill
- Satisfy the hunger for 10 days.
- Increase metabolism and regenerative abilities for 10 days.
- Increase lifespan by 10 years.
- Increase all five elements Qi by 10 years' worth of cultivation.
.
Leo read through everything. He paused for a long time to digest the information.
First off, this workshop was beyond broken. It changed a regular potato and a mutated nut into 30 pills, which could bless him with 57 years of lifespan!
Secondly, the pills were mostly inferior in quality, judging from their prefix. Leo stared at the run-down workshop, wondering if the pill quality depending on the level of the building.
And lastly, it involved cultivation that Leo had no clue about.
Seeing so many perks of these nut pills, Leo had the urge to think of "Deez Nuts" jokes. He laughed to himself and quickly collected his loot.
"Should I test the taste?"
Leo licked his lips.

chapters.title: Chapter 17 Drug-Addicted Florida Man Invents New Meds
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 17 – Drug-Addicted Florida Man Invents New Meds
Leo popped the water grain pill into his mouth and chewed it like candy. The hard surface of the pill melted upon touching Leo's tongue, and the rich flavor of mint and pine nut hit his nose.
Leo exhaled a fume of cold air and shivered in ecstasy. He just had a mental orgasm.
DING
<Your lifespan has increased by one year.>
"WOO!"
Although there was no report about Qi or related internal energy, Leo sensed the inflating cold air inside him. The sensation ran from his stomach to his blood vessels, then it flowed all over his body, sending a shiver down his spine.
As Leo didn't want to waste his lifespan buying more containers from the shopping system, he picked another pill and put it in his mouth.
This time, he ate the fire pill.
When the burning hot pill touched his tongue, Leo smelled the nostalgic chili scent. The spicy taste and the heat instantly canceled the chilling air. After Leo chewed the pill, sticky juice came out and flooded his mouth with pine nuts and a sweet potato aroma.
It was delicious!
Leo swallowed everything, ignoring the conflicted temperature. He reached out to grab another fire grain pill. However, a nauseous sensation kicked in. His stomach rejected additional food, and he was on the verge of vomiting.
He was full.
"Holy cow, moo. I guess it is "Grain Pill" for a reason."
Leo forgot how long his stomach was this bloated. He rubbed his round belly in astonishment and frustration. At this rate, he wouldn't be able to eat anything to recover his lifespan.
Still, Leo had many things to do to kill time as many projects piled up. He sorted the pills into different containers and inserted a new batch of ingredients into the workshop cauldron. Then, he let it auto-refine the meds.
.
Half a day later, Leo sat on the floor of his store, gazing at the dozen stainless steel pots that contained grain pills. 12 batches of pill-refining gave birth to 360 grain pills of six elements and a few unique elixir pills.
Leo was annoyed. A thousand years of lifespan was right before his eyes, but he couldn't eat any pill because of his bloated stomach.
'I can't eat any food now. How am I going to get my lifespan back?'
Leo glanced at the display windows of his store. He pondered for 10 minutes, questioning himself how he could swindle lifespan from other local cultivators.
There was no other choice. He had to officially open the general store and invite more customers.
Putting his idea to work, Leo spent more of his lifespan, purchasing transparent Tupperware from the system shop. He transferred the pills into the containers and lined them behind the display glass windows as premium goods. Then, he turned his attention to the corianders, potatoes, cabbages, and bananas.
As potatoes and mutated corianders could be used in alchemy, Leo decided not to sell them for the time being. He transferred them to the workshop building.
The interior of the alchemy workshop was the same as any blank cabin. Leo got plenty of room to store ingredients and his merchandise, so he carried the baskets of corianders and potatoes there, using the structure as his storehouse.
After sorting out the non-merchandise, Leo turned his attention to the cabbages and bananas. He hesitated at first, but he picked one of each and touched them with his naked finger.
The cabbages turned purple as usual. However, the bananas instantly turned yellow as if they were old enough to be consumed.
Curious, Leo tried to peel the banana even though he couldn't eat it at the moment. But as soon as he tried to peel it, he sensed something odd.
The skin was rough and harder than usual. Leo exerted the same force as when he uprooted the pine tree. After a portion of the banana was peeled, gold light shone from inside the fruit.
It was a gold banana. Moreover, its strong banana scent contained a tinge of earthy smell similar to brown dirt or dried land.
Leo narrowed his eyes. He suddenly recalled something.
"Come to think of it, after I started refining grain pills, I haven't researched any of the mutated fruits or veggies here. I also haven't tried the black grasses yet."
He smacked his forehead. He picked a sample of each mutated ingredient and waited for the cauldron to finish refining the next batch of pills.
Several minutes later, the auto-refining workshop completed the task. Leo collected the pills and switched to the research mode right away. Then, he put an entire stalk of black grasses into the pot.
DING
The result came out.
.
[Immortal Grass]
Immortal grasses are commonly populated in an area with dense seven elemental Qi. It is one of the key ingredients to making longevity pills and the infamous pill of youth.
[Alchemy Recipe – Longevity Pill]
One Blade of Immortal Grass
One Liter of Pinnacle-Grade Holy Water
One Black Heart of 9th-Grade Demon Beast
*Optional* One of any Fire Element Catalyst
*Optional* One of any Water Element Catalyst
*Optional* One of any Earth Element Catalyst
*Optional* One of any Metal Element Catalyst
*Optional* One of any Wood Element Catalyst
Any Elemental Essence
[Alchemy Recipe – Pill of Youth]
One Hundred Blades of Immortal Grass
One Drop of Virgin Sage's BloodI think you should take a look at
One Drop of Unicorn's Tear
One Liter of Pinnacle-Grade Holy Water
Five Elemental Essence
.
Leo blankly stared at the detail. He was astonished by the names of the required ingredients in the recipes. Sometimes, Leo wondered who came up with the recipes and the combinations.
'Forget longevity pills. This thing sounds too complex and difficult. I'll stick with the iron grain pill for now. Oh, right. What about the cabbage and banana?'
Leo put the purple cabbage into the pot next. Then, he received another weird result.
.
[Cabbage of Extreme Yin]
This poisonous cabbage can only be found in a demonic realm as it is one of demon's staple food. No cultivator should consume this as it is full of Poison Qi and yin miasma. However, it can be used in alchemy to make potent poison.
[Alchemy Recipe – Demonic Poison Potion]
One Cabbage of Extreme Yin
One Liter of Yin Fluid
One of any Poison Element Catalyst
Poison Qi
.
Leo raised his eyebrows. The last time he ate it, it was delicious. He wondered how it was poisonous.
"You? Poisonous? You must be joking. Oh, well. I'll add the poison label to the merchandise. Next."
It was the gold banana's turn, and Leo wasn't disappointed this time.
.
[Golden Sand Banana]
This fruit is exclusive to the Golden Sand Mystic Realm as no realm can produce Earth Element Essence as thick as this place. Golden Sand Bananas are known to be the top-tier Earth Element Catalyst in alchemy, and every alchemist expert will kill to get their hands on one of them.
[Traits]
Increases any Earth-Type Cultivation Pill's success rate by 100%. Increases the quality by three major tiers. Increase the number of final products by 50%.
.
"Oh, boy. This will sell!"
Leo was overjoyed. He planned to set a high price for the mutated bananas. Still, he needed to keep some of them to himself as he might need them in the future.
Putting his new project to work, Leo started converting cabbages and bananas.
When the sun sank to the west horizon, Leo finished transporting a basket worth of golden sand bananas and purple cabbages to the alchemy workshop's storehouse. As for the rest, Leo arranged them in supermarket refrigerators and wrote a price tag on them.
Leo looked forward to Wu Buyi's return. He couldn't wait to spread the information about his shop.
"Please hurry and come back. I need more lifespan…"
While Leo prayed, the chomper plant returned home. It scratched the front door with its branches.
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm "MEOW!"
Like a hungry cat returning home after a day of adventure, it yowled. Its roots slipped into the store and coiled its roots around his leg. As for Cat's head, it got stuck outside.
"MEOW!"
"Ah, dammit! I know, I know. You're hungry, right?"
In frustration, Leo picked up a few regular cabbages and threw them toward Cat. The latter opened its mouth and caught everything.
Unfortunately, after swallowing them, Cat wanted more. It extended its roots and grabbed the goodies in the display fridges and the freezer chest. It grabbed both regular and poisonous cabbages.
"Hey! That's inedible!"
Before Leo could react, Cat picked up one of the poison cabbages. It put the purple cabbages in its mouth and ate them.
It was too late for Leo to do anything. He deeply sighed and facepalmed, unable to come up with a word to scold this reckless plant.
"I can't save you this time, kitty."
"Meow?"
Betraying Leo's expectation, the chomper tilted its head in confusion. It picked its sharp teeth with a thorn on its branch and returned to its home at the side of the store, satisfied.
"…"
Leo watched how Cat swaggered away after the quick meal. He followed it and noticed that it fell asleep and snored.
He deeply frowned. Then, he glanced at its black leaves and vines.
Thinking for a moment, Leo cut a piece of its root and brought it to the alchemy cauldron. He put it in and pressed the research button.
DING
The result came out, which explained everything about why Cat managed to resist the poisonous cabbages.

chapters.title: Chapter 18 Florida Man Cooks Chemical Weapon Using Dog’s Blood
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 18 – Florida Man Cooks Chemical Weapon Using Dog's Blood
The next day morning, Leo sat in front of the glutton plant, staring at it. The chomper was, as usual, lazing around like a tree. It didn't even notice that Leo had cut its root by an inch.
"Seriously, you…"
Leo was perplexed about how this plant was related to demons. He was aware that it became like this because of his radiation, but he couldn't figure out how it connected to the demon race.
.
[Root of Infant Demon Dryad]
This root can be extracted from an infant demon dryad, a rare mythical specimen from a demonic realm. It can be used to substitute both wood and poison element catalysts due to its poisonous nature.
[Traits]
Increase any poison element pill success rate by 25%.
.
"A dryad, you? Aren't you supposed to be sexy tree girls or half-naked elves with vines around your body?"
Leo stared at the round chomper's head. His fantasies were ruined.
"Meow?"
Cat drowsily woke up as it noticed Leo's gaze. It licked his face like a happy puppy.
Leo couldn't help but pat this guy like a good dog. He went back to the store and brought in a dozen of mutated cabbages for breakfast. Then, he returned to his pill-refining duty.
Last night, Leo got a good sleep, but his stomach was still full. As he couldn't increase his lifespan, he busied himself making more pills.
While inserting a potato and a mutated nut into the pot, Leo's mind wandered. He spoke out his thoughts, "Where can I get one of those Yin Fluid? If a man is Yang, is a woman Yin? Does Yin Fluid mean a woman's water... or pee?"
Leo repeatedly shook his head as he was disappointed in his silly mind. He activated the workshop to automatically make grain pills again. Then, he approached the pile of logs and pondered what to do with them.
"The wood is too hard for modern saws. Even if I use a chainsaw, it will end up breaking the tool instead. But that stupid mutated whip managed to break this tree. What if I use my super strength?"
Testing the toughness of the iron pine wood, Leo karate-chopped one of them.
SWUA
As if Leo's hand broke the log in half. His skin emitted yellow smoke because of his radiation.
"…"
Leo stared at his hand for a moment as he couldn't explain how light came out from his skin even though he had been living with it for years. He pursed his lips and shrugged, "I guess I still have it. Alright, time to remove the barks… with bare hands, it is."
.
Leo finally encountered an issue. After measuring the log's elasticity and toughness with his raw strength, Leo concluded that the mutated pine log was too durable for modern tools to process.
After three hours, Leo finished cutting all branches, separating leaves, collecting nuts, and debarking the first log. Even though he managed to remove the hard skin, his fingers were sore. Still, Leo got to admire the beauty of a skinless log.
Despite the bark being black, the interior skin was glistening white, but the hardness was as tough as steel plates. As for the inner skin, it was as white as a sheet, but it was a lot softer than the bark.
Curious, Leo brought a piece of iron pine bark to the workshop. He collected the completed batch of pills and put the piece of bark in there. Then, he pressed research.
DING
.
[Bark of Iron Pine Tree]
Extracted from an Iron Pine Tree. Can be used as a metal element catalyst or smelt into Iron Pine Ingot.
[Traits]
Increase metal element pill success rate by 10%.
.
For the first time, Leo found an item that could be used in another field other than alchemy. Seeing the ingot option, he wondered if he could create a blacksmith workshop in his store domain too.
Leo was not disappointed. There was a blacksmith workshop building on the list.
.
Basic Blacksmith Workshop
Requirement – Humble General Store Level 3
Price – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
Space – 10 x 10
.
"Am I in an RTS game or a base-building game world?"
Leo was amused. It seemed that the general store system wanted him to craft his merchandise himself. Still, he couldn't afford it as he didn't have enough lifespan to invest in another building.
For the moment, Leo had no customers, and he couldn't eat food. Thus, he could only busy himself tidying his backyard and sorting available resources at hand. Having nothing else to do, Leo peeled other iron pine logs and organized the barks next to the alchemy workshop.
.
Another day went by. The stomach condition issue was resolved as the grain pills' effects subsided.
Leo immediately rushed to the wolf cages to check on the livestock. The animals no longer made a noise. As Leo didn't feed it anything but water, they ran out of energy, and they were starving.
He had no intention to spare them as they were the only source of protein and lifespan. Leo mutated all of them and extracted their meat. As for the bones, blood, skin, and innards, Leo kept some for his alchemy while he donated a portion of them to Cat, replenishing its lifespan.
It was noon when Leo finished. He began cooking the old mutated meat in the freezers while he kept the fresh ones in the chest refrigerator.
After the meal, Leo let out a long sigh. A proper steak was a thousand times better than grain pill candies. Those meds weren't compatible with his lifestyle, and he swore not to eat them again.
Leo washed the dish and the BBQ set with the river water. When he was putting plates and grills on a table to dry them, he heard the whizzing sound of wind coming from above.
When Leo looked up, he noticed a team of five white-robed young men, standing on top of iron pine trees. They stared at him as if Leo was a celebrity.
Seeing new people, Leo was excited. He wondered if he would get new customers that day.
"Come down if you want to talk, boys," Leo smiled at them.
The cultivators gulped and looked at each other. However, they leaped away from Leo, heading west to Magpie City.I think you should take a look at
Leo clicked his tongue and shook his head. Since those kids avoided him, he returned to work at the alchemy workshop. He researched the wolf's goodies.
.
[Fenrir Skin]
Extracted from the mythical beast Fenrir's skin. Can be tanned into hides and crafted into Fenrir Leather Armor.
.
[Fenrir Bone Marrow's Essence]
Extracted from the mythical beast Fenrir's spinal cord. It is one of the key ingredients of the legendary pill – Bone Reconstruction Pill.
[Alchemy Recipe – Bone Reconstruction Pill]
One Drop of Fenrir Bone Marrow's Essence
A liter of Fenrir Blood
A liter of Holy Water
Three of Fire, Earth, and Water Element Catalysts
Fire, Earth, and Water Essence
.
[Fenrir Heart]
Extracted from the mythical beast Fenrir. It is one of the key ingredients of the legendary pill – Werewolf Dantian Pill.
[Alchemy Recipe – Werewolf Dantian Pill]
One Fenrir Heart
A liter of Fenrir Blood
One of Poison Element Catalyst
Poison Essence
.
[Fenrir Liver]
Extracted from the mythical beast Fenrir. It is the universal catalyst of all antidotes and healing pills, which can also substitute all elemental catalysts.
[Traits]
Substitute any type of catalyst for antidotes or healing pills. Increase the pill success rate to 100%. Increase the pill quality by three grades. Add a temporary purification perk to the completed pills.
.
[Fenrir Intestine]
Extracted from the mythical beast Fenrir. Can be used as poison or earth catalyst in antidote or healing pills.
[Traits]
Increase poison and earth pill success rate by 100%. Increase the pill quantity by 20%.
.
[Fenrir Blood]
Extracted from the mythical beast Fenrir. Can be used as a substitution for Yin-type liquid ingredients in any recipe. Can be consumed raw to replenish one's blood and Qi, but it has severe side effects.
[Traits]
Substitute any Yin-Type liquid materials. Raw consumption replenishes the loss of blood equal to the volume consumed.
.
[Fenrir Meat]
Extracted from the mythical beast Fenrir of the demonic realm. Can be cooked for food if the consumer has high poison resistance or Poison Qi.
.
A lot of questions were answered there. Leo finally understood why Wu Buyi valued them highly. Although he realized that he undersold the innards a few days ago, Leo didn't regret it. After all, he got a bunch of veggies and other resources in exchange.
Moreover, by completing the research, Leo had enough ingredients for another pill. He browsed the pill recipe while he gathered the necessary ingredients.
.
[Alchemy Recipe – Demonic Poison Potion]
One Cabbage of Extreme Yin
One Liter of Yin Fluid
One of any Poison Element Catalyst
Poison Qi
.
Although cooking a chemical weapon always resulted in trouble, Leo laughed and tried making it for fun. He threw in a mutated cabbage, a liter of mutated wolf's blood, the wolf's intestine, and a bit of spitting to the charcoals under the cauldron. Then, he pressed proceed to make the first poison.
DING
Unfortunately, the refine timer showed six hours instead of one.
"Six hours?! Seriously? What are you cooking? Ramen soup?!"
Leo almost kicked the cauldron. He grudgingly brought back the wolf ingredients and chilled them in the fridges. Then, he sat there, staring at the pot as he lost the motivation to work for the day.
"I'm gonna sit here. I'm gonna stare at you. And I'm…"
Suddenly, the weird sides of Leo took over his brain. He stood up and danced.
"Never gonna give you up. Never gonna let you down. Never gonna run around and desert you!"

chapters.title: Chapter 19 Chemist Intrudes Florida Man’s House, Kowtows For Forgiveness
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 19 : Chemist Intrudes Florida Man's House, Kowtows for Forgiveness
While Leo had a mental breakdown during the waiting, a group of white-robed cultivators returned to the Life Sword Sect. These outer disciples were Gao Yan's bullies, and they were all 19 years old. They gossiped.
"You saw that, right?"
"Yeah, the rumor is real. Gao Yan got immortal grasses from him!"
"There are plenty of spirit grasses around here. Should we go collect them?"
"And get ourselves killed? I'm sure he's growing them. If we steal those, we'll offend him!"
"But Gao Yan got the immortal grasses from him..."
"Remember the rules of survival number one : Run whenever you see a stranger with a superior cultivation base. It's not worth risking our lives for the unknown!"
"But Gao Yan..."
"That guy has an exceptional physique. That elder must have noticed that and decided to help. What about us? We are all Qi condensation stage, but we can only cultivate non-elemental Qi! If we go talk to him, instead of getting anything, he would have killed us!"
"..."
Everybody was dejected. Still, for the sake of contribution points, they rushed to the contribution pavilion to report their findings.
The next mystic realm opening was about three weeks away. They had to get ready to compete for the spot within the sect, and they needed contribution points to earn the right to compete.
.
.
= Alchemy Department =
In this department, there was a custom : Every Monday at 8 AM, a trainee was always randomly chosen by a lottery drawing, and the chosen trainee had to give a demonstration or share their knowledge, research, refining tricks, or insight.
There was also another unspoken rule - The chosen trainee must not present their knowledge half-heartedly. After all, after the presentation, every trainee was free to criticize, chastise, or debate the lecturer if the workshop class was poor and mundane. Therefore, if someone gave a weak or bad lecture, he would be humiliated on the spot.
Gao Yan joined the little gathering of 20 trainees. As he was still a disciple who couldn't concoct a pill, his name wasn't put in the lottery, so he could come here every week to listen to free lectures.
The lecturer today was a 22-year-old alchemist intern, who was also an outer disciple of the Sixth Element Sect. He had been working for Life Sword Sect as a guest alchemist for six months. He had short black hair. His face was full of pimples. His fingernails were black, and his skin was riddled with black spots as he had been exposed to various types of poison substances.
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm "Fellow alchemists, my name is Jin Yong. As my friends know, I'm from the Sixth Element Sect, which is well-versed in poison element. I'll be demonstrating how to extract venom from poisonous plants and choose the right catalyst ingredients for poison element pills."
Gao Yan's pupils dilated as he was interested in the unknown element. In the books, they only described five elements : Earth, Fire, Water, Wood, and Metal. None of them mentioned poison elements.
"Before I start, I must correct the misconception. Yes, poison is harmful. But when it is correctly utilized, it can become medicine. To prove my point, I'll show you how to make an anti-infection dressing gel with this bone-rotting sap."
"..."
Nobody uttered a word as they focused on how Jin Yong refined the purple sap in a small cauldron on the table.
The lecture lasted four hours.
.
.
Later that day, at 10 PM, Jin Yong left Magpie City and took a stroll in the eastern forest to change his mood.
During the morning, the lecture was a success. Only a few seniors debated with him, but nobody managed to humiliate him in front of the crowd. He managed to get some praise from a senior guest alchemist, who came to see the lecture.
Because of the happy mood, Jin Yong enjoyed the scenery and let his imagination run wild during the stroll. As his brain came up with various impossible scenarios, he suddenly remembered one of the trending rumors around the sect.
In the east forest, a mysterious senior lurked there. He was also the reason Gao Yan awakened Wood Qi and became Wu Buyi's disciple.
Curious, Jin Yong leaped over the tall trees and ventured deeper into the forest.
A few minutes later, Jin Yong finally saw a dense fog at a distance. Unperturbed and confident in his foundation establishment stage's strength, Jin Yong entered the fog area.
After entering the fog, Jin Yong couldn't see anything beyond five meters in front of him. Still, he kept placing himself on top of pine trees. When he landed on a tree in the fog, he noticed something odd - The tree bark and leaves were all shining in blue.
Jin Yong silently collected a few nuts and put them in his clothes. He would compare them to the encyclopedia book in his dorm later. For now, he continued traveling further, searching for the source of the anomaly.
After 10 minutes, Jin Yong saw two sources of bright light. One came from the windows of a large cabin while the other one came from the building behind it, but it was dimmer. Jin Yong approached the brightest area first to get a closer look.I think you should take a look at
The orange light of the building was so bright that it amazed Jin Yong. He had never seen any tool or lamp that illuminated this far. Curious about the source of light, he got down from the tree and stood in front of the building with glass windows.
Jin Yong looked at the weird long bulbs of light inside the cabin at first. Then, his eyes lowered and noticed a dozen transparent containers lining the table.
The round pills of various colors interested him.
"Pills? What pills are these? I've never seen them before."
Jin Yong was frustrated. He wanted to sniff them to check what kind of pills they were, but no scent came out from the glass windows. He turned to the door, wondering if he should knock on it to call the owner.
Hesitated, Jin Yong took a few steps back to look at the building's signboard, which was brightly illuminated by peculiar purple light.
[We Sell Weed]
Jin Yong was astonished. If this was a store, the store owner might have a mental issue. Still, it gave him hope. Since this was a store, Jin Yong tried to open the door.
CREAK
It was unlocked. Jin Yong entered the store and looked inside.
The interior was bright as if it was daytime. Many weird glass containers emitted chilling air. All of them also had a light bulb built-in, illuminating the content inside.
The alchemist trainee was stunned. He didn't know what he should check first. Still, his legs brought him toward the tallest object in the room : The Supermarket Showcase Refrigerator. Then, he noticed the vegetables on the showcase.
There were countless black grasses, blue coriander, mutated cabbages, and gold bananas lining in order. Every item emitted thick elemental Qi.
"I-Immortal grasses?! Yin Cabbage and Sand Banana?! I-Is this an immortal herb pavilion?!"
Jin Yong gulped. He turned to the other fridges to see the other items.
The glass-door refrigerators were also filled with cabbages and black grasses. However, the slide-door chests had something else.
There were meat cuts, buckets of blood, and packages of innards in there.
Jin Yong turned to the meat display fridges. He also noticed beautiful cuts of red meat, but they looked the same as meat in the city's market.
"Commoner's food is here too. What is this place?"
Jin Yong looked around, but he couldn't see any other item. Then, his nose caught a pleasant aroma. He followed the scent and found a transparent pot, containing black water and a blue coriander at the south corner of the cabin.
For an unknown reason, Jin Yong had the urge to drink the water. He approached the pot and was about to open the lid.
CREAK
Suddenly, someone entered the store through the backdoor. Jin Yong immediately turned around and found the store owner. He was an elder with long white hair and a silky-smooth white beard. In his hands, he carried a glass pot full of purple liquid while wearing strange gloves.
Leo stared at Jin Yong, "Is there something I can do for you, mister?"
Jin Yong was surprised for a moment before his eyes were attracted by the purple liquid in the glass pot. His nose caught on the familiar scent of a poisonous substance, telling him that the content was poisonous.
'Poison liquid? I haven't seen that before? What kind of poison is that?'
He turned his attention to the elder. Then, he noticed the colorful aurora around him. Just like the others, Jin Yong was nervous. He gulped.
'A soul formation cultivator, the sixth stage! He's as strong as the sect master! The rumor is true!!'
As an inferior 3rd stage cultivator, Jin Yong didn't dare to offend the senior. He quickly knelt and cupped his fist.
"Please forgive this junior for trespassing senior's abode!"
"..."
.
.
Meanwhile, Leo scratched his head and frowned at Jin Yong. He thought to himself.
'Why do these guys always overreact when they see me? What did I ever do to them?'

chapters.title: Chapter 20 Florida Man Gets Rich Selling Trash
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 20 – Florida Man Gets Rich Selling Trash
Just a few minutes ago, Leo was busy scooping purple substances into the glass pot. He heard the footsteps and the creaking sound of the store's door, so he rushed to the cabin to check.
Leo was not disappointed. A wild customer appeared even though he was on the ugly side.
Trying to be friendly, Leo initiated the conversation.
"Is there something I can do for you, mister?"
The pimple man instantly knelt and cupped his fist, "Please forgive this junior for trespassing senior's abode!"
"Huh?"
Leo pursed his lips. Once again, his customer made the situation awkward. But since he showed respect, Leo didn't mind doing business with the guy.
He activated the shop domain and revealed his customer's status.
.
Name: Jin Yong
Age: 22
Remaining Lifespan: 167 Years, 5 Months, 24 Days, 1 Hour, and 42 Minutes.
.
Compared to Han Meng or Wu Buyi, this guy didn't have much lifespan, but he was somewhat better than Gao Yan. Still, Leo needed to get something out of this man.
"You have a Daoist nickname?" Leo asked as he didn't want to reveal his ability or secret that he knew the guy's name.
Jin Yong dryly laughed and confessed, "I'm still the first rank of the foundation establishment stage. I still have a long way to go until the golden core stage and get my Daoist Name, senior."
Leo raised his brow. He heard something related to the culture of this cultivation world. He probed further.
"What are you doing here, mister?"
"Senior, I heard about your rumor, and I come here to pay respect. I have no intention of doing anything disrespectful!"
"…"
Leo smiled and repeatedly nodded. He was glad to hear it as the viral marketing method started to show some results. In a good mood, Leo put the poison water pot down on the pill table next to the display windows.
Before Leo could say anything, Jin Yong looked up and gazed at the purple liquid in the pot.
"S-Senior. I heard you are selling precious herbs. C-Can I buy some?"
Nothing made Leo happy more than getting an enthusiastic customer, "Stand up, mister. Is there something you need?"
"Y-Yes," Jin Yong stood up. He glanced at the showcase fridge's immortal grass at first. However, his instinct drove his eyes toward the purple liquid on the pill table.
Leo followed Jin Yong's gaze and noticed that his customer was interested in the finished products. He smiled and opened the plastic Tupperware, showing him the grain pills.
"Are you interested in grain pills?"
Jin Yong widened his eyes as he recognized the aura of Fire Qi, Metal Qi, and other elements. Moreover, one of them produced Poison Qi, which was beneficial to him.
Alchemists always used low-graded ingredients to make grain pills. As a result, most food pills only filled their stomach, but they didn't give elemental Qi that they could cultivate. As for ingredients with elemental Qi, they usually saved them to make a more difficult pill.
Secondly, the only places cultivators could accumulate elemental Qi were mystic realms, which opened once every three months. Therefore, every cultivation pill, herb, or artifact that produced elemental Qi was more precious than spirit stones or gold.
Seeing so many grain pills with elemental Qi, Jin Yong was distracted. He pointed at the purple pills in the Tupperware as they contained necessary poison Qi that he needed.
"H-How much is this, senior?"
Leo gazed at the plastic box in his hand. As he concocted iron grain pills every hour, he got several purple pills as byproducts. Averagely, Leo got one inferior poison grain pill per batch. So far, he collected 25 poison element pills.
As these poisonous grain pills were useless to Leo, he was more than happy to sell them. He pointed at the floating lifespan status in front of Jin Yong, introducing the store system, "See the text, mister?"
"!!!"
Finally, Jin Yong noticed the status of his lifespan. His throat was dry, and his pupils dilated.
"I-Is this my lifespan?!"
"Yes. Also, in my store, your lifespan is the currency. For example, I sell these for…"
Leo paused for a moment to think of the price tag. Then, he raised three fingers.
"Three years of lifespan per pill. How about it?"
After showing Jin Yong three fingers, Leo inwardly cursed himself as he thought it might be too expensive. His instinct told him that one year per pill was enough since these things decreased the consumer's lifespan. No matter how he looked at it, these poison grain pills were trash.
Jin Yong widened his eyes in shock. His voice cracked, and his heart raced. He couldn't believe what he heard.
Not everybody could enter the mystic realm to cultivate elemental Qi there. Every season, all sects chose their most promising disciples and elders before they dispatched the teams to the mystic realms. In addition, the quota was limited due to the restriction of each mystic realm. An average alchemist trainee like Jin Yong might not be able to earn the right to join the expedition.
Getting these pills were equivalent to obtaining the quota to join the event. Moreover, if Jin Yong could drastically improve his cultivation base by consuming these poison grain pills before the event, he might earn the quota for the expedition, killing two birds with one stone.
In short, three years of lifespan per pill was dirt cheap for such an opportunity!
"T-THREE YEARS PER PILL?! REALLY?!"
Leo deeply sighed. Judging from the reaction, he was convinced that it was overpriced. He silently sealed the plastic boxes and prepared to get scolded by an angry customer.
Betraying Leo's expectation, Jin Yong said in a clear voice.
"I'll TAKE EVERY PILL, SENIOR!!"
"Hah?"
Leo was taken aback. There were 25 purple pills in three plastic boxes, but this guy wanted all of them. The total price was 75 years of lifespan.
"Are you sure? That's 75 years, you know?"I think you should take a look at
"Senior, 75 years is nothing if I have those pills!" Jin Yong insisted.
Leo started to feel bad. He revealed some of the hidden information about the pills.
"Do you know that poison grain pills decrease your lifespan upon consumption? If you eat all of them, you will lose 25 years of your lifespan on top of that. If we combine the total lifespan you lose, it's 100 years!"
"Senior, are you joking? I'll gladly throw away 100 years of my lifespan for those pills! Please sell them to me. I really need it!"
"…"
Leo stroked his beard and gave Jin Yong a meaningful look. Half of him felt bad for the ugly guy, but his capitalist side was screaming that he should take the deal.
In the end, the capitalist heart demon won. Leo brightly smiled and opened the plastic Tupperware, allowing Jin Yong to collect them. As he didn't want to spread the plastic technologies to this world, Leo decided not to give Jin Yong the Tupperware boxes.
"Go ahead, take them. I won't ask what you're gonna do with them, but… good luck."
"THANK YOU, SENIOR!"
Jin Yong collected the purple pills and put them in his sleeve pockets in glee. Then, his lifespan status changed as 75 years were deducted from the pool.
However, after collecting everything, Jin Yong was not done. He gazed at the purple fluid in the transparent pot. He hadn't given up the tempting liquid yet.
"Senior, if I may ask, could you tell me what that water is? It smells like snake poison sacs."
"Oh, this?"
Leo bitterly smiled. This was the newest product that he wasn't proud of. After all, it was as useless as the poison grain pills.
.
Lesser Yin Poison Potion
- Adds Yin Energy to Dantian.
- Increase Poison Resistance.
- Increase Poison Qi by two years' worth of cultivation per 10cc.
- High Chance of Causing Gastritis.
.
What was the point of drinking something that could cause gastritis? Leo regretted spending six hours to make a liter of this poisonous water.
"This might be too much for you. It's incomplete, and it will harm your constitution. Do not be greedy."
"Oh…"
Jin Yong was dejected. Still, he didn't give up, "T-Then, can I have a small portion of it? J-Just a few drops are fine!"
Leo deeply sighed. Since the guy asked for it, he let Jin Yong learn a harsh lesson through the results.
"Alright. Let me get a container."
"No need senior. I have this!"
Jin Yong brought out a little bamboo canteen, which could be used to store fresh water. He drank everything inside and passed it to Leo.
"Please store the liquid in here, senior."
"… Okay."
Leo received the canteen. Measuring it with his eyes, Leo estimated that it could only hold about 500-600cc of the fluid. He scooped the liquid from the pot with a ladle and carefully poured it into the container to the brim.
Not wasting a single drop, Leo sealed the canteen with its plug and passed it to Jin Yong.
"Consider it a promotion. You can have that for free."
"!!!"
Jin Yong's hands trembled as he slowly retrieved the container. After putting it in his, Jin Yong kowtowed, "THANK YOU FOR YOUR KINDNESS, SENIOR! I'LL BE SURE TO COME BACK AND REPAY YOU WHEN I'M SUCCESSFUL!"
Leo rolled his eyes as he had heard a similar line before. He waved his hand.
"Instead of that, how about you repay me now by spreading the word about my store. I'm selling pills and weed for cheap. Of course, I only accept lifespan."
Jin Yong's eyes gleamed. He slammed his head against the floor and caused a loud noise.
Leo's face darkened. He was afraid that this ugly guy might destroy his house. Fortunately, the floor was intact, and there was no scratch mark.
"I'll tell everybody in the Sixth Element Sect, senior! I'll even invite the elders there!"
"… Okay."
"Umm." Jin Yong slowly stood up and asked Leo.
"Could I know your name, senior?"
Once again, Leo widely grinned. He puffed his chest with pride and bragged about his name.
"My Daoist name is Florida Man!"
.
.
After a brief chat, Jin Yong excused himself and left. Before he left, he glanced at the fridges with the black grasses and other goodies.
'With the poison pills and the poison liquid in my hands, I should be able to jump from first rank of foundation establishment stage to fifth rank at least! With this progress, the main sect will have no choice but to recall me! Then, I might even secure a spot in the next mystic realm expedition!'
Jin Yong departed. His laughter echoed in the forest. Still, he swore that he would come back here to return this favor one day.
'I'll be back, Senior Florida Man! I'll be your customer again!'

chapters.title: Chapter 21 Florida Man Baths In Wolf’s Goo, Complains He Smells Like Testicles
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 21 – Florida Man Baths in Wolf's Goo, Complains He Smells like Testicles
After Jin Yong was gone, Leo thought of the obnoxious plant pet outside. He checked its lifespan.
.
Name: Cat
Age: 0
Remaining Lifespan: 700 Years
.
It consumed some of the mutated cabbages, the mutated wolves' innards, and blood, increasing its lifespan by 1,000 years. However, Leo chose not to swindle it again for the moment.
Leo brought the purple soup and put the pot in front of the chomper. He opened the lid.
"Hey, Cat. I heard you're immune to poison and radiation. You think you can drink this?"
Cat drowsily woke up and sniffed. Then, it turned stiff for a moment.
"MEOW <3"
As if Cat just found its favorite food, it sank a hundred small roots into the pot and absorbed the liquid. The pulsing vines and roots drew everything into its head, and it burped. The poison soup was gone in a flash.
Leo nodded in satisfaction. Then, he checked its lifespan, wondering if it benefited the plant.
.
Name: Cat
Age: 0
Remaining Lifespan: 1,200 Years
.
It was just half-pot, but it increased Cat's lifespan by 500, which was better than feeding it raw blood and cabbages. Also, the chomper seemed satisfied with the soup.
"About 1,000 years of lifespan per full pot? But I can only make about one more pot since I don't have enough wolf blood and intestines. That one-liter requirement is brutal."
Giving a liter of blood to Cat directly could boost its lifespan by about 200-300 years at most. However, after combining with other ingredients, it granted more.
"Meow?"
As if Cat understood Leo's words, it tilted its head, asking him why he couldn't make more.
"Don't meow me, silly plant. You ate a portion of the wolf's intestines and blood. I have enough yin fluid for only another batch."
"Meow…"
Cat was crestfallen. It stuck out its tongue and collapsed on the ground, sulking.
Seeing the plant's reaction, Leo snickered. He also had an idea, so he gave it a hint.
"Look, Cat. We need dire wolves to make you the purple soup. If you, by chance, can hunt or capture those wolves for me, I can make you more soup!"
"MEOW!?"
"Damn right, I'm not kidding."
"MEOW, MEOW-MEOW MEOW?!"
Leo nodded, "If you hunt other creatures, will I make you something? Of course. As long as you bring them here alive, I'll find a way to make you the best fertilizer."
"MEOW, MEOW!!"
Motivated. The chomper plant uprooted itself and dashed into the dark forest.
Looking at how the plant ran, Leo couldn't help but laugh as it looked like a running chimpanzee. He then cleaned the pot and started making the next batch of poison potion for the plant. Then, he called it a night.
.
.
The next day morning, Leo woke up to see the progress of the auto-refining workshop. As expected, it finished making one liter worth of Lesser Yin Poison Potion.
He scooped everything in the cauldron with a ladle, storing them in the usual pot. When it got difficult to scoop, Leo lifted the entire cauldron and poured every drop of content into the glass container.
The cauldron was about 800 pounds, judging from Leo's feelings. Still, he easily lifted it with one hand.
After putting the cauldron back, Leo carried the soup pot back to the store and placed it in the corner, away from the fridges or other display windows.
While Leo was doing chores, he heard the creaking noise of wooden roots and the loud noise of a large animal. Leo turned around and looked through the front windows, checking outside.
He saw Cat, dragging a living wolf by its legs toward the store. However, it was not a regular dire wolf. It was a monster, whose physique was 10 meters in length!
Its fur was dark green, and it leaked green gas. Three emerald eyes of the monster emitted dense mist. In addition, it had two mouths on top of each other as if it was Osiris from Yu Gi Oh. The five tails also looked similar to tree branches. However, its four legs were broken and bent at a weird angle.
The chomper plant was also in bad shape. It had countless scratches on its head. Some of the vines were dangling, and the roots seemed shorter than usual. It panted and dropped the monster beast down in front of the store.
"Meow…"
Cat let out a soft cry, reporting its finding.
Seeing how miserable Cat was, Leo rushed to the store and brought the newly cooked poison soup to it. The plant noticed the soup and dipped its roots and vines into it, sucking everything in seconds.
Leo patted Cat's head, "You stupid cat. I told you to hunt animals, not to get hurt. What's the point of risking your life for something exotic if you can't eat it?"
The chomper purred and focused on licking the dripping vines and roots. The small scratches were healed, and the major wounds on the vines and roots were closed. For now, it was safe.
Leo stood up and walked toward the large beast that Cat caught. The monster wolf noticed Leo's presence and struggled to get up, but its broken legs had no strength to support its large physique. It collapsed on the ground.
GRRR
Despite being heavily injured, it snarled at Leo.I think you should take a look at
Leo was expressionless. He nonchalantly walked toward the head of the monster wolf and reached out his hand to touch it.
At that moment, the wolf monster's two mouths snapped at Leo. One caught his hand while the second mouth got his head. Then, it applied pressure on its large jaws, trying to chew or crush Leo to death.
CRACK
The sound of a broken large piece of bone was audible.
"MEOW!"
Cat let out a desperate cry. It rushed to Leo to pry the jaws open with its vines. However, the wolf's two mouths didn't budge.
While Cat tried to help Leo, the latter's left hand patted its head. Then, it heard his voice.
"You don't need to help me. You should be worrying about your future breakfast instead."
As Leo finished speaking, small white pieces of fangs fell to the ground.
The one with broken bones was not Leo. The wolf ended up breaking its fangs after trying to bite Leo.
*WHIMPER*
The wolf monster widened its green eyes in shock and pain. It tried to spit Leo out, but Leo suddenly spat into its throat and pushed himself out.
Leo massaged his right wrist which got bitten. Then, he scratched his head. Not even a scratch was left behind on his skin.
"Look, doggie. When you bite someone, you're supposed to aim for their neck, not the hardest bones or skull. Anyway, you have 10 seconds to live. Any last word?"
The monster didn't say anything. It trembled for a moment before the shaking turned into spasms. Foam came out from its mouth, after which it turned purple. The belly swelled as if it was a balloon. Solid scum and urine were discharged from the bottom orifices.
"MEOW <3"
Although the black waste and urine were nasty and disgusting, Cat opened its mouth and feasted on them in glee.
Gazing at the behavior of his cat, Leo sensed a shiver down his spine. He thought of the times it licked his face with the same tongue, causing his stomach to retch.
Leo covered his mouth and approached the dead monster beast. He inspected the large body and the weird physique, including the two-mouth feature.
"How am I going to drain your freaking blood, doggie? You're as big as a mutated rat in my world."
Since meat couldn't butcher itself, Leo started working on it by cutting its swelling belly with a skinning knife first.
CLANK
The modern knife broke when Leo exerted his force. Judging the feedback of the tool, Leo was certain that the thick was harder than steel.
As modern tools wouldn't work on the monster beast, Leo straightened his right index finger. He gazed at the fingernail, entrusting his job to it.
"Do me a favor, my nail. Cut through this thing for me."
No finger could speak or reply to its master's questions. Thus, Leo pressed his finger on the monster's stomach and pushed.
PU
The nail sank into the skin as if it was a sharp knife cutting through a piece of raw steak. However, what came out wasn't blood but yellowish rotten pus, splashing on Leo as if it was a bursting zit landmine.
Leo was covered in yellow slime-like goo!
"…"
Leo accidentally sniffed it, then his expression turned ugly. It smelled like a piece of skin from someone's testicles who hadn't taken a bath for months.
In disgust, Leo took off his clothes and ran toward the alchemy workshop, where he had stored several canteens of fresh water from the stream. He jumped into the cauldron. Then, he poured the water from the canteen, getting rid of the waste as soon as possible.
.
10 minutes later, Leo climbed out of the cauldron, filled with hot water and yellow goo. He threw the dirty clothes into the fire to dispose of them.
Because of frustration, Leo no longer had the mood to work. He gazed at his drenched body, which still had a few drops of yellow puss on him. Moreover, he still smelled like a dirty man's virgin balls during No-Nut-November Season.
"This will take days to clean it off. Next time, I won't touch any inflamed part! Dammit!"
While complaining, Leo glanced at his makeshift bathtub.
The boiling yellow liquid sent out a foul odor and black miasma. Moreover, Leo heard someone's shrilling wail from inside the fluid as if it was cursed.
Attempting to remove the nasty liquid, Leo opened the workshop menu and pressed the research button, trying to trick the system to remove it.
DING
The workshop accepted the item. Instantly, all liquid inside and the foul odor were gone like smoke.
The next moment, the workshop informed Leo of the result.
.
[Emerald Wolf's Tear]
This rare tear can be extracted from any 5th-grade or higher emerald wolf's body. Can be consumed directly to increase one's muscle strength and bone density. Diluting one drop in freshwater can transform it into Yin Fluid.
[Traits]
Increase muscle strength and bone density by 10% per 10cc.
.
Leo blankly stared at the workshop's window message for ten minutes. Afterward, he screamed in anger.
"WOLF'S TEAR MY VIRGIN ASS! THIS IS DIRTY ZIT'S PUS, YOU #@&$!!"
.
Meanwhile, Cat had the best day of its life. After it finished the waste of the wolf, it slurped the yellowish goo in glee.
"Meow <3"

chapters.title: Chapter 22 Florida Man Cures Stray Cat’s Blindness Using Homemade Parasites
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 22 : Florida Man Cures Stray Cat's Blindness Using Homemade Parasites
Leo ended up spending a few years of his lifespan purchasing bars of soap and a modern bathtub. After 30 minutes of scrubbing, Leo got out of the bathtub and poured the wastewater into the outhouse. Although he had some concerns if Cat could drink soap juice, he dumped the waste water there anyway.
After refreshing himself, Leo returned to the front of the store to resume butchering the wolf. This time, aside from his right hand, he wore some protection : the hazmat suit.
When Leo returned, he found the chomper licking the belly of the monster. Most of the yellow goo was gone. Noticeably, the purple skin of Cat glistened under the sunlight as if it had coated itself with premium lotions.
Leo frowned as Cat ate most of the goo. He complained.
"Cat, that mayonnaise is the ingredient of your purple juice. If you drink them all, I can't make you those."
"Meow?!"
Cat turned around and dropped its jaw. It covered its wide mouth with a few leaves, looking shocked.
Leo brought out a metal bucket that he always used to draw water from the stream. He put it next to the wolf and began scooping the remaining yellow pus into it. As not much fluid was left, Leo managed to fill half of the bucket.
"Don't drink this anymore, okay?"
"Meow..."
Cat was dejected. Still, it seemed satisfied after the meal.
Looking at the chomper plant up close, Leo noticed something strange. Previously, its head was attached to its soft vine, and the branches were about one inch thick.
The present chomper's vines and branches were twice thicker. In addition, it grew flower buds on its branches, producing white fog around itself. Fortunately, the flower buds gave off a lavender scent, so Leo had no issue with Cat.
"Go play somewhere else, Cat. Daddy is going to work."
"Meow <3"
The chomper moved its eight chubby roots, walking like a spider. It climbed the cabin and sat on the roof, enjoying the sunbath.
As no one was around to interrupt his work, Leo began dissecting and skinning the monster. He purchased additional buckets and large bins to store the innards, blood, bones, skin, and meat.
.
At noon, Leo finally dissected everything. However, this time, he didn't directly feed the organs to his pet right away. He brought each sample to the cauldron pot to research them.
The first item was none other than the intestines. He pressed the confirmation.
The result instantly appeared, but the intestines were ejected from the cauldron.
DING
<You have already researched Fenrir Intestine.>
"..."
Leo deeply frowned. He was sure that the intestines were different than the mutated wolf, yet the workshop system claimed that they were the same.
"Wut da hail?"
He tried the other ingredients. Unfortunately, the workshop rejected every item.
<You have already researched Fenrir Blood.>
<You have already researched Fenrir Liver.>
<You have already researched Fenrir Meat.>
<You have already researched Fenrir Skin.>
<You have already researched Fenrir Heart.>
"OH, COME ON! IT'S NOT THE SAME!"
Leo had the urge to launch this cauldron to Mars, but he couldn't afford to waste his expensive workshop tools. He reached out for the emerald eyes of the wolf and tossed one of them inside.
This time, it vanished. The cauldron didn't spit it out.
DING
<Research completed!>
<You have discovered the Eye of Fenrir!>
<A new pill recipe has been added to the encyclopedia.>
.
[Eye of Fenrir]
Extracted from an elder Fenrir. This is a universal catalyst for Wood, Metal, and Poison pills. It also contains thick poisonous miasma inside. Many demons love these as they usually implant them as their third or fourth eye to see through poison miasma. Can be used in alchemy to create a prosthetic eye.
[Alchemy Recipe : Prosthetic Eye of Fenrir]
One Eye of Fenrir
One Wood Element Catalyst
One Metal Element Catalyst
One Poison Element Catalyst
100cc of Yin Fluid
100cc of Fenrir Blood
Poison, Metal, and Wood Element Essence
.
"Prosthetic Eye?"
Leo was interested in this object. He double-checked the ingredient list in the recipe and made a checklist.
"I have no problem with essence since it magically comes out from my spit. The eye, checked. The yin fluid, obtainable, so checked. Fenrir Blood, checked. Poison catalyst? I can use the intestines for that, so checked. Metal catalyst, I can use the nuts. As for the last one... Wood element catalyst... eh."
Leo pursed his lips and fell into deep thought. He remembered that he had it, but he couldn't remember. Thus, he opened the encyclopedia menu of the workshop, searching if he had any item that could be used as a wood element catalyst.
It didn't take long for him to find one. There was one item that he had researched before.
.
[Root of Infant Demon Dryad]
This root can be extracted from an infant demon dryad, a rare mythical specimen from a demonic realm. It can be used to substitute both wood and poison element catalysts due to its poisonous nature.
[Traits]
Increase any poison element pill success rate by 25%.
.
It was the chomper's roots. Leo simply needed to cut a piece of it to use in this recipe. Wasting no time, Leo climbed up his store and went after Cat.
As Cat was photosynthesizing the sunlight, it was asleep. Its long chubby roots spread across the entire building.
Leo didn't need much. He gently snapped the tip of the smallest root. It was one inch long, and it should not affect Cat much.
The chomper didn't react when Leo cut the tip of its root, but it yawned and returned to change its sleeping posture.
After getting the necessary wood catalyst ingredient, Leo gathered all items and put them next to the workshop. He set the ingredients and chose the pill recipe. Then, he confirmed the system.
DING
<Refining Prosthetic Eye of Fenrir...>
A timer appeared. However, the duration shocked Leo.
23 Hours, 59 Minutes, 55 Seconds...
Leo facepalmed. It took too long to make this item. He felt like he wasted the opportunity to make more grain pills to make money.I think you should take a look at
Dejected, Leo returned to his cabin to clear the room for new wolf meat. He spent the rest of the day cooking, doing chores, and cutting wolf meat into smaller pieces.
.
.
The next day, at noon, Leo sat on a chair behind his store, staring at the cauldron. It slowly counted down while the progress bar gradually moved from left to right.
DING
<Workshop has refined 28 Inferior Prosthetic Eyes of Fenrir and 2 Lesser Prosthetic Eyes of Fenrir.>
"..."
The finished products floated over the cauldron, glittering in green light. All of them moved around as if they were alive, looking at the forest, cabin, workshop, and Leo in curiosity.
Leo was speechless. He had expected only one eye as he had only one wolf's eye as the material. However, the workshop created 30!
He reached out to pick one of them. It wiggled and bounced on his palm while it stared into Leo's eyes.
"Wut da hail are yu?"
*BOUNCE*
"..."
.
Inferior Prosthetic Eye of Fenrir
This prosthetic eye is a manmade parasite. By implanting it on a person's face or replacing an eye, it will connect its nerves to the host's brain, sharing its vision with the host. The eye has the following traits.
- Enable Night Vision.
- Increase the host's resistance to poison, wood, and metal Qi deviation by 50%.
- Enable the host to cultivate Wood Qi.
- Increase visual range by 100 meters.
.
Lesser Prosthetic Eye of Fenrir
This prosthetic eye is a manmade parasite. By implanting it on a person's face or replacing an eye, it will connect its nerves to the host's brain and transmit the signal, sharing its vision with the host. The eye has the following traits.
- Enable Night Vision.
- Increase the host's resistance to poison, wood, and metal Qi deviation by 60%.
- Enable the host to cultivate Wood Qi and Metal Qi.
- Increase visual range by 200 meters.
.
After Leo read through the description, he widened his eyes in astonishment.
They were technically parasites!
"Yikes. I guess I and Cat can't eat you."
*SHIVER*
The bouncing eye on Leo's palm and the floating ones heard his words and shivered in fear. The small balls were wet as if they were crying.
Feeling bad for these creatures, Leo lightly stroked it, "Don't worry. I won't eat you or harm you. As a matter of fact, I have a good host for y'all.
*BOUNCE*
The 30 eyeballs danced and jumped around. Although they couldn't make a noise, their innocent sparkling green pupils looked happy and excited.
While Leo chatted with the eyeballs, the lazy chomper crawled down from the cabin's rooftop. It looked at what Leo had made.
"Nom-Nom Meow?"
Leo rolled his eyes, "This ain't food or a treat."
"Meow..."
Cat was sad. It faced the floating eyeballs and salivated, scaring the small green eyes again.
Leo said nothing. He lightly attached the eyeball on his palm above Cat's thick lips, leaning toward the right. Coincidentally, the eye was the lesser-graded one.
"Meow?" Cat was puzzled about what his master was doing to its face.
"Stay still, kitty. You don't have eyes, right? How about adding a pair?"
"Meow??"
Cat was confused. Still, it let Leo put the strange delicious-looking eyeball on its head.
Leo adjusted its position. Then, he poked at Cat's skin.
*WIGGLE*
Small tentacles came out from the back of the eyeball, penetrating into Cat's face. A few seconds later, it became one with the plant.
"MEOW?!"
The chomper panicked. It tried to unplug the eyeball. But as it had no hands, it couldn't do anything about it.
Several seconds later, Cat's skin generated an eyelid. It blinked for the first time and stopped moving.
"Meow...?"
It tilted its head and rotated its eye around. That was the first time that Cat got to see the world.
Leo waved his hand in front of Cat's eye. It blinked several times and gazed at Leo in curiosity.
"Meow, meow?"
"Yes. This is I, Florida Man!" Leo made a Jojo reference pose.
"Meow! Meow-Meow, Meow!"
"And yes, I gave you an eye so that you can see everything around you instead of randomly moving around with your sixth sense."
"Meow? Meow-Meow?"
"Oh, you can feel the parasite? Don't worry about it. It just wants to live, but it needs some of your energy. In exchange, it will boost your physicality, okay?"
"Nom-Nom Meow?"
"No. You can't eat the other parasites. As a matter of fact, I don't think you have enough eyes for your large head. I'm planning to put another one on you. Get ready."
"Meow <3"
After getting confirmation from Cat, Leo carefully placed another lesser-graded eye on its face.
When Leo was done, Cat's two eyes widened as the parasites and the host's vision became one.
"Meow <3"
Cat was in a good mood as it could see the world in color instead of using its sixth sense. It bobbed its head up and down like a vibing cockatoo bird.
"You're welcome, kitty."
As it was so grateful to Leo, Cat hugged him and licked his face, applying the odor of the mutated monster's gaga and goo-goo to his skin. Moreover, the rotting poisonous saliva intensified the bad breath.
Leo was expressionless when he got ambushed by the saliva and the foul odor. He inwardly cried.
"I should have worn the hazmat mask around you."

chapters.title: Chapter 23 Philanthropist "Mr. Florida Man" Donates Meth To Neighbor
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 23 – Philanthropist "Mr. Florida Man" Donates Meth to Neighbor
After experimenting with the eyeballs, Leo collected the remaining eyes in glass jars and put them behind the display windows.
The eyes stared at the view in curiosity and hopped up and downs non-stop. They didn't seem to get bored from looking at the same scenery for hours.
After washing his face, Leo returned to the workshop as usual. Instead of continuing to make grain pills, Leo explored the pill recipes he had discovered so far, searching for other pills that he could make with his current ingredients.
Some recipes required inaccessible materials, such as Holy Water, Unicorn's Tear, and Virgin Sage's Blood. Thus, Leo couldn't touch them for the time being.
However, he had enough ingredients to make a new thing.
.
[Alchemy Recipe – Werewolf Dantian Pill]
One Fenrir Heart
A liter of Fenrir Blood
One Poison Element Catalyst
Poison Essence
.
"Neat! I'm bored of grain pills. Let me see what you can do."
Once again, Leo substituted the poison element catalyst with wolf intestines. Then, he added the blood and the heart. The poison essence was his spit, so there was no problem with that.
DING
<Will you refine Werewolf Dantian Pill?>
"Yes, please."
<Refining Werewolf Dantian Pill…>
Once again, the timer showed how long the workshop needed to complete the pills.
23 Hours, 59 Minutes, 57 Seconds!
Leo almost fell to his knees and screamed in agony. He hated waiting.
"NOOOO!! Why are you taking so long to make some ancient METH?! Can't you make it instantly like video games?!"
The workshop gave Leo no response. He fell on the ground, making the "OTL" pose, saddened by the harsh reality.
As Leo had nothing to do, he turned his attention to the non-alchemy materials, namely wolf meat.
"That's it. I'm gonna eat everything until I can't eat anymore."
.
.
It had been almost a week since Wu Buyi last visited Leo.
Wu Buyi had visited three cities during the past 4-5 days, and he bought a hundred large baskets of fruits and vegetables for Leo. He also had a dozen sacks of seeds for his favorite senior to grow crops.
Wu Buyi arrived at Leo's cabin before sunset. As soon as he arrived, the first thing in his vision was the large head of the chomper plant. It now resided on top of Leo's cabin, producing white mist and green gas around its body. In addition, it grew two eyes, which stared at him.
"Meow <3"
As usual, Cat opened its mouth, begging the visitor for food.
Wu Buyi clicked his tongue in disgust for a moment. But when he noticed the Wood Qi and Poison Qi from the monster, he realized something.
Cat had evolved! Its strength was comparable to a golden core cultivator!
'What did Daoist Florida Man do to that monster?! How come it is so strong now?!'
Although unwilling, Wu Buyi showed respect to Leo by giving Cat some food. He ejected a dead monster's carcass toward the chomper.
Cat caught it and chewed the monster in glee. While eating, he bobbed his head up and down like a vibing cockatoo bird again.
Wu Buyi ignored the monster and arranged his gifts in front of the store. He ejected all items from his spatial ring and put them on the ground.
While Wu Buyi arranged his items there, his eyes noticed the movements inside the store. The lights were turned on, illuminating the items and the pills on the display table. The eyeballs in glass jars also fixated on him, jumping up and down to get his attention.
"Huh?"
Wu Buyi narrowed his eyes as he recognized some of the pills. They lacked the luster of well-made medicines, but their feature and color couldn't fool his eyes.
They were elemental grain pills!
As an alchemist, his heart ached. He would never make elemental grain pills as it was a waste of rare materials. If he had the same items, he would have made cultivation pills instead.
Still, Wu Buyi was interested in the store. He put all his gifts down and entered the store, hoping to inspect the pills and the items inside.
Upon getting inside, Wu Buyi found Leo, who was in the middle of eating cooked steaks behind a long counter.
"Oh, hi. I haven't seen you in days, mister," Leo waved his hand at the alchemist.
Wu Buyi politely cupped his fist and bowed.
"Daoist Florida Man, as promised, I've brought you more vegetables, fruits, and seeds for you to cultivate spirit herbs."
"Ah, nice!" Leo stood up and looked outside the glass windows. When he saw a bunch of fruit and vegetable baskets, he widely smiled. "Thank you so much for your trouble. Here, want some steak I made? Have you eaten anything?"
Wu Buyi glanced at the steak. It was roughly cut, and it was slightly on the rare side. As he was trained not to eat any hard food, he chose to decline.I think you should take a look at
"My stomach has gotten used to grain pills. I'm afraid it can't handle solid food anymore."
"Oh, shame," Leo shrugged, but he seemed happy with Wu Buyi's answer. He shoved the last pieces of steak in his mouth and put on his rubber gloves.
Wu Buyi had no idea why Leo had to wear gloves inside his store. He watched the store owner walking toward the pill bottles on the display stand and pulling a red pill out. He brought it for Wu Buyi to see up close.
"By the way, I just made this during my free time. Do you think it can become popular among your disciples? I'm selling them for three years of lifespan per pill, by the way."
"Hmm? Three years per pill?"
Wu Buyi raised his brow. His brain calculated at the same speed as a modern computer.
'Three years per inferior elemental pills are still very cheap. Some disciples might find them useful since not everyone can enter the mystic realm to cultivate, but they are useless to nascent soul stage cultivators and stronger. Is he trying to get rid of these useless pills?'
The alchemist came up with a solution. He informed Leo.
"I'm sure everybody in Life Sword Sect will be eager to purchase these pills. I'll spread the news about your new items."
"Ah, thank you very much. Also, I see that you've brought a lot of fruits and veggies. How much are they?"
Wu Buyi laughed, "They are the tokens of gratitude from me. I hope that Life Sword Sect and Daoist Florida Man can be on good terms."
"Aw. You're a nice guy," Leo dryly laughed and stroked his beard. His eyes shifted, looking at the fridges in his store. Then, he said something that Wu Buyi had never expected.
"How about this? You have done a lot for me. I'll give you any item I have in my store in exchange for your veggies."
Wu Buyi was stunned. He didn't expect Leo to be this kind.
"C-Can I take anything?"
Leo happily nodded, "Yup. But just one item, alright? Don't be greedy and take multiple items, or I'll be mad."
"…"
Wu Buyi gulped. He looked around the shop and checked the things in the fridges. Then, he finally noticed the weird cabbages in the showcase refrigerators.
'Yin Cabbages?! This thing only exists in the demon realm! Even the sect master can't go too deep in that place. How did he get so many?!'
Wu Buyi brightly smiled and looked for other goodies. Then, he found countless stacks of fresh immortal grasses.
"…"
The alchemist almost vomited blood. There were over 3,000 blades of grass in the showcase.
'So many immortal grasses! Where did he get them?! Did he harvest them from the demon realm? That might be it! He must have a connection with the demon realm or he has gone deep into the realm! Wow.'
Wu Buyi smacked his chest, suppressing his desire and greed. He turned to the other refrigerators. Then, he discovered that there were items in the chest freezers.
'Ah, the Fenrir's innards! But wait… why are there so many?! How many Fenrirs did he kill?!'
Fenrir meat, blood, and bones attracted him the most, especially the liver. As Fenrir Liver was a universal ingredient of antidotes, its value surpassed other parts.
