Wu Buyi ignored the cabbages and immortal grass. He stared into the slide-door chest freezer, where Leo had stored the mutated liver. But when he was about to choose, the corner of his eyes noticed the movement on the display stand behind the glass windows.
The green eyes in the jars kept staring at him.
"…"
These eyes were something that Wu Buyi had never seen before. He suppressed his greed and asked Leo.
"Daoist Florida Man, what are these… living eyeballs?"
Leo followed Wu Buyi's gaze and found the eyeballs. He snickered.
"Oh, those eyeballs? They are the Prosthetic Eyes of Fenrir. It's my first time making them, so the quality is a bit poor. If you attach it to your forehead, it will become your third eye. It gives a boost to your visual range also."
Wu Buyi gulped. His interest was piqued, and he discarded the thought of picking Fenrir's Liver.
Prosthetic organs were more valuable than antidote ingredients. After all, many cultivators always risked their lives for cultivation resources, and the majority of experts didn't have complete 32 organs - Some lost their arms, legs, or eyes during combat with wild monster beasts.
They could be resold in an auction for a high price! Even an inferior-grade organ could be sold for a million spirit stones!
"I'll take the eyeball, please."
"Cool!" Leo giggled and picked an eyeball for him. The eyeball jumped up and down on Leo's glove in joy while it stared at the potential host.
Leo looked at Wu Buyi's bald head. He wondered if the third eye would fit him, "Want me to help you equip it?"
Wu Buyi shook his head. He came up with an excuse, "I'm planning to give this to my disciple. I don't need extra vision range, sir."
"Ah, shame," Leo was disappointed. He was looking forward to experimenting on a human.
Since Wu Buyi already picked an item, Leo closed the jars and tried to upsell the items.
"Are you interested in other things? I can sell them to you. As usual, I only accept lifespan."
Wu Buyi broke a sweat. He already spent 500 years, so he didn't want to waste more. Thus, he excused himself.
"That would be for another occasion, sir. Oh, I have something else to do at my sect. Please excuse me."
"Ah, okay. Take care of yourself."
Wu Buyi let out a sigh of relief. He turned around and was about to leave. But suddenly, he remembered something very important.
The alchemist had another purpose here. Not only he came here to deliver fruits and vegetables, but he also ran an errand. He turned around to ask Leo.
"Daoist Florida Man, would you like to join our Life Sword Sect as a guest elder? The next mystic realm expedition will begin in two weeks. We are hoping that you can join us on this trip."
"… Mystic realm expedition?"

chapters.title: Chapter 24 Florida Man Scammer Starts New Franchise, Hires Scammed Victim
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 24 : Florida Man Scammer Starts New Franchise, Hires Scammed Victim
"Mystic realm?"
Leo's expression was complicated. He understood that Wu Buyi wanted him to join his sect, but he had a major issue that he couldn't tell Wu Buyi - He needed to be in the shop domain. If he went outside, the auto-translation feature would have been disabled, and he wouldn't be able to communicate with the others.
'How the duck will I communicate with them if I go too far from my store? Learning Chinese? As if I can speak Chinese. What will I say when I'm in front of the crowd?'
Leo paused as his brain.exe malfunctioned and thought of a Chinese sentence. He didn't care if the spirits of the Chinese government might deduce his social credits afterward.
'Zaoshang Hao Zhongguo, Xianzai Wo You Bingqilin! Wo Hen Xihuan Bingqilin! Yes, I'm Zhong Xina, and I love ice cream... God dammit, brain! WTF were you thinking?!'
Leo closed his eyes, crossed his arms behind his back, and deeply frowned, suppressing his silly brain from wandering off the topic.
Seeing his complex expression, Wu Buyi gulped, afraid that he might have jumped the gun and said something wrong.
"A-Are you busy, Daoist Florida Man? You don't have to join us if you don't want to."
Leo slowly opened his eyes and shook his head. No matter what, he couldn't join other organizations if he would be forced to move out of his shop domain.
"Sorry. I have no intention of joining any organization at the moment."
Wu Buyi was slightly dejected that he failed to recruit Leo to Life Sword Sect. Still, he didn't give up persuading him. After all, the mystic realms were the only way to acquire rare ingredients or capture rare monster beasts. Edible animals, rare vegetables, and exotic fruit trees were abundant in there as long as the cultivators were skillful enough to collect them.
"What about the mystic realm, sir? Will you join us on this trip? We will reserve a seat for you. It's better than entering the mystic realm alone as a rogue cultivator since you might have to compete against the others for an available quota."
Leo felt like they were talking in a different language. He wanted to know what the mystic realm was, but Wu Buyi insisted on inviting him.
Still, for the sake of getting more customers to scam, Leo politely declined Wu Buyi.
"I'm truly sorry. I have another plan."
"... I see." Wu Buyi deeply sighed. He seemed sad.
Leo changed the topic to cut the silence, "By the way, could you explain what the mystic realms are? Explain to me like I'm six years old."
"Huh?"
Wu Buyi was surprised that Leo asked that question. He thought that Leo was already aware of the local culture and traditions.
'Does he not know about the mystic realm's custom or the Jianghu Alliance's rules? Oh, right. He must be testing me. Since he came from a higher realm, he might not know about our customs. That must be the reason!'
The alchemist coughed. He explained.
"The mystic realms are worlds in another dimension, sir. The Jianghu Alliance is managing them, and the Life Sword Sect is in charge of a portal. Every three months, every portal to the other world automatically opens. However, the destinations are always random, so we don't know any other detail about them until we get in there."
Wu Buyi paused and brought out a bamboo scroll. He opened the scroll, revealing the rough drawing of a map. Leo examined the map and discovered that it depicted an island.
The alchemist continued, "This is the map our sect drew in the last expedition. Our sect's portal connected to an island in the middle of an ocean, and it was full of danger. We ran into an army of a hundred thousand 3rd grade monster beasts. Oh, they are as strong as foundation establishment cultivators by the way. We managed to kill a thousand and scavenged some herbs from the island. Unfortunately, we only had seven days to finish our expedition, so we couldn't fully explore the place."
Leo nodded. On the map, there were only five landmarks. The rest of the map was blank.
"The next expedition is expected to be a new place. This time, we're planning to send our strongest elders and the most talented disciples there to gain some real combat experience. Since you've helped a lot, I wish to give you a spot as a token of gratitude. I bet you will experience fortuitous encounters in there and find many treasures."
Leo still couldn't understand why Wu Buyi wanted him along. However, from the tone and the information, Leo roughly guessed that the alchemist wanted him to tag along with his disciples and protected them.
"In short, you want me to babysit your disciples?"
"No, no, no! Argh... Yes, you're right."
Wu Buyi sweated profusely. Leo hit the mark, and the former couldn't come up with an excuse. Although embarrassed, Wu Buyi confessed.
"I'm ashamed. In the previous expedition, four of the ten disciples died because we lacked life-saving treasures and healing medicines. I notice that you're good in botany, so I thought that you could provide us with some healing medicines and herbs."
Wu Buyi sighed and lamented to himself. He turned around, giving up convincing Leo.
On the other hand, Leo had his own thoughts.
'I don't understand why they insist on going there and risk their lives. If I were them, I would have just sat back and scratched my belly button at home. What do they lack? Herbs? Pills? Oh, right. They're cultivators, so they lack cultivation resources? If I can solve that by selling them cultivation pills, will that help? Is that a win-win for me and the sect?'
Leo suddenly had an inspiration. He grinned and coughed.
"Ahem. So, you lack cultivation resources, right?"
Wu Buyi lowered his head, "Yes, sir."
"What do you usually get from the mystic realms?"
"Erm... rare mineral, ancient relics, treasures, elemental herbs, and corpses of ancient experts."I think you should take a look at
"Anything else?"
"If I have to name some, I have a few. You see, mystic realms are usually filled with elemental Qi that doesn't exist in the mainland, and our people need them to get stronger. Also, seniors like us usually collect some rare herbs and natural minerals since they can't be found on the mainland. For example, the immortal grass grew in some mystic realms..."
Wu Buyi looked at the showcase refrigerators in the store and pointed at them, planning to give an example. However, he stopped mid-sentence when he noticed something unusual.
Aside from the yin cabbages and immortal grass, the bananas in there didn't look like a regular ones. Upon getting a closer look, he sensed an aura of Earth Element Qi from the bananas!
They were all rare fruits that only grew in a desert mystic realm!
"..."
Wu Buyi was speechless. He looked at Leo, wanting an explanation of where he got those fruits from.
Leo ignored Wu Buyi's funny expression. He changed the subject by pointing at the eyeballs in the jars, "I get it. Say, mister. If you sell those, how much will you get in return?"
"..."
Wu Buyi gulped. There were 27 eyeballs in the jars, not including the one on his hand. Each could easily fetch a million spirit stones, which could be exchanged for rare treasures, artifacts, pills, and many more.
Once again, Wu Buyi told Leo the truth.
"If you sell one of these to an auction house, you might get about a million spirit stones."
Leo heard something interesting. He probed for more information.
"How much is a million spirit stones? What can they buy?"
"Hahaha. Sir, you must be joking. A million spirit stones are a lot even for me. With one million spirit stones, you can buy a small flying ship or a top-graded flying sword. If a first-rank foundation establishment stage cultivator absorbs all Qi from the spirit stones, he is guaranteed to advance to the nascent stage! That's two major stages, sir. This amount is life-changing."
Leo stroked his beard and widely grinned. In secret, he compared the value in his mind.
'So, a small flying ship is like a small car, and a top-graded flying sword is an expensive bike. If I compare it this way, it makes a lot of sense. Vehicles are always expensive since it saves time, and time is invaluable. Speaking of which, how much should I charge for the eyes...'
Leo glanced at the baskets of vegetables and fruits. He remembered that he hadn't started plowing farmland yet. Moreover, he needed more lifespan to upgrade his shops and tools. Then, he questioned himself if upgrading was necessary.
'To be honest, I can be self-sufficient and retire quietly without upgrading anything. I can slowly eat the mutated plants and veggies here. Then, I can live as long as I want to. But hey, what's the point of living in poverty for a billion years when I can upgrade my life quality with someone else's lifespan! I NEED TO FARM LIFESPAN AND SCAM MORE PEOPLE! CAPITALISM HO!'
Motivated, Leo proposed his idea to Wu Buyi.
"Instead of letting me join your expedition whatsoever, how about you give me the list of what you found in the past expeditions?"
Wu Buyi was confused about why Leo wanted the sensitive information. He was reluctant to disclose the intel as it affected their sect's security.
"Sir, could I ask why you need them for?"
"For some calculations. Oh, if you aren't comfortable, it's fine. You don't have to be too detailed. I just need to know some general information that every people know."
"..."
Again, Wu Buyi didn't want to expose the sect's secrets. He decided to tell Leo what everybody in the other sects and countries knew.
"We got some carcasses of monster beasts, elemental herbs, and some minerals to make weapons, sir."
"Are the carcasses as good as these things in the freezer?" Leo tapped the freezer chests, wondering if they were better than mutated wolves.
Wu Buyi shook his head, "No, sir. They're much inferior to this..."
"Okay. What about those veggies over there," Leo pointed at the bananas in the showcase fridges.
Again, Wu Buyi bitterly laughed, "We... can't compare ourselves to you, sir. Your precious herbs and materials are far superior to what we had."
"Good!"
Leo heard enough. He discovered an opportunity to do business.
"Instead of me working for your sect, how about you work for me instead? I need a PR and a coordinator to handle some trivial tasks."
"Huh?"
Wu Buyi was stunned for several seconds. He doubted himself if he heard it right.
Leo pushed on, "For example, I need someone to run errands and fetch me some regular vegetables and fruits from other cities once in a while. Also, I need someone to advertise my store that I'm willing to trade my rare materials that you can't usually find in the mystic realms. Of course, I only accept lifespan."
Leo widely grinned while Wu Buyi dropped his jaw.

chapters.title: Chapter 25 Florida Man’s General Store Runs A Promotion – Price Increases By 500%!
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 25 : Florida Man's General Store Runs a Promotion : Price Increases by 500%!
Leo explained his business scheme to Wu Buyi.
"You won't be doing it for free. I'll pay you commissions. For example, if an invited customer spends 100 years of lifespan in my store, I'll give you an item worth 10 years of lifespan as a commission reward! Easy, right?"
Wu Buyi was flabbergasted. He had never heard of this business scheme before. Even though he had traded with countless merchants and fellow cultivators, he never heard of the [Sale Commission] system.
Excited, Wu Buyi recited what he learned out loud, "S-So, if I introduce you to a customer, and that person spends 500 years of lifespan here, I get 50 years of lifespan as points to exchange for the items in the store? Is that correct?!"
"Of course!"
"I'M IN! COUNT ME IN!"
Wu Buyi readily accepted. After all, there was nothing to lose. Moreover, he knew hundreds of alchemists and experts in the Jianghu Alliance, and Wu Buyi was confident that those undying old coots would spend most of their lifespan for Leo's precious herbs and fruits.
The alchemist salivated, imagining what he could obtain for free. However, he was sober enough to figure out a problem : There was no currency or medium to tally Wu Buyi's commission rewards.
Having some doubts, Wu Buyi asked Leo, "But, fellow Daoist. How do we calculate my rewards? Do I have to claim it right away? Can we do something like my sect's contribution points so that I can trade my points with the reward material later?"
Leo had expected this. He checked the store system if he could bestow lifespan to others.
The answer was no : He could not give away his lifespan to other people directly.
However, there was a convenient way. As Leo examined the system menu, he noticed a locked feature.
[Unlock Store Employee Feature] : 100 Years of Lifespan
It cost 100 years to unlock, which Leo had no problem with that as he had eaten so many wolf steaks and grasses during the week.
DING
Leo unlocked it. Then, he tried to operate the system. He pressed on a new tab next to the store domain building menu.
<Please appoint your worker.>
A new window appeared. A resume template was shown on the screen. On the blank portrait, there was an [+] icon.
Leo pressed on it. Then, the system asked.
<Please choose the worker you wish to employ. The worker must be within your shop domain.>
'Oh?'
Leo immediately pressed the [+] icon. Then, a list of people in the domain appeared. As Wu Buyi was the only one here, there was only one name to choose.
After adding Wu Buyi to the menu, his general information was shown. The interesting part was at the bottom of the screen.
<Wage and Salary Settings>
<Please choose the payment method for the employee.>
There were four options : Monthly wage, Annual Salary, Commission-Based, and Contract-Based. In addition, Leo could adjust the wage or the commission rate.
However, one thing made Leo smile. He could pay Wu Buyi with lifespan instead of gold coins or other native currency. He immediately set the payment method to commission-based and set the fee to 10%.
DING
<Wu Buyi has been assigned as an employee.>
Only Leo could see the message. Wu Buyi was still oblivious to the changes.
After confirming the method, Leo confirmed their deal.
"We'll settle with a 10% commission. Also, you should know about the price of my items."
As soon as Leo mentioned the price tag, Wu Buyi immediately offered his advice.
"Sir, about the price of the items, can I offer my suggestion? You see, I believe you underprice them."
"Hmm?"
.
.
= At night =
Wu Buyi returned to the sect with a blank expression. His mind still recalled the deal he made with Leo while he looked at the living eyeball in his hand. He couldn't stop smiling.
He could tell that it was a parasite, judging how it secretly eat dead skin on his palm for food. He also looked at a banana in his left hand, which he got from Leo as the advanced payment for the advertisement.
"Instead of risking our lives in mystic realms, we can get cheap pills and alchemy ingredients from his store. This idea is... amazing and innovative!"
Wu Buyi was hyped. He rushed to his house to get a container for the golden sand banana and the eyeball. Then, he flew to a friend's abode - The pagoda of the grand elder Han Hao.I think you should take a look at
As soon as he entered Han Hao's room, he showed the grand elder the banana and the prosthetic eyeball.
"Han Hao. You see this?" Wu Buyi pointed at the banana, "Guess where I got it from?"
Han Hao slowly opened his eyes. He had been meditating and waiting for Wu Buyi's report regarding Leo for days. But instead of reporting, Wu Buyi seemed strangely excited.
"Is that an earth element fruit? Where did you get that from? The mystic realm hasn't opened yet." Han Hao frowned and gazed at the jumping eyeball in a bottle.
"From the usual place, Daoist Florida Man's store."
"We asked you to investigate the person, not to shop! What the hell, Buyi?"
When they chatted a few days ago, they agreed that Wu Buyi would visit the mysterious cultivator to investigate his motive. However, this guy flew around and visited so many cities during the days, which disappointed Han Hao.
Wu Buyi looked smug. He giggled, "You know what? I'm going to work part-time for Daoist Florida Man's store now. I'll send all the available alchemists to visit his store and buy his rare herbs. Tell the others for me that I won't be going to the mystic realm this season."
"WHAT?! BUT WHY?!" Han Hao was taken aback.
"Can't you tell what it is in the bottle, Han Hao?"
"..."
Han Hao deeply sighed and stared at the living eyeball. Although he wasn't an alchemist, he could identify it.
"Prosthetic organ. Yeah, this is a valuable treasure. If you sell this, you'll be rich. So, why are you showing me this? I know you're rich. What's the point?"
Wu Buyi paced around the room. He continued mumbling. At a glance, he seemed restless. In reality, he was drunk on dopamine and serotonin.
"We have a new project, Han Hao. Daoist Florida Man is planning to supply us with rare elemental fruits and herbs. Actually, if we have enough supply, we might no longer need to rely on the mystic realms anymore!"
"Hah?"
Han Hao's expression turned ugly, confused. As Wu Buyi was too excited, he didn't properly explain what he saw or did.
Wu Buyi also realized that he forgot to report everything in detail, he started by patting the bottle of eyeball.
"Ahem! Sorry, I got too excited," Wu Buyi took several deep breaths. He continued, "What if I tell you that Daoist Florida Man has about 20 eyeballs like this."
"W-WHAT?!"
Han Hao counted his fingers. One of them was enough to fetch one million spirit stones. With 20, it could drive the Jianghu Alliance insane or even trigger a war!
"That's not all, friend," Wu Buyi continued, "In his store, I saw thousands of immortal grasses, hundreds of yin cabbages, and hundreds of desert bananas! This doesn't include Fenrir's heart, liver, blood, and bones! Hell, he has so many ingredients that he made inferior grain pills using elemental herbs! My heart still aches whenever I think about it. Buy hey, one of those pills is still very useful for the disciples, especially the ones that have already awakened their elemental Qi. They don't need to risk their lives to cultivate elemental Qi in the mystic realms anymore. We can simply give the elemental pills to the promising disciples instead!"
Wu Buyi talked so fast that he stuttered.
Meanwhile, Han Hao managed to put the puzzle pieces together and understood the general idea. He instantly found the flaw of this scheme.
"What if that person suddenly runs out of rare herbs? What about the investment and prices of those pills? No sane man will supply everything for free. So, Buyi, what's the catch?"
Wu Buyi puffed his chest and widely smirked. He laughed at Han Hao.
"You fool. Daoist Florida Man is someone from a higher realm. I saw his spatial ring. It doesn't look like something that we're wearing. There must be some herbs or treasures that he hasn't shown us yet. Also, he doesn't need spirit stones or gold coins! He only needs our lifespan!"
"Lifespan? Oh, right." Han Hao narrowed his eyes. He had heard of this from his son, Han Meng.
At first, Han Hao believed that Han Meng was tricked. But after hearing Wu Buyi's testimony, his interest was piqued.
"How much does he need?"
Wu Buyi walked toward a shelf and picked up a blank paper. He took a brush and started writing.
.
Immortal Grass : 50 Years per blade
Golden Sand Banana : 50 Years per Piece
Yin Cabbage : 50 Years per Head
Elemental Grain Pill : 10 Years per pill
Prosthetic Eyeball of Fenrir : 500 Years per eye
.
Wu Buyi grinned. He came up with this price to make Leo's store more profitable. Moreover, with these price tags, his income would increase as well. Even though it would cost more to buy Leo's stuff, the appropriate value would make the store more attractive to old experts.
"How about it? Cheap, right?"
"..."

chapters.title: Chapter 26 Florida Man's Overpriced Rotten Tea Becomes Popular Among Elders
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 26 : Florida Man's Overpriced Rotten Tea Becomes Popular Among Elders
After Wu Buyi had left, Leo took notes of the suggested price and started labeling his items. He spent a few extra lifespans, purchasing label stickers from the shop system. He also bought a box of ball pens for writing.
When Leo finished writing the notes, he pondered.
'I doubt everybody can read modern numbers. It's still up to me to trade the lifespan anyway. I wish I had a bot or A.I. employee to run the store.'
Leo shifted his attention to the hundred bamboo baskets outside the store. He widely smiled when he noticed the varieties of veggies and fruits. Aside from the old stuff, there were new goodies - Tomatoes, carrots, lettuces, onions, watermelons, oranges, and lychees. There was even a basket of tea leaves.
In addition, the two sacks of seeds reminded Leo that he hadn't cleared enough land to make a vegetable garden or farmland yet.
Seeing so many fruits and veggies, Leo rubbed his hands. He was excited.
'New research materials! Also, I haven't eaten those for ages! I need to try the regular ones before I start making the mutated ones.'
Leo put on his hazmat suit. Then, he transferred the baskets and sacks of seeds to the storage house, aka the alchemy workshop building. He spent the entire night researching new materials and eating the samples.
...
DING
<You have discovered Invigorated Tea Leaf.>
<You have discovered Fiery Yang Tomato.>
<You have discovered Unicorn Horn Carrot.>
<You have discovered Weeping Onion.>
<You have discovered Bloodmelon.>
<You have discovered Tiger Killing Orange.>
<You have discovered Lychee of Drowning.>
DING
<Refining Rejuvenate Tea!>
.
.
BANG
BANG
At 5 AM, someone knocked on the front door.
Leo jolted up from his bed. As he went to bed at 3 AM, he was in a bad mood. Being half-asleep and wearing only a t-shirt and short pants, Leo opened the door without looking at the visitor first.
"Yeah, what!?"
"MEOW!"
In front of the cabin, Cat tried to squeeze in. However, its head was too big.
"You... you're a plant. You're supposed to act like plants even if you're carnivorous! Stop waking me up in the early morning!"
"MEOW-MEOW!"
"IT IS WEDNESDAY, MY DUDE!"
"MEEEEEEOOOOOOW!!"
Cat smacked the door frames, trying to get in no matter what.
Leo frowned and rubbed his eyes. He gently pushed the giant chomper's head out of the way and walked out of the store to see why Cat panicked.
Behind Cat, Wu Buyi and a dozen middle-aged cultivators in the same uniform stood there, gazing at Cat in curiosity. Everybody but one man stood behind the alchemist.
Han Hao, the grand elder, also tagged along with the team. He glared at the monster plant and the shop owner, scanning their cultivation strength. Then, he noticed Leo's strange aura.
'Oh? A soul formation rogue cultivator? So the rumor is true.'
Han Hao continued to observe Leo.
Meanwhile, Leo swiped the corners of his eyes and wiped his dirty fingers with the hem of his t-shirt. Then, he faced the visitors and inwardly complained.
'I guess I haven't set the opening hours yet. Oh, well. I haven't visited a proper store for ages. I forgot about that. I'll tell that guy to mind the time after this.'
As it would be rude and stupid to push the rare customers away, Leo put on a business smile and greeted everybody first.
"Welcome, dear guests. Are you here for a visit, or are you here to purchase my ware?"
Wu Buyi brightly smiled and cupped his fist, "As promised, I've brought you some customers. Let me introduce them to you. The guy with a similar face as mine is Han... I mean, Daoist Bald Swordsman!"
Han Hao's Daoist title was Bald Swordsman. He got this title not because he was bald, but because he rarely carried a scabbard when he was young. Thus, his mentor gave him that title to remind him not to carry unsheathed swords everywhere. However, as Han Hao got older, he became bald. Afterward, the Daoist title became a curse to him.
Secondly, the Daoist Title was similar to an alias or a business name that cultivators used to introduce themselves to strangers. Only elders could call their juniors or their friends by their real names.
Meanwhile, Han Hao didn't care about the title anymore. He took a deep breath and cupped his fist, showing Leo some respect and giving him face.
"Junior Bald Swordsman greets Hermit Florida Man. I heard that you're selling rare herbs for lifespan, so I wish to purchase some. As for the people behind me, they are deacons and elders of the Life Sword Sect. They also wish to see your goods."
Nothing made Leo happier than good-mannered customers. He slowly dragged Cat aside and gestured for them to enter the store.
"Very well. Please come in. Oh, don't mind the mental plant. He's harmless. Look at him. Whenever he sees strangers, he gets rowdy..."
While Leo was speaking, Cat got angry because Leo forcefully pulled him away from the store entrance. It flailed its branches and roots around.
WHACK
The long branches and roots hit the store's exterior walls and rooftop. However, it didn't budge.
Instead, Cat cried in pain. It felt like it kicked an iron plate.
"MEOW!!"
While in pain, Cat crawled to the roof and jumped off from the back, running toward the alchemy workshop and getting to another roof.
The crowd watched how the monster plant nimbly moved to the back of the store. The elders and deacons behind Wu Buyi let out a long sigh of relief as they managed to avoid an unnecessary fight. They followed Leo into the store.
Upon getting inside, they gawked at the showcase refrigerators.I think you should take a look at
"Immortal grass!"
"THOSE BANANAS!?"
"Y-Yin cabbages?"
While the deacons were amazed by the items, Han Hao was interested in the content in the freezer chests. He looked inside and found mutated wolf's organs. Without hesitation, he asked Leo.
"How much for all of these?"
Leo looked at the chests and shook his head, "Those are not for sale."
"Oh... a pity."
Han Hao deeply sighed. He turned his attention to the other freezer chests. However, most of them only stored wolf organs and meat.
But one of them had something else. In one of the chests, there were five clear glass bottles of silver liquid. Curious, Han Hao opened the chest and brought one chilling bottle out. Although the bottles were sealed, Han Hao instantly recognized the content due to the sparkling color and pieces of tea leaves inside.
'Rejuvenate Tea?!'
.
.
While Leo gazed at his customers, he inwardly grumbled, regretting that he didn't have enough time to make more pills or potions to sell. In addition, he didn't have enough refrigerators or showcases to display the new mutated fruits and vegetables. Most of the newly mutated fruits and veggies were still in the alchemy workshop.
Leo deeply sighed and looked at Han Hao, who was checking the new potions that Leo had made last night.
.
Alchemy Recipe : Rejuvenate Tea
Three Invigorated Tea Leaves
One Water Element Catalyst
One Liter of Freshwater
Water and Earth Essence
.
Inferior Rejuvenate Tea
- Restore and repair bone marrow.
- Decrease physical age by one year per liter.
- Increase metabolism.
: Very high chance to increase appetite.
.
This tea had no effect on cultivation. However, it served as a cosmetic for cultivators. Moreover, it was easy to make as the alchemy cauldron only required 10 minutes to make one liter of tea.
However, Leo had an issue. He wasn't confident that he was a good salesman. He looked at Wu Buyi, asking him to evaluate the price tag with his look.
Wu Buyi noticed Leo's gaze. He widely grinned and checked the freezer chest that Han Hao was gawking at. Then, he discovered the Rejuvenate Tea.
"Oh, my. What do we have here?" Wu Buyi merrily laughed and glanced at Leo. The latter shifted his eyes, gesturing to Wu Buyi to pitch the sale.
"Ahem!"
Wu Buyi coughed and took the hint. He smiled at Han Hao while he intentionally described the perks of this tea.
"Friend, do you know what the tea can do?"
Han Hao clicked his tongue, annoyed by Wu Buyi's smugness. Still, he played along, wondering what the alchemist was up to.
"What?"
"This high-classed tea is Rejuvenate Tea, made from the elusive invigorating tea leaves that can only be found in jungle-based mystic realms. Usually, 7th-grade tree monsters protect these tea plants and hide them behind their unique illusion arrays. If you eat the leaves raw, you will be energized for weeks. But if you turn them into tea, it can decrease your bone age!"
Han Hao snorted as he was aware. On the other hand, the group of following deacons and elders were amazed.
"R-Really?"
"Decreasing our bone age?"
Rushing to the freezer chest, the men gazed at the glass bottles in admiration. Then, they asked Leo, "H-How much are these, sir? We heard that you only accept lifespan. We wish to trade with you!"
Leo stroked his beard, but he glanced at Wu Buyi. Again, the salesman racked his brain and came up with a proper price on the spot.
Wu Buyi coughed and pretended to be the know-it-all guy.
"First off, we have to think about the average income of cultivators. Every golden core cultivator in the mainland usually works for a sect or an organization, and their annual income is 1,000 spirit stones. If we use this as a standard, 1,000 spirit stones equate to one year of lifespan. Now, let's look at the tea. As these tea leaves are difficult to come by and they taste like fine wine, they are naturally expensive. The Jianghu Alliance's best tavern usually charges 5,000 spirit stones per small cup. But for this one, they came in a bigger bottle. So, from my calculation, this bottle should be worth about 250,000 spirit stones at the minimum."
Wu Buyi widely grinned. He looked at Leo, asking for confirmation.
"My guess is 250 years of lifespan per bottle. Am I right?"
Leo maintained his pokerface, but his internal expression turned dark. He complained in his mind.
'I imagined 50 years. Damn, it was too cheap again?!'
Leo looked at Han Hao and his followers. He shook his head.
"I'm not that heartless. 200 years per bottle."
Wu Buyi coughed twice, gesturing to Leo that it was underpriced. However, Leo shook his head again.
"I have a dozen of these in the storeroom, and I'm selling them at a wholesale price so that you can go and resell them if you wish."
"..."
Wu Buyi widened his eyes for a moment as he found the idea amazing. He thought to himself.
'So, if Daoist Florida Man sells the items cheaper than the market price, he will naturally attract greedy merchants here to spend their spirit stones or lifespan for his goods. And when those merchants make a profit, they will come here again for more. This is ingenious!'
The alchemist inwardly gave Leo a thumbs up. Meanwhile, Leo had another idea.
'How much do you think the production cost is? Only one year of lifespan, you dum-dum! I only invested a year of my lifespan to get a luxurious-looking glass bottle, but the material cost and process costs are free! Why should I sell them at a market price? I have more margin, so I'm gonna cut the damn price to make my rivals out of business!'

chapters.title: Chapter 27 Local Martial Artists Mistake Florida Man As Alien Scientist
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 27 : Local Martial Artists Mistake Florida Man as Alien Scientist
After declaring the item price, Leo activated the store system, allowing the people here to see their remaining lifespan. Wu Buyi also got to see his remaining time once again.
On the other hand, Han Hao was taken aback when he saw the timer.
.
Name: Han Hao
Age: 107
Remaining Lifespan: 873 Years, 6 Months, 5 Days, 12 Hours, and 14 Minutes
.
Although Han Hao had a long life, he seemed unsatisfied. His physical appearance aged along with him, which made him worry about the future.
Han Hao inwardly grumbled.
'When I'm 300, I might become a Jiangshi at this rate. I guess I need a lot of this tea. But man, they're expensive. 200 years per bottle? How far can it really rejuvenate me?'
Living for a long time made Han Hao pessimistic. He doubted it was worth the investment. Instead of spending his limited currency, he turned his attention to other objects in the store. Then, Han Hao found the grain pills that Leo had made.
Han Hao's expression turned dark. He wondered if Leo was ignorant or possessed abundant resources to the point that he could waste precious herbs for something insignificant. Still, they offered mild elemental Qi, which could be useful for beginners or muscle-tempering stage disciples. He believed that they might be popular among the outer disciples.
Curious about Leo's background and skills, Han Hao asked, "Senior, sir. I have something to ask. Are you well-versed in alchemy?"
Leo calmly stroked his beard, "I might not be an expert in the field, but you know, I'm somewhat of an alchemist myself."
Wu Buyi giggled as it was impossible for rookie alchemists to make elemental pills even if they were inferior in quality. After all, they required the elemental essence of a specific type to make them.
For example, a fire-element pill required fire essence and fire catalyst materials, which only alchemists with fire Qi could concoct. Meanwhile, the merchandise by the windows contained all five element pills, which showed how strong his foundation truly was.
'Only idiots will think that those inferior pills were made by rookies. If it were me, I would have only made fire and wood grain pills, but not all five elements. Those pills aren't just for sale, you fool. It's a warning message to you lots that you shouldn't try anything stupid here. He can use all five elements, so his combat prowess is naturally superior to you, who can only use one or two elements. Ha!'
While Wu Buyi inwardly laughed at Han Hao, the corner of his eyes noticed a white grain pill, which was behind the window curtains. He raised his eyebrows, surprised that he didn't notice it during the last visit.
'Hmm? Isn't that?!'
Upon realizing what they were, Wu Buyi widened his eyes. Rushing to the showcase table, he collected the two bottles with a dozen white pills. He put them on the counter next to the meat showcase fridge.
Seeing how flustered Wu Buyi was, Han Han, Leo, and the dozen deacons looked at the former. They were curious why the alchemist put the bottles of white grain pills over there.
Wu Buyi coughed. Then, he cupped his fist and bowed to Leo.
"Daoist Florida Man, please forgive me for being rude. Please do not sell these items here."
Leo and Han Hao were surprised once again. They wondered what this alchemist was scheming. As Wu Buyi seemed suspicious, Han Hao frowned at him.
"Why? Are you planning to hoard those pills to yourself?"
"NO! OF COURSE NOT! I-I just wish to ask Daoist Florida Man if I can study these treasures!"
"Treasure?!"
Seeing how flustered Wu Buyi was, Han Hao's interest was piqued. He looked at the white grain pills for a moment and turned to Leo, who had been doing nothing but stroking his long white beard.
"Senior, sir. What are these?"
"Ah, that?" Leo remembered them as they always appeared together with poison grain pills. He deeply sighed, "Those are something I accidentally made. They're elixir grain pills that contain only 10 years' worth of five-element Qi. Well, since they're called elixir, they also increase the consumer's lifespan by 10 years. There's a side effect though. Since it was made when I was making grain pills, it will stuff you for 10 days."
"WHAT?!"
Han Hao was shocked not because of its effects but the small detail.
Five Elements
Normally, cultivation pills only provided one type of element Qi to consumers. Even grand master alchemists from all alchemy-related sects couldn't add more than two or three types of element Qi into one pill. However, this one contained five elements, which defied all logic.
Wu Buyi wryly smiled. He slapped his forehead several times, regretting that he didn't notice these pills earlier. Now, everybody knew about them, and he couldn't monopolize the pills anymore.
The alchemist sighed, "This is why I call it TREASURE! You see, Han Hao, no one can make any five-elemental pill, even those thousand-year-old trios!"
"WHAT?!" Han Hao's jaw dropped. He turned to Leo, wondering if he was a master alchemist.
Leo coughed, "They're still inferior quality, though. I still have a lot to learn."
Wu Buyi repeatedly shook his head. He was convinced that Leo was a master alchemist. However, he was bad at pricing his products, "Don't be humble, sir! These things belong in auction houses! We can't sell them here for small profits! They're even more valuable than those prosthetic eyeballs, sir!"
'Oh, really?' Leo was internally amused.I think you should take a look at
"To you, it might be nothing. But to us, they're the proof of a breakthrough! We, alchemists of this lower world, can learn a lot from them!"
"Ah, breakthrough. Technological breakthrough. So, cultivators of this world never had this before. That's understandable," Leo muttered and nodded in agreement.
Noticing Leo's demeanor and words, the crowd murmured, convinced that he came from a higher dimension.
Wu Buyi sweated profusely as he started to get nervous. He bowed 90 degrees, "Also, you must have invested so much time and resources just to make these. We can't just dishonor you!"
"..."
Leo had the urge to tell Wu Buyi that he could make one of those pills every hour by using free iron pine nuts in the backyard. However, he couldn't reveal his little secret.
Still, learning that he could turn those nuts into money, Leo was elated. He also got inspired by the tips. Leo figured that he might need the local currency to trade in the future as he might need to purchase something in town. He couldn't afford to rely on Wu Buyi to bring in vegetables, fruits, and seeds all the time.
"Fine. You handle that. I also need some local pocket money. The commission fee is 10% as usual."
Hearing that Leo gave him permission, Wu Buyi was overjoyed. He laughed and deeply bowed twice, "I'll make sure that they will fetch the highest price, sir! Oh, please tell me if you are making more pills. I wish to observe and learn from you."
Leo clicked his tongue, "No. I don't like being observed."
"Ah, what a shame."
Wu Buyi was disappointed. Still, he was glad that he got another good deal.
Meanwhile, the deacons started choosing the items that wanted. 10 deacons took a blade of immortal grass. One of the swordsman elders was half-blind, so he decided on the expensive eyeball. As for another elder, he took two bananas.
After picking the items and informing Leo of what they had chosen to buy, Leo deduced their lifespan. He got 1,100 years of lifespan from this trade. However, Wu Buyi got a 10% cut, so Leo only received 990 years in total.
Meanwhile, Wu Buyi noticed that his lifespan increased by 110 years. He widely grinned, believing that this job was worth the effort. Han Hao also discovered that Wu Buyi got the boon of this trade as he could see his friend's status.
"You sly bastard," complained Han Hao.
Wu Buyi snickered, "This is how you use your brain, brother."
The elders and deacons looked at Wu Buyi in envy. They secretly glanced at Leo, hoping that they could get the same treatment too.
Han Hao also had a similar idea. As he was bolder and had a higher status than the people here, he daringly proposed, "Senior, sir. I heard that you've accepted Wu Buyi as your servant. I wonder if we can help you, too."
Leo widely grinned as he already had a plan in his mind. Since Wu Buyi showed them the example of a modern customer reference program scheme, Leo offered them the same deal.
"It's just a small agreement. How about this? If you introduce customers to me like how he did, I'll give you 10% of the sale as a commission. Of course, you'll receive the payment after the transaction in lifespan as currency."
The customer reference program was one of the tricks that modern companies loved as they seduced customers into becoming their temporary salesmen. Some of the customers then turned into part-timers, reeling in their relatives and friends to purchase the goods from the companies while many used them to get some discounts.
Leo had no intention of allowing one person to monopolize the market. He wanted them to compete so that he could get more customers.
When Wu Buyi heard that Leo would give them the same treatment, he panicked.
"S-Sir! I thought this deal is for me."
Leo snorted, "I'm not planning to let someone monopolize the market. Mister, if you wish to succeed, you must compete with others in the same field and become the best. Trickeries and dishonesty are bad for business."
Han Hao burst into laughter as he loved Leo's attitude. On the other hand, Wu Buyi was dejected that he could no longer monopolize the perk.
"There you have it, you sly fox! The senior sees through you!" Han Hao mocked his friend.
Wu Buyi snorted. He bickered, "I doubt you know more top cultivators than I do! I'm going to the Jianghu Alliance now! Oh, Daoist Florida Man Sir, please excuse me. I'll go bring you more customers, now!"
Without waiting for Leo's response, Wu Buyi rushed out of the store with the bottles of elixir pills in his arms. The crowd could only watch how the alchemist shamelessly brought the items out without paying.
Leo deeply sighed. For the first time in this world, he experienced a semi-robbery case. Although he trusted that Wu Buyi would keep the promise, Leo still needed insurance. He turned to Han Hao.
"You said you are his friend, right?"
Han Hao nodded, "Yes. We are like sworn brothers."
"Then, can you be the guarantor for that man? Just in case that idiot runs away with my elixirs."
Han Hao dryly laughed. He was embarrassed because of Wu Buyi's shamelessness. Still, as an upright grand elder, Han Hao vouched for the alchemist. He pulled out a token from his pocket and gave it to Leo.
"This is my personal token. If you show this to anybody in the Magpie City or the Life Sword Sect, they will do everything you tell them to, even if you ask them that you wish to participate in the mystic realm expedition."
"Hoh?"
"Also..."
Han Hao's expression changed. He never forgot his purpose here.
"Senior Sir, I wish to ask you honestly. I heard that you are planning to supply our sect with elemental pills so that we won't need to rely on the mystic realm expedition. Is that true?"

chapters.title: Chapter 28 Florida Man Invests 1,000 Years In Simulation Game
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 28 : Florida Man Invests 1,000 Years in Simulation Game
Leo widely grinned. He had no idea what Han Hao was talking about.
'What supply? What sect? I just want to sell my things and earn more lifespans. Did Wu Buyi spread a silly rumor?'
He had enough of the misunderstandings and miscommunication, Leo directly asked Han Hao, "What supply?"
"Oh?" Han Hao was surprised. He thought that Leo had a deal with Wu Buyi, "Didn't you agree that you would supply us pills so that we wouldn't have to rely on the mystic realms?"
"Oh, that?" Leo remembered the deal. He stroked his smooth silky beard, "You mean, I will make more pills like the ones on that table, and you will send your disciples to purchase my pills, using their lifespan. Is that what you mean?"
Han Hao raised his brow. Once again, Wu Buyi didn't clarify this agreement, so he didn't know about the detail. It seemed that Wu Buyi only agreed that he would send his disciples here to buy rare pills from Leo.
"Well, it's the same. We hope that you will prioritize the Life Sword Sect's disciples over other customers."
Leo never hated customers. He readily accepted, "No problem. I'll save the pills for your disciples."
"Thank you for your cooperation. Also, I will take this."
Han Hao grabbed a bottle of rejuvenate tea. Leo quickly took 200 years of Han Hao's lifespan right away.
"One more thing," Han Hao coughed as he never forgot about his primary objective here. "Would you like to join us on this season's mystic realm expedition?"
Leo sighed and shook his head. He had his reason not to participate in the event, "I don't know if I should go. I don't think I have much to gain there."
"Are you sure? Nobody has captured any mystic realm yet. Someone of your status should be able to do it. Legends said that the person who managed to dominate a mystic realm would become a mystic realm overlord, and he would monopolize all the herbs, treasures, and artifacts in there."
Han Hao was not convinced that Leo was not interested. He baited the white-haired old man with glory and profits. However, he could not read Leo's mind.
Meanwhile, Leo inwardly grumbled.
'It's not like I don't want to go. I want to go out and play, too. I want to go on a field trip and socialize with REAL PEOPLE for once! But how am I going to enjoy a trip if I don't understand a goddamn word that comes out of your mouth, mister!? I don't speak Chinese, dammit! If I go there, I'll BINGQILIN all day, and my image will be ruined!'
Because of the dilemma, Leo insisted that he could not go. Otherwise, he would embarrass himself.
"I'm sorry. I don't think it's a good idea to give someone else's ticket to me. If someone works hard to earn his spot, you should give it to him, not an outsider."
Han Hao and the deacons' eyes glittered as they gazed at Leo in admiration. Everybody cupped their fists, "Such consideration and honor are rare these days. We're ashamed that we're blinded by greed. We shall give the seat to the disciple that earns it."
Leo was secretly relieved. For now, he avoided a troublesome scenario. He felt like he was an introvert, whose brothers never stopped inviting him to a nightclub.
Han Hao and others bid farewell. They left through the front door and flew back to their sect.
After everybody was sent off, Leo returned to his store. He closed the door and locked it.
"Finally, peace at last."
Sometimes, Leo was confused about his true desire. Half of him yearned for civilization and people, but the other half sought solitude. He wondered why.
Exhausted from the long night's work and the meeting, Leo collapsed on his bed and was fast asleep.
.
1 PM, Leo woke up, refreshed. He sat up and yawned. Then, he walked outside the storeroom, which he had chosen as his temporary bedroom.
Upon walking to the store, Leo flinched as the massive shadow blocked the sunlight from the front windows. In front of the showcase glass windows, Cat sat there, staring into the store with its new menacing eyes. It used its thorns to scratch the windows.
"MEOW!"
It was hungry.
"I know, I know! I also need to take a dump. Just give me a second."
"Meow <3"
After grabbing a towel, Leo paused to think. He felt like their relationship sounded weird. However, he shrugged and moved on to the outhouse, doing his business.
After dropping some chemical bombs in the outhouse near the sword sage boulder, Cat happily scooped the waste in the septic tank to its mouth in glee. It also ate the yin cabbages that Leo had thrown out.
Leo got used to Cat's nasty appetite. He returned to the alchemy workshop and glanced at the piles of lumbers nearby.
"I should start working on these soon. But for now, IT'S UPGRADE TIME!"
Leo opened his lifespan status to see how much he could spend.
<Your current lifespan: 2,043 Years, 11 months, 10 days, 23 hours.>
Because of the daily meat diet and the recent sales, Leo got a whooping two thousand years of lifespan to use. He snickered as he was proud of himself.
"Time for your upgrade, you damn pot! I'm tired of making inferior pills. I want something better!'
Leo opened the workshop's system menu.
.
Basic Alchemy Workshop Level 1
[Upgrade] : 1,000 Years of Lifespan
[Research New Ingredient]
[Pill Making]
.
Without hesitation, Leo pressed the upgrade button and paid 1,000 years of lifespan.I think you should take a look at
DING
<Upgrading Alchemy Workshop...>
<Please choose one of the traits you wish to upgrade.>
"Huh?"
Leo had expected that the workshop would be automatically upgraded. However, it prompted him with options.
[Add New Cauldron] (1/5)
[Add Automaton Alchemist] (0/5)
[Upgrade Cauldrons - Improve Product's Quality] (0/5)
[Upgrade Fireplaces - Increase Product's Quantity] (0/5)
Seeing the choices, Leo's expression turned ugly as he hated overly complicated systems and games. The first thing that came to his mind was the min-max strategy spreadsheets of simulation games in the ancient past.
'So, there's a total of 19 potential upgrades, but this won't be that simple. Is there a level cap for the workshop? What if it's capped at level 10 and I can only upgrade 9 more times? Will I have to choose 9 out of 19 upgrades? If I upgrade everything, will I ruin the potential of this system building? Then, can I build another workshop? What's the highest quality that pills can have? Also, how much does the fireplace yield after the upgrade?'
Leo had a hundred questions, but the system remained silent. He could only learn by experimenting.
'To be honest, I want another cauldron to increase productivity, but my guts say that quality is king. I'll pick the quality first and see how it goes.'
Playing it safe, Leo picked the third option. Nothing could go wrong with a quality upgrade.
DING
<Alchemy Workshop has been upgraded to Level 2.>
RUMBLE
The alchemy workshop's building changed. The old rotten wood walls were replaced with new planks, and the tiles on the ceiling gained red color. It didn't look like an abandoned house anymore.
The message didn't end there. The system message gave him an important hint.
<Please note : The max level of Alchemy Workshop is 10. Please choose your upgrade options wisely.>
'Bingo!'
Leo clicked his tongue. His guess was on point, and he was glad that he picked the quality choice first.
With this information, he had an upgrade plan in his mind.
'Max quality first. For efficiency build, I can put four extra points into quantity upgrade. But if I want to make it a factory for trivial pills, I can put one point to a new cauldron, two for automatons, and one for quantity. Then, I probably won't have to watch over that thing 24/7. Yeah, I should aim for the "Factory Build". Oh, right. Can I build more workshops? If I can, I can be creative with this. For example, I have crap tons of materials for grain pills. I can just spam low-quality pills and sell them for dirt cheap, so the quantity build might somewhat synergize with the automatons and multiple pots. Oh, there's the max efficient build for difficult pills, too. I can ignore everything else and put four extra points to quantity. For example...'
Before Leo realized it, he had fun strategizing for future upgrades. He fell into deep thought while he operated the shop domain system, wondering if he could purchase another workshop.
DING
The icon of the workshop was there. It was locked. However, there was a clue to the unlock condition.
<Required Humble General Store Level 3.>
"..."
At that moment, Leo realized - This might be a grind.
As Leo had 1,000 years of lifespan in stock, he rechecked the upgrade option to see how much he needed for the next level.
.
Basic Alchemy Workshop Level 2
Production Quality Level - (1/5)
[Upgrade] : 1,000 Years of Lifespan
[Research New Ingredient]
[Pill Making]
.
The price was still the same. Leo noticed a template. He was overjoyed.
'1,000 per level? This will be easy!'
Leo smirked and pressed the upgrade button again.
BZZ
The system gave a weird buzz. Then, it gave him a piece of bad news.
<Required Humble General Store Level 3.>
The refrigerator upgrades, the workshop upgrades, and the new workshop building all required store level 3. It started to get on Leo's nerves.
"Oh, god. It's the freaking mobile simulation game system! Am I building a war town or something? Who the hell came up with those unrealistic games?"
Leo facepalmed. It would take a long time before Leo could get his dreamt pill factory.

chapters.title: Chapter 29 Florida Man Turns National Artifact Into Chair
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 29 : Florida Man Turns National Artifact into Chair
DING
<Will you upgrade the Humble General Store to Level 3?>
<Upgrading requires 2,000 years of lifespan.>
Leo was depressed. Once again, he didn't have enough lifespan to upgrade the store. Still, he had many ways to procure the currency.
He looked at Cat, who was chilling on the roof as usual. So far, he had been feeding it yin cabbages and his dung.
.
Name: Cat
Age: 0 Year
Lifespan: 3,743 Years
.
This guy gained lifespan so fast. Sometimes, Leo wondered how it got so much lifespan even though he only fed it his poops and cabbages.
"Cat, come here!"
"Meow?"
The chomper looked at Leo. Unfortunately, it looked away and closed its eyes, taking a day nap like real cats.
"You... Hah."
Being ignored, Leo gave up on Cat. Part of him was guilty that he was about to resort to thievery on his own pet. Since he had nothing else to do, he tried creating a new batch of pills, testing the newly upgraded cauldron. He put in ingredients to make a quick item : Rejuvenate Tea.
.
[Alchemy Recipe : Rejuvenate Tea]
Three Invigorated Tea Leaves
One Water Element Catalyst
One Liter of Freshwater
Water and Earth Essence
.
All previous batches came out as inferior quality. This time, Leo hoped that it could be better.
DING
<Refining Rejuvenate Tear.>
<9 Minutes, 59 Seconds Remaining...>
Leo pursed his lips. He was a bit disappointed that the refining time didn't decrease after the upgrade.
Killing his time, Leo entered the alchemy workshop building and picked up a glittering pill from a bowl, hidden behind the array of vegetable baskets.
.
[Inferior Fenrir Dantian Pill]
Increase Poison Resistance
Grant Anti-Biotic Effects
Increase Poison and Metal Essence by 100 Years' Worth of Cultivation
Increase Lifespan by 100 Years.
Consume More than One a Day Grants Laxative Effects
.
This batch of pills came out from the 24-Hour wolf dantian pill recipe. They were the proper cultivation pills that Wu Buyi and Han Hao had been searching for. However, as it offered 100 years of lifespan per pill and it tasted like sweet chocolate, Leo chose not to sell them.
Leo gazed at the bowl of black chocolate pills. He thought of Han Hao's gang and wondered if he should sell them.
'This can probably fetch 500 years or so, but it's antibiotic! I can just keep it here as household meds and snacks!'
After eating the pill and increasing his lifespan to 1,143, Leo tidied the workshop storeroom for 10 minutes. Then, he walked out to check the newly made tea.
The liquid came out of the cauldron and floated over the cauldron, waiting for Leo to collect them. Spending one year of lifespan, Leo bought a 1-liter glass bottle. He pointed at the floating water mass, and the liquid automatically filled the container.
DING
<Workshop has refined one liter of Lesser Rejuvenate Tea.>
.
[Lesser Rejuvenate Tea]
Restore and repair bone marrow.
Decrease physical age by two years per liter.
Increase metabolism.
Very high chance to increase appetite.
.
Not much changed except the physical age reduction effect. Instead of one, it became two years.
Leo shrugged and put in another batch of ingredients to make another set of tea. Then, he started chugging the tea. Although they were called "TEA", they tasted like cold root beer.
"HAH! That hits the spot!"
Leo burped. Drinking a cold beverage during the hot afternoon was the best. After getting a mouthful of delicious drinks, Leo got in the mood of working. He turned his attention to the pile of lumber, which he had ignored.
'I should turn these into something. Also, I need farmland. I need to cut trees... no, pull some trees!'
Leo grabbed a long lumber with his fingers and lifted it. His other hand also grabbed another one and brought them toward the front yard of the store.
BOOM
Leo put them down so that the visitors could see them. He wondered if anyone would buy them.
As Leo couldn't tell, he looked at the smallest lumber in the backyard and karate-chopped it on the top part, cutting a small portion of the steel-like lumber. Then, he brought it to the alchemy workshop and waited there until the next batch of tea was finished.
DING
The second batch of tea was completed. Again, it came out as a lesser grade.
Leo grinned and filled the bottle in his hands, which he had downed all the content earlier. The one-liter glass bottle was filled to the brim once more.
"Infinite root beer of youth, HOH!"
In a good mood, Leo dumped the chunk of lumber into the cauldron and pressed the [Research] button.
.I think you should take a look at
[Iron Pine Wood]
This lumber is a precious ingredient for all artisans. It can be processed into fine furniture or refined into sacred wood.
[Alchemy Recipe : Sacred Wood]
One Iron Pine Lumber
Wood and Metal Essence
.
"What's sacred wood? Is that edible?"
For the first time, Leo discovered a recipe that didn't require any catalyst. Curious, he decided to chop more lumber with his bare hands.
After turning white lumber into arm-sized blocks of wood, Leo threw one of them into the pot and pressed the refine button. As usual, his spit was the element essence.
DING
<Refining Sacred Wood.>
<Time Remaining: 9 Minutes 58 Seconds...>
Fortunately, it didn't take long to refine the material. Leo smiled and returned to the lumber site, continuing his work.
10 minutes quickly passed by. Leo returned to see the result.
DING
<Alchemy Workshop has refined a Sacred Wood Block.>
The finished product slightly grew in mass. It was a one-cubic-meter cube-shaped wood as if it had been processed by a master carpenter.
.
[Sacred Wood Block]
Refined from Iron Pine Lumber. It contains a thick amount of Wood and Metal Essence, suitable to be crafted into a weapon.
.
Leo scratched his head and frowned as he was dissatisfied with the product. It seemed precious, but it was useless for him. Still, it would serve as a nice showcase stand for large items.
Because this item was useless, Leo ceased the project and left the pile of lumber in the front yard. He resumed making Rejuvenate Tea as he needed something to drink.
During his free time while waiting for the cauldron to finish refining tea, Leo began clearing new land, uprooting more iron pine trees, and cutting their branches to make more catalysts.
Leo lost count of how much he drank rejuvenate tea. When the sun set, he finished uprooting 20 trees and peeled their bark. However, he hadn't cleared enough land to make a new farm yet.
Looking at the uneven land, Leo could see some progress. Soon, he would get more room to build a new alchemy workshop and a new farm to grow crops.
.
.
After Han Hao returned to the sect, he called Han Meng over to the grand elder building. The disciplinary elder entered the building to report right away.
While sitting in his seat, Han Hao summarized the agreement to his son and gave him a new order.
"Tomorrow, you can start sending inner disciples to Daoist Florida Man's store. Make sure the disciples purchase his grain pills and other treasures. They will benefit a lot."
Han Meng had visited Leo before. He knew the nature of the store. However, he wondered if it was a good idea.
"Father, what if one or two of them causes trouble in that store? There are countless treasures there, and a few spoiled brats might have the wrong idea, especially that guy from the Ouyang Family."
"Ouyang?"
Han Hao deeply sighed. He thought of the troublesome inner disciple, who was the youngest son of a prestigious clan's elder. Although he was talented, he had an attitude issue.
That person was immature, arrogant, impulsive, and overbearing. Only when he was in front of Han Hao and the elders, he pretended to show some respect.
Thinking of the disciple and his influence, Han Hao bitterly smiled. He gave up on him.
"Sometimes, the best way to teach a person is to let them make mistakes."
Han Hao already predicted the future : Had Leo and the disciple met, the disciple would get himself into deep trouble.
Han Meng snickered, "That mistake is going to be very costly if he doesn't know his place."
"True. Well, if he dares to provoke a soul formation stage senior, he deserves it. He needs to understand his place and that not everybody in the world is below him. Sometimes, he will run into an unyielding individual and be reminded of the disparity between cultivation stages."
"Hahaha! You're right. If he lacks common sense, he doesn't deserve to become an immortal. But you know, father. The issue isn't Ouyang Ting but his relatives, his underlings, and his parents. Isn't Ouyang Long a representative of the Ouyang Clan in the Jianghu Alliance? He's also a soul formation stage cultivator. That guy is the real issue here."
Han Hao thought of the arrogant and domineering man in the Jianghu Alliance. He groaned and closed his eyes, not wanting to think about it anymore.
"Let's just pray that Ouyang Ting won't step out of the boundary. Rather, let's not introduce him to the store. Send the outer disciples there first. As for the inner disciples, let them in the dark for now."
"Ah, that should work."
.
Although the two elders came up with a countermeasure to avoid complications and issues, it was too late for them to react.
At 8 PM, at the inner district of the sect, where only the most talented inner disciples could enter, a young Asian teenager with a long sideburn, paled skin, thick eyebrows, and straight long black hair sat at the lone table in the inner disciple's courtyard, drinking the most expensive rejuvenate tea that he got from the Jianghu Alliance's merchants.
Ouyang Ting was a 9th-rank foundation establishment stage cultivator. He was two major stages weaker than Han Meng and Han Hao. This year, he was only 17 years old, one year older than Gao Yan.
In short, Ouyang Ting was one of the top dogs among his peers. He had also been monopolizing the mystic realm expedition quota due to his status and relationship with the prestigious Ouyang Clan.
Ouyang Ting stared at the five groveling outer disciples, who had once seen Leo. Behind them, a deacon slightly bowed and cupped his fist, showing respect to the teen.
"Young Master Ouyang, I've confirmed their testimonies. They're speaking the truth. There is a rogue cultivator in the Sword Saint Forest, and he owns countless treasures, including rejuvenate tea that you like."
Ouyang Ting downed the tea in his cup and slammed it on the marble table. He stopped glaring at the outer disciples.
"You all can go."
"T-Thank you, Young Master Ouyang!"
The group ran away from the courtyard as if their lives depended on it.
After the group had left, Ouyang Ting turned his attention to the deacon, "Tell me more about this rogue cultivator and his treasures."
"Yes. First of all, the rogue cultivator has over 20 prosthetic eyeballs, thousands of immortal grasses, Fenrir's organs, element pills, and..."
The deacon continued listing the items that he had seen in the store. He also brought out a blade of immortal grass that he had purchased from Leo.
Ouyang Ting continued to listen, but the flame of greed in his eyes was ignited.
He asked the deacon.
"How strong is the shop owner?"
"Soul Formation Stage, young master."
"Tsk!"
Ouyang Ting clicked his tongue as the man in question was as strong as his father. He alone couldn't possibly steal items or provoke the senior there. However, he knew a few tricks, which could make stronger foes succumb to his family's influence.
"Call over the Hound Squad."

chapters.title: Chapter 30 Cop Called On Florida Man For Practicing Long Throw Using Cat
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 30 – Cop Called on Florida Man for Practicing Long Throw Using Cat
The next day, Leo got up at 5 AM. After getting his coriander coffee and doing his morning routine, Leo resumed working on his farm project. He pulled more trees and debarked them, collecting the metal catalyst and nuts.
As Leo expanded the area, he came across more bushes, dead plants, and mutated grasses. As usual, Leo collected everything that he could mutate. He even got two more thorn whips to play.
Looking at the thorn whips, Leo wondered if they could sell. Unfortunately, Wu Buyi was not here to give him advice. Since he couldn't come up with the right price, he brought it to the cauldron to try researching it. He tossed one of the thorn whips into the pot.
DING
.
[Metal Thorn Whip]
Extracted from a dead iron thorn bush. It can be refined into Firmament Thorn Whip.
[Alchemy Recipe – Firmament Thorn Whip]
One Metal Thorn Whip
One Metal Element Catalyst
One Wood Element Catalyst
Metal Essence
.
Leo was surprised that the workshop could refine a weapon. He collected the thorn vines and hid them in the workshop's storehouse for the time being.
'Weapons are no good. It can fetch a lot of money or lifespan, but it's too dangerous. I played around with it, and it can easily destroy mutated trees. If it hits people, it's instant death.'
Despite the mental note, Leo put all the ingredients in the pot and refined it anyway.
DING
<Refining Firmament Thorn Whip…>
<Time Remaining: 59 Minutes, 59 Seconds…>
It didn't take long to completely refine a weapon, which surprised Leo.
'Oh, this is nice. I have another one extra. I'll refine this one, too.'
He resumed working on clearing the land while he watched over the timer.
Two hours later, Leo finished refining two whips. He wielded the two weapons and played with them for a while. However, he encountered an issue.
'Speaking of weapons, what's the point of having a weapon that can't even cut the trees in half when my bare hands can do so? If I need to fight, I can just punch my enemy in the face, no? Why the complications?'
Not satisfied with the whip's firepower, he tossed it to the side, planning to get rid of them later.
.
.
"Meow?"
While Leo was busy with the alchemy workshop, Cat had been watching him from the store's rooftop. It noticed the pair of thorn whips.
.
[Low-Graded Firmament Thorn Whip]
This low-graded artifact is made from Metal Thorn Whip. Applying metal or wood element Qi into it can boost its destructive power, capable of breaking any nascent soul cultivator's protective barrier.
.
Although Cat couldn't see the item's status or detail, it sensed that the thorns were similar to its branches and vines.
"Meow-Meow?"
Noticing that Leo seemed uninterested in the whips, Cat secretly grabbed them and ran deeper into the forest. It giggled and tried to mimic Leo's action by cracking the whips.
BOOM
BOOM
A hundred regular pine trees in front of Cat exploded upon impact, sending dust and small tree pieces everywhere in the air.
Cat widened its eyes and brightly smiled, having fun with them.
"Meow!"
BOOM
BOOM
It destroyed more trees, causing several local beasts to panic.
As soon as Cat noticed movements, it salivated. With its chubby roots, it sprinted like a spider charging at its prey.
"Nom-Nom Meow!"
It caught five rabbits and a weird-looking pheasant. As they were small, Cat ate them raw. After finishing its meal, it looked at the toys.
"Meow <3"
It loved them so much. It started thinking, wondering if it could use its branches and vines like the whips.
As soon as Cat thought about using its arms like whips, the two whip artifacts resonated with Cat's wood Qi.
The whips merged with its branches.
"MEOW?!"
Cat was shocked. However, it was also delighted. Cat cracked the newly merged arms around, getting used to the new sensation. It could feel the energy in the metal whips as if it was part of its branches.
"Meow <3"
It coiled the whip around its small trunk, protecting the most delicate part of its body. Then, it uncoiled the trunk, trying to get used to the movements and commands.
Starting to have fun, Cat returned to the shop's rooftop, leaving the carnage behind it. Without Leo noticing, it practiced moving the whips around without causing any damage to the store.
However, while practicing, Cat noticed a group of incoming visitors, who were traveling toward Leo's store. There were 11 humans. 10 were 2nd-stage cultivators while the middle-aged man was a 4th-stage, aka the golden core stage.I think you should take a look at
Confident in its abilities and the whips, Cat decided to approach them.
"Nom-Nom Meow?"
.
.
At noon, Leo took a short break after he finished making the second batch of grain pills of the day.
"WHAT THE HELL?!"
"MONSTER!"
Someone made a loud noise in front of the store. Leo stopped what he was doing and listened to the voices. He then heard the noises of people and Cat's meowing.
In the front yard, a sect's deacon and 10 outer disciples in white robes stood before the chomper plant, which was smiling at the crowd. The disciples pulled their weapons out, but the deacon stood in front of everybody, crossing his arms.
Meanwhile, Cat was as naughty as usual. Upon seeing a weak crowd, it extorted them for a toll fee by opening its mouth, asking to be fed.
"Nom-Nom Meow?"
"S-Senior. What is it saying?" Asked the disciple behind the deacon.
"I don't know. Ask the store owner."
"Nom-Nom Meow? Nom-Nom?"
"I-It points at its mouth. Maybe, it wants us to feed it? Senior, should we feed it?"
"I don't know. The last time I came here, Grand Elder Han gave it a precious carcass of a monster beast. I don't have a monster beast's corpse in my spatial ring."
"No-Nom, Meow?!"
"S-Senior. It looks angry."
"… It probably asks us if we have any food for it. I don't think we can feed it."
"NOM-NOM MEOW!?"
"S-Senior. I think it's angry."
"… I think it wants to eat us now."
"NO-NOM?! NOM-NOM MEOW?!"
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm "PREPARE TO FIGHT!"
Leo heard enough. He walked out of the shade and approached the visitors in front of the store.
A deacon, who visited Leo yesterday, seemed to have escorted a group of 10 disciples here. They were gawking at Cat in the front yard. As for Cat, it widely smiled at the guests while it salivated.
No matter how Leo looked at Cat, it was about to attack the group to eat them.
"Cat," Leo lightly poked the back of its head. However, for Cat, it was a smack to the back of the head.
"Meow?!"
Cat was stunned for a moment. However, when it realized that Leo hit it, Cat turned around and brightly smiled. Catching Leo off guard, it licked his face, spreading its bad breath and changing his scent.
Leo stood there, giving Cat a blank look. He got used to it.
After Cat had enough licking, Leo picked up a wet towel in a water bucket near the BBQ set and wiped his face. Then, he tossed the contaminated towel into the water bucket.
Seeing the contaminated water, Cat rushed toward the water bucket and slurped the content. It even sucked the towel's juice in glee.
Leo gently lifted the chomper plant and gently yeeted it toward the backyard, throwing the massive monster plant like it was a javelin.
"MYAAA!!"
Everybody could hear the plant's scream and a loud thud, which came from the back of the workshop.
After getting rid of the troublemaker, Leo greeted the visitors.
"Hello."
The ten outer disciples of the Life Sword Sect gazed at Leo in astonishment. When the deacon coughed, everybody bowed 90 degrees toward Leo.
"GREETINGS, SENIOR!"
"JUNIOR GREETS SENIOR!"
The deacon embarrassingly coughed. He cupped his fist and stated his purpose, "As promised, I've brought you more customers. Could you sell grain pills to these disciples?"
Leo brightly smiled. He opened the door and allowed them to go inside.
.
Ten minutes later, the first group of disciples each purchased two grain pills of their choice. Most of them picked the metal element grain pills as they synergized with their sword techniques. Only a couple of weirdoes picked earth pills.
After the transaction, Leo got a total of 180 years of lifespan as profit. The deacon got to live 20 years longer as he got his commission. Everybody bid farewell to Leo and left.
After the first group had left, the next group of disciples and a deacon arrived. They didn't interact with Cat this time.
The deacon was also a follower of Han Hao that had visited the store yesterday. Like the previous guy, he brought the disciples under his care here.
"Senior Florida Man, I've guided these talented disciples here to purchase your pills. Could you sell them to us?"
Leo shrugged and repeated the process. The disciples entered the store and admired the rare herbs and fruits in the showcases. However, each disciple only bought two metal element pills.
After the second group, the third, fourth, and fifth came in order. The deacons kept bringing a new team here.
Unfortunately, only seven groups of disciples visited the store. Leo managed to sell 140 pills, earning him 1,260 years of lifespan!
The hectic hour was over. Leo got room to breathe and restock the grain pills.
.
.
While Leo attended the guests and disciples, an inner disciple and 20 black-robed men watched them from afar. They stood on top of regular pine trees, observing Leo's actions.
They were Ouyang Ting and the Hound Squad of the Ouyang Clan.

chapters.title: Chapter 31 Local Criminals Scared As Florida Man Uses Cat As Weapon
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 31 – Local Criminals Scared as Florida Man Uses Cat as Weapon
Ouyang Ting wore black robes like his subordinates. He covered his face and his hair with bandannas. Although it was still daytime, the group camouflaged themselves under the shades and secretly observed Leo and the disciples.
"Soul Formation Cultivator," uttered the Hound Squad's leader.
Ouyang Ting looked at the captain of the assassin squad, "How is it, Duan Mu? Do you think you can kill him?"
Duan Mu, the captain of the Hound Squad, was a nascent soul cultivator and an array master. He had completed seven assassination missions involving soul formation cultivators, and he wasn't afraid of a rogue cultivator with no background.
"Very easy job. That man's foundation is terrible. I can't even feel his aura or the usual presence of a soul formation cultivator. I think he must have forcefully advanced through the ranks when he was young. Anyway, there won't be any issue."
Hearing the captain's evaluation, Ouyang Ting almost laughed. He was confident that he could steal all the treasures in the store and kill the Florida Man.
"Let's wait until night. There are too many eyes around here. Once the sun goes down, you can start setting up the trap array," ordered the young master.
"I agree."
The group continued to lurk in the shadow.
.
.
Meanwhile, Leo ate another dantian pill and rechecked his lifespan status. He believed he had enough to upgrade the store to level 3.
<Remaining Lifespan: 2,503 Years, 11 Months, 9 Days 23 Hours.>
There were more than enough. Leo upgraded the store to level 3 right away. While standing behind the store, he touched the wooden wall at the back of the store, and the system prompted him.
Leo didn't need to reread the message. He commanded it, "Upgrade to level 3."
DING
<Humble General Store has been upgraded to Level 3.>
<New Construction Options!>
RUMBLE
The store transformed again. The walls looked newer and glossy as if they had been sanded and coated with wax. The rusty hinges and the door frames changed into new metal door frames, and the creaking sound was no more.
Leo rushed inside the store to see the changes. Upon getting inside, he was shocked.
The store, which was supposed to be about 100 square meters, got slightly larger. The showcases and tables remained in the same position, but they stood in the middle of the store while the walls and windows were two meters away.
Confused, Leo exited through the front door and opened the shop domain menu to see the grid map. However, the shop still occupied the 10x10 grids, remaining unchanged. But when Leo entered the store, it was larger than before.
'Wow. The inside gets bigger, but the outside is still the same. What kind of sorcery is this?'
Leo rushed to the bedroom, aka the storeroom of the humble store building. He wondered if it got bigger as well.
Sure enough, it was larger. Instead of being a rat hole that could barely fit one person, it had the same size as a studio room in an apartment.
Looking at the new bedroom, Leo wondered if the store could feature a modern toilet. He left the bedroom and checked the other parts of the store.
Unfortunately, no toilet was in sight. It was still a store, not a house for a living person. Disappointed, Leo deeply sighed.
'Oh, boy. This feature is unreal. The store is obviously bigger, but no one can notice from the outside. Damn!'
After the upgrade, there was more work to do. Leo relocated the showcases, fridges, and furniture in the store.
After rearranging everything, Leo looked at the empty area at the center. He felt like it lacked something.
The store lacked aisle shelves.
Since Leo had a surplus of lifespan at the moment, he opened the shopping menu to get some modern shelves to display more items so that he wouldn't have to place the pill containers on a flat table.
DING
By spending only six years of lifespan, Leo got six supermarket aisle shelves. He placed them in the middle of the store so that it wouldn't look too empty. Then, he started arranging pill containers on them.
Leo started investing. He purchased 100 Tupperware boxes to store his merchandise instead of putting all of them in a bowl. Fortunately, the 100 containers only cost him 10 years, so he didn't lose out much. Then, he started storing newly made pills in the boxes.
