Leo grinned as he gazed at the potential best-seller items in the store.
.
[Low-Grade Metal Grain Pill]
Satisfy the hunger for 72 hours.
Improve blood circulation and internal organ efficiency by 20% for 72 hours.
Increase lifespan by three years.
Increase Metal Qi by three years' worth of cultivation.
.
After upgrading the alchemy workshop's quality, the new batches of metal element pills came out as low-grade instead of the lesser or inferior-graded ones. As for the other elements, they were fixed at a lesser grade.
Leo couldn't help it – The iron pine nuts were a metal-based ingredient, so it gave a better result when the pills came out as metal element items.
That was not all. As the pill's quality increased, the price had to be reasonable. Leo removed the previous price note on the pill containers and put a new label on them.
[Low-Grade Metal Element Grain Pill – 15 Years of Lifespan per Pill]
All lesser-grade pills remained at the same price. However, only the low-graded ones required 15 years instead of 10.
The metal grain pills were not the only main attraction here – Another type of dangerous pills could be sold like hot cakes. However, Leo kept these pills away as they weren't suitable to be shown in public.
.
[Lesser Elixir Grain Pill]
Satisfy the hunger for 48 hours.I think you should take a look at
Increase metabolism and regenerative abilities for 15 days.
Increase lifespan by 20 years.
Increase five elemental Qi by 20 years' worth of cultivation.
.
The lifespan perk was no joke. Moreover, the amount of Qi was twice the inferior-graded ones.
Leo looked at the white glossy pills and thought of Wu Buyi. He wondered how he would react to these elixir pills.
'He's gonna have a heart attack. Anyway, I should store these in my bedroom. If the news spread, I'll get myself in trouble.'
Leo carried the pill boxes with the elixir pills to the storeroom, hoping that nobody would notice their existence. After sorting the elixir pills out, Leo gathered the poison element pills to a separate corner of the shelf and put them in the same usual sealed Tupperware boxes.
Looking at them reminded Leo of Jin Yong, aka the guy with pimples that purchased all his poison pills. Leo wondered if he was still alive.
'I should reserve these for that poison freak. This shelf is reserved for poisonous substances and pills. Oh, speaking of categories, I should rearrange the shelves. I shouldn't put all six elements near each other.'
Leo continued to run in and out, juggling between the alchemy workshop and the store, sorting and filling the containers with more grain pills until night.
.
At 9 PM, Leo was mentally exhausted. He walked out of the store, planning to take a quick bath, take a leak, and hit the bed. As soon as Leo got out of the store, he stretched, taking a deep breath and enjoying the scent of the night air.
*SNORE*
Cat, who was usually on the roof, snored like an old man. It seemed to be in deep sleep after all the workouts - chasing around the visiting disciples and deacons all day.
Leo walked toward the earthen jar next to the store, where he had collected the fresh water from the stream river. However, it was empty as Cat drank them all. Moreover, there were signs of contamination as the earthen jar smelled like the chomper's bad breath.
'Dammit, Cat. You could have gotten the water from the stream, not my freaking water reserve! Now, I have to walk to the river and get some water.'
While complaining in his mind, Leo put on gloves and grabbed a water bucket. Then, he walked toward the stream.
But along the way, Leo saw a silhouette of a person behind a large mutated pine tree.
'A bear?'
BZZZ
In a forest, bugs and mosquitoes at night could be annoying. Although Leo's skin and bodily fluids were poisonous to all mammals, the insects flocked around him as if there were flies, attracted to the most delicious stool.
'Ah, damn bugs! Be gone!'
Leo lightly snorted. Unlucky mosquitoes that latched on his skin fell one after another. The fruit flies that hovered in front of Leo also died after being blown by Leo's breath.
After standing still and waiting for the bugs to die out for a minute, Leo resumed his journey to the river.
.
.
A member of the Hound Squad frowned when his eyes met Leo's. He was confident in his stealth abilities, and he didn't believe that Leo could see him in the darkest area of the forest.
The assassin slowly pulled out a knife, ready to attack Leo. However, he heard the voice transmission of his captain.
"The array is incomplete. Stand down."
The assassin moved back into the shadow and put away his weapon. When he was out of Leo's sight, he gulped and looked back at his young master, who was still observing the store from the top of a pine tree.
Ouyang Ting looked at the assassin and shook his head. The latter nodded and remained silent.
Meanwhile, their target simply stood there and stared at the assassin for a few seconds. Then, he continued carrying the water bucket toward the stream.
10 minutes later, Leo returned to the store with a bucket full of water. His face and his clothes were slightly wet, and he hung a white towel around his neck. Oddly, the old man still wore strange-looking gloves.
The assassin slightly peeked out of the shadow, observing Leo.
Suddenly, Leo put down the bucket of water and took off his gloves. He muttered, "Ah, seriously. I hate insects."
"!!!"
All assassins were frozen, including Duan Mu and Ouyang Ting. Their hearts skipped a beat as they noticed that Leo's killing intent soared.
'Does he know we're here?!'
Duan Mu started to get nervous. Although he believed that Leo was a weak soul formation cultivator, he didn't let his guard down. He kept placing talismans around the store building while avoiding Leo's line of sight.
.
.
Meanwhile, one of the assassins did his role, placing additional talismans at the north side of the store. He also sealed the back door, preventing Leo from escaping through this route.
After blockading the backdoor with a barrier talisman, the assassin took a break and looked at another building behind him. The alchemy workshop was still working, and the cauldron seemed to be brewing something.
The assassin caught the scent of an element pill. He drooled.
'Boss won't blame me if I steal some pills, right?'
The assassin approached the cauldron. He grabbed the lid and tried to open it. However, it didn't budge.
"Huh?"
He tried to pull the lid with both hands. Again, it didn't move.
Because of frustration, the assassin exerted more force, yet the fragile-looking metal lid stayed glued to the cauldron.
"This thing…!"
The assassin accidentally uttered a couple of words. He clicked his tongue and walked around the cauldron to see how he could open the lid.
He didn't notice that a certain plant woke up. It turned around and stared at him with red eyes that glowed in the dark.

chapters.title: Chapter 32 Robbers Killed By “Cat” While Attempting To Break Into Florida Man’s House
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 32 : Robbers Killed by "Cat" While Attempting to Break into Florida Man's House
"Why doesn't this move?!"
The assassin had enough. He kicked the cauldron, hoping to flip it over and get the precious medicines inside.
DONG
The cauldron didn't budge. Instead, the assassin's foot bones cracked because of the impact.
The man in black robes groaned and knelt, looking at his broken foot. He bit his lips to endure the pain. Because of the injury, the assassin failed to notice a creeping vine.
WHOOSH
A thorny vine suddenly coiled around the assassin's face. Then, it twisted his head.
CRACK
The assassin widened his eyes. Before his consciousness faded forever, he saw the shining eyes of a monster plant. It dragged the assassin to the roof and peeled his clothes. Then, it put him in its mouth.
.
.
CRUNCH
CRUNCH
The sound of breaking bones echoed in the silent forest. Leo frowned and looked at the store's ceiling, wondering what Cat was doing. While looking, Leo slapped a flying mosquito in front of him.
'There weren't many bugs and insects here before. Did that stupid plant attract bugs around here? He's getting louder than usual. Did he catch a beast around here or something?'
Leo was in a bad mood because of the bugs. He hung the towel on a hanger in front of the building and entered the store.
.
CLICK
After Leo had entered the store and locked the door, the assassins crept out of the bushes and shades. They surrounded the building and placed more talismans on the windows and the front door.
Unlike Leo, the group of assassins witnessed everything Cat had done. They saw how the monster caught one of their members and ate him alive.
Duan Mu came out from hiding. He spoke in a hushed voice.
"Kill the plant monster first. Treat it as a golden core cultivator."
Five assassins unsheathed their blades and leaped on the roof. They imbued their element Qi into their weapons and hacked the giant head of the chomper plant.
CLANK
CLANK
The metal blades broke in half upon impact!
"What the?!"
"HOW?!"
The five assassins were shocked. They had hunted countless 3rd-stage monster beasts, but they always cut through them like tofu. However, this guy's skin was harder than their steel blades.
"Meow?"
While chewing the previous victim, Cat turned around. Then, it found five more intruders.
"Nom-Nom Meow?"
The assassins pulled out backup daggers from their waists and stabbed Cat's face in unison.
CLANK
CLANK
Once again, Cat's skin was like an impenetrable fortress. The daggers' tips bent upon impact.
Cat's eyes were still bright red. It glared at the assailants and moved its arm, lashing its newest weapons.
WHIP
WHIP
The thorn whips lashed the five assassins' bodies. Their torsos were broken in half!
"AAAHHH!!"
Death throes of the assassins alarmed everybody in the area. Duan Mu looked up and found that the five-man team was instantly wiped out.
That plant was not a 3rd stage monster! Its strength exceeded its usual Qi.
'Not good!'
Their cover was blown. It was a matter of time before the Florida Man came out to fight them. Still, Duan Mu and his men completed their first objective.
"ACTIVATE THE QI SEALING ARRAY!"
Duan Mu bellowed, and the remaining 13 assassins surrounded the building. They formed a hand incantation and injected their Qi into the talismans in their hands.
RUMBLE
All talismans lit up, creating a red dome, covering the entire building. Even Cat got trapped inside the array formation.
All assassins sneered at the chomper monster. They had done this countless times, and no victim had survived this array. Duan Mu grinned while Ouyang Ting let out a long sigh of relief.
Ignoring the casualty on his side, Duan Mu informed his lord.
"Young master, it's over. That monster and the expert inside have already lost their abilities to use Qi. Once he comes out, we can use ranged weapons to kill him. He will be as weak as a commoner as long as they stay inside the dome."
Ouyang Ting was interested in this technique. He wished to learn it.
"How does this work? Is it because of the talismans?"
Duan Mu laughed, "That's right, young master. Our clan has a deep connection with the Situ Clan. They have been supplying us with these talismans in exchange for our services. We get rid of their competitors, and they reward us with their best talismans."
"Hahaha. Is that right? I heard the Situ Clan is the best when it comes to alchemy and talisman scribers. One of their clan members is the master of the Cauldron Gnosis Sect, one of the three powerhouse alchemy sects on the mainland! We ride on their tailcoat, and we can expect great things."
"Young master is knowledgeable. I'm envious."
While Ouyang Ting bragged and Duan Mu bootlicked his boss, changes occurred to the monster on the rooftop. It suddenly leaped and charged at the assassins on the ground, opening its mouth and trying to bite the nearest victims.
Ouyang Ting frowned and stood behind Duan Mu for safety. However, the assassin captain laughed again.
"Don't worry, young master. No monster and cultivator can escape the array! They will get stuck in there while we're free to attack them."
BOOM
Cat's head smacked with the array barrier. It fell to the ground. Then, it looked at the red dome and the semi-transparent energy wall in confusion and frustration.
"Meow?!"
Cat innocently tried to bite the assassins on the other side of the energy dome. However, he couldn't get through.
"Mya?"
Cat was annoyed. It lashed its whips at the wall, trying to destroy it.
BOOM
BOOM
The array dome shook, and small cracks appeared. Again, Cat was confused.
"Meow..."
Duan Mu and the assassins sneered at Cat's attempt while they leisurely brought out small crossbows and poison darts to shoot at it.
"The array can repair itself. No matter how much it tries, its puny attacks can't get through. This array can even fend off any nascent soul cultivator's attacks!"
Cat tilted its head as it heard the comment. It climbed back to the rooftop and started rotating its whips. After getting a good momentum, it lashed the barrier again.
BOOMI think you should take a look at
BOOM
The two whips hit the same spot.
CRACK
This time, half of the barrier was cracked like a glass wall on the verge of falling apart.
"Huh!?"
Duan Mu and the assassins frowned. Nobody had cracked their array barrier to this extent, but this weak-looking monster almost shattered it in a few hits.
Not letting their guard down anymore, the assassins pointed their crossbows at Cat and imbued their element Qi into their bolts. Then, they unleashed a barrage.
The arrows passed through the array barrier as it was designed to block the insider's attacks while allowing the people outside to attack at will.
DING
All bolts bounced off Cat's skin, causing sharp noises as if they were needles hitting a thick steel plate. Instead of harming it, Cat was enraged.
It lashed the whips at the barrier again. This time, it didn't stop hitting the same area once or twice. Cat kept hitting it and roared.
"MYAAAA!!"
BOOM
BOOM
BOOM
The array was fully cracked!
Duan Mu bellowed, "Strengthens the array! I'll attack that monster myself!"
After sending his order, Duan Mu unsheathed his long sword. He gathered metal essence in his sword, strengthening its durability, hardness, and sharpness. A semi-transparent soul of his came out from his body and overlapped with his real body. Then, he jumped to the sky and slashed down, shooting a long-range attack from the sky.
A crescent energy sword wave descent upon Cat.
Cat looked up. Sensing the danger, it jumped off the roof.
SWUA!
One of its roots was slightly cut and caused bleeding. Cat tumbled and fell to the backyard of the shop. Then, it noticed its small wound.
BOOM
The energy blade hit the building directly. However, it caused no damage to it.
"Hmm?!"
Strangely, the fragile-looking wood building was intact after being hit by his sword energy. Duan Mu always managed to cut through trees and steel plates with ease, but it didn't work here.
Duan Mu sensed something amiss. His instinct cried that he was in danger.
"MYAAAOW!!"
The monster suddenly yowled like a cat in pain or distress. Its eyes were moist, and it was calling for its parent for help.
The assassins repositioned themselves and surrounded Cat. The crossbowmen pointed their weapons at the plant monster again, ready to finish it off.
The back door of the shop suddenly blasted open.
.
.
"MYAAAA!!"
"Huh?"
The commotion got louder and louder while Leo was in his bed, trying to get some sleep. He sat up and complained, "What the hell, Cat? Are you fighting something weird in the woods again?"
Leo got out of bed. Then, he placed his ear on the wall, trying to listen outside.
BOOM
BOOM
Something loud was going on, and Leo didn't understand why. He got out of the bedroom and opened the front curtain to look outside.
There was nothing there.
BOOM
BOOM
The sound came from the east side of the store, where there was no window. Leo clicked his tongue as he didn't want to go out and get swarmed by bugs and night mosquitoes again.
As Leo was about to go back to sleep, he received a rare message from the shop domain system.
DING
<One of your buildings is under attack!>
"..."
Leo stopped on his track. He turned his head to look at the message.
"Attacked? By whom?"
He didn't remember provoking anybody except the wolves. It confused him why he would be attacked out of the blue. But then, as a former American, his instinct remembered the usual burglary and robbery in the neighborhood.
Leo scratched his head in frustration.
"I thought Asians are educated and humble. I guess not everybody follows the stereotype."
Leo cracked his fists and walked toward the back door. But then, he suddenly had a weird inspiration.
"Say, system. I know that I can't steal my customer's lifespan without their consent, but is there a way to punish those intruders for raiding my store? How about a fine? Of course, they have to pay with their lifespan."
Normally, the system never replied to Leo's questions. However, this time, it gave him support.
<Self-Defense is an exception. You may extract lifespan from criminals if they attempt to harm you, the store, or the employees in the domain.>
"Good to know."
Getting the confirmation, Leo felt a lot better. He tried to open the back door.
Click-Click
The knob didn't turn as if it was stuck by something even though it was unlocked. Leo frowned and exerted more force.
CRACK
He exerted too much force. The doorknob was broken.
"Tsk."
Without a choice, Leo kicked the door, sending it flying outside. Then, he heard a strange shattering sound of glasses upon impact.
The door was blasted open, and a layer of red wall collapsed.
"Finally."
Leo deeply sighed and looked at the broken door. He scratched his head, thinking about how he would repair the door after this. While looking at the door, he noticed that Cat was nearby. He gazed at the plant.
It was bleeding. Green blood was dripping from one of Cat's major roots. Moreover, the plant was yowling.
"..."
Leo silently stared at the injured plant. Then, he shifted his eyes, glancing at the assailants outside. Finally, he discovered the assailants.
"You there... Which one of you hurt my Cat?" Leo stared at the nearest assassin.
The black-robed men readied their weapons, preparing to shoot crossbow bolts at Leo.

chapters.title: Chapter 33 Armed Robbers Slaughtered In Florida Man’s Store. The Store Owner Pleads “Please Raid My Store Again! I Love It!”
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 33 : Armed Robbers Slaughtered in Florida Man's Store. The Store Owner Pleads "Please Raid My Store Again! I Love It!"
"Something's wrong. Why doesn't his Qi disperse? He should have lost all supporting inner energy. No matter how strong he is, it's impossible to move in there!"
Duan Mu had a bad feeling about Leo. His aura condition didn't change after being hit by the Qi Sealing Array. All soul formation cultivators in the past succumbed to this array. As cultivators relied on Qi as an energy source and ate grain pills instead of hard food, they always ran out of energy after the Qi had been dispersed.
Yet, Leo was still looking healthy!
Seeing how Leo broke the talisman's seals and came out, Duan Mu ordered his men.
"He must be pretending! There's no way that he can move around for long. All units! Keep your distance. Wait for him to run out of energy and become crippled because of starvation and energy depletion."
The assassins nodded and backed away from the array dome. They were also confident that the array could trap Leo.
.
.
Meanwhile, Leo looked around, scanning the perimeter and counting the enemies. A total of 14 people were surrounding this place. However, as Leo looked further, he found another silhouette of another ninja behind a pine tree.
'14 robbers. Wow, a large group.'
Leo didn't wait for them to answer his previous question. He deeply exhaled and strode toward his pet.
The assassins snorted. One of them shot a bolt at Leo's face, aiming at his right eye. After applying his Qi, the bolt flew at the speed of a modern rifle's bullet!
The bolt directly hit Leo's pupil. However, it failed to penetrate through the soft-looking eyeball. Instead, the bolt broke!
"What the hell?!" The assassin was taken aback.
Leo ignored the crowd. He brought out a low-grade elixir grain pill from his pocket. Then, he fed it to Cat and patted its head.
"I'm sorry. I wish I had a bigger house to keep you indoors."
"Meow..."
Cat nudged at Leo's chest while crying. Leo wiped its tear and cleaned its dirty dusty face.
"You also need to take a bath and brush your teeth. You stink."
"Meow!"
Cat sobbed, but it kept nudging its head against Leo's chest. The latter stroked its cheek twice and turned his head, looking at the uninvited guests.
WHOOSH
WHOOSH
WHOOSH
Countless arrows hit Leo's face, arms, legs, and body. However, none of them managed to pierce through his skin.
"Dear customers, you shouldn't throw peas at people," Leo complained. His expression turned dark.
Duan Mu fired a red sword wave energy at Leo from outside the barrier, aiming at his neck.
Seeing the incoming energy sword, Leo raised his hand and received the energy wave with his palm.
BOOM!
The energy sword exploded like a crimson firework. The flame blast kicked the dust and dirt flying, causing black smoke everywhere. The smoke was contained in the dome, blocking the visual from the outside.
One of the assassins mocked Leo, "Soul Formation Cultivator? More like a dead soul. No one survived Lord Duan's Fire Crescent Slash! Once hit, you'll be burned to death!"
The smoke continued to expand, but it was still trapped inside the red dome. However, everybody believed that Leo was done. The other assassins also smirked. They waited for the dust and flame to subside so that they could finish off the cultivator.
WHOOSH
Suddenly, a fist came out of the smoke and flame. It punched through the red dome.
Sounds of shattering glasses echoed, and the red dome collapsed like a broken dome of glasses!
CLANK
The talisman array of Duan Mu was broken. The red dome fragments vanished, and the smoke was blown outside, revealing the silhouette of Leo.
"WHAT?!"
The assassins took several steps back in shock. Even Duan Mu couldn't believe his eyes.
Leo pulled back his punch and walked out of the smoke. He exhaled the dust from his lungs. His green pupils glowed in the dark, staring at the people at the back of his store.
The assassins were speechless as Leo's aura was still the same as ever. It didn't seem like the array had affected him at all.
Duan Mu gritted his teeth. He sent seven more red energy sword slashes at Leo.
The Florida Man positioned himself in front of Cat. Using only his left arm, he swatted and deflected the energy waves back to the caster as if they were Ping-Pong balls.
"!!!"
Duan Mu dodged all the reflected sword waves that came toward him. He descended and landed on the roof of the alchemy workshop.
However, when Duan Mu looked at Leo again, the latter had already vanished from the spot.
Suddenly, the warm hand of Leo seized the back of Duan Mu's nape!
"WHAT?! HOW?!"
Duan Mu couldn't even see Leo's movement. By the time he sensed Leo, he was already caught!
Leo leaned closer to the assassin captain. His dark expression was the same as the characters in Jojo's Bizarre Adventure Series.
"Dear customer. The store is closed at night."
"!!!"
Duan Mu struggled, trying to break out of Leo's grip. However, his fingers squeezed tight, causing him to get dizzy as the hand pressed on his sensitive nerves. Moreover, the skin around his neck gradually melted, and he could feel the burning pain.
Leo continued whispering, "Also, you will be fined for harming the store's mascot and forcing me to destroy a door. The fine will be all your lifespan."
.
Name: Duan Mu
Age: 64
Remaining Lifespan: 596 Years, 4 Months, 18 Hours, 8 Minutes
.
Duan Mu could see the status window of his lifespan for the first time and last time. The number rapidly decreased. Within seconds, it was down to zero!
All 596 years of Duan Mu's lifespan vanished and added into Leo's life force's pool.
"NOOOO!!"
Duan Mu's body was instantly dried and withered. The assassin's captain's body withered and dissipated into ash.
Leo's green pupils shifted, turning his attention to the other black-robed men.
"RETREAT!!"
The men shouted and kicked the ground, flying away from the store.
Leo deeply exhaled and activated the shop domain system with a thought.
'System! Collect everything!'
DINGI think you should take a look at
<Affirmative. Collecting assailants' lifespan as compensation for damaged properties...>
<You have collected 554 Years, 6 Months, 3 Days, and 7 Minutes.>
<You have collected 541 Years, 8 Months, 10 Days, and 16 Minutes.>
<You have collected...>
<You have collected...>
<You have collected...>
Series of 13 messages reported that Leo had stolen all lifespan of the raiders. Everything was added to Leo's lifespan pool just like when he traded with the other guests.
A moment later, he heard the death throes of the escapees.
"AAAAAHHHH!!"
"IMPOSSIBLE!!"
"NOOOOO!!"
The running assassins saw their status, witnessing how their lifespan was reduced to zero. They turned into ash while they cried in desperation, leaving behind only their clothes and belongings.
CHING-CHING-CHING
Leo heard the casino-jackpot-like sound from the domain system. He rechecked his lifespan status.
<Your remaining lifespan: 8,128 Years, 6 Months, 7 Days.>
Leo almost had a heart attack. These guys were rich!
'Oh, boy. Now, I wish more idiots attacked my store. Actually, please raid my store again! I love it!'
Killing robbers were so profitable that Leo had the urge to join the dark side. Leo chortled like Mr. Smith from The Matrix.
"H-Hiek!!"
While Leo was laughing, someone let out a weird noise. Leo stopped laughing and looked at the source of the voice. Surprisingly, one of the black-robbed men survived the system's power.
Leo frowned. He thought he had ordered the system to kill everybody. However, this guy was still around.
"System, how is this guy still alive?"
DING
<You cannot steal the lifespan of innocent bystanders, guests, or customers.>
"..."
It appeared that one of the black-robed guys didn't participate in the robbery. He might be an accomplice, but he never harmed the store or Cat.
Leo was annoyed. He snorted and stomped toward the last survivor.
"NOO!! LEAVE ME ALONE!"
The guy turned tail and ran. Leo kicked the ground and vanished, leaving behind a deep footprint.
.
.
Ouyang Ting was terrified. He thought that the Hound Squad of his clan was an invincible assassin unit that could easily kill any rogue cultivator.
The plan backfired. All assassins and Duan Mu were killed.
He ran away from the store as fast as he could. He didn't care if he would expose his back to the store owner.
POW
Suddenly, Ouyang Ting felt an impact coming from the back of his head. He tumbled and rolled on the ground for 10 meters before his head hit a tree trunk. He got dizzy and his vision blurred.
While his world was spinning, he heard a voice.
"Whoops. I forgot to wear gloves. Oh, well, it was unintentional. I was planning to capture you, but I end up touching you directly. I hope your mutation goes well."
Ouyang Ting didn't understand a thing. He tried to get up, but the concussion and the spinning vision prevented him from maintaining his balance or recovering his vision. He fell to the ground again and lay on his stomach.
A sharp pain suddenly came from the back of his head. He felt like his skin or his blood burst out from the inside. The nauseous feeling made him vomit all wines and water that he had drunk, but all the fluid dirtied his face.
The pain spread to his stomach. He felt like all his bones were shattered, including his spinal cord. His stomach exploded from the inside, and his intestines moved as if he had diarrhea.
After the ultimate pain had hit his bones, it transferred to all nerves in Ouyang Ting''s arms, legs, and manhood. He opened his mouth to scream, but his vocal cord failed to produce any noise.
POP
His lung ruptured. He was no longer capable of holding his breath as his lungs were the same as leaking balloons.
Because of the sudden suffocation, Ouyang Ting forgot about the pain. His tongue stuck out as he tried to breathe, but he couldn't suck in the air. In desperation, he moved his arms and hands to touch his throat.
*WIGGLE*
The arms were no longer human-like. They become a mass of grotesque muscle meat, which rapidly consumed his Qi to grow larger non-stop.
Although Ouyang Ting was a strong cultivator, without air, he lasted for 15 minutes before he stopped moving.
That was the most painful and torturous lesson that he learned : First, a weak-looking tiger is still a tiger, so one must never underestimate his opponent. Second, never pick a fight with a stronger foe with a higher cultivation base. And lastly, one must prepare for the consequences of his actions.
It was too late for Ouyang Ting to apply what he had learned in the future. He paid the price of these lessons with his life.
.
.
"The dildo of consequences rarely arrives lubed, boy."
Looking at the corpse of Ouyang Ting, Leo grumbled. He didn't feel bad for accidentally killing a robber, but he was disappointed that he didn't get to steal Ouyang Ting's lifespan.
"Oh, well. I could have stolen your lifespan had I worn gloves, but you end up dying because you touched me. Oh, wait. I touched you. Oh, wait. That sounds terribly wrong for many reasons!"
Leo scratched his head while he dragged the swelled and mutated corpse of Ouyang Ting back to the store. He hummed, wondering if he could do a little research on the mutated body's blood and organs to get new alchemy materials.
Upon arriving at the store, Cat wagged its breaches as if it was a dog.
"Meow <3"
Leo laughed, "Yeah, I love you, too. Don't eat this MF yet."
"Meou."
Cat pouted. It climbed back to the roof and picked up the corpses of the five assassins that it had killed. Then, it busied itself, peeling the clothes and eating the human bananas.
But a second later, it spat them out. Then, it complained.
"MEOW!"
Leo looked up and remembered something. He warned Cat.
"By the way, damn cat! You just ate a grain pill. Your stomach will be full for 48 hours. Don't eat anything, or you'll puke!"
"MA-MEOW?!"
"Don't NANI me! I healed your wound!"
Cat jumped around and threw a fit. Fortunately, the store was sturdy enough to withstand Cat's weight.
Leo laughed at his pet and shook his head. He proceeded to drag Ouyang Ting's corpse to the backyard.

chapters.title: Chapter 34 Dead Robber’s Father Blames Florida Man For Retaliating Against Robbers
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 34 – Dead Robber's Father Blames Florida Man for Retaliating Against Robbers
= Life Sword Sect =
The Grand Elder Pagoda's top floor was the home of Han Hao. The entire floor was his living quarter, living room, and bedroom.
The floor below, on the other hand, was the monitor room of inner disciples. The sect housed key artifacts that represented the lives of all inner disciples – Life Candles.
Life Candles were the tools that the sect relied on to monitor their inner disciples' well-being. Every inner disciple's life was connected to one of the candles. Whenever they were healthy, the candle's flame shone. Whenever the disciple was sick, the flame flickered and wavered. When a disciple was injured, the candle melted, and the fire faded.
But whenever a disciple died, the candle would reveal the cause of death. If the disciple died because of sickness, the candle stick would always remain intact, but the flame would die out. But if someone killed the disciple, the candle would be broken in half.
On the candle stands next to the wall, two hundred candle sticks stood there, and the flame was calm. At the bottom of the candles were the labels and tokens of inner disciples.
In the middle of the room with nothing but candles and shelves, a burly middle-aged man sat there, meditating and guarding the candle sticks. He had no facial hair, and he tied his long hair into a topknot like a samurai. The red tiger tattoos on his thick arms and countless sword scars on his skin were his signature feature, and his Daoist Name was Tiger Swordsman.
Tiger Swordsman was another elder of the sect. His position was below Han Meng and Han Hao, but held a high ranking among the internal affairs elders due to his duty – He was in charge of monitoring the statuses of all inner disciples.
CRACK
While Tiger Swordsman was meditating, one of the candles broke in half and fell to the floor. The elder snapped open his eyes and stood up. Walking toward the candle, the elder picked it up and looked at the name token of the fallen inner disciple.
Ouyang Ting
"Ouyang Ting? Which madman provokes the Ouyang Clan? Is he insane?"
The elder pulled the broken candle out of the shelf and brought them to a Buddhist altar on the north side of the floor. The Buddha statue was three meters tall, but it depicted a sleeping Buddha. In front of the statue was a large water bowl with clear water.
Tiger Swordsman deeply sighed and dropped the broken candle into the water bowl. The liquid instantly turned murky white.
"Show me what he did before his death."
This water bowl was another artifact of the Life Sword Sect. Upon dropping a broken Life Candle into this container, the water would show the last 10-30 minutes of the deceased's vision before his death. Unfortunately, it could only show the vision. The audio was not included.
The water in the bowl revealed a scene of a dark forest and a certain wooden cabin. At first, the scene remained the same because Ouyang Ting had been stalking the general store.
A minute later, Leo returned to his store. Then, a group of assassins came out and started putting on talismans around the cabin.
Tiger Swordsman frowned. Although they wore black robes, he recognized this tactic of this assassin unit. After all, they were famous for overusing the Qi Sealing Talismans of the Situ Clan.
"Damn Ouyang's Hound Squad. This stupid group should have been eradicated long ago if not for the Ouyang Clan! They're the dumbest one-trick-pony gang. What assassin? They're just a pretentious group of ragtag assassin-wannabe. They have no skill whatsoever!"
The elder was in a bad mood as he hated dishonorable assassins. He forgot for a moment that he was supposed to investigate Ouyang Ting's cause of death.
Soon, the vision changed. Ouyang Ting moved down from a tree, but he still lurked in the shadow. He watched the fight scene between a group of assassins and a monster plant on the rooftop, but five of them were slaughtered instantly. Then, the assassins activated the array and trap the monster inside.
Seeing how the assassins stayed outside of the Qi Sealing Array and shooting bolts and arrows at the plant, Tiger Swordsman sneered.
"See? In the end, your group is just full of trashy wannabes. None of you know anything about swordsmanship or weapon techniques. You're all nascent soul cultivators, but you can't even take down a 3rd-stage monster. How disgraceful."
Tiger Swordsman laughed for a moment, but then, he noticed something weird.
The infamous Qi Sealing Array was cracked by the monster's whips.
His interest was piqued. He looked closer and clicked his tongue. However, Ouyang Ting was too far away from the scene, and Tiger Swordsman couldn't see the detail.
"Get closer, you coward! Get back on a tree and look from above if you are stalking someone! What a fool!"
The elder wished he had a jar of wine and snacks to eat while he watched the show. Once again, he forgot that he was supposed to investigate Ouyang Ting's death.
The fight tipped on the monster's side at first. But then, the assassin captain started using a sword technique. It was a long-ranged crescent slash, which generated a sword energy wave that could cut through steel.
The elder shook his head. This was a basic skill that all disciples eventually learned from the Life Sword Sect. He didn't know how Duan Mu had learned it, but its strength and speed were subpar. Tiger Swordsman, who had the same cultivation strength as Duan Mu, was confident that he could do it a thousand times better.
The monster got pushed back by the sword slash. It fell to the back of the store.
After the monster had fallen off the rooftop, the assassins followed it. Ouyang Ting also moved out of the shadow and ran toward the back of the store. He continued observing the situation from behind.
Once more, the vision was poor. Ouyang Ting prioritized hiding over observing, which made Tiger Swordsman annoyed.
Fortunately, the situation developed. The store owner walked out of the store.
Tiger Swordsman raised his brow as he found Leo's odd. Although he couldn't tell if Leo was a soul formation cultivator, the colorful aura around him indicated that he mastered all five elements, which made him a dangerous existence. Picking a fight with a soul-formation cultivator was the same as picking a fight with a Quasi-Immortal cultivator.
"Well, it's over. They're done for."I think you should take a look at
The elder watched how Duan Mu activated the formation and used an explosive sword technique. Leo soon punched and broke the array with ease. Then, he came after the assassin captain in a flash.
The fight instantly ended. The assassin captain turned into ash on the spot. The other goons fled in all directions, but they also dissipated into dust even though Leo didn't touch them.
Tiger Swordsman was amazed by Leo's mysterious power. He broke a cold sweat, unable to imagine how he would cope with such a mysterious ability.
The elder bit his lower lips. No matter how he simulated the fight between him and Leo, he couldn't figure out a way to win. The power was too domineering.
DRIP
The water curtain rippled as a sweat drop Tiger Swordsman fell into the bowl. Fortunately, the artifact continued to show the last experience of Ouyang Ting.
The guy turned tail and ran. He was fast for a peak 3rd-stage cultivator. But facing a soul-formation senior with a monstrous foundation, he was like a kitten in front of a veteran lion.
Ouyang Ting was knocked by something as the vision span. The image blurred, and Tiger Swordsman could no longer see anything.
The elder gave up watching. He had enough information about what Ouyang Ting had done.
"Idiot. Truly an idiot. He picked a fight with a senior, and he got himself killed. Did he think that all seniors won't lay their hands on juniors? Not everybody follows the doctrine of the Jianghu Alliance. Those "Senior must not bully junior" things are outdated. If the juniors deserve it, we obviously will teach them a lesson!"
Tiger Swordsman deeply sighed. He believed that Ouyang Ting deserved it. However, there was a major problem.
How would Life Sword Sect explain to Ouyang Ting's father? Ouyang Long was a member of the Jianghu Alliance, and he was in command of the Ouyang Clan's troops. He would surely know about his son's death and pay the sect a visit. If this matter was handled poorly, it could trigger a war.
As Tiger Swordsman didn't have enough influence or power to make a decision for the sect, he picked the broken candle in the bowl and Ouyang Ting's token. Then, he brought it to the higher floor, where Han Hao resided.
.
.
The Life Sword Sect was not the only place with the Life Candle artifacts. The Ouyang Clan also possessed them as they could be easily made with alchemy. In addition, it was common knowledge that Life Candles were made from a human's spinal cord and the blood essence of Life Candle's owner.
The capital city, Cauliflower City, was the heart of the capital was the Jianghu Alliance's palace, which was the gathering place of clan lords and undying old men.
In the palace, one of the Ouyang Clan's Life Candles was broken. A clan membered picked them up and looked at the name token in panic. Then, they brought the broken candle stick to their master.
In a courtyard of the Jianghu Alliance, Ouyang Long sat at a tea table with two other clan lords. They had been exchanging pleasantries while they admired the scenery and wine.
But the Ouyang Clan's servant rushed in and knelt before the three lords.
"Report! Young Master Ouyang Ting has fallen!"
"Hmm?!"
Ouyang Long was a 6'6 toned middle-aged man in long blue robes. He had a long black beard that reached his solar plexus and straight long hair. He also wore scholar headwear to hide a portion of his hair in there.
Upon hearing of his son's demise, Ouyang Long remained expressionless. He muttered, "Who killed him?"
The clan member rubbed his spatial ring and ejected an empty bowl and a bucket of water. He poured the water into the container and dropped the broken candle stick in there.
The last vision of Ouyang Ting was displayed.
The two lords and Ouyang Long watched the water screen together. A few minutes later, only Ouyang Long closed his eyes while the other lords burst into laughter.
"Brother Long. Your son was quite bold. Why did he provoke a soul formation cultivator?"
Another lord snickered, "His death is unfortunate. But still, even we can't comprehend his thought. Why did he do it anyway? From the looks of it, the other party is just minding his business in the woods, but your son brought a group of assassins for him. Is he insane?"
Ouyang Long's face reddened in embarrassment. He wished that he would have received this report in private. Because of this clan member, Ouyang Long became a laughingstock.
The father stood up and politely cupped his fist, "It seems that I'll be busy for a while. I'll make sure to come back before the mystic realm expedition."
"Hahaha. Go ahead."
"Yeah. Just go. We understand."
"…"
Ouyang Long nodded and turned around. He glared at the servant with bloodshot eyes.
"Prepare the ship. We're going to Life Sword Sect!"
The servant sensed a chill running down his spine. He sweated profusely and ran toward the airstrip, where the Ouyang Clan had parked their flying ships.

chapters.title: Chapter 35 Florida Man Steals Valuable From Crime Scene
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 35 : Florida Man Steals Valuable from Crime Scene
The airstrip of Cauliflower City was located on the south, outside the city wall. Although it was called an airstrip, it was just an empty land, reserved for airship parking space.
Two cruiser-class battleships were stationed there, intimidating the visitors. Further south, a hundred smaller private ships parked in rows and columns. Servants of the ship owners stood around their vehicles, protecting them from thieves and opportunistic cultivators.
Although the tension was high, no guard dared to stop one man from approaching his ship.
Ouyang Long flew over the city wall and arrived at the airstrip. He was embarrassed and frustrated to the point that he wanted to kill someone to vent his anger.
The previous servant rushed to the Ouyang Clan's private airship, telling the servants to get on board and activate the engine.
Ouyang Long landed on the deck. Afterward, he waved his hand, calling the previous servant over.
The servant rushed to his master's side.
SWUA
Ouyang Long suddenly unsheathed his sword and beheaded the servant!
"This is for what you did!"
The servant widened his eyes in shock. Tears rolled down from his eyes before his consciousness faded to black.
Ouyang Long turned to the other servants and cultivators on the ship. He commanded them.
"Listen up! If you don't want to become this guy, NEVER and I mean EVER report any sensitive information to me when I'm in public! Think about common sense!"
"..."
The servants had no idea what the dead guy had done. They bowed and sweated profusely, acknowledging the command. The captain hurried and launched the flying ship.
Ouyang Long snorted at the servants and informed them of his destination, "To Magpie City."
The ship ascended to the sky and turned south. It picked up the speed and traveled at 700km/h.
Ouyang Long stood on the deck, refusing to rest inside the cabin. He was still frustrated by the earlier incident. As for the crew, they threw away the corpse and cleaned the deck's floor in a hurry.
WHOOSH
While the airship traveled south, heading toward the Magpie City, a lone cultivator on a flying sword flew by. Ouyang Long looked up to see the rude guy that dared to fly so close to his airship.
Then, he discovered an acquaintance : Wu Buyi.
Wu Buyi also noticed Ouyang Long's presence. His flying sword made a U-Turn and came toward the airship. The alchemist jumped off his sword like a professional skateboarder and landed on the deck.
"What a coincidence, Lord Ouyang! I've been looking for you!" Wu Buyi laughed and cupped his fist. Then, he glanced at the bloodstain on the deck.
Ouyang Long was not in a good mood. He spoke in a loud voice, "What do you want? I have no business with the likes of you."
"Oh, my. How cold," Wu Buyi coughed several times. Then, he pulled out an inferior elixir grain pill that Leo had made. "I'm here to put this treasure in an auction, and you're in charge of the Cauliflower City's auction house. Do you mind if we talk business?"
Ouyang Long frowned. As an auction house's owner, he had an eye for treasures : He knew a technique that could identify every item that his customers brought out to sell in his auction house.
The elixir grain pill was authentic. Ouyang Long instantly noticed the five-element Qi inside the medicine ball. Although he was not well-versed in alchemy, Ouyang Long could tell that it was highly regarded among senior alchemists.
"You've come at bad timing. I have some business to attend to at Magpie City. If you need to put that item in my auction house, go ask my servant at my clan's pavilion."
Despite seeing a precious pill, Ouyang Long waved his hand, trying to chase Wu Buyi out of his ship.
Wu Buyi didn't give up. He brought out a prosthetic eyeball and showed it to Ouyang Long.
"Are you sure? I have other precious items. Your servant will eat all the service fees, you know?"
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm "..."
Ouyang Long hesitated. He wanted to go and find the culprit that killed his son first. However, half of him valued money more than the useless son's corpse.
In the end, Ouyang Long succumbed to his greed. He clicked his tongue and stomped toward Wu Buyi, "What else do you have? Show them to me!"
"Hehehe. I knew you would be interested. Here."
Wu Buyi proceeded to show a blade of immortal grass and a dozen elixir pills. Then, he observed Ouyang Long's reaction.
He was not disappointed. Ouyang Long's dilated pupils and round eyes glued to the pills and the immortal grass. The long-bearded man gulped and pointed at the pills.
"D-Did you make those?"
"Of course not! I'm running an errand for another master alchemist."
"WHAT?!"
Ouyang Long was stunned. He thought that Wu Buyi had come here to brag about his new pills and his wealth. But since Wu Buyi didn't create them, it posted new questions.I think you should take a look at
Who made them?
How did Wu Buyi get those pills?
Running an errand?
His curiosity was ignited. Ouyang Long turned around and shouted at his servant.
"Turn the ship around! We're going back to Cauliflower City!"
The servants' expressions were complicated, yet they followed their lord's instruction. They turned their ship around and flew back to the airstrip.
While the ship was returning, Wu Buyi began soliciting Ouyang Long.
"You know, Lord Ouyang. I know a unique store near Magpie City. I'm sure you will find the store interesting if you see it."
"I'm not interested in small businesses."
"Aw. Don't be so bold. I know that you're always interested in rare herbs from the mystic worlds more than anyone. The store owner has so many rare herbs that he made grain pills with them."
"Not interested. If I want rare herbs, I can always get them for free every season."
Wu Buyi was disappointed. He gave up on Ouyang Long, "Fine. Let's register my items in your auction house, and I'll go ask the others."
Ouyang Long snorted. He disliked competitors, so he had no intention of buying stuff from others. Every spirit stone was precious to him.
"Don't ever ask me to visit a store again. I'm not spending my precious spirit stones on something worthless."
"Even if they're immortal grass and a five-element elixir?"
"It's going to cost an arm and a leg anyway. As I said, I'd rather find them for free in the mystic realms."
Wu Buyi burst into laughter as he had predicted the answer. Then, he dropped a bomb, "The store owner doesn't ask for spirit stones though. He just wants our lifespan."
"..."
Ouyang Long paused. Then, he frowned and repeated what he understood, "So, you're saying, he doesn't sell his items for spirit stones, but he's asking for lifespan?"
"Exactly! That's the charm of that store."
Ouyang Long was infuriated. He turned around and glared at Wu Buyi, "Are you trading with an unorthodox cultivator?! Only evil sects practice one of those life force leeching techniques!"
"Whoa, there," Wu Buyi took several steps back and raised his arms, trying to calm Ouyang Long down, "You're misunderstanding something, Lord Ouyang. That person is not an unorthodox cultivator. I can vouch for that. He's an orthodox alchemist, just like me! Do you think evil cultivators can condense five elements? Look at these pills. The element Qi is so pure!"
"..."
The pill quality might be terrible, but the purity of the Qi was unquestionable. It was as Wu Buyi had said : The Qi was pure and pristine without a tinge of evil Qi, which was always left behind by unorthodox cultivators.
Ouyang Long was still skeptical about this shop owner. Thus, he continued to extract more information from the alchemist, learning more about his mysterious person.
.
.
In front of the alchemist workshop, Leo poured some of Ouyang Ting's blood into the cauldron and pressed the research button.
DING
<You have already discovered Yin Fluid.>
"Why is it Yin?! He's a dude, right? Did he swing that way?"
Leo clicked his tongue in disappointment as Ouyang Ting's blood ended up becoming Yin Fluid. Fortunately, it had a lot of usages, so Leo scooped the blood back into a storage bucket. Then, he hung the mutated corpse on a tree, draining its blood into a bucket.
As there were a lot of cleanups to do, Leo chose not to sleep tonight. He climbed the store to the roof and picked up the militated bodies of the assassins.
Leo separated their clothes from the meat. He tossed the body parts to the backyard, so they would become cat food. As for the clothes, weapons, and belongings, Leo gathered them and arranged them in front of the alchemy workshop.
The rooftop clearing was easy but tedious as there were too many human parts to collect. The hard part was the other assassins as they died in a different location.
Leo couldn't remember where they all went. Thus, he only used his instinct to search for their belongings. He managed to collect 13 sets of clothes and belongings. However, he couldn't find another runaway guy.
As the sun was about to go up, Leo gave up searching for the last corpse, hoping to clean his store before sunrise. He turned his attention to the store and peeled the weird yellow papers from the walls and the glass windows.
After the yellow talismans had been removed, Leo stood in the backyard, looking at the pile of black clothes. He giggled, "After I wash these, I'll have a lot of good rags to clean the store's floor, window, and stuff. They come at the right time."
The clothes could be recycled. However, the assassin's crossbows, swords, and daggers were the problem. As Leo had no use for them, he thought of a way to get rid of these weapons.
There were also interesting items that Leo got from the corpses. A total of 19 rings jiggled in his pocket.

chapters.title: Chapter 36 Florida Man’s Used Weed Sold For Millions
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 36 : Florida Man's Used Weed Sold for Millions
After clearing the corpses and the crime scenes, Leo temporarily stopped creating or researching anything. He had another plan for the workshop.
Having 8,128 years of lifespan, Leo resumed the upgrade project. There were three things that he needed to do : Upgrade the workshop to level 3, upgrade the refrigerator to level 3, and build a new workshop to increase production.
Spending 1,000 years of lifespan, Leo upgraded it to level 3 and increased the pill quality.
RUMBLE
The building didn't change much except for the cauldron's appearance. The pot's clear surface had a rain dragon carving on it. The eyes of the dragon glittered as if it was looking at Leo, and it continuously emitted red smoke.
Leo ignored the fancy-looking cauldron. He walked toward the newly cleared land and opened the shop domain map.
.
Basic Alchemy Workshop (Second Building)
Requirement : Humble General Store Level 3
Price : 1,000 Years of Lifespan
Space : 10 x 10
.
As the Humble General Store had already been upgraded to level 3, Leo could build the second alchemy workshop. He confirmed the system, spending 1,000 years of lifespan.
The second workshop was placed adjacent to the first one. Leo aligned it and place it next to the first workshop to save space.
A new building appeared out of nowhere. It almost looked identical to the first workshop, but it looked older as it had never been upgraded.
As the new building came out as level 1, Leo could upgrade it twice. He spent additional 2,000 years of his lifespan upgrading the new workshop to level 3. As usual, he put all points to the quality.
DING
.
Basic Alchemy Workshop Level 3
Production Quality Level - (2/5)
[Upgrade] : 1,000 Years of Lifespan
[Research New Ingredient]
[Pill Making]
.
Both workshops had the same status. While admiring the newly upgraded buildings, Leo widely grinned, proud of himself.
With two workshops, Leo could produce more grain pills. He threw iron pine nuts in the cauldrons, and let the cauldron run.
After spending 4,000 years of lifespan, Leo turned his attention to refrigerators. A few days ago, he upgraded it to level 2 to enable its electricity. He wondered what level 3 fridges would improve.
Leo entered the store and touched one of the showcase refrigerators. The shop domain system prompted him.
<Upgrading this refrigerator costs 100 years of lifespan.>
Upgrading electrical appliances were cheap. Leo was relieved.
"Do it!"
DING
The showcase refrigerator's appearance slightly changed. The stainless steel turned black, and the cold air was stronger. Just by standing in front of the showcase, Leo could feel the chilling temperature around it even though it contained two thousand blades of hot immortal grass inside.
Leo was delighted. He upgraded the rest of the refrigerators. He had been enduring the hot and humid air for so long, so he welcomed the cool air from the fridges with open arms.
After upgrading everything, Leo was left with 3,128 years of lifespan. He began searching for new buildings and upgrades for fun, playing with the shop domain menu. As soon as Leo checked the list, he found new locked system buildings.
.
Warehouse
Requirement : Humble General Store Level 4
Price : 500 Years of Lifespan
Space : 5 x 5
.
Small House
Requirement : Humble General Store Level 4
Price : 500 Years of Lifespan
Space : 5 x 5
.
Farm Plot
Requirement : Humble General Store Level 4
Price : 1,000 Years of Lifespan
Space : 10 x 10
.
Stone Road
Requirement : Humble General Store Level 4
Price : 1 Year of Lifespan
Space : 1 x 1
.
Asphalt Road
Requirement : Humble General Store Level 4
Price : 3 Years of Lifespan
Space : 1 x 1
.
Concrete Road
Requirement : Humble General Store Level 4
Price : 5 Years of Lifespan
Space : 1 x 1
.
As if the shop tried to tempt him, it showed the icons of each building. Looking at these icons, Leo thought of the ancient base-building games of his old world.I think you should take a look at
'You're turning my life into a SIM game, my system. Well, it's not like I hate it. This is fun!'
Leo's next goal was the [Farm Plot], which required 10x10 grids to build. Since it coincided with Leo's goal, he was interested in it. However, the Small House seemed strange as they seemed redundant to him. He wondered why it required 500 years of lifespan to build when he could just sleep anywhere in any building.
'I understand what warehouses are for, but why a small house? I can sleep in the store. I don't need it.'
Leo shrugged. He touched the wall of his store. Then, it prompted him with the upgrade cost.
<Will you upgrade the Humble General Store to Level 4?>
<Upgrading requires 3,000 years of lifespan.>
"..."
Leo almost vomited blood as the upgrade price increased again. Moreover, it demanded most of his precious lifespan. Although it was vexing, Leo grudgingly agreed and spent 3,000 years of lifespan, making the humble general level 4.
DING
<Humble General Store has been upgraded to Level 4.>
<New Construction Options!>
The new buildings were unlocked. Unfortunately, Leo ran out of lifespan to spend. He could only look at the new icons and fantasized about what they could do.
RUMBLE
As the store was upgraded, the interior space expanded again. The previously arranged refrigerators and shelves remained in the same place, but the walls were pushed away. Previously, the interior size was about 15x15 meters, after the upgrade, it became 20x20. The 10 fridges and six aisle shelves seemed too few for the wide area.
WHOO
Leo heard a sound of an air conditioner. He looked up and found an air duct ventilation system on the ceiling. Cold wind circulated in the store building, and the air wasn't as stale as before.
"Wow."
Admiring the store's enlarged space for a while, Leo remembered something. He turned around and looked at the back of the store.
The staff door was still there and was expanded. Leo entered it and discovered that his bed was in the middle of the room instead of being at the corner. Unfortunately, it didn't have a toilet as usual. Leo was disappointed.
'I guess I'll get stuck with the ancient outhouse system for a while. Should I build a small house for a toilet? Hmm...'
After running out of things to upgrade, Leo lost enthusiasm. He took off his clothes and threw himself on the bed.
*JIGGLE*
The 19 rings were still in the pants pocket. Leo forgot about them as he was mentally exhausted.
.
.
= Grand Elder Pagoda, Top Floor =
Three elders sat at a table, looking at a kneeling deacon. The latter was a servant of Ouyang Ting, who also visited Leo's store along with Han Hao. However, because of his leaked info, Ouyang Ting knew about the place.
Han Hao, Han Meng, and Tiger Swordsman glared at the deacon, listening to his confession.
"Let me summarize your report," Han Hao snorted. "You told Ouyang Ting about Daoist Florida Man's store, and that brat brought his men there to assassinate him for treasures!?"
"Y-Yes, grand elder."
Han Hao, Han Meng, and Tiger Swordsman deeply sighed. They finally understood what had happened.
Han Meng snickered, "Good riddance. He never showed respect to us. He thought that he could kill every stronger cultivator with his goons, and he has been monopolizing cultivation resources by robbing other disciples. Now that he's gone, the competitive scenes between the inner disciples should be healthier."
Tiger Swordsman nodded, "True. Many good seedlings were destroyed because of Ouyang Ting. Now that he's gone, those that are in hiding can come out."
Although the two elders were glad that Ouyang Ting died, Han Hao was concerned. He reminded them of the issues at hand.
"And what are we going to explain to Ouyang Long? Tell him the truth and sell out Daoist Florida Man?"
"..."
The two elders closed their mouths. They couldn't imagine which of the two soul formation cultivators would survive if they clashed. Moreover, the Sword Saint Forest was a sacred place for newbie swordsmen. If it was ruined because of them, the cultivators and commoners would blame Life Sword Sect as they were the guardian of that place.
Han Hao leaned back and downed the snake wine in his cup. He voiced his thoughts.
"If we play tricks to protect Daoist Florida Man, the Jianghu Alliance will point their swords at us. But since Ouyang Ting is at fault for provoking a senior, we will simply tell Ouyang Long the truth behind Ouyang Ting's death. If possible, we'll help Daoist Florida Man negotiate with Ouyang Long and retrieve that brat's corpse. Is that alright with you two?"
Han Meng and Tiger Swordsman had no issues. Compromising in this situation was the best answer since none of them were the culprits. As for Ouyang Long's wrath, they could only pray that Leo could handle the angry father without their help.
"Come to think of it," Tiger Swordsman looked at the deacon. "What should we do with this guy?"
As Han Meng handled the Justice System of the sect, he was the only one who could sentence deacons and elders to prison. He looked at the employee, "That depends on the outcome of the aftermath. If everything turns out well, one year of salary deduction is enough. But if things affect the sect and the city, that's 10 years imprisonment at the minimum."
The deacon was shocked, "T-Ten years?!"
"Property damage is 10 years imprisonment, not including the fine. Being an accomplice gets you the same punishment! Since you bowed your head to that brat for spirit stones and social status, you're an accomplice of Ouyang Ting and Ouyang Long. If Ouyang Long somehow damages the city or harms the commoners, we will prosecute you since you're the cause of all this mess!"
"T-That's not fair! I-I just told him about Daoist Florida Man! Also, I confessed. I'm a witness!"
"Leaking sensitive information is a crime, junior. Let's pray that Ouyang Long won't go berserk over this incident. If better, pray that Daoist Florida Man can suppress Ouyang Long's wrath. If not, your head might roll."
"..."
The deacon lowered his head, accepting his fate even though the sect's law was one-sided.
.
.
Meanwhile, at Cauliflower City, a certain alchemist brightly smiled and stood in front of three old men from the Jianghu Alliance in their courtyard. Next to him, Ouyang Long stared at the three old men with a dark expression as he couldn't believe his eyes.
"500 million spirit stones."
"550 million!"
"570 million!"
These three old men were from three different alchemy sects, and they were bidding to get their hands on a single blade of immortal grass.
"700 million!"
"Tsk!"
"Dammit!"
Finally, one of them overbid, and their competitors resigned.
Ouyang Long coughed and glanced at Wu Buyi, "No more bidding, sold for 700 million!"
Wu Buyi cackled. He wanted to see their reactions when they realized that Leo had over two thousand immortal grasses.
"Alright. Next item, 5-element grain pill! I'm sure you all know the significance of a five-element pill since no one has successfully made them before. If you get your hands on this, you might, no, you WILL learn a lot by studying it! I have 20 of them on me, and I'll be selling a batch of eight and two batches of six. The highest bidder gets the batch of eight pills. The rest get six. Now, you should calculate carefully before you bid because you can only bid once!"
The three elder alchemists stared at Wu Buyi with burning eyes. They clicked their tongues and brought out a paper and a brush from their spatial rings. Then, they started writing their offer without showing them to their colleagues.
Ouyang Long deeply sighed. He waited for the transaction to finish as he would get a 15% cut of this private auction. While he was managing this small event, he kept thinking of what Wu Buyi had told him.
'This fool said the mysterious grandmaster alchemist lives outside of Magpie City. Come to think of it, Ting'er attacked someone in a forest. Does that place near the Magpie City?'
Ouyang Long narrowed his eyes, imagining various scenarios. He suspected that the murderer and the mysterious alchemist were the same person.

chapters.title: Chapter 37 Neighbor Stops Florida Man From Turning National Treasure Into Furniture
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 37 : Neighbor Stops Florida Man from Turning National Treasure into Furniture
"Oh, I must warn you. If you're thinking you're smart because you only bid one or two spirit stones to get six elixir pills from me, you won't get any. The minimum bid is 600 million spirit stones! Any lower, and I won't sell you any!"
Wu Buyi snickered and warned the three old alchemists. The three elders clicked their tongues and tore the papers. Then, they brought out a new set of writing papers.
Ouyang Long shook his head as these old foxes had the same idea. Had he been in their shoes, he would have used the same technique to get the elixir pills for cheap. Unfortunately, Wu Buyi was also a cunning fox and a professional alchemist in this field. Nobody could outsmart him in his games.
While waiting for the old alchemists to finish, Ouyang Long whispered to Wu Buyi as he was curious about Leo.
"Hey, brat. About your new master, is he a soul formation cultivator?"
Wu Buyi widely grinned, "Of course. He's as strong as you. Actually, his foundation is more profound. He doesn't have the domineering and suppressive aura like you, but he can definitely use all five element essence!"
Ouyang Long narrowed his eyes. He confirmed another coincidence - The mysterious cultivator that slaughtered the Hound Squad was a soul formation cultivator!
'I have a feeling that they're the same person. Did Ting'er offend him or did he try to steal his pills? Was he an idiot?!'
His expression was so dark that he didn't know if he should be angry or ashamed of his son. Still, even if his son was in the wrong, Ouyang Long believed that it was inappropriate for a soul formation senior to kill junior cultivators as it violated the unspoken Jianghu traditions : No senior should bully, harm, or kill a junior as conflicts might escalate. If everybody selfishly slaughtered every junior, the cultivation world would have been in chaos as nobody could cultivate in peace.
Using this belief as a core, Ouyang Long concluded that Leo was in the wrong. No matter how rude his son was, he didn't deserve to die!
'It doesn't matter! No matter how strong his foundation is, an alchemist can't possibly defeat a true martial artist. If he's weaker than me, I'll cripple him and force him to be a pill slave for my clan for the rest of eternity! If he's stronger than me, I'll pressure these old alchemists to excommunicate him from the three alchemy sects! He needs to compensate me for my boy's death!'
.
.
10 AM of the next day, Leo crawled out of his bed. He put on his clothes and dragged his feet out of the store to wash his face and cook some late breakfast. Fortunately, no one visited the store in the early morning or late morning. He got the time for himself to sort things out.
However, Leo soon discovered an issue - Leo ran out of edible wolf meat. Without meat, he had no other food except vegetables, bananas, and other fruits.
He looked at the showcase refrigerator and stared at the immortal grass. He wondered if he should continue eating them. While contemplating his future, the corner of his eyes found the grain pills on the aisle shelves.
He had two choices : Grain pills or grass.
"Grass or pills... grass or pills... pills or veggies... I HATE VEGGIES!"
Leo hesitated. He knew that eating mutated fruits, vegetables, or grass would grant him some lifespan. However, Leo had been eating meat every day, and his current palate found it difficult to eat vegetables or grasses.
His stomach desired meat!
Leo turned toward the grain pills. They could fill his stomach for a couple days, and they would get rid of the hunger issues. But again, it would hinder Leo's lifespan gain for two days.
"Argh! Fine. No grain pills! I'll eat some fruit instead! REJECT HUMANITY! RETURN TO MONKE!"
Leo stomped toward one of the fridges. He picked a gold banana and started eating them. After downing four bananas, Leo burped, having enough food for the morning.
From a cow to a dog-eater, from a dog-eater to a monkey, Leo wondered if he would become something else tomorrow.
He checked his lifespan status next, wondering how many years he got from the bananas.
<Your Current Lifespan: 148 Years...>
It was 128 after Leo had spent everything last night. Four bananas increased his lifespan by 20, which was equal to what the elixir grain pill offered.
Leo snorted as he believed that it was the right decision. He had plenty of fruits, so it would have been a waste not to eat or use them as alchemy ingredients.
After the meal, Leo resumed working. He visited the two workshops to collect the newly made grain pills. Each pot gave him 30 pills of various elements. The majority of the pills were still Metal Grain Pills, but their quality got better.
The metal element ones came out as medium-grade instead of low-grade. As for the other elements, they came out as low-grade pills. Even the five-element elixir grain pill came out as low quality.
Looking at the new batches of pills, Leo wondered what kind of unique pills would come out after he upgraded it to the quality to the max.
As the store lacked products and grain pills, Leo queued for another batch of grain pills. Then, he visited the storeroom in the workshop to check the other fruits or vegetables to sell in his store.
The mutated fruits and vegetables were still there. Although they sat here for days, they still looked fresh and moist.
Leo carried a large bamboo basket of Bloodmelons, aka mutated watermelons, to the store and put them at the center of the store, near the front door.
Leo gazed at the Bloodmelons, wondering how much he should sell them for.
.
[Bloodmelon]
Can only be found in Blood Swamps of demon-infested mystic realms. The melons grow from absorbing blood from the swamps, and their juice is filled with demonic Qi and Yin Energy. It is one of many fruits that Vampires and plant monsters are very fond of. Can be used as a water element catalyst.
[Traits]
Increase water element Qi and demonic Qi by 10 years' worth of cultivation (If consumed)
Increase water-based pill's success chance by 30%. (If used in alchemy)
.
Since it gave 10 years' worth of Qi, Leo believed that it could be sold for about 20-50 years of lifespan. Also, he believed that it could be used as a lure to attract certain types of monsters.
Testing its effectiveness, Leo brought one of the Bloodmelons outside. He then rolled it like a bowling ball in the front yard.
"MEOW <3"
It only took Cat two seconds to jump from the roof to the front yard. It snatched the Bloodmelon and jumped to the store's roof. Despite not being able to eat anything for 48 hours, it still hogged the melon.
"..."
Leo stared at Cat, speechless. It seemed that the Bloodmelons were effective lures for plant monsters.
As the experiment was successful, Leo returned to the store and calculated the price. He wrote [50] on the label. Although it might be overpriced and might not sell, Leo could still use it as a catalyst in the future or directly consume it as a snack.
After arranging the placement of the basket, aisle shelves, and fridges, Leo picked a broom and swept the store. But before he could even start doing the chore, he heard the voice of Cat from the rooftop.
"Nom-Nom Meow?"
That didn't sound pleasant to hear. It also said this whenever it saw strangers or visitors.
"Ah, crap. Here we go again."
Leo toss away the broom and exited the store through the front door. He turned around and looked at Cat, who was still sitting on the roof and staring at the visitors.
"No food! They're not food!"
"No Nom-Nom?"
"NO NOM-NOM!"
"Meow..."
Cat was crestfallen. It turned around and returned to its favorite spot.
Leo deeply sighed and grumbled. Again, Cat had eaten a grain pill, yet he extorted food from visitors. Its gluttonous nature was troublesome.
After dealing with Cat, Leo turned his attention to the visitors. Surprisingly, he found a couple of familiar faces - Two of which used to visit this place before. One was a deacon that came with Han Hao. As for the other guy, he was the first customer of Leo.
Gao Yan brightly smiled and cupped his fist. He deeply bowed, "Greetings, senior! I heard about your store, and I hope I can buy some of your rare herbs again!"
"..."
Leo stroked his beard and deeply nodded. He had already forgotten about the guy. However, as he stated that he wanted his herbs AGAIN, Leo managed to remember him.I think you should take a look at
"Ah, Gao Yan wasn't it?"
He activated the shop domain system and allowed everybody to see their lifespans. Leo also rechecked Gao Yan's status.
.
Name: Gao Yan
Age: 16
Lifespan: 202 Years, 3 Months, 18 Days, 4 Hours, and 10 Minutes
.
As for the other disciples, they were pale in comparison. They had about 120 to 150 years.
Leo believed that Gao Yan had about 120ish years when he first met him. But now, he had over 200 years in stock. He wondered what he did to gain 80 years of lifespan during the past weeks.
The deacon stated his business. "Senior, I've brought more customers. Please allow us to purchase your pills again."
Leo smiled and opened the front door for them, "Come inside."
"Thank you very much!"
The deacon gestured for everybody to enter the store. Everybody also saluted Leo and prepared to enter the store in excitement.
On the other hand, Gao Yan looked behind him and gazed at the piles of lumber. For an unknown reason, his Qi resonated with the woods.
"Senior, what are those?" Gao Yan pointed at the roughly processed lumbers. Everybody stopped and turned around to see what the famous alchemist-to-be was interested in and gazed at the lumber pile.
Leo pursed his lips. They were useless woods that he had planned to change into furniture in the future. He didn't mind selling some to his first customer.
"Those? They're Iron Pine Wood."
"Iron Pine... Wood?!" Gao Yan's eyes gleamed. He remembered the term as he remembered reading about it in an encyclopedia.
"Yes. Do you need those?"
Gao Yan nodded, "Yes, senior! I can use them as charcoal for alchemy. They are metal-based, right? It will be a big help when I refine difficult pills that require metal essence. Actually, I can upgrade non-element pills into metal element pills with metal-based charcoals."
Leo raised his brow. He had no clue what Gao Yan was talking about as he didn't need charcoal or firewood to make pills. After all, he only needed to spit a few times to supplement the cauldron with all elemental essence.
"Well, sure. How much will you need?"
"One log-worth is enough, senior. Umm, how much is it? Are they expensive? I believe they're very rare."
"..."
Leo looked around him. He wondered if Gao Yan was blind as the iron pine trees were everywhere around here.
'He probably doesn't know. Well, the barks are all black, but these lumbers have already been peeled. Meh, it doesn't matter. I won't take advantage of him. 10 years is enough.'
Leo coughed and declared the price, "Only for you, 10 years per a log's worth of lumber. Want it?"
Gao Yan was delighted, "Yes, please!"
Leo didn't think much. He grabbed a log of processed lumber and placed it in front of Gao Yan. The latter's lifespan instantly decreased by 10 years. One year went to the deacon while Leo got 9 years of lifespan.
Gao Yan happily touched the lumber. He unsheathed his sword and tried to chop it.
CLANK
His sword broke in one hit.
Gao Yan: "..."
Everybody: "..."
Gao Yan's face reddened in embarrassment. He shyly sheathed his broken sword. Then, he bowed to Leo, "S-Senior. If it's possible, could you help me chop them into smaller pieces? I can't bring them home like this. They are too heavy for me."
Leo inwardly questioned Gao Yan about how he would carry everything home. He lifted it with one hand and flipped it around to weigh it. Judging from his feeling, the entire lumber was about five thousand pounds.
Since it might be too heavy for the teenager, Leo helped him. He put it back on the ground. Using only his bare hand, he karate-chopped, cutting the log into 10 blocks of lumber.
Gao Yan and the disciples watched Leo in awe and respect. The deacon was also interested in the wood and touched its surface. As soon as he touched it, he sensed the overwhelming metal element Qi inside.
"T-This is..."
The deacon realized what the lumber was. He was stunned.
"I-Isn't this tougher than steel?! Wait. Isn't this sacred wood?! ARE ALL OF THESE SACRED WOODS?!"
"EH?!" Gao Yan was stunned.
Leo rolled his eyes. He went into the store and grabbed a cubic block of sacred wood. He placed it in front of the store to show the deacon, "Y'all need to refine it first before it can become sacred wood. This block is the real sacred wood. As for those, they're just iron lumber."
"W-WHAT?!"
The deacon touched the surface of the sacred wood block. He gasped in excitement, "S-Senior! I'll buy this! How much?!"
Leo narrowed his eyes. As he had learned from his past mistakes, he chose to probe for information first before he named the price.
"What do you need it for?"
"Are you kidding, senior?! I know many top blacksmiths on the continent. This is the finest material to make a holy weapon! It doesn't matter if it turns out to be a wooden sword. It can instantly kill every type of undead monster in one hit!"
Leo raised his brow. He glanced at the raw iron lumber and wondered if he should make more of these sacred wood blocks. Then, he thought of the making process.
.
[Alchemy Recipe : Sacred Wood]
One Iron Pine Lumber
Wood and Metal Essence
.
It didn't need a lot of material : Any piece of iron pine lumber that could fit in the cauldron was enough. Moreover, it only took 10 minutes to make. The only downside of this item was the labor as Leo had to manually uproot the trees, cut the branches, and peel the bark by hand.
Thinking of the tedious labor, Leo jacked the price.
"100 years. Want it? You have the 10% discount since you're affiliated with the store, so that will only cost you 90 years."
"T-This..."
The deacon gulped. He took several deep breaths, contemplating if he should purchase it.
While the deacon contemplated his choice, Gao Yan asked Leo, "Senior, sir. If I remember correctly, it takes a whole year of dedication and hard work for an alchemist to refine this rare lumber into sacred wood. Is that true?"
Leo held back his laughter. It took 10 minutes of idle refining as the workshop automatically made it for him. He grinned and messed with Gao Yan, "That was nothing. I made it during my free time. I was planning to turn it into a chair or something. From what I learned, sacred wood is a good material for furniture."
"F-Furniture?!" The deacon almost vomited blood. "P-Please don't turn it into furniture! I'll buy it! I'll buy it!"
Leo stroked his beard and widely smiled. Once again, he managed to get rid of unused items in his store for lifespan.

chapters.title: Chapter 38 Florida Man Discovers New Shrooms Species In His Pocket
chapters.content:
﻿Chapter 38 : Florida Man Discovers New Shrooms Species in His Pocket
After collecting the deacon's lifespan, Leo invited them into the store. Everybody entered the building first, but Gao Yan remained behind. The latter rubbed an emerald ring on his middle finger, and it shone.
WHOOSH
The 10 pieces of iron pine lumber vanished into the ring!
Leo saw that. He rubbed his chin and thought of the rings in his pocket.
'What are the rings? Rings of Power? Rings of Magic? Ah, right. Some kind of inventory or Doraemon's 4th dimension pocket, maybe?'
Leo wished to inquire Gao Yan about it. However, before he could do it, the people inside the store suddenly ran out and looked at the building. Then, they went inside and made a loud noise, distracting Leo.
"SPATIAL DISTORTION?!"
"I-Is this the legendary spatial array?! Isn't this what the people experience in the mystic realms?!"
"I heard only the elusive Soul Transformation cultivators can tamper a large space. T-This is awesome!"
