Natural Qi gathered in the center of the platform. Then, four pillars emerged from the concrete ground, becoming the four scorpion tail obelisks, pointing at the rotating ring.
WHOOSH
The structure continued to charge its energy. Blue light gathered, and a beacon of blue light shot up from the ring to the sky.
"Wow."
Leo admired the scene, thinking of it as a firework or a light show. He also clapped his hands for it.
However, admiring it wouldn't change anything. Leo approached his new toy and touched the scorpion tail obelisk, wondering what it was for.
.
Mystic Realm Portal – Level 1
Entry Limit (Person) – (1/10)
Portal Cooldown Reduction – (0/5)
Portal Duration – (0/5)
Next Destination: Unknown Low Plane
[Upgrade] – 10,000 Years of Lifespan
Status: Ready to Open
.
Leo almost vomited blood when he noticed the upgrade cost. Instead of 1,000 years of lifespan per level, the portal required 10,000!
The upgradable things here were self-explanatory. Still, Leo touched every panel to see the explanation.
<Entry Limit – The number of people allowed to enter the portal at a time.>
<Portal Cooldown – After activation, the portal will undergo a maintenance cooldown. Without the reduction, the average cooldown is 80-90 days. Each upgrade decreases the cooldown time by 10 %.>
<Portal Duration – The length of the active portal. Once a portal is opened, it will remain open for ten days. Upgrading this section increases the length by five days per level.>
<Next Destination – Indicate the next destination that the portal will link to. The destinations cannot be chosen as it generates randomly. A low-level portal can only find low-tier mystic realms while a high-level one can send you to demon realms or immortal realms.>
Leo nodded in approval. By having this, Leo had something to look forward to.
<Current Lifespan: 41,731 years…>
Looking at the remaining lifespan, Leo started calculating. He counted his fingers, counting the number of buildings that he needed to upgrade.
"AAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHH!! THIS IS IMPOSSIBLEEEEEEE!!! HOWW!?"
Leo heard a certain someone's voice from behind the store. It seemed that Wu Buyi had a heart attack or something similar. He shrugged and continued working.
.
At night, Leo finished upgrading the essential buildings. The first alchemy workshop, warehouse, granary, and two farm plots were raised to level seven, costing him 10,000 years of lifespan.
The next investment was the third alchemy workshop. He erected it next to the second workshop. Leo didn't care what Wu Buyi might think about it since he had no time to check his reactions. He upgraded it to level 7 like the others as well, and he also raised the pill quality to level 5. As for two additional points, he put one in automaton and one in pill quantity each.
After dumping 7,000 years of lifespan for the pill factory, Leo built another farm plot next to the first farm. Using the alchemy workshop as a template, Leo allocated the points of all farms the same way.
.
Basic Farmland Level 7
Automaton Farmer – (1/1) MAX
Growth Speed Level – (0/5)
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm Production Quality Level – (5/5) MAX
Production Quantity Level – (1/5)
[Upgrade] – 1,000 Years of LifespanI think you should take a look at
.
Three automatons rose up from the ground, and they began working by themselves. They used the seeds that Leo had stored in the granary to sow the lands, and they carried tools to do their jobs.
Leo left them alone as the resource shortage wouldn't be a problem in the future. The only issue was the limited worker slot as one automaton might not be able to harvest everything on their own, which was why Leo needed helping hands from Life Sword Sect.
<Current Lifespan: 27,731 years…>
After making sure the production factories operated, Leo turned his attention to the welfare of his future employees.
.
Small House
Requirement – Humble General Store Level 4
Price – 500 Years of Lifespan
Space – 5 x 5
.
Leo was reluctant to build this, but he did it anyway. He built all three available small houses and erected them east of the general store.
That day, Leo designated the eastern part of his domain as the residential area. Although the granary was nearby, he didn't care as he could spend his lifespan to move it elsewhere like in a simulation game.
After the three buildings appeared, Leo stopped what he was doing to inspect the potential homes of future employees.
It appeared as a one-story straw shack. No matter how Leo looked at it, it was too pathetic to be called a house.
Fortunately, the system allowed Leo to upgrade them.
.
Small House Level 1
House Size – (1/5)
House Quality – (0/5)
[Upgrade] – 500 Years of Lifespan
.
The upgrade cost was cheap. Without hesitation, Leo tested one of them by raising its level to seven. Then, he put five points to house quality and one to house size.
RUMBLE
The straw shack instantly transformed into a 25 sqm concrete house. It was still one story, but the exterior appearance drastically improved.
Curious, Leo entered the first house to check the space inside. Then, he had a déjà vu. It seemed that the spatial expansion was a thing for his system.
Instead of finding a small 25 sqm studio-room house, Leo found a sizable home. Judging from his eyes, Leo estimated that it was about 49 square meters or more.
As Leo looked around the house, he noticed something attractive. He saw a small room in the corner. Without hesitation, Leo rushed toward the small room to check it right away.
"My word…"
Leo finally found what he had desired the most – A functional modern toilet!
Although Leo had one in the store, having one in a private home was a real improvement.
"Should I move here?"
Leo was tempted to bring his belongings there to occupy the first house. However, after minutes of contemplation, he shut down the thoughts.
It was not the time. There might be a bigger house in the future. After all, this building was called "Small House" for a reason.
"I'll wait until I get something worth my time. A mansion, maybe? If possible, my dear ring, I want a penthouse with glass walls, please. Oh, I also need a swimming pool in my yard and a large space to park my Rolls Royce and Bugatti."
Leo started having a daydream while he stood in the middle of the empty house.
While Leo was absentminded, Wu Buyi knocked on the door and coughed. The former came back to his senses and turned around.
Wu Buyi's face was as pale as a sheet. He sweated bullets, and bloody saliva seemed to leak from a corner of his mouth.
Worrying about Wu Buyi, Leo asked him, "What's up? Do you need help? Did you just vomit blood?"
"M-M-Master. Care to explain what you were doing? This disciple doesn't understand how you created buildings and… MYSTIC REALM PORTAL out of nothingness *cough*."
Wu Buyi's condition was worse than Leo had imagined. Leo pulled an elixir grain pill from his pocket and softly flickered it into the alchemist's mouth.
Because Leo controlled his strength, the pill was still intact. However, it slightly grazed the alchemist's uvula, causing him to choke. Fortunately, the medicinal effect soothed him as it boosted his lifespan.
"Better?" Asked Leo.
"T-Thank you very much, master."
Leo bitterly smiled and looked around, trying to change the subject. He then came up with an idea.
"I'm building a house for you. Since you'll be studying here for a while, it won't be good if you stay out 24/7. You can bring your belongings here. Oh, the toilet is over there. If you don't know how to use something, just ask me."
"… Eh?"
Wu Buyi was taken aback. He looked inside the house and found LED lights and an air conditioner. He also found random small holes in the wall.
Leo followed Wu Buyi's gaze and found electric outlets. He broke a sweat and warned Wu Buyi.
"If you're not immune to… tribulation lightning, do not stick your finger or anything into those holes. They will zap you, and you will die."
"… Y-Yes, master," Wu Buyi gulped, but he was tempted to do it. He fervently looked at Leo, "I can feel the aura of fire element and tribulation lightning in this building. Can I cultivate here?"
Leo flinched. He was puzzled about how Wu Buyi would cultivate Qi from the system's electricity. As Leo didn't know what to answer, he let Wu Buyi test it.
"Suit yourself. Don't get yourself killed."
"THANK YOU VERY MUCH, MASTER!"
"…"
Again, Leo had no idea why Wu Buyi seemed so excited. He left him alone in his new house.
.
.
After Leo left the house, Wu Buyi rushed into the house and touched the marble floor tiles. He then inspected the electric outlets and touched the surface of the holes.
From Wu Buyi's perspective, this place was rich in fire essence, which was hidden behind the outlets. He could also sense the electricity, which was milder than the heavenly tribulation lightning bolts that he had experienced in the past.
"C-Can I cultivate the mythical Lightning Element here?! Is this even possible?!"
Wu Buyi smacked his chest, preventing himself from having a stroke. Earlier, he almost had a heart attack twice when Leo built the mystic realm portal and the third alchemy workshop. And when the first and the third workshop's mannequins began working, he vomited blood for the third time.
As Wu Buyi was overexcited, he immediately injected his Qi into the electric outlet's holes. Then, the electric current followed the Qi and reached him.
BZZZ
The breaker was immediately switched off, and the house went dark. Wu Buyi got a taste of zappy zap.

chapters.title: Chapter 67 Florida Man Skins His Arm To Make Evening Dress For Sale
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 67 – Florida Man Skins His Arm to Make Evening Dress for Sale
Leo was oblivious to Wu Buyi's deed and how he zapped himself. He continued building his little empire.
<Current Lifespan: 17,231 years…>
.
Clothing Store
Requirement – Humble General Store Level 6
Price – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
Space – 10 x 10
.
Livestock Shed
Requirement – Humble General Store Level 7
Price – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
Space – 10 x 10
.
Aside from the roads and the decoration items, two core structures were buildable. However, Leo hesitated if he should invest in them since his lifespan was low again. He contemplated if he should upgrade the general store first or construct these side-job buildings first.
The next general store upgrade would cost 7,000 years of lifespan. However, it would unlock the next upgrade and new buildings. On the other hand, Leo didn't want to miss out on the perks of the new structures.
As Leo was greedy, he chose to build everything. He put the clothing store building to the west of the general store, designating the area as the shopping district.
RUMBLE
A rundown wooden cabin was erected. It looked similar to the general store when it was at level one as it came with a small door and thin showcase glass windows.
Leo entered the building and looked around. However, he found a blank building with one wooden mannequin, standing creepily in the dark, staring at Leo.
"…"
Leo ignored the creepy wooden mannequin. Curious about its feature and functions, Leo touched a wall to summon the building menu.
.
Clothing Store Level 1
Automaton Worker (0/5)
Automaton Weaver – (1/5)
Weaver Skills – (0/5)
Store Quality – (0/5)
[Upgrade] – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
[Research]
.
Leo read through the description and scratched his head. He felt like it was a waste of lifespan since it could only make clothes.
However, the [Research] button reminded him of what the alchemy cauldron could do. He pressed on it, checking its feature and functions.
DING
<Please give a clothing design, pattern, or complete sample to the weaver to research.>
<Please noted. After the item has been researched, the automaton weavers will automatically procure materials and weave the clothes for you.>
"…"
Leo had a feeling that the building should be called a tailoring factory instead. Still, as it was named "Store", he believed that it had a hidden function. Testing things out, Leo upgraded the building to level 7. He put five points to weaver skills and one point to store quality.
.
Clothing Store Level 7
Automaton Worker (0/5)
Automaton Weaver – (1/5)
Weaver Skills – (5/5) MAX
Store Quality – (1/5)
[Upgrade] – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
[Research]
.
RUMBLE
The store's interior space expanded, but it still looked old. Meanwhile, the weaver automaton transformed into a female mannequin, and it wore a modern maid uniform. It even had a frilly cat ear headband and had movable robotic eyebrows.
The maid slightly bowed like a noble lady, greeting Leo without saying anything.
Leo stared at the cat-ear maid for a moment. Then, he frowned at the unusual big knockers.
"Fake boobs," Leo snorted as he believed that everything was made from wood like her body.
The automaton flinched. She turned around and silently sulked in a corner.
Seeing the mannequin's reaction, Leo was surprised. He thought that they had no feelings, but this weaver doll seemed to be conscious of her surroundings. He coughed and patted her back.
"I'm sorry. You're beautiful. I was joking."
The doll's head turned around 180 degrees like an Asian ghost. Her eye-lens glittered, staring into Leo's eyes. Then, she twisted her body to correct her posture and stand up.
Leo was taken aback. This doll seemed to be a fan of horror movies. Still, he didn't hate her.
Testing her functions, Leo asked the doll, "What can you do for me?"
The doll tilted her head. Then, she pointed at the empty air in front of her.
DING
The store menu appeared in front of Leo. Then, the doll pointed at the research button, gesturing for him to use it.
Leo pursed his lips. As he had no experience in fashion sense, he had no idea how to procure a fashion design or a pattern.
"Ah, right. I can do that."
Fortunately, Leo remembered about the online store. He purchased the dress that he used to purchase a couple days ago. At that time, Leo resold them to the girls from Amazonian Sanctuary. He wondered if it could be used as a sample.
A cardboard box appeared. Leo unpacked it and pulled out a beautiful evening dress and fluttered it in front of the mannequin.
"!!!"
The mannequin girl's eyes shone. She carefully received them and flipped them around. Then, she gave Leo a thumbs up.
DING
<You have researched a common evening dress.>
<Your automaton will try to create a better version of this dress.>
"Heh. How cheeky," Leo found the doll amusing and the system. He believed that they might get along well.I think you should take a look at
The next moment, the mannequin did something unbelievable. She transformed her hands into a hundred nails. Her arms also shone and produced a vacuum force, absorbing the air around them.
The usual radiating light aura around Leo also got sucked into her arms. Leo stood there, watching what the doll would do with his radiation.
WHOOSH
The arms made a 3D printer noise. The light flickered and glittering white threads slowly came out from her wrists as if she was a spiderwoman. Then, the threads entered the nail holes, and the mannequin skillfully knotted them.
"Huh?"
A minute later, the mannequin produced ten coils of white silver sewing threads. However, she kept on absorbing Leo's aura and made more threads.
Leo nodded as he started to understand how the store worked. Instead of procuring threads from nature, this robot absorbed his radiation and 3D-printed the threads. Then, it would use them to make clothes.
As Leo understood how the weaver automaton functioned, he left her alone. He exited the store and was about to build the last structure and call it a day.
CREAK
However, the mannequin followed Leo. She stood behind him, stealing the endless rainbow aura into her arms.
"…"
Leo turned around and looked at the mannequin girl. He pursed his lips and patted her head.
"Well. At least, you don't start screaming PUTA like a creep. If you need my essence, I'll find a way to make some for you."
Leo grinned and purchased a glass cup from the online store.
KAAAAAAAK-PTUT!
As usual, Leo spat into the glass and gave it to the automaton, "Here, my essence."
The automaton flinched and took a step back. She repeatedly shook her head, and she squinted her eyebrows in disgust.
"What? You don't want it?"
"…"
Again, the mannequin repeatedly shook her head.
"Then, what do you want?"
The mannequin was silent for a moment. Then, she stabbed Leo's arm with her nails. Unfortunately, she couldn't penetrate his skin, and one of her nails was broken.
Leo silently observed her action. From her behavior, it seemed that she wanted something else.
"Do you want my blood?"
"…"
Again, the mannequin shook her head. Then, she poked his skin with her nails.
"Do you want my skin?"
"…!"
The mannequin's expression was brightened. She repeatedly nodded and waved her hands around, trying to communicate. However, Leo didn't understand what she meant.
Leo scratched his head. He found the doll weird and creepy. Still, he found her demand understandable since his skin might be the toughest hide in the fallout world. After all, nothing got through his skin for several millennia.
"This is gonna hurt. Oh, well."
He looked at his fingernails and found a small hangnail on his pinky finger. He took several deep breaths, preparing his mind.
"HMM!"
Leo grabbed the hangnail and pulled it with full force.
SQUAK
"!!!"
Leo bit his lower lip, and his voice muffled in his throat.
The hangnail came off along with a layer of skin. It extended from the pinky nail to his palm, and it continued down to his wrist, forearm, and elbow. Fortunately, it stopped there. The starting piece was thin in the beginning. Unfortunately, it got bigger the longer he pulled.
After pulling a long piece of his forearm and hand skin, Leo quietly passed it to the mannequin. His mercury-like blood seeped out from the wound, but they instantly regenerated his lost skin.
Just like that, Leo's wound was gone.
"There you go. Don't ask for my skin again. That was damn PAINFUL!"
The mannequin was overjoyed. She happily received the long piece of skin, which endlessly emitted a thick rainbow aura.
Her right arm suddenly split, showing the sophisticated 3D-printer mechanism inside her. She inserted the skin into her right forearm and closed it.
WHOOM
The same rainbow aura leaked out from the mannequin's forearm. Her printing machine worked faster, and more colorful threads came out from her wrists.
Seeing how the threads ceaselessly came out, the mannequin returned to the clothing store building and closed the door behind her.
Meanwhile, Leo watched her leave. She didn't even utter a word of appreciation.
"You're welcome." Leo chuckled and scratched his forearm. The wound was gone, but it was still itchy.
DING
<Current Lifespan: 10,231 years…>
With only 10,000 years of lifespan left, Leo deeply sighed. Although he made his decision to build every new building first, he hesitated if he should proceed with it.
After thinking it through, Leo chose to postpone the Livestock Shed project. He returned to the general store and upgraded it to level 8 so that he could take a sneak peek at the next batch of buildings.
Leo touched the external wall of the store. He upgraded it to level 8, spending 7,000 years at once.
<Humble General Store has been upgraded to Level 8.>
<New Construction Options!>
RUMBLE
The store transformed again. Instead of a hybrid brick-wood building, it became a two-story brick building. It looked like something from the Renaissance Era instead of a shabby wooden house.
Leo entered the store and checked the interior. As soon as he entered, he blankly stared at the wide space.
It was huge. He could no longer measure the dimension of this place with his eyes anymore.
"This is not a HUMBLE general store. This is a freaking SHOPPING MALL!"
Aside from the wide center area, 20 partitioned rooms occupied the west and east side of the building. Each room consisted of 25 sqm, which was enough for someone to set up a small store there. They also had sufficient electrical outlets and came with a shutter door.
Secondly, there was a wooden staircase near the entrance. Leo climbed the stairs to the second floor and found 20 partitioned rooms and another wide area.
Looking at the massive shopping mall space, Leo paused and sat on the stairs. His expression was dark.
"I'm going to develop Agoraphobia at this rate. What am I going to do with the wide space?! I can't fill everywhere with shelves and goodies. I can't possibly monitor everything when many guests enter the store at once."
The development was overwhelming. Leo failed to adapt to the change, and he had a lot of concerns about thieves. After all, he had seen so many shoplifters in shopping malls and supermarkets in the modern world. As a shopkeeper, he feared shoplifters the most.
"I need securities…"
Leo's eyes gleamed. He thought of the elders of the Life Sword Sect, wondering if he could scam them to work in his store permanently. The more he thought about the elders, the more Leo leaned toward recruiting them.
A new project came to his mind. Leo looked at the glass windows from the second floor, gazing at the mystic realm portal. He recalled the words of Wu Buyi, Han Hao, and Han Meng when they mentioned the mystic realms.
"Quota, is it? Can I permanently hire somebody by offering a ticket to go through my gate? Rather, can I set up a company? No, it should be called a sect or a cult by this world's standards. Should I really make one?"

chapters.title: Chapter 68 Officials Confused As Florida Man Draws Alligator Emoticon As His Business Signature
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 68 – Officials Confused as Florida Man Draws Alligator Emoticon as His Business Signature
As Leo had a lot to think about, he called it a day and rested.
The next morning, Leo woke up and came out of the shop to perform his routine, cleaning the store and collecting pills. He totally forgot about Wu Buyi.
When Leo came out, he found Wu Buyi kneeling in front of the store. When their eyes met, the latter's expression brightened.
"Master! You've finally come out! I have something to report!"
"…Speak." Leo was bemused, wondering what the alchemist had been doing all night.
"T-The house… has just lost the Qi source. The lightning element Qi and the fire Qi are gone! I don't know why, but they instantly vanish!"
"…"
Leo frowned. He didn't remember that the system house had a Qi source. Still, he strode toward the house to check the mess Wu Buyi had made.
Upon getting inside, Leo discovered a black electric outlet. From a glance, he could tell that someone short-circuited the electricity as the trace of a small electric shock was obvious as day.
Leo deeply sighed. He walked toward the circuit breaker at the back of the house and flipped the switch on.
BINK
BINK
The LED light and the air conditioner were turned on.
Meanwhile, Wu Buyi was in a daze. He gazed at the light and the air conditioner. He deeply inhaled the cold air from the machine and smiled.
"Master is awesome! How did you restore the Qi source? Please teach me, master!"
Leo rolled his eyes. He pointed at the black outlet, "See that?"
"Hmm?" Wu Buyi followed Leo's finger and noticed the black electric outlet, "What about it?"
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm "ARE YOU A FREAKING IDIOT SANDWICH?! I TOLD YOU NOT TO STICK YOUR FINGER IN! WHAT ARE YOU, A DONKEY?!"
Wu Buyi was quick. He covered his ears and circulated his Qi to protect his eardrums. Still, the voice rocked his balance, and he fell to the floor, getting dizzy.
Seeing Wu Buyi's condition, Leo lowered his voice and squatted next to him. He pointed at the circuit breaker.
"Listen here. You wet banana. Next time you ruin your house, check that thing over there. If it lever is down, flip it up, and everything will be fine. But if you do that and everything is still broken, it's on you. Okay?"
Wu Buyi repeatedly nodded even though he barely understood Leo's instructions. He gazed at the breaker unit and wondered what it was for. He also had some questions regarding Leo's strange vocabulary.
"Master, what's a wet banana?"
"An idiot that deserves a thousand slaps to the face for his stupidity."
"…"
"Anyway, continue what you've been doing. I have some work to do."
"Y-Yes, master."
Leo left Wu Buyi alone in his house and visited the three alchemy workshops behind the store next.
.
10 minutes later, Leo stared at the group of mannequins in a daze. He didn't expect to see three workshop mannequins coordinate with the warehouse workers.
.
Warehouse Level 7
Warehouse Automaton Level - (3/5)
Storage Size Level – (4/5)
[Upgrade] – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
.
As Leo had upgraded the warehouse to level seven, he added two more workers to help sort and collect resources. However, he didn't know that they had other functions.
The alchemist bots automatically collected the pills and put them in the warehouse. Afterward, the warehouse workers learned about the pills and coordinated with the workshop mannequin, fetching pill ingredients from the granary for them.
In addition, the warehouse mannequins were nimble. They jumped and ran like characters from Naruto, traveling back and forth between the granary, warehouse, workshop, and farms. Leo even noticed that one of the warehouse mannequins helped the farm automaton harvest a potato. Then, it carried the massive unit into the granary.
In short, these warehouse workers ran around, providing logistic assistance to the other mannequins.
Leo's mood was lifted. He was glad that he no longer had to manually collect or make new pills on his own. With this, he could just sleep at home all day and let the mannequin slaves do the daily chore for him.
Unfortunately, not all good things came without flaws. There was an issue with the alchemist mannequins. As Leo didn't update his instructions, they continued making the same pills over and over again.
The first workshop focused on yang flame dans. The second workshop hadn't finished making the Hope and Dream pills. As for the newest workshop, it ceaselessly produced Rejuvenate Tea.
Products that required hours to make were not an issue. The ones that took less time to make was the headache-inducing one. As the rejuvenate tea required containers to collect, the mannequins used whatever they could find to store them. As a result, they were in a mess.
The earth jar that Leo always used to store freshwater was filled with tea and freshwater. Cat's bucket of mutated water was also used. A massive trash bin, which contained spirit stones and essence stones, was brought out from the warehouse, and they were half-filled with the tea while some of the stones were still inside.
In short, the tea was wasted. Only Cat could drink it, but Leo doubted that she would.
"Haiya…"
Leo regretted that he didn't prepare enough glass bottles or a proper barrel for the juice. He purchased a few empty barrels from the online store. He then ordered the mannequin for the third workshop.
"Next time, store the tea in here. Don't bother using another container, okay? If you run out of containers, come find me."
The mannequin looked at Leo's face for a moment and nodded. It returned its attention to the cauldron, continuing refining the tea.
After giving out his order, Leo gazed at the mess. He carried the bucket of mutated water and brought them to the old outhouse near the Sword Saint Boulder. He poured the content in there. Leo also did the same to the earth jar of freshwater as it couldn't be used anymore. As for the trash bins, Leo spent a long time sorting the essence stones out of the containers. It took him hours to finish cleaning up the mess.
At late noon, Leo's stomach grumbled. Leo forgot about breakfast, and he realized that he hadn't eaten anything yet. He stopped what he was doing and returned to the store, hoping to grab some bananas to eat.I think you should take a look at
Stepping into the store and experiencing the distorted space again, Leo flinched. He couldn't get used to the weird space distortion of this place no matter how many times he entered or left the building. Going back to fetch food from the store was also a hurdle as the fridges were still at the center of the building.
Walking a hundred meters, Leo reached the center of the store, where the fridges and shelves were gathered here. Leo grabbed a few golden sand bananas and ate them as usual.
While eating, Leo gazed at the large empty space. He still couldn't figure out what to do with it. Moreover, the partitioned rooms on the west and east stood out like a sore thumb. By looking at it, Leo wished that he could get someone to open some shops here so that he could collect rent.
Just as Leo thought of Hua Jiashan and the elders, one of them returned to the store. Tiger Swordsman led the Magpie City's representative and local merchants here to establish a trade deal with Leo.
Tiger Swordsman knocked on the store's front door. Then, he opened it.
"Senior Florida Man. As promised, I've brought you… HOLY BUDDHA!!"
The burly cultivator was taken aback when he saw the massive space in the building. He immediately took several steps back to check the two-story building from outside. Then, he shoved his head inside, peeking and checking the interior.
Tiger Swordsman wasn't the only one with this reaction. The merchant representatives were also shocked as they peeked into the store through the windows from outside. They saw how big and wide the building was, and they couldn't help but rub their eyes.
Leo noticed their reactions. He chuckled and waved his hand, inviting them in. He could have gone out to receive them, but he was too lazy to walk.
Tiger Swordsman noticed the gesture. He invited the people in. Five commoners behind him nodded and followed the cultivator into the building.
As Leo was being lazy, he put the usual sacred wood blocks for them to sit on. He could have purchased proper chairs from the online store, but he always forgot about it.
Everybody got to their seat. They nervously gazed at Leo, who was still chewing a banana in his hand. Tiger Swordsman also noticed that Leo was eating a rare golden sand banana. The corners of his mouth twitched.
No sane cultivator ate a raw vegetable or fruit from mystic realms as the residual element Qi in the fruit or vegetable would have killed them from the inside. However, Leo seemed to be unaffected by the food.
"My apologies that I can't serve you tea today. One of my workers is too new on the job and he messed up a few gallons of tea."
Leo patted his hand and glanced at the banana peel on his lap. He shrugged and put it in his mouth, eating them as well. After all, every part of mutated fruits and veggies gives him life force.
The expressions of the crowd were complicated. The merchants and the city representatives looked at Tiger Swordsman, questioning him with their eyes if the man was sane.
Tiger Swordsman coughed and got to the point.
"Ahem. Umm, senior. We would like to discuss the deal we talked about, yesterday. I talked to the locals, and they agree to sell you vegetables and fruits. However, they need an advanced payment since it's a long-term deal."
One of the merchants stood up and cupped his fist. He added, "Although our status is inferior to cultivators, we need some insurance that you will not take advantage of us, commoners. I-If we offend you, please forgive us."
Leo nodded. He had seen this type of deal in the modern world before, and advanced payment wasn't something new to him.
"How much do you need for the advanced payment?"
The merchants looked at each other. They slightly nodded as they had discussed this before they came here.
"Umm, one spirit stone per month per merchant firm, senior. That will be a total of five spirit stones. After we receive the payment, we will deliver our goods here every first day of the week."
"How much will I get?" Leo didn't bother looking at them. He stood up and picked another banana from the showcase refrigerator. Then, he ate the tip of it without peeling it.
The crowd gulped as they were taken aback by Leo's weird sense of food. The city representative spoke next.
"T-Ten stones of vegetables and fruits for me, senior."
Another merchant nervously stated his offer, "Seven, no, eight stones for me."
"Eight for me, too."
"Ten here, senior."
"I-I can only do seven."
Leo quietly looked at the people. Then, he gazed at Tiger Swordsman, wanting to ask him how much one stone of fruits was. However, Leo's facial skin wasn't thick, so he didn't reveal that he had no idea what they were talking about.
Since spirit stones were easy to find, Leo readily agreed.
"Alright. Five spirit stones for those. Where do I sign?"
The merchants and the city representative were delighted. They brought out their contract papers for Leo to sign.
Unfortunately, this world still relied on brushes and ancient ink stones. They started grinding ink stones to make ink for Leo to write. One of them also asked him.
"Senior, do you have a seal stamp? We can use stamps, too."
"… Stamps?"
"Yes, senior. If you have a stamp that can represent your clan or lineage, you can use it instead of signing."
"…"
Leo stroked his beard and frowned. As he was not a noble from the local kingdom, he was already disqualified from using the stamp thingy.
"I'll write my name."
"… Alright, senior."
The group finished preparing the ink and brushes for Leo. The latter quietly rolled his robe sleeves and gracefully picked a brush. He gently dipped the tip in the ink container.
Meanwhile, Leo's mind screamed in panic. It was his first time writing his name in Chinese. Even though he had learned the characters from the system, he was still nervous.
As Leo's brain was frozen in panic, his muscle memory kicked in. Instead of writing his name properly, his arm and hand automatically moved, treating the paper as if it was something he could draw a picture on.
Leo skillfully drew a smiling alligator head on the signature area.
Everybody: "…"
Leo didn't finish there. He then spelled his Daoist Title underneath in Chinese.
Everybody looked at the characters and pronounced them in unison.
"Fu-Luo-Li-Da?"
"It's Florida…" Leo facepalmed.

chapters.title: Chapter 69 Elderly Men Interested In Florida Man's Balls, Survey Said
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 69 – Elderly Men Interested in Florida Man's Balls, Survey Said
After signing the deal, the merchants and the city representatives returned home happy. They got their spirit stones, which could be exchanged for their local currency later.
Tiger Swordsman remained behind as Leo asked him to stay. When the crowd left, Leo proceeded with his agenda. He consulted the elder.
"I'm planning to create a new sect. What do I need to do? Is there a custom around here, or do I have to acquire a license somewhere?"
Tiger Swordsman was astonished. Still, he was glad that Leo consulted with him first. He honestly revealed the process.
"Usually, sects and cults are built on top of a cultivation resource or Qi sources, such as the Mt. Claymore of Life Sword Sect. Although the natural Qi is faint, it's enough for others to cultivate and gain strength. If you wish to build a sect, you must secure a place for disciples and elders to cultivate first."
"Hmm."
Leo nodded and rubbed his chin. He got a general idea. While he listened, he glanced at the shop domain menu and looked at the new building list.
.
Livestock Shed
Requirement – Humble General Store Level 7
Price – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
Space – 10 x 10
.
Parking Lot
Requirement – Humble General Store Level 8
Price – 1,000 Years of Lifespan
Space – 30 x 30
.
Warehouse (2)
Requirement – Humble General Store Level 8
Price – 500 Years of Lifespan
Space – 5 x 5
.
Granary (2)
Requirement – Humble General Store Level 8
Price – 500 Years of Lifespan
Space – 5 x 5
.
Employee Apartment
Requirement – Humble General Store Level 8
Price – 10,000 Years of Lifespan
Space – 20 x 50
.
Domain Expansion
Requirement – Humble General Store Level 8
Price – 10,000 Years of Lifespan
Expansion Range – 100 x 100
.
Everything seemed irrelevant to the Qi source as most of the buildings were related to modern structures. Even the parking lot seemed useless.
Fortunately, Wu Buyi used to mention Fire Qi and Lightning Qi in the house. Leo wondered if the modern houses and apartments could be used as a Qi source for disciples and elders to use.
Testing his theory, Leo invited Tiger Swordsman.
"Can you come with me for a moment? I need to show you something."
"Alright, senior. Lead the way."
Both men exited the store. Then, Leo guided the elder to the small house, next to Wu Buyi's home. He opened the door and invited the swordsman in.
Tiger Swordsman entered the modern home. He looked around in astonishment as he had never seen a house without an open window. As the air conditioner worked 24/7 there, there was no need to open a window to let the airflow.
"It seems stuffy," Tiger Swordsman remarked. "What is this place, senior?"
"A house."
"A house?! People live here?!"
"Why? Is it inappropriate or unusual?"
Tiger Swordsman gulped. He deeply inhaled and revealed his thoughts.
"I don't think anyone should be living here. This is a place for someone with a high status, such as a sect master or an important guest to stay. I can feel intense Fire Qi and an unknown element Qi here. It feels like Heavenly Tribulation's lightning bolts, so I believe this might be the legendary lightning element Qi!"
Tiger Swordsman seemed excited. Unlike Wu Buyi, he only glanced at the electrical outlets and the circuit breaker. He didn't seem like he wanted to poke his finger or something into the holes.
Leo continued to probe for information.
"If I let people gather around the house, can they cultivate Fire Qi?"
"Hmm."
Tiger Swordsman pondered. He exited the house and stood in front of it. A minute later, he shook his head.
"It's unfortunate. I don't think anybody can cultivate the Qi from outside."
"I see."
Leo learned something useful. He believed that the new building "Apartment" might also be the same. If that was the case, Leo could solve the Qi source issue, and he could openly solicit people from Life Sword Sect to join him.
Still, there was one hurdle. Leo was short of lifespan once again.
Although Leo was short on lifespan, he had plenty of ideas on how to make some. He ordered Tiger Swordsman to wait there, and he went to the warehouse to fetch some essence stones. After packing a hundred stones in a leather bag, Leo gave them to Tiger Swordsman.
The elder received the leather bag and looked inside. Upon seeing the essence stones, he was shocked.
"S-Senior. This…"
Leo mischievously grinned and whispered, "Do me a favor. Bring those essence stones to the royal court or the imperial court whatsoever. I want you to report to the emperor that I'm hoarding countless essence stones with me, and I have a way to procure them. Can you do it?"
"W-WHAT?! BUT WHY?!"
Tiger Swordsman was taken aback. He was confused about why Leo wanted to provoke the imperial court.I think you should take a look at
"Don't ask why. Please do what I said. I need to get their attention. If they are aware of my existence, they might send people to visit my store and become my customers. If they buy my products, you will also get some commission from me. It's a win-win, right?"
"…"
Tiger Swordsman hesitated. He wasn't convinced that it was the right approach. Still, as Leo seemed to be confident in his abilities and strength, he agreed.
"Alright. Please be careful, senior. Those guys are overbearing and arrogant. They might come to extort taxes from you."
Leo brightly smiled, "That's even better. Let them come."
"…"
The elder was speechless. He quietly stored the leather bag and excused himself, returning to the sect to spread words. He would also inform the other elders that Leo wished to establish a new sect.
After Tiger Swordsman was gone, Leo turned his attention to his store. He cracked his knuckles.
"This is going to be a long day. I'm gonna rearrange the shelves and the fridges into the booths. Right, I should designate one of them as my personal store. As for the rest, I can let my future workers or those elders rent the place. Of course, they will have to pay me with their lifespan. Hehehehe."
.
.
It had been a day since Cheng Yuanzhi and Ouyang Feng escaped from Leo's grasp. They reached Phoenix City. When they arrived, the clansmen spotted them and rushed to help their young lord.
"YOUNG MASTER OUYANG?!"
"WHO DID THIS TO YOU?!"
Ouyang Feng still hadn't recovered from Leo's sound attack. He couldn't even stand on his own even though Cheng Yuanzhi fed him several healing pills. Upon arrival, he fainted.
Cheng Yuanzhi's condition was a lot better as he had a superior cultivation base. Still, he was still dizzy, and he had been suffering from a high fever. As soon as he saw the people of the Ouyang Clan, he collapsed on the ground and passed out.
.
Half a day later, Cheng Yuanzhi recovered. He opened his eyes and saw a ceiling of a wooden building. He rolled his eyes to look around.
"Ah, you're up."
Cheng Yuanzhi heard an old man's voice. He pushed his body to sit up, but his head was so heavy that he couldn't lift it up. He fell back on the pillow.
"Take it easy. I know you're injured."
Ouyang Ke had been sitting on a chair next to Cheng Yuanzhi's bed. He turned around and picked a medicinal tea from a table and served it to the elder.
Cheng Yuanzhi gratefully accepted the tea. Upon smelling the pleasant odor, his head felt a lot lighter. He managed to sit up and took a sip of the herbal tea.
"Tell me," Ouyang Ke deeply sighed. "What happened to my grandchild? Who did it?"
Cheng Yuanzhi didn't hide anything. He revealed the incident that they had gone through.
…
After listening to Cheng Yuanzhi's tale, Ouyang Ke's expression was dark.
"I'm afraid you ran into the murderer of Ouyang Long. Obviously, you're not his opponent."
"W-Who is he, grand elder? He concocted immortal pills and endured green lightning tribulation, yet he was strong enough to take on Situ Clan's killing formation head-on. He must be a famous expert, right?"
Ouyang Ke snorted, "Famous, my ass. He's just an upstart rogue cultivator. I bet he's just a quasi-immortal that has just come up from a long seclusion. Since he killed Situ Luan, those undying mummies from the Situ Clan won't leave him alone. In fact, I bet the imperial court must have heard about him by now since the Fatui Cult has a deep connection with the third prince."
"…"
Ouyang Ke stood up and looked outside the window. He thought of his rival – Situ Nantian. He wondered why that quasi-immortal had been so quiet.
"Say, Yuanzhi."
"Yes, senior?"
"You saw Situ Luan there, right? Have you seen the other people from the Situ Clan?"
"Hmm."
After Ouyang Ke reminded him, Cheng Yuanzhi recalled that the people from Situ Clan didn't directly join the siege. Instead, they lurked in the forest and in the Magpie City, hiding under Hua Jishan's nose.
From the perspective of the Ouyang Clan and Situ Clan, the Life Sword Sect was a small sect that wasn't worth mentioning. It was a lot weaker than its rival – The Death Sword Sect, which gathered many soul transformation cultivators on their side. On the other hand, Life Sword Sect only had a dozen nascent soul cultivators and Hua Jiashan, who was the sole soul formation cultivator that had been protecting the sect for centuries.
A 500-year-old soul formation cultivator was trash and talentless. Everybody branded Hua Jiashan as a weakling!
"I spotted a few in the forest, but no one made their move. I think they also retreated."
"I see. Well, just rest. We'll handle this matter later."
Ouyang Ke nodded. He then stood up to leave the room. But before Ouyang Ke left, he remembered something, "Oh, by the way."
"Yes, senior?"
"Never attack a stronger cultivator regardless of the situation. A wounded tiger is still a tiger. Haven't you learned that?"
"… I'm sorry, sir."
"Hmm."
Ouyang Ke quietly left. Meanwhile, Cheng Yuanzhi was relieved. He continued zipping the herbal tea.
"…"
It was delicious, strangely delicious. Cheng Yuanzhi felt like he had never drunk anything like this before. It was also weirdly mellow, and he felt like something inside him slowly vanished.
"Hmm? Err, eh?"
Cheng Yuanzhi's consciousness slowly faded. He felt so sleepy for an unknown reason. A few seconds later, he fell asleep… forever.
.
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm After poisoning Cheng Yuanzhi, Ouyang Ke stood in front of the room, scoffing at the incompetency of Ouyang Feng's master. Although his action might offend the Death Sword Sect, he had a thousand explanations to tell their elders.
After all, who in the right mind brought his treasured grandchild into a dangerous place? If he was stupid enough to allow Ouyang Feng to fight a stronger foe, he should have his intelligence reevaluated.
"Damn, idiot. He almost killed Feng'er."
Ouyang Ke gestured for his subordinates to clean the corpse. Then, he returned to his residence to visit his grandson.
.
.
The Ouyang Clan wasn't the only one that had survived the ordeal. Many people of the Situ Clan had also witnessed the fight, and they managed to gauge Leo's strength.
Situ Clan's spies returned to the clan and reported to their masters. The quasi-immortal Situ Nantian also received intel from the Magpie City that Hua Jiashan had a relationship with the mysterious alchemist.
In Situ Nantian's house, the elderly man meditated and pinched his fingers. He mumbled to himself as if he had been communicating with someone far away.
"What do you mean by FLORIDA? What is that Dao?"
"You don't know?"
"Huh? An elder of the Life Sword Sect has exchanged an essence core for a high-grade flying sword in the black market?! Where the hell did he get that?! Wait, are you sure?!"
Situ Nantian opened his eyes as he received many interesting pieces of information. He wanted to visit Leo right away. However, he couldn't go there as he had to prepare for this season's mystic realm expedition.
"Tsk! How annoying. I'll go there myself after the expedition."

chapters.title: Chapter 70 Senators Summons Florida Man For Hearing About His Balls
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 70 – Senators Summons Florida Man for Hearing about His Balls
Magpie City
The city was under the jurisdiction of the Life Sword Sect. Commoners of this city always sent their children to take the sect's aptitude tests, hoping to raise their family status. In addition, the sect had a good reputation among commoners as they never imposed taxes on them. Instead, they accepted requests from commoners and provided protection to the local merchants as their primary job.
Although the sect was popular among commoners, their financial status was inferior to other orthodox sects and unorthodox sects. Because of that, they lacked cultivation resources and pills to employ deacons or invite strong cultivators to join them. With fewer resources, their disciples' progress was also slower than the others in their peers.
However, things changed after Leo appeared. The disciples acquired rare pills while many elders purchased essence cores from Leo. With the new resources, their cultivation progress skyrocketed. Most of the disciples, deacons, and elders shut themselves in their abodes, cultivating in frenzy.
Hua Jiashan, Han Hao, and Han Meng were also the same. They used whatever they got from Leo to cultivate. As such, the number of protectors and patrolling cultivators in the city dwindled.
This allowed spies and cultivators from other sects and clans to infiltrate the city. Everybody used their organization's secret artifact to hide their presence and Qi while they lurked in the city.
In an alley, a group of three hooded golden core cultivators stood in front of a local middle-aged merchant. They paid him a bag of gold coins for the information.
"T-Thank you, sir! C-Can I leave?"
"Go." One of the cultivators chased the merchant away.
The merchant ran away with the bag of gold coins. He widely grinned as his financial issue would be solved for the rest of his life.
The cultivators looked at each other. They were baffled by the intel that they had just gathered.
This group belonged to the Fatui Cult. They were the backup forces that came with Situ Luan. However, after their master's death, they lurked in the city, gathering information for their cult.
"That Florida Man is commissioning the local to bring him… food?"
The captain of the group corrected his subordinate, "More like, he is gathering resources. If he needs food, he would have requested meat or live animals."
"But vegetables and fruits?"
"The spies from Situ Clan said that Florida Man might be a quasi-immortal. If that's the case, it explains everything. Any quasi-immortal can convert regular fruits and vegetables into precious herbs and alchemy materials. Since Florida Man is an alchemist, it makes a lot of sense to me."
Everybody nodded in agreement. They took notes and disappeared into the shadow, leaving the city with the information. Their cult would receive this intelligence at night.
These people weren't the only ones with the information. As Leo openly commissioned the merchants, the local farmers and travelers heard of it and spread the rumor.
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm Although the center of attention was on Leo and his actions, many spies noticed irregular activities of the Life Sword Sect's elders as one of them visited the black market in the slum outside the city wall, north of Magpie City.
As the black market ran by money, it was easy for spies to acquire information. Everybody soon realized that someone sold a unique contraband item "Essence Stone" to the unauthorized auction house.
Agents from major sects and clans swarmed the auction house to confirm the information. Then, they learned that an elder from Life Sword Sect sneaked the item here and exchanged an essence stone for a high-grade flying sword, which was publically sold in the market for a hundred million spirit stones!
The news traveled fast as cultivators had the means to deliver information to their organizations. Within 24 hours, the news reached the ears of the imperial officials.
.
.
The Yan Empire had been governing the mainland for 500 years ever since the last Sweet Dream Mushroom Incident. The Yan Clan took over the imperial court after the mushroom zombie apocalypse while the Situ Clan cleaned up their mess.
Although the Yan Empire was the ruler of all cultivators on the mainland, not all families were fond of them. The Situ Clan was one of them as they still held a grudge that the Yan Clan took advantage of their ancestors 500 years ago and usurped the throne.
Currently, Yan Xiang was the emperor of Yan. He was a quasi-immortal, and he was famous for his talent in cultivation and combat. Ever since he had advanced to the quasi-immortal stage, he had never been defeated in a fight.
At Cauliflower City Palace, Yan Xiang sat on the throne, skimming through the scrolls of his subordinates. They were the daily reports of the imperial court, which informed him of the surrounding events around the mainland.
Yan Xiang wore gold dragon robes and an emperor crown. His throne and tables were made of pure gold, but they ceaselessly emitted Yang Element Essence, which was one of the rare elements that no cultivator could cultivate.
The emperor was 650 years old, yet his appearance looked the same as a teenager's as he didn't have a string of beard or mustache. He also wore a pair of eyeglasses even though he could see everything clearly. His spotless white jade skin never touched the sunlight, and his physique was average as if he had never worked out before. His long black hair was hidden under the crown.
While the emperor was busy reading the reports, a thousand soul transformation cultivators and soul formation cultivators, dressing as court officials, stood still and lowered their heads in the wide throne room. They waited for their lord to finish examining their jobs.
Among the crowd, representatives of the Jianghu Alliance were present, except the representative from the Ouyang Clan. Three alchemy sects, the World Tree Sect, the Sixth Element Sect, and the Pill Union sent their elders to attend as well. Even Death Sword Sect, Fatui Cult, and all unorthodox sects participated in the meeting as these organizations belonged to Yan Xiang's sons.
Everybody was quiet. Only the sound of Yan Xiang's movements and his scroll were audible in the hall.
Two hours later, Yan Xiang finished reading all of the scrolls. He rolled them and put them on the floor, allowing the eunuchs behind him to tidy the place.
"I have a question. Chancellor Tang. What is Florida?"
Chancellor Tang was a thin elderly man, whose gentle smiling face never faded. He looked like a kind grandpa that every child loved. He had short white hair, white eyebrows, and purple pupils, but no beard.
The representatives from the Situ Clan flinched. They were the ones who sent the report about a mysterious figure by the Daoist name "Florida Man".
One of the Situ clansman stepped out of the crowd and stood in the middle of the throne room, presenting himself on the red carpet. He deeply bowed while he cupped his fist.
"It's a new Dao, your majesty. This term appears along with the mysterious rogue cultivator that calls himself Florida Man. He shows up near Magpie City of the Life Sword Sect."
"Hmm. Alright. Is the representative from the Life Sword Sect present?"
"…"
Nobody uttered a word as Life Sword Sect never sent their representative here. Rather, they didn't know that the emperor demanded one of them there.
The crowd sweated profusely. Most of the sects and clans here excommunicated small and weak sects so that the allocable resources from the imperial court would never reach them. Then, their annual share would be naturally increased as a result as long as they contributed something to the court.I think you should take a look at
The emperor leaned back and picked up a cup of tea. Coincidentally, it was also pinnacle-grade rejuvenate tea, which the Tang Clan specially concocted for the emperor.
After sipping the tea, Yan Xiang looked around the room. He frowned, "You know what's funny? This is the first time I heard about Life Sword Sect. I know about the Sword Saint's deeds, but I thought their successors found the Death Sword Sect. So, tell me, people. Why haven't I heard about this sect before?"
Everybody was drenched in sweat, especially the people from the Jianghu Alliance. Some of them clattered their teeth as they were afraid of the punishment for their misdeeds.
The emperor glared at them, "I thought I ordered the Jianghu Alliance to gather every representative from all sects in the mainland here so that we can communicate better. In exchange for their trouble, I'll allocate essence stones and spirit stones to their sects and make an exception about the essence stone contraband. If they aren't here, I can't question them when something happens in their territory, can I? They also can't get their hands on our cultivation resources. So, why aren't their representative here?"
Being pressed on something unspeakable, nobody dared to utter a word.
Yan Xiang was not a pushover. He narrowed his eyes as he saw through his subordinates' political schemes. He purposely intensified his murderous aura.
Facing the quasi-immortal's killing intent, everybody prostrated to the floor and slammed their foreheads to the ground.
"Please quell your anger, your majesty!"
"Anger deteriorates your health, your majesty! Please calm down!"
Yan Xiang was calm, but he hated hypocrite underlings. He bellowed, "YOU IMBECILS! I ASKED YOU WHY THEY AREN'T HERE!!"
The thousand people in the hall vomited blood. Fortunately, these officials and representatives were strong, and they managed to endure the emperor's pressure.
On the other hand, Chancellor Tang was also a quasi-immortal. He didn't feel anything from the pressure, but he lowered his head to Yan Xiang.
"If I remember correctly, the Magpie City is located in the southern region, close to the Fatui Cult and Death Sword Sect. It takes only half a day to travel from Cauliflower City to Magpie City. I think they might be suppressed by the neighbors, and they haven't received any help from us."
"IT HAS BEEN 500 YEARS!!"
Yan Xiang stood up and threw his teacup at the representative from the Fatui Cult. The glass broke, and the blood came out from the elder's head. However, the cultist, who no longer wore cone-shaped headwear, didn't raise his head.
"500 Years. They have been isolated for 500 years! From the first day that our kingdom was founded, my ancestors stressed that every sect and cult, regardless of practices and culture, must be treated equally! We forbid every cultivator from accessing essence stones so that we can allocate them equally to all clans and sects. Then, you can have healthy competition! The side that outperforms the others can get a high status in the court… AND WHAT IS THIS?!"
Yan Xiang stomped and raised his hand. One of the Fatui Cult's elders and Death Sword Sect's elders floated in the air as their necks were squeezed and raised by invisible hands.
"EXPLAIN! WHY HAVEN'T I HEARD OF THE LIFE SWORD SECT BEFORE?!"
"…UGH."
"H-HELP!"
Nobody bothered raising their heads to answer. Even the colleagues of the suffering elders didn't dare to speak.
However, a young man in gold robes in the crowd suddenly stood up. He gazed at his father.
"Father, this is my fault. I ordered them not to inform you."
"You…"
The speaker was the third prince, Yan Zhu. He was known as the patron of the Fatui Cult. This year, he was 150 years old, and his cultivation base was in the soul transformation stage.
Yan Zhu explained to his father, "These days, pretentious small sects emerge everywhere. Just because they call themselves a sect doesn't mean we should acknowledge them as a cultivator organization. Some of them use the name as a cover to exploit people or take advantage of the commoners. Because of that, I ordered the Fatui Cult and Death Sword Sect not to include small sects in the official sects. Unless they can produce a soul transformation cultivator, their organizations remain unofficial."
Yan Xiang wasn't happy with his son. He clicked his tongue, "And let the big cults and sects monopolize my essence stones? How about I cut the supplies from your sects for 500 years? I bet your cult will instantly be disbanded!"
Hearing that Yan Xiang would cut the supplies to Fatui Cult, Yan Zhu clapped his hands and dispelled his father's power, allowing the two representatives to fall to the ground and breathe.
The two tortured men gave Yan Zhu a grateful look. They coughed and continued lowering their heads as usual.
Yan Zhu tried to convince Yan Xiang with a new report that he hadn't told his father yet.
"Father, my stance on the small sects and cults remains unchanged. Besides, do you know that Life Sword Sect has illegally smuggled essence stones from a new source and exploited them?"
"What?" Yan Xiang raised his brow. He thought that all essence stones on the mainland came from the five mystic realm gates, which belonged to the court. He was surprised to hear about a new source.
"Where did they get the essence stones?"
Yan Zhu smirked. He reminded his father about the primary issue.
"Florida Man!"
"… Hmm?"
"Remember what you asked? What Florida is might actually be a place or a Dao that relates to the essence stones. Life Sword Sect might know something about it, but they are keeping it a secret."
Yan Xiang still didn't believe in his cunning son. He glared at him, "What's the proof? What if you just blatantly accuse them to protect your cult?"
Yan Zhu then volunteered, "Pass me an order, Father. Allow the Fatui Cult and my personal army to move. We'll pay Magpie City a visit and face the Life Sword Sect head-on. We'll question them personally about where they get the essence stones and who Florida Man really is!"
The emperor snorted. He knew what his son cooked from a mile away. At this rate, Yan Zhu would annihilate the Life Sword Sect and kill Florida Man, making them a scapegoat for the unproved crime.
To prevent such an unfair activity, Yan Xiang glanced at the representative of the Pill Union and Chancellor Tang. He ordered them.
"You two go along with that brat. Chancellor Tang, I give you permission. Accompany them and investigate everybody thoroughly, and I mean EVERYBODY. You may PUNISH ANYONE, INCLUDING MY KIN IF THEY DESERVE IT! I'm allowing you to use your judgment!"
Yan Zhu's expression turned dark while Chancellor Tang glanced at the third prince. The latter's smile widened as he bowed, "By your will, your majesty."

chapters.title: Chapter 71 Greta Enraged As Florida Man Cut 2,000 Trees In Front Of Official Agents
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 71 – Greta Enraged as Florida Man Cut 2,000 Trees in Front of Official Agents
Having subordinates was convenient. Leo had time to work with the terrain clearing, removing iron pine trees from his domain. He also mutated the surrounding grasses and bushes, making more weird items.
While Leo was working, he spotted a hundred silhouettes of people at a distance. They had been hiding behind trees and shades, staying 200 meters away from Leo's shop domain.
Leo glanced at these people and pretended that he didn't notice them. He carried the last iron pine tree in his shop domain to the empty lot near the junkyard. Then, he proceeded to remove the barks and branches from the logs.
The crowd of stalkers moved closer to the shop domain. However, they remained out of the premise as they had no place to hide – All trees and bushes had been removed, and the trenches were too shallow for them to hide during the daytime.
While Leo worked on the tree barks, he sneaked glances at the stalkers several times. He started to get annoyed as they neither attacked him nor declared their intention.
After finishing the 10th log, Leo paused his work. He let the mannequins do their jobs, bringing the tree bark, leaves, nuts, and other resources to the warehouse. As for him, he had another task to do.
Leo walked toward the southwest of his shop domain. He stepped on the mystic realm portal platform, but he didn't activate it. He proceeded further and reached the boundary of his shop domain for the first time.
The crowd that had been hiding and inspecting the mystic realm portal in secret dispersed. They slipped away in the dark and stayed 200 meters away from Leo. The latter noticed their movements, but he didn't pursue them.
After crossing the boundary, Leo came across a blue forest. This area got contaminated by the iron pine trees' aura, and they turned into something similar to spirit grasses. However, as Leo got closer and touched them, they blackened and evolved into iron pine trees.
Leo snorted. He quietly uprooted the trees and threw them over the portal platform as if he was a superman quarterback, treating the tree logs as a ball.
"…"
The crowd remained silent. They backed away while they continued to observe Leo.
Leo also noticed their intentions. He kept clearing land, removing every tree he touched. This time, he ignored small bushes as they took too long to remove.
One hour later, Leo successfully removed 200 iron pine trees, clearing one-third of an acre's worth of land. He inwardly laughed as he thought of the ancient tree lovers back in the modern days. They would have cried bloody tears if they had seen Leo's deeds that day.
As the land was partly cleared, the spies from various clans could no longer hide close to the mystic realm portal. Still, they quietly observed Leo's power and took notes of his actions.
Unfortunately for them, Leo had another plan in mind. After he rearranged the 200 logs north of the portal platform, the three warehouse mannequins came to survey the area. They masterfully uprooted bushes and immortal grass, piling them nearby. Leo also returned to remove other trees.
The crowd started to notice the trend. They clicked their tongues and relocated themselves.
Leo entered beast mode that day and almost deforested the Sword Saint Forest. When the Sun went down, Leo finished uprooting the 2,000th tree. The logs piled up everywhere in the shop domain, and the workshop mannequins never stopped working.
When Leo stopped working, he admired the scenery around his shop domain by jumping 500 meters into the sky. He looked around and laughed as no tree existed near the boundary of his domain anymore.
With fewer places to hide, the stalkers were forced to keep a distance from the shop domain and sensitive structures, such as the farmlands and the mystic realm platform. Still, Leo was not satisfied with the result. He aimed to remove every tree, creating a border surrounding the domain.
Leo snorted and returned to the store and called it a day. He yawned and threw himself on the bed.
.
At midnight, a wooden mannequin unlocked the front door and entered the store. It looked around for a moment and entered Leo's bedroom. Noticing that Leo was sleeping soundly, it stood next to him and leaned closer to his face.
As the mannequin couldn't talk, it stood there, menacingly staring at Leo's sleeping face with two red lenses.
*SNORE*
"…"
The mannequin tilted its head. It gazed at Leo's mouth and poked it with his finger.
Leo didn't react or move.
"…"
The mannequin straightened his back. It quietly walked out of the store and picked up the bucket of Cat's mutated water. Then, it came back with the bucket.
Upon getting back to the room, the mannequin didn't splash the water on Leo. Instead, it gently poured the mutated water into Leo's mouth, one drop at a time.
It continued adding water for the entire night.
.
.
YAWN
Leo returned from his dream world, and he could feel his real body. He stretched, readying his mind for a new day.
MLEM-MLEM
For an unknown reason, his mouth was strangely moist. His throat wasn't as dry as usual. Moreover, the bitter mint taste got stuck in his mouth.
Leo squinted his eyebrows as he recognized this scent. It smelled like Cat's saliva. Because of the unusual experience, he opened his eyes.
*Insert Jojo ambient sound here*
The creepy face of the third alchemy workshop's mannequin was two centimeters away from Leo's face. It tilted its head 45 degrees while its red eyes shone.
"…"
Leo didn't utter a sound as he wasn't afraid of ghosts or monsters. He was simply speechless by the first sight in the morning. After allowing his brain to process information, Leo gently pushed the wooden doll's face away and sat up.
"Are you out of containers?"
The mannequin repeatedly nodded.
"Fine. I'll get more for you-"
CLANK-CLANK
As Leo got out of bed while he spoke, his foot accidentally kicked a certain empty bucket. Leo looked down and found the wooden bucket, which was reserved for Cat's drinking water.
Leo licked the ceiling of his gum. He thought of the nasty smell of Cat's saliva and connected the dots.
"…"
Leo was not angry at the mannequin. Instead, he thought that Cat pranked him. He facepalmed.
BOOM-BOOM-BOOM
"MEOW!!"
Meanwhile, someone had been searching for her water bucket. Cat smacked the front door and the display windows while screaming, calling Leo to come out.
PFFT
Leo snickered and picked up the bucket, toothbrush, and toothpaste. He then led the mannequin out of the store.
Another slow and peaceful morning continued.
.
.
At noon, Han Hao traveled from Magpie City to Leo's store on foot. He brought along 20 outer disciples from the sect to help Leo.
When they arrived, they were stunned by the cleared land. The Sword Saint Boulder became a part of Leo's domain as the surrounding trees were gone. It became a landmark, informing them that they were in Leo's territory.
Han Hao bitterly smiled as he couldn't complain about what Leo had done to the sacred place. He quietly led the young cultivators to the store.
Along the way, Han Hao ran into Wu Buyi, who had been concocting pills in front of his house. When their eyes met, Wu Buyi gestured to him with his eyes that he was busy.I think you should take a look at
Han Hao was an understanding man. He turned around and informed the group, "Don't disturb the elder. Follow me."
The disciples gulped and quietly saluted Wu Buyi. Then, they proceeded to the front of the store.
Among the crowd, Gao Yan also tagged along. He wanted to greet his mentor, but Wu Buyi didn't bother looking at him. In addition, upon seeing so many buildings and farms, Gao Yan was astonished that he forgot what he should speak to his master.
The mannequins still ran around like nothing had happened. The farmer bots struggled to collect potatoes in the farms while three logistic mannequins carried huge logs and potatoes to their perspective storehouses.
While the disciples gawked at the strange buildings and scenery, a mannequin with a yellow jacket and a protection helmet came out from a five-meter-wide road between the store and Wu Buyi's house. It walked past the group and picked up a piece of wooden branch and black iron pine leaves on the ground. Then, it carried them to the back of the store building.
The disciples observed them with interest. One of them peeped into the alley road and found alchemy workshop buildings behind the store.
"Wow. There's an alchemy section! Gao Yan, you're lucky!"
Gao Yan followed his friend's gaze and found the first and the second workshop. He widely grinned, "I guess I have a place to train."
"Lucky you!"
Han Hao coughed, "Be quiet."
"…Whoops."
After shutting the disciples' mouths, Han Hao deeply sighed and looked around as he couldn't find the monster plant. Instead, he detected several life signatures in the forest in the distance, and they had been observing them.
'Why are there so many lurkers around here? How many clans dispatched their agents here?'
Han Hao thought of the previous incident when Leo slaughtered the raiders. He wondered if they were related to the Fatui Cult, Ouyang Clan, or the Situ Clan. Han Hao was also afraid of the potential imperial court's agents.
After shaking his head and getting rid of unnecessary thoughts, Han Hao knocked at the door.
"Senior Florida Man, I have brought you helpers."
As soon as Han Hao made some noise, a certain monster plant came out from the granary, which was located directly behind Wu Buyi's house.
Cat peeked at the crowd while she was in the building. When she spotted someone she knew, Cat came out and immediately extorted them for nom-nom tax.
"Nom-Nom Meow?"
"… It's you again." Han Hao laughed and ejected a dead horse from his spatial ring. He tossed the carcass to her.
Cat caught the corpse with her chomper mouth and grinned. She receded back to the granary and disappeared.
The disciples trembled in fear as some of them had never seen such a monster before. Only Gao Yan seemed indifferent to Cat.
"G-Grand Elder Han, what in the spirit's mercy is that?!"
Han Hao rolled his eyes, "Senior Florida Man's pet."
"P-P-PET!? He's keeping a monster as a pet?!"
"Get used to it. Y'all signed up to work here for spirit stones, and you'll soon live here. If you don't wanna get eaten, you'd better learn and follow Senior Florida Man's instructions."
Again, the disciples gulped. Only Gao Yan inwardly laughed at his colleagues.
A few minutes later, Leo came out from the store building. Toothbrush foam stained his mouth and beard as he brushed his teeth 8th time today.
"Oh, it's you."
Leo looked at the crowd behind Han Hao. Noticing a familiar face, Leo grinned.
"Good to see you again, Gao Yan. Have you gotten better?"
Gao Yan dryly laughed, "I haven't learned much from my master. He keeps disappearing."
"Oh, my bad. He has been working here."
"…"
Everybody glanced at Wu Buyi, who was still busy with his cauldron. But while everybody paid attention to him, Wu Buyi finished his batch of pills.
BOOM
15 high-grade yang flame dans came out. However, Wu Buyi was not satisfied with his work. He mumbled to himself while he looked at the open scroll on the ground, which he had taken notes from what he had learned from observing the mannequin alchemists.
"My essence is lacking. I don't have all the necessary essence like those golems. Also, something isn't right during the merging process. I don't have enough Qi to sustain the other half of the pot. Damn, alchemy is hard!"
Wu Buyi grumbled and looked up. Then, his eyes met with Gao Yan.
"Disciple! You've come at the right time. Come with me! We'll go and learn the new concoction method from a grandmaster golem! Bring your goddamn notes!"
"Eh?"
Gao Yan couldn't even react. Wu Buyi dragged him to the first alchemy workshop to learn the techniques by observing.
Leo and Han Hao stared at them and shook their heads in unison. Then, they proceeded with their talk.
"So, are they the workers? I don't have to pay them, right?" Leo seized up the people behind Han Hao. The crowd was embarrassed, and they lowered their heads.
"Yes, senior. The sect will provide the salary. But if you can, please provide them basic needs, such as a place to rest or cultivate. If better, please give them some bonuses, such as some of your pills."
"Eh, I'm not a cheapskate. I have plenty of element grain pills and rejuvenate tea to feed them for a thousand years."
"…"
Han Hao was inwardly envious of the disciples. He gulped and whispered, "T-Then, can I have a few bottles of rejuvenate tea for the trouble?"
Leo sneered and walked back to the store. He then came out with four bottles of cold tea.
Han Hao received them in glee. But when he noticed the quality and the color, he was surprised.
"Wait a second, senior. Isn't your tea…THE PINNACLE GRADE?!"
Leo puffed his chest, "Damn straight. My tea is the pinnacle of all tea! Hahahaha!"
.
.
"…"
Standing in front of the third workshop cauldron was the alchemy mannequin. He overheard the conversation and turned his head 180 degrees. Then, his eyes gleamed as if he wanted to protest Leo that he made them.
.
Pinnacle Grade Rejuvenate Tea
- Evolve bone marrow and blood cells.
- Decrease physical age by 20 years per liter.
- Increase metabolism by 100% for 480 hours.
- Remove cancer cells.

chapters.title: Chapter 72 Florida Man Mistakes Emperor Envoy As Ohio Man, Offends The Officials
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 72 – Florida Man Mistakes Emperor Envoy as Ohio Man, Offends the Officials
Leo guided the disciples and Han Hao to the store's ground floor.
"Welcome to Narnia," he cackled.
"…"
The crowd dropped their jaws as the space in the building was massive, and there was a second floor. They believed that it was as big as the entire cleared land.
However, one thing puzzle them – Aside from a partitioned room, the rest of the store was empty, including the other 19 blank rooms.
"Senior, something is wrong with your building. How come it's empty?" Han Hao couldn't help but ask.
"That's because the workers will be very busy here."
Leo looked at the young men behind Han Hao. He counted their heads. Coincidentally, there were 19 of them, which was equal to the number of available partitioned rooms.
"See the empty lots?" Leo pointed at the empty rooms, "These will be the place for you to stay. Pick one to be your temporary home. I'll build a proper abode for you later. By the way, you have 100 breaths to unload your belongings and pick your place. Gather here when you're done."
"EH?!"
The disciples were taken aback. They thought that they would have to build their own shelters or live in the forest. Instead, they got a place to sleep under the rooftop.
Because of the time limit, the disciples started running around to choose their place. As they wore straw sandals and cloth shoes, they brought a lot of mud and dirt from the forest to the store, dirtying the floor.
Leo glanced at the floor. Then, his expression was dark. A moment later, he beamed Han Hao with a bright smile as he remembered that he got free henchman.
Han Hao noticed the creepy smile. He cupped his fist and excused himself, "Since I've delivered the manpower, I'll be taking my leave."
"I see. I won't send you off. Be careful on the way back. There are too many eyes around here."
"… I can tell."
ραΠdαsΝοvel.cοm Han Hao left the building and flew back to the sect.
.
After the disciples finished picking their places, they gathered in front of Leo. They were ready to work and earn their keep.
Looking at the young men, Leo summoned their status menu to see their names and lifespan. They also got to see their value for the first time.
<Remaining Lifespan: 137 Years…>
<Remaining Lifespan: 171 Years…>
<Remaining Lifespan: 145 Years…>
Their lifespan varied, depending on their cultivation base and talent. As most of them were still Qi Condensation cultivators, none of them surpassed 200.
Leo thought of Yao Qiqi as that girl who had better potential than these disciples. He wondered how much lifespan she would have if once she reached the pinnacle of her potential.
PA
Leo clapped his hands once to remove the thoughts and get the disciples' attention. He briefed them about the nature of this store.
"As you can see, everybody has a lifespan, and I can let you see them. My store also uses lifespan as a currency. Oh, don't worry. We accept spirit stones too, but my items are very expensive."
The disciples dropped their jaws and gawked at the floating system screens in front of them. They also compared their lifespans with their colleagues, and they made fun of each other for having fewer years to live.
"AHEM!"
The disciples stopped making fun of their friends and looked at Leo after the cough. Then, Leo resumed the briefing.
"For now, I want you to start mobbing the floor. I'll provide you with the tools, of course. Also, next time you enter the store, take off ya goddamn shoes!"
"…"
Everybody looked at the floor and found their dirty footprints on the white marble floor. They gulped as the mud and dirt were everywhere.
Meanwhile, Leo secretly purchased mops and water buckets. Then, he passed them to the disciples.
"Start cleaning. I'll be back in a few hours. Oh, if you need water, you can get some in the public toilet next to the storeroom, aka my freaking bedroom. Oh, nobody should be in my room, or you're fired."
"…"
The public toilet that Leo had longed for appeared along with the new rooms. It came with five unisex toilet stalls and two face-washing basins. A water faucet for utility also existed under the basins, and it provided tap water even though Leo had never installed any water system.
As the disciples were confused, Leo led them to the toilet and pointed at the faucet under the basins. He showed an example by pushing the lever.
ZAAA
Clean water came out, and the disciples were shocked.
"HUH?!"
"A WATER ARTIFACT?!"
"But I don't sense Qi! HOW?!"
Leo rolled his eyes as these country bumpkins had never seen a running water system. He felt like he had time-traveled to the medieval era.
"Instead of getting surprised by everything, get your mops wet and start cleaning! DON'T FORGET TO TAKE OFF YOUR SHOES! THIS AIN'T MURICA HOUSE!"
"…"
Everybody wanted to retort that putting shoes on and off was troublesome. Still, they complied with the order and cleaned their feet with the tap water. Then, they started working.
.
After two hours of cleaning the ground floor and the second floor, Leo gathered the disciples for another task. He taught them the daily routine.
"This is the first day, so there won't be a lot of work. Still, I'm gonna teach you what you will be doing every day from now on. First, I want you to look outside the window."
Leo guided the disciples to the display window on the second floor, which had a better view of the farmlands. The disciple followed Leo to the second floor and gazed outside.I think you should take a look at
On the farmlands, three mannequins awkwardly harvested giant potatoes from the field. Then, they witnessed the massive crops that the golems pulled from the ground.
"I-Is that really a potato?! For real?!"
Leo nodded, "Real potato, damn straight."
"… Wow."
