Noticing that Leo couldn't hear her, Thora came up with an idea. She used her Qi to write on the wall. As the dust was thick, she successfully wrote the words in Chinese.
Leo paused to read the words. It looked foreign to him, but his brain comprehended them instantly as the purchased linguistic skill was at work. He waited for Thora to finish.
"Who…am I? Meh, kiddo. I am the last Floridian."
Thora kept writing.
'How do you know about the room's function?'
"Isn't that obvious? Even if I'm not an astronaut, I just know how it works. I watched sci-fi movies, you know?"
'Sai…Fai?'
WHOOSH
The inner door was opened, and Leo proceeded forward. Taxi and Thora quickly followed after Leo.
Walking further, Leo encountered something strange. After leaving the air-pressured room, Leo found a corridor. In front of him, there was a sign and the ship's map, showing his current location.
The map was easy to read. However, what shocked Leo was its language.
Everything was written in English.
An abandoned alien spaceship in a cultivation world had English?!
Something was not right about this place. Leo frowned and gazed at Thora.
"Why is English here? Who was the captain of this ship? Predator? Alien? Darth Vader? Skywalker?"
Thora smirked. She picked a section of a dusty wall and wrote.
'The spirit queen told me that her master had already passed away. She became the new owner of this place.'
"Spirit queen? Someone from your species?"
'What's sa-pee-shie?'
Leo scratched his head. He almost got a vital intelligence, but Thora seemed clueless. He retried and rephrased his words.
"Okay. Change of questions. Do you know where this ship came from?"
Thora clapped her hands and puffed her chest. She wrote big words.
'Milky Road!'
Milky?
Milky Road?
Milky Way Galaxy?
Leo's pupils dilated. He had a sick hypothesis in his mind, and he needed confirmation. Leo probed Thora again.
"Be specific. Which star? Which star system? Is it Earth from Solar System?"
'I don't know.'
Leo smacked his lips in pity as he couldn't confirm the alien spaceship's origin yet. Still, learning that it might be from the same galaxy as Earth, Leo was excited. He had a feeling that he might find other survivors or the descendants of Earthlings in one of the mystic realms in the future.
For now, Leo was curious about the spaceship. He wondered if it contained any artifact that was similar to his ring.
Leo rechecked the sign and the map. As he could read the description and the language, he found where he needed to go.
The first destination – The Bridge!
Without hesitation, Leo guided Taxi to head deeper into the ship. Thora also trailed after them as she was curious about what Leo would do in there.
A few minutes later, Leo, Taxi, and Thora reached a gate, which separated them from the hallway and the bridge. Leo looked around and noticed the dim light of a console in front of the door.
Leo swiped the dust away and looked at the monitor. There was an image of a hand on it.
"Handprint? Sure."
He put his right hand on it.
Thora giggled. She didn't believe that it would work as the console only acknowledged the realm's owner, her, and the spirit queen.
BEEP
The dim monitor brightened in green. Then, the gate was unsealed.
'Huh? Hold up! HOW?!' Thora was speechless.
Leo snickered and waltzed into the bridge. As soon as he entered, he found a tragic scene.
On the bridge, seven dried human skeletons in tight spacesuits still sat on their seats. Another dead body was on the floor, behind the center console. All skeletons were pitch black.
"Ah, never mind. I guess I won't find other humans here."
Leo was slightly disappointed. He thought he might find someone with the same language instead of local cultivators.
Still, the spacesuit looked neat. Leo stripped one of them and fluttered the suit a few times. He didn't notice that the owner of the clothes turned to dust when Leo moved it.
CRACK
Unfortunately, the suit seemed to be too old. It fell apart and crumbled to pieces.
"…"
Leo's disappointment was immeasurable, and his day was ruined. He thought he could wear some cool-looking spacesuit to flex the locals, but it was wishful thinking.
As their suits had no value, Leo turned his attention to the black skeletons. He wondered if he could use them as alchemy ingredients.
But again, as soon as Leo tried to pick them up, they turned into dust like the first corpse.
Realizing that he got nothing but dust, Leo gave up disrespecting the dead. He turned his attention to the ship's consoles next.
"Say, ghost. Can I still pilot this thing?"
Thora sneered and wrote on the ground.
'You wish! Without the spirit queen's blessing, this thing won't budge!'
"Are you sure?"
Leo noticed a few switches on a side console. They also came with labels "Engine 1", "Engine 2", "Engine 3", and so on.
Treating it as a game, Leo flipped them up, switching them on.
RUMBLE
BOOM
Something exploded and caused a tremor. Dust fell from the ceiling, and the light inside the ship was turned off.
"Whoops."
Leo bonked his head. Knowing that he had done something wrong, he stopped fiddling with a sophisticated console. After all, he couldn't even fly a plane.
'You idiot!'
Thora was enraged. She ditched Leo and flew toward the engine room, checking if the soul stone still had enough energy to generate air and purify water for the plants.
Leo also turned around and headed out. He also wondered if something exploded, and this spaceship might be on fire.
However, as soon as Leo turned around, the black dust of the black skeletons merged, forming a humanoid silhouette of a strange creature.
Leo stopped his feet as he sensed the cold stare behind him. He turned around and saw a humanoid monster, who was covered in black dust.
The dust monster had no eye or face. It simply confronted Leo and gathered more black dust around itself.
Looking at the monster, Leo was reminded of the monsters in the alien ship that he came from. He wondered if this strange creature was the byproduct of an inhuman experiment.
"What are you? Can you still talk?"
The dust monster didn't reply. It focused on gathering black dust and condensing them into a new set of skeletons.
WIGGLE
It succeeded. Its silhouette transformed into a complete human skeleton. Then, it fell to the ground as it had no ligament.
Leo gazed at the skeleton. He pulled out a tree branch from his spatial ring and poked it.
"Hey, dude. Are you still alive?"
CLATTER
The skull clattered its jaw, trying to tell Leo something. Leo also leaned closer, hoping to hear its words.
"Smash."
"…"
Leo rolled his eyes. He glanced to the left and found Taxi, who also leaned closer to the skeleton.
"Can you shut up for a second?"
"…Smash XD"
Leo shook his head and looked at the black skeleton once again. As if poking with a stick wasn't enough, he lifted it up.
The skeleton didn't turn into dust this time. Instead, Leo saw a glint of its smile even though it had no skin.
CLATTER
Its jaws clattered as if it was laughing at him. Then, the black bones melted and attached to Leo's skin.
Leo raised his eyebrows at first. A second later, he frowned.
He realized its intention now.
"Oh, boy. I guess I'm not the only one with evolved cancer cells. You, too, eh?"
The entire skeleton was a unified consciousness of undying cancer cells of the corpses. They had been waiting to devour or take over another host.
Unfortunately, they picked Leo instead of a local cultivator.
"Sorry to say this to you, but you're outnumbered, damn parasites."
Leo closed his eyes and deeply inhaled, allowing the skeleton to enter his body through his skin.

chapters.title: Chapter 117 Naked Florida Man Dances And Sings To Cheer Arson Victim After He Burnt Her House
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 117 – Naked Florida Man Dances and Sings to Cheer Arson Victim after He Burnt Her House
The parasitic cancerous cells of the skeleton vanished into Leo's body. Leo's blood cells quickly swarmed the intruders, and a war erupted inside him.
Muscle tissues and fibers were twisted and torn. Cracking arm bones let out a loud noise, warning Leo about the crisis. However, the guy ignored the pain in his broken right arm. He pulled another talisman from his left pocket and put it in his mouth, eating it as a snack.
Leo was never afraid of symbiosis creatures or microorganisms. Because of his evolved cells, his immunity system had never been defeated by random viruses, parasites, bacteria, or fungi.
CRACK
The right arm swelled and wiggled as most intruding cells were in there. As for his left arm, nothing changed as his cells already suppressed the parasites.
WIGGLE
The swelling right arm turned green. Leo glanced at it as he started to get annoyed.
A few seconds later, the arm shrank and reverted to normal. The skin's complexion restored its usual color. Unfortunately, impurity gathered in Leo's nails, causing his right hand's fingernails to turn black.
DING
<You have digested soul stone parasites.>
<Your lifespan has increased by 10,000 years.>
A smile appeared on Leo's face. At least, the reward was worth the trouble.
Nonchalantly, Leo pulled his right hand's fingernails off his fingers. He flickered one of them away, discarding it.
As soon as the nail hit the floor, it melted the metal frame, releasing acidic gas and a sizzling sound.
"Ah, crap. Are you for real? Is my body fluid the same as Aliens in movies? Even my freaking nails can melt spaceships now?"
Noticing the melting floor, Leo pulled the black nail out of the ground and looked at it. While holding it in his hand, it slightly burnt his skin.
Since the polluted fingernails might be too dangerous, Leo stored them in his spatial ring for the moment. He turned around and left the bridge.
.
After taking care of his business, Leo explored the spaceship, following the guide from the map earlier. He visited the crew cabins next.
At the back of the ship, a section was dedicated to a living quarter. Capsule beds lined up in the walls, allowing the ship's crew to sleep inside.
Looking at the cramped space, Leo couldn't imagine himself living in this spaceship. Still, he challenged his inner claustrophobia and climbed into one of the capsules for fun.
The bed was soft and comfortable if Leo didn't mind the thick layer of dust and trillions of dust mites.
"I should build these for my employees later. I don't think the apartment is enough for a couple thousand people."
Leo wondered if he could build another apartment or a living quarter for more people as the current facilities in his system domain were insufficient to house at least a thousand people from Amazonian Sanctuary and Life Sword Sect. He might have to manually build a resident for them.
After leaving the capsule, Leo patted his clothes. He searched for the crew's belongings if they had some useful sci-fi tools or interesting weapons to use.
Thinking of weaponry, Leo had an idea.
"If this spaceship came from the US, they should at least have firearms or an armory onboard."
Leo snickered and scanned through the drawers, cabinets, and crates in the living quarter. It didn't take long for Leo to find unknown objects.
He found a metallic tube with a button. Leo pressed on it, but it did nothing. There were three others. However, Leo couldn't make it work for some reason.
After shaking and slapping one of them a few times, something came off the metallic tube.
TOK-TOK
A small black crystal bounced and rolled on the floor. When Leo found it, he raised his eyebrows in bemusement.
It was an essence stone. However, its energy was already depleted.
"So, I need an essence stone? Alrighty, then!"
Leo mimicked Jim Carrey's expression and ejected a spirit stone from his spatial ring. He grabbed the stolen spirit stone and shouted at it, again, copying the actor's iconic voice.
"My brother in Christ! BEHOLD ZE MIRACLE!"
The spirit stone glittered and transformed into an essence stone. Its energy was filled with Leo's element essence and his life force.
After getting a brand new essence stone, Leo fiddled with the unknown stick, inserting the stone back in.
Five minutes later, Leo finally learned how the tool worked. He twisted the handle, which revealed s small hole to insert the stone, aka a battery. After putting the essence stone in, Leo pressed the button again.
FZZKKRRRGG
The lightsaber was activated. Its red color and its sci-fi sound effect stunned Leo.
"Isn't this a freaking lightsaber? Ha… Hahahaha! Oh, dear lord. I have a freaking lightsaber in a Chinese fantasy world! What the hell?!"
Playing with the lightsaber, Leo swung it around, pretending to be a master Jedi. However, he accidentally sliced capsule beds nearby and left carnage behind.
Playing enough, Leo flipped the switch and deactivated the lightsaber. He quickly stored it in his spatial ring. However, having one wasn't enough.
Leo scoured and gathered more broken lightsaber handles. He chortled like a maniac while he broke more crates and cabinets in the area, searching for more.
After 10 minutes, Leo only secured 10 lightsabers. He was slightly disappointed, but he was still excited to find more useful futuristic tools from this spaceship.
When Leo left the cabin area, Thora returned to him. She didn't look happy.
'The air circulation machine is broken because of you. The plants are going to die soon,' Thora wrote the wall in anger.
Leo stroked his beard, "Air circulation? Plants? Well, instead of growing those plants in here, how about I bring those plants to my domain?"
'Yes, please. Well, if you can access the engine room, that is. You still need the spirit queen's permission to access the other restricted area.'
Thora paused for a moment. She frowned as she remembered that the crew cabin area was also restricted. Even Gao Yan couldn't enter here when he tried earlier.
'By the way, how did you get in here?' Thora had a bad feeling about this.
Leo shrugged, "I just can. Well, same-old, same-old. I just scanned my fingerprints and hands on the console, and voila!"
The corners of Thora's mouth twitched. She had a wild guess, but she prayed that it wouldn't be the case. Still, for the sake of confirmation, she guided him to the engine room.
'Follow me.'
"Okie, dokie. By the way, does this spaceship have an armory? Where did the former crew store the guns?"
Thora had no idea what Leo was talking about. She scoffed and ignored him.
Seeing the girl's reaction, Leo shook his head. He stopped making jokes and walked through the dark corridor, proceeding toward the engine room.
.
When the duo was close to the engine room, they came across thick black smoke and extreme heat. Leo's green eyes and nostrils braced the toxic as he stomped toward the burning engine room.
"Oh, boy. Nobody here has a fire extinguisher, I see."
Leo pointed his finger in front of him and ordered his cancer cells to produce water for him.
ZAAAA
A high-pressure water stream came out from Leo's index finger like a laser beam. He let out a long sigh and sprayed water everywhere to reduce the heat.
When Leo got closer to the engine room, he saw a trace of blue flame, which was burning something behind the room. As electronic devices wouldn't work, Leo ignored the console and walked toward the sealed metal door.
Without hesitation, Leo punched it.
BOOM
Bad idea.
As soon as the door was blasted and allowed the air to flow out of the engine room, a sea of flame flooded Leo, devouring him whole. Even the water from Leo's index finger was suppressed.
The blue flame burnt his clothes, but it couldn't do anything to his skin. Leo snorted and changed his approach, commanding his cancer cells to unleash his water element essence and create more water.
ZAAAA
A tsunami came out from Leo's body, entering the engine room.
ZAAAP
Unfortunately, by doing so, Leo got zapped by an unknown source of electricity. He felt like he was hit by a green tribulation lightning bolt.
A mild electric current didn't faze him. Leo patiently extinguished the flame and waited for the situation to be under his control.
When the fire died down, Leo stopped producing water. While butt naked, Leo walked into the ruined engine room to check the ship's condition.
Everything in the room was reduced to metal scraps. Leo bitterly smiled as he felt guilty for flipping the wrong switches and burning the ship by accident.
Thora looked inside the room and cried. This place was once her home, and she used to live here. Without the functioning engine, no other lightning element spirit could be born.
'It's your fault, geezer! Why did you have to ruin my home?!'
Leo couldn't hear Thora. He explored the destroyed engine room and found a pedestal, which stored a large crystal ball inside a glass container. However, the glasses were already melted, leaving only the fist-sized crystal ball.
Leo frowned and rubbed its surface, wondering what it was.
VIING
As soon as Leo touched it, its property changed. Some of his element essences recharged its energy.
WHOOSH
The soul stone changed color from black to green. Then, it emanated green lightning branches everywhere.
'Eh?! HOW?!'
Thora was shocked as Leo just recharged the soul stone's energy to the max with one touch. As for Leo, he still had no clue what it was for as he hadn't researched this item yet.
"Eh… It wasn't me!" Leo laughed, denying his responsibility. Still, he grabbed the soul stone and stored it in his spatial ring. "Welp, we're done here. Let's go to other places and rescue your little plants."
While flabbergasted, Thora kept staring at Leo's face. When she came back to her senses, she wrote the floor to ask Leo the most important question.
'Geezer, are you the new owner of this realm? Did you kill the Rabbit Trent King?'
"How did you know?" Leo proudly grinned, "I thought I hadn't told anybody."
'You…'
Thora pointed her finger at Leo's face, but she gave up commenting on anything else. She was mentally exhausted.
'Fine. Let's take the plants out, and we're leaving. There's nothing to see here.'
Again, Leo couldn't hear her. He Gangnam-styled his way to the plant chamber, trying to cheer her up.
The weird sight of a buffed elderly man dancing made Thora smile. She shook her head and secretly cursed him.
'Dumb geezer.'
"OP-OP-OP OPPAN Gangnum Style!"

chapters.title: Chapter 118 Florida Man Murders 10 Elders And Bring Their Corpses Home For Food
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 118 – Florida Man Murders 10 Elders and Bring Their Corpses Home for Food
After dancing enough, Leo stopped playing around. He salvaged the burnt clothes to search for his precious talismans, which he had stuffed into his pants pockets.
The pants were burnt to a crisp. When Leo found it, he bitterly smiled.
The talismans were gone with the flame.
"Haiya…"
Leo smacked his forehead and lamented in silence. He proceeded to the next destination with a broken heart.
.
Hydroponics Lab
Because the air ventilation and machines stopped working, the room was too quiet. Without a source of light, everything was pitch black.
After putting on a new t-shirt and jeans, Leo explored the lab and inspected the plant factory here. Using his night sight, Leo navigated through the wreck and collected every plant he found.
'Take these too, geezer.'
Thora pointed at the broken lab capsule machine, which was once the home of the spirit queen. Although the machine had long ceased functioning, it still held a lot of sentimental value for Thora.
Leo took the machine in his spatial ring. He lost count of how many objects he stored in those dimensional pockets, but they were almost full to the brim. As the space was limited, Leo stored some of the plants in the ring, where he had kept the eyeball and the dragon fruit trees.
Other than the plants, nothing else was worth Leo's attention. He looked at Thora.
"Anything else?"
'No. That will be all.'
"What about guns and armory? I want my railgun and laser guns!"
'There is nothing like that!'
Leo sighed and shook his head. He muttered in pity, "How uncultured and primitive. What kind of spaceship doesn't bring guns and weapons for the crew? Haiya."
'…'
.
After touring enough, Leo and Thora opened the door and came out of the ship. While walking out, Leo turned around to give the spaceship a meaningful look.
'It's different from THAT spaceship. This one might have come from Earth, but who knows which Earth or dimension it came from. One thing is for sure, the spaceship I know wasn't this fragile. It endured red lightning bolts a hundred times before it collapsed.'
Leo gave up the idea of bringing the spaceship to his domain. He left it there for the time being as his spatial rings were full.
Coming out of the ship, Leo found Wu Buyi, Taxi, and Gao Yan, who had been waiting for them.
"Let's go home. We're done here."
Wu Buyi was reluctant to leave this mystic realm. He scratched his arms and face as he was nervous.
"My lord, can we stay a bit longer? I haven't cultivated enough."
"Then, who asked you to fap all day long?"
Wu Buyi lowered his head, ashamed of what he did.
"Don't worry. Y'all can come back here and cultivate to your heart's content. When we get back, I'll set up a permanent portal for you to return here. This world belongs to me, and we can do whatever we want to it."
Wu Buyi's eyes gleamed. He repeatedly nodded as he had faith in Leo and his mysterious power, "Yes, my lord! Let's go home!"
Leo hopped on Taxi's back and led the group out of the cave.
.
.
Leo, Wu Buyi, Gao Yan, Thora, and Taxi left the manmade underground cave and returned to their campsite. They ignored local monsters, such as cockatrices, black caimans, giant wasps, and oversized tarantula spiders.
While they flew in the sky, they crossed paths with another group of 10 soul transformation cultivators.
Gao Yan nervously looked at the group of strong cultivators at a distance. Wu Buyi also sweated profusely, but Taxi, Thora, and Leo remained expressionless.
The 10 soul transformation cultivators also avoided them. They took a detour and kept their distance. Still, they continued traveling south, heading to the artificial cave that Leo had come from.
After they parted ways without chatting, Leo glanced at the group. He then asked Wu Buyi.
"Say, have we collected all corpses and their gears before we left?"
Wu Buyi brightly smiled. He showed Leo the spatial rings of the second prince and his entourage, "They're right here, my lord. As for their clothes and armor, they are inside my spatial ring."
"Good job. That's a relief."
Wu Buyi tilted his head. He looked at the team of strong cultivators, wondering why Leo was wary of them.
"What's wrong, my lord? Are you worrying about something? Are you afraid that they might find out?"
"Nah," Leo scoffed. "I was more concerned about the loot. It would have been a waste if we forgot to take their rings and their precious lifespan papers. Speaking of which, I need to eat more."
Leo stuck his hands into his jeans' pockets only to discover that they were empty.
"Ah…"
He suddenly had a flashback. He remembered that he no longer had the talismans in his pockets. Thus, he scanned his spatial rings, searching if he still had some leftovers in there.
Fortunately, a stack of 20 talismans was in one of the rings. Leo put them there when he collected the random drops from the dead people, and he forgot about them.
Leo almost had a heart attack. He let out a long sigh of relief that he didn't accidentally destroy all of them because of his greed. He ejected one of them out and chewed it as usual.
.
.
Leading the group of nine soul transformation cultivators was Yan Luo, the first prince of the Yan Empire. He was a grey-haired elder, but his eyebrows and long full beard were still black.
Unlike the second prince, the first prince, Yan Luo, didn't wear fancy clothes or artifacts. He donned himself in patched robes as if he was a commoner or a beggar. He also carried a wooden staff, which was made from sacred wood.
This elderly prince glanced at Leo's group and bitterly smiled. He let out a long sigh when Leo didn't bother with them.
"I guess my brother is already dead."
When Yan Luo mentioned the death of the second prince, the bodyguards gulped. They stared at Leo's group in wary and fear.
"Is that elder really a quasi-immortal, your highness?"
Yan Luo nodded, "Very likely. My brother never spared the weak or made friends with stronger cultivators. He always relied on Situ Clan's talismans like the third-rated assassin group from the Ouyang Clan. Whenever he quarreled with stronger seniors, he always used those talismans to kill them."
The group wryly smiled. They had heard the rumor about the second prince's personality before, but hearing it from their lord had a different vibe.
"That group came out from the place that my brother visited, so they must have met. Knowing my brother's personality, he must have tried to rob those people one way or another. Since they've come out first without a trace of combat…"
Yan Luo sighed. He had planned to kill Yan Long for a long time, but someone did it for him.
"He finally swallowed more than he could chew. Suit him right."
The first prince burst into laughter while he led his men toward the artificial cave. He pointed his staff at the metal dome.
"Go in and explore. Since we're here, we should be nice and bring their corpses back home."
The nine cultivators nodded and rushed into the cave.
A few minutes later, Yan Luo and his men found the abandoned spaceship. However, they didn't find the corpses of the second prince's people. Everybody walked around the ship while they scanned the cave, searching for the track of Yan Long.
As they searched, one of them picked up a couple warm bullet shells. They brought them and presented them to Yan Luo.
"Your Highness. We've detected strong wood element essence in these metal cylinders. I think they were new."
Yan Luo picked them up and flipped them in his hands. He also detected the remnant of Leo's aura.
SIZZLE
After holding them for a few seconds, Yan Luo's hands were charred. He dropped the shells and rubbed his palms.
"Your Highness?!"
Yan Luo deeply inhaled and circulated his Qi. A few seconds later, the charred parts were slightly healed, but he lost a layer of his skin.
"Those cylinders are not made from wood or metal element essence," Uttered Yan Luo.
"What do you mean, Your Highness?"
Yan Luo's eyes glinted as he studied the aura of the shells on the ground. He solemnly looked at his men.
"This is the power of dao or the work of a sentient dao avatar. Either that quasi-immortal used an artifact or a secret technique, I'm sure Yan Long died here. I think they might have taken their corpses with them."
"…"
The group gulped. They wondered who that elder was as he boldly stole the corpses of imperial guards and the second prince. This didn't include the crime of murdering a royalty.
There was only one way to find out.
"It doesn't matter. Someone from the imperial palace will use Yan Long's life candle to identify the murderer and how they died anyway. We don't need to do anything. By the way, does anyone have a spatial ring that can store this massive artifact?"
Yan Luo smiled and pointed at the spaceship. He added, "We're bringing this thing to the palace. We already found two, and we are close to learning the lost techniques from those artifacts. Maybe, this one will help our scholars at home."
The bodyguards stopped worrying about the second prince's group and looked at the spaceship. As it wasn't their first time handling this order, they brought out their ropes to tie the ship. Two of them flew toward the ceiling and began digging a hole even though the roof was manmade.
Soon, they pried open the dome. Then, everybody carried the entire spaceship as if they were supermen. Yan Luo laughed and guided his men to their portal near the pagoda town.
.
.
Leo's group reached the camp unhindered. When they arrived, they found the ransacked shacks and destroyed cooking utensils.
Wu Buyi and Gao Yan grumbled as those tools were gifts from Leo. On the other hand, Leo thought of the people they saw.
"Eh, this world is full of thieves," Leo complained. "Welp. We can't help it. There's no law here, and people can use superpowers. Since everybody abuses their powers as they see fit, the country is in anarchy. What a beautiful civilization. This world should get nuked once or twice so that they can understand the hardship of having no peasant to provide them food or services."
"…"
Wu Buyi and Gao Yan gave Leo a weird look. Both of them didn't understand what he meant, but they could feel his killing intent rising. They also secretly prayed for whoever made Leo angry.
'May they rest in pieces in hell.'
'Even Yama can't save you now.'
Leo didn't bother scavenging for remaining tools and usable utensils. He touched the blue portal, and the system prompted him with a message.
<Will you return to the domain?>
<You have completed all objectives, and you are the master of this mystic realm. When you return you can build a new portal, which can permanently link between your domain and this world.>
Leo ignored the message. He was mentally exhausted, and he needed a good night's rest on a warm bed.
"Bring me home."
<Affirmative.>
The portal was unsealed, and Leo's hand sank into the energy portal. He took a step and entered it.
Wu Buyi, Thora, Gao Yan, and Taxi also followed suit. They obtained enough treasures and stories to tell their friends for months.
After crossing the gate, Leo and the group returned to the floating platform with the four heavenly demons. When their eyes adjusted to the light, the first sight they saw was the pride of cowering thunder unicorns, which had been trapped in a square cube.
"Smash?"
Taxi sneered at his friends and family. He didn't even try to ask them why they got into that position.
"SMASH!"
The other ponies cried and begged Taxi for help. They also pointed their hooves at the four giant statues.
Meanwhile, Leo laughed at the horses. He was also relieved that the dangerous monsters didn't go on a rampage or try to molest Cat.
Thinking of Cat, Leo's eyes swept through the platform. However, he couldn't see the giant wasps and cockatrices that he had thrown here.
Leo facepalmed. It wasn't hard to guess who stole them.
"Nom-Nom Meow, I see."

chapters.title: Chapter 119 Warrant Issued On Florida Man Again After His Missing Man-Eating Cat Found In Church Along With Half-Eaten Priests
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 119 – Warrant Issued on Florida Man Again after His Missing Man-Eating Cat Found in Church Along With Half-Eaten Priests
"Who's doing this to y'all?"
Leo inspected the transparent cage that trapped the horses. He stroked the smooth surface of the cube.
The four statues glanced at Leo and grinned. The cat-octopus statue secretly chanted a spell, dispelling the trap array.
Munya!
The transparent cage vanished like smoke. The thunder unicorns cried and surrounded Leo, thanking him for freeing them.
"Alright. Alright. Calm your tits, damn donkeys! Let's come down and arrange a place for you to stay. Also, we need to set some rules so that you won't accidentally kill my employees down there."
Leo ordered the unicorns and Taxi to sit around him while he gave them a brief lecture about the domain's rules.
First, they could not harm Leo and his employees unless it was self-defense.
Second, thunder unicorns were obliged to protect the facilities, employees, and guests of Leo's domain. Against hostile intruders, they were allowed to use deadly force as long as they wouldn't damage the store and other buildings.
Third, they had to treat their comrades, Leo, and his employees with respect. Bullying and sexual harassment would not be tolerated.
Fourth, thunder unicorns, including Taxi, could explore outside the domain at their own risk. In case they caused trouble, Leo and his employees would not be held responsible for their actions. However, in case they were attacked first and were forced to flee to the domain, they could ask Leo to help them if necessary.
Fifth, each thunder unicorn would receive a fixed wage per day by choosing one of the following choices; 10 stalks of immortal grass, 10 yin cabbages, 10 bottles of rejuvenate tea, or one essence stone.
Taxi and others agreed to the terms as protecting Leo's territory was a simple task. After all, they could laze around and wait to receive free food easily. All unicorns inwardly laughed.
"Smashishishishishi."
"Smashishishishishi!"
"SMASHSHISHISHI!"
After seeing how cocky they were, Leo imposed the sixth condition.
"As you know, I'm an alchemist, and I need some ingredients to make pills. Coincidentally, I need unicorn horns. Therefore…"
Taxi and the other unicorns closed their mouths. They sweated profusely.
"I won't ask for much, but I will need one of you to sell me your horn. Of course, I'll pay you with whatever you want from the store, be it extra food or pills that I made."
Taxi and the unicorns gulped as their horns were their pride and social status. Trimming it or cutting it was like a death sentence in their social life.
However, Leo's offer tempted the elderly unicorns. A few of them already mated with their partners, and they no longer needed the horns to find mates. One of them trotted in front of the group and gazed at Leo.
Leo gazed back at the elderly unicorn. Curious, he summoned a lifespan status to check its age.
.
Name: Nameless Thunder Unicorn
Age: 4,487 Years
Remaining Lifespan: 512 Years, 11 Months, 29 Days, 11 Hours, 49 Minutes
.
"Wow."
Leo was surprised to see a real elder among the ponies. It was over 4,000 years old, and its physique was toner than the others. However, it didn't look as energetic as Taxi and the younger unicorns.
The nameless unicorn lowered its head and rubbed it against Leo's face, showing affection and trust.
Leo bitterly smiled. He patted its head in return, "You do realize that my body is poisonous, right? You could have died had your immunity system and DNA failed on you."
"Smash…"
"You don't care? Well, I do care for my friends and family. I don't want to accidentally kill you by touching you. Anyway, back to the topic, it's not like I want your entire horn. I just need the tiny tip."
The elder unicorn's horn was over a meter long, and it curved upward like an elephant's tusk. As it was too long for the 2-meter-tall pony, a portion of it was covered in dirt. Leo patted the dirt and mud off to see its real beauty.
CRACK
Before Leo could pick the part he wanted, the elder unicorn's horn glowed in silver light and broke in half!
"Hold up! I didn't say that I want that now!"
"…Smash :P"
"Yeah, too late. I know. Oh, dear. Does it hurt?" Leo checked the wound to see if the unicorn was in pain. He thought of making a new batch of elixir grain pills to heal it."
"Smash :D"
The elder unicorn smiled. The next moment, it gathered lightning essence in its horn. The wound mended, and a portion of its horn regrew. Although it failed to restore the horn's size and shape at the moment, it would soon restore its former glory in a few weeks.
Leo was relieved to learn that the unicorns could regrow their horns. He stroked the pony's head.
"Thanks, buddy. I'll give you extra food today. What do you want?"
"Smash :D" The elder wanted a mountain of dragon fruits.
"Dragon fruits? Fine. I'll bring you some. Also, do you need a name?"
"Smash XD"
"Okay. Then. Since I call that idiot Fake Taxi, you will be known as P***hub!"
"… Smash? D:" The elder unicorn found the name weird.
"Don't worry. This name is very unique. It also has a nice meaning to it!" Leo bashfully smiled and gave it a thumbs up.
.
After naming the elderly unicorn, the others also wanted their unique names, and Leo satisfied their desire. However, nobody realized where their origins came from.
OnlyF***, Xvi***, Nh***ai, R***34, those iconic names were famous in Leo's world as only cultured men and women would know. There were others, but Leo simply gave them some actresses' names that he remembered.
After the naming ceremony was complete, Leo guided the crowd to the ground. The unicorns cheered and jumped down along with Leo.
While they were gliding and descending, Leo finally noticed the change in geography and landscape. At the southwest of his domain, there was a humongous trench, threading from the southwest of the farmland to the south.
Leo landed and rushed to see the giant hole. He looked into the pit in confusion at first. But when he recalled the order that he had given to some mannequins a week ago, Leo smacked his forehead.
"Did those idiots keep digging because I didn't tell them when to stop?!"
Annoyed, Leo turned around and ordered Wu Buyi to bring the horses to the northwest area of the domain to settle there. He then jumped into the pit to measure the depth.
Falling three kilometers deep, Leo landed at the bottom of the massive hole. He looked up to see the rays of light from above as it was dark in there.
Looking at the scenery from below, Leo thought of the Grand Canyon as this place reminded him of the bottom of those tall canyons and plateaus. Two tall cliffs and the deep trench created a path to the south.
Leo sprinted and followed the pathway. He wondered if this deep trench would continue until the edge of his domain.
Exceeding his expectation, the path continued outside the domain boundary. After traveling two kilometers, Leo still couldn't see the end of the trench.
As Leo couldn't measure the length efficiently by looking at it from below, he kicked the ground and jumped off the canyon. Leo landed on the surface first. Then, he jumped again so that he could see where the trench's other end was.
After jumping to the sky, Leo could get a clear picture of the canyon's pathway. It was connected to a river. However, that river was also dried by an unknown cause.
Coming down, Leo leaped toward the dried river. He wondered if the mannequins unknowingly worked until they reached that area. When Leo arrived, he found five of his mannequins digging the trench with their shovels.
'Since when had I bought them shovels?'
Leo scratched his head. He didn't remember giving them shovels.
When Leo looked at them carefully, he noticed that they weren't actually shovels. The things in their hands were makeshift shovels, made from spear shafts and metal plates.
"Dudes. Where did you get those?" Leo approached the bots and asked them. He forgot that they couldn't speak.
One of them stopped working and menacingly stared at Leo with two glowing red eyes. The others also did the same, surrounding him.
Fortunately, Leo wasn't scared of creep dolls. He patted their heads, "That's enough work. I ordered you to dig a fish pond, but you freaking created the Grand Canyon. What were you thinking?"
The mannequins tilted their heads in unison. Then, they pointed at the river.
"???"
Leo couldn't understand them. He also tilted his head, mimicking their gesture.
While Leo was confused, his dao avatar came out from his body. He stood in front of the crowd and looked at them for a moment. He then turned around and acted as their translator.
'Silly master, they said they were digging a fish pond as you asked.'
"But why it's so deep and big?!"
The mannequin turned to the workers. While turning its back to Leo, the avatar's shoulders trembled as if it was laughing.
'That's what she said.'
"…"
Leo flinched for a minute as he didn't expect to hear that joke in this world. He took a deep breath, handling it like a pro.
"Okay. You got me. But it's too big."
'That's what she said.'
"…"
Leo raised his hands and turned around, secretly venting his frustration. After reeling in his emotion, he smiled at his avatar and avoided the trap.
"What are they doing?"
'Tsk.'
"Don't "Tsk" me. Tell me what they were doing?"
'Fine.'
The dao avatar pointed at the dried river. Leo also looked at it.
'There was plenty of water when the mannequins reached here. But when they were about to direct the waterway to the trench, some black-clothed cultivators attacked them. Cat joined the fight, and they managed to repel the attackers.'
Leo narrowed his eyes. He rechecked the conditions of the workers.
Fortunately, no clear damage had been inflicted on them. They looked brand new.
"How did they survive? I remember that they aren't combatants."
'Meh, those cultivators were weak. Anything under the immortal stage can't possibly hurt them… they said.'
Leo nodded in approval. If they were this strong, he could leave dangerous tasks with them, "Excellent. Well, where is Cat, by the way? What happened to her?"
The mannequins lowered their heads. The dao avatar's expression was also gloomed.
'They said… Cat has been captured by those guys.'
"WHAT?!"
Something didn't make sense there. Since these mannequins were stronger than average cultivators in this world, they should have been able to protect or repel random thieves and robbers. Leo couldn't understand how Cat got abducted when these mannequins were invincible.
"If these guys said they are stronger than everybody here, how come she got captured?"
The dao avatar shook his head, 'It's not their fault. It's hers.'
"How so?" Leo was confused.
'They said that… she… deliberately allowed herself to be captured, and she told these guys not to help her.'
"…"
'…For the sake of nom-nom meow.'
"…"
Leo facepalmed. It took him five minutes to restore his sanity to ask another question.
"Where is she now? Where did she go?"
The mannequins pointed at the southwest. The dao avatar also looked in that direction and translated their thoughts.
'Fatui Cult.'

chapters.title: Chapter 120 Homeless Florida Man Arrested For Taking A Bath
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 120 – Homeless Florida Man Arrested for Taking a Bath
Underground beneath the Frozen Fire City hid an underground city. A total of 2,000 cultists lived there, using it as a hideout and a secret ritual site, avoiding the eyes and ears of Yan Xiang Emperor.
The ruler of this place was none other than Yan Zhu, the third prince. In addition, this place was the true headquarters of the Fatui Cult, where their cultivators practiced black arts and forbidden techniques.
Sacrificial altars, giant cauldrons full of human blood, rundown torture tools, and dry bloodstains were common there. Cultivators usually traveled back and forth between the Frozen Fire City and their underground headquarters, shipping and importing new slaves, monsters, and orthodox cultivators that they had captured.
Among the caravans, a cart carried a large cage, which trapped a monster inside. However, the people accompanying the wagon kept their distance from the monster.
Sitting in a cage, a chomper plant monster chewed a cultivator's corpse in glee. This was the sixth person that got too close to her cage.
A hundred golden core cultivators escorted the caged monster while 20 nascent soul cultivators walked in front of them. Everybody wore black robes and black cone masks, revealing only their eyes and hands.
It was already a miracle that their platoon managed to capture Cat with their meager strength. At the moment, Cat was a 7th-stage monster, which should have been so strong that no nascent soul cultivators could have been her opponent. Yet, she was easily captured and brought there.
Several of the cultivators thought that their teamwork successfully suppressed the monster. However, the reality told a different story.
While sitting in the cage, Cat periodically and randomly snatched escorting cultivators into her cage and ate them alive.
"Nom-Nom Meow?"
Again, Cat's vines lashed at lightning speed, extending from inside her cage and latching on five escorting golden core cultivators behind the wagon. She then pulled them into the cage and peeled their clothes like bananas. A few seconds later, the gory scene and the bone-crunching sound made the escorting cultivators turn away in disgust and fear.
"Damn monster."
One of the cultists grudgingly glared at Cat. He believed that the monster pretended to lose and got herself captured intentionally.
"Not for long, monster. Those sacred wood on your body will become fine weapons for our elders. Your monster core and all your body parts will be refined! We will make sure that you will die as painfully as possible!"
Cat ignored the angry man and chewed the five men earlier. After swallowing their blood, flesh, and bones, she burped and released green gas from her mouth.
The gas was just her breath, but it smelled worse than rotting human corpses mixed with the smelliest wet feces of elders with constipation issues and intestine cancer.
Cultivators in this world improved their inner Qi and five senses through training and cultivation. When the nasty smell came out, they covered their nose and mouth. Their faces turned purple, and a dozen of them vomited.
"Goddammit! Can somebody put that monster to sleep or kill it?!"
"S-Sir, but our weapons did nothing to its skin when we fought it."
"Ah! You're useless! Use flame element techniques! Watch this!"
A nascent soul cultivator stepped forward and summoned his dao avatar. A flame spirit emerged from his body and pointed its palm toward Cat.
"Nom-Nom Meow?"
Cat turned around and thrust two vines toward the cultivator. She grabbed him and pulled him toward her cage. Without peeling his clothes, she opened her mouth, baring her thousand teeth.
"NOOOO!!"
CHOMP!
Cat bit his head off before the dao avatar could even use a dao technique. Its spiritual physique disintegrated into particles while the spirit widened its eyes in confusion.
After the nascent soul cultivator perished, nobody dared to utter another word. They silently gestured to the caravan leader to bring that monster to the underground city as soon as possible.
.
.
At the bottom of the dried river, Leo listened to his mannequin dao avatar while the latter translated the silent language of the workers.
'As for the river issue, the water actually sank into the ground that they dug. It seems they found something that drained the entire river, but they haven't searched for the source yet.'
Leo shrugged, "Where is it, then? Maybe I'll dig it out and put it in my store for sale."
The mannequin spirit turned to the workers. The latter nodded and guided the group to the place where the water disappeared into.
Leo and his dao avatar followed the workers and noticed an area with firm ground. The former lightly tapped on it to test its strength.
"Is this the place?"
'I think so.'
"Good. Let's dig then."
Leo took a makeshift shovel from one of the workers. He shoved it in and pulled a layer of dirt.
At first, his movement was clumsy and awkward. A few seconds later, Leo picked up speed. He left behind afterimages while he repeatedly threw dirt and rocky soil to the side. Some of the dirt went through the dao avatar's body by accident.
Within five minutes, Leo dug 100 meters deeper. Then, his shovel hit something hard and shiny.
Leo stopped applying forces or using the super speed. He lightly removed the dirt around the object. However, the mysterious shining blue object was bigger than Leo had imagined.
Looking at the mysterious blue gemstone, Leo rubbed his chin and pondered. Then, he smacked his forehead and jumped out of the hole.
Leo injected his Qi into one of his spatial rings. He unloaded the pharaoh's statue and edible gold coins. Then, he asked the workers.
"Bring those to the junkyard, but don't recycle them. Those are my food."
The workers nodded and began lifting the statue. They turned around and jumped in unison. A second later, they were out of the 3km-deep trench.
Leo gazed at his workers and nodded in approval. At least, they didn't need his help.
The dao avatar observed Leo and understood his intention. He looked at the spatial ring that Leo had emptied.
'Very creative.'
"Call me the master."
'Meh.'
Leo returned to the hole and touched the mysterious gemstone. He injected his Qi into the ring and the object. The next moment, the massive gemstone vanished into the ring as if it got sucked into a black hole.
When the gemstone was stored in the ring, a massive chunk of ground vanished. Leo fell further into the ground, and the soft soil nearby collapsed on him.
He was buried alive.
A second later, blasted out of the collapsed soil and got back to the bottom of the trench. His t-shirt and jeans were dark brown as the wet dirt dirtied him.
"Oh, boy. That was scary. This takes me back." Leo snickered. It was his second time getting buried alive. Fortunately, he wasn't as weak as when he got buried the first time.
At that time, Leo got struck by green lightning tribulation for the first time, and his heart stopped beating, and he could not move after the first hit. However, his brain and consciousness were intact. Leo got stuck in that state for 100 years, eating and swallowing sand, dirt, and polluted rainwater while he got buried alive by a random landslide.
It was a nightmarish experience. However, he managed to survive, and his body became immune to the green lightning bolts since then.
"Let's go home. We're done here."
'What about your pet?'
Leo looked south. He pursed his lips for a moment, wondering if he should go and rescue Cat. At first, Leo planned to go home and wait for the naughty kid to return. But when Leo recalled the pitiful cry of Cat when she was hurt, his heart wrenched.
"Haiya. Fine. You win. We'll take a short visit to Fatui Cult. By the way, did my workers tell you where she went?"
'Just use your nose and follow her scent.'
"I ain't a dog, you dumb doll. But you're right. I can smell her from here."
'…'
Leo laughed and started sniffing the air. He then looked toward the southwest direction and leaped to the sky.
.
After leaping and jumping 10 kilometers southwest, Leo found a province-sized city. The 15-meter-tall stone city walls stood tall and looked intimidating. In front of the walls, a water moat was 100 meters wide, deterring wandering monsters and thieves from reaching the bottom of the walls.
However, the tall and defensive city array was nothing to Leo. He leaped across the wall and landed on a rooftop of a wooden house. Unfortunately, his momentum was too strong, and his weight broke the wooden beams on the ceiling. He fell into the building.
Leo landed inside a bedroom. On the stone bed, a naked young man and a woman screamed in fright. Hearing their voices, Leo turned around to look at them.
Upon seeing the naked couple, Leo smiled at them.
"My bad. Just think of me as a random hailstone. Anyway, I won't disturb you. Continue."
He walked out of the room and proceeded to exit the building through the front door. While he walked out of the place, many men and women in fancy silk clothes looked at Leo's muddy t-shirt and jeans in disgust.
"Who let a beggar in here?!"
"Chase him out!"
Leo ignored the crowd. He glanced at them, but he didn't feel the presence of a cultivator or their Qi. It seemed that they were all commoners in this city.
As Leo left the building, he looked around to see what he had fallen into earlier.
It was a 10-story wooden building with medieval Chinese architecture. The sign clearly stated "Flower House", which implied a certain meaning.
This building was a brothel.
"Haiya. Even in this world, they still spread STDs and AIDS. I pity for those thirsty men."
The dao avatar came out from Leo's body and mocked him, 'You're still a virgin, though.'
"Virgin with Godzilla physique, mind you."
Leo snickered and looked around. Again, he started sniffing, tracking the scent of Cat. He walked while he looked up, causing the bystanders to give Leo a weird look.
A young boy who walked on the street with his mother pointed at Leo.
"Mom. Look! A crazy beggar!"
The mother panicked, "Don't look. Come here. Let's go."
Leo overheard it and flinched. He then looked at his dirty clothes and his arms.
They were covered in dirt and mud. Even his hair was messy because of the landslide earlier.
He needed a bath.
"Meh."
Leo put his right palm on his head. Then, a stream of water came out from his hand, pouring down on him. Using the water pressure and the freshwater, Leo washed away the dirt from his body and his face.
However, this action caused the stone road in the city to become wet. As the ancient road had no sophisticated drainage system, water gathered in several areas and created small puddles. Some of the water accidentally wet bystanders' shoes and clothes.
As Leo caused a lot of commotion, nearby commoners ran away from him and rushed to the authority outpost nearby.
"Help! A cultivator is ruining my store!"
As soon as the commoner reported it to the local guards in the outpost, they rushed to the site to find the culprit.
Meanwhile, Leo stopped pouring water on himself. He purchased a clean towel and a new set of clothes. He cleaned himself and changed into a new one while he was on the public street.
The guards spotted Leo, who was butt-naked on the road. They shouted.
"Arrest him!"

chapters.title: Chapter 121 Florida Man Outruns Cops By Mimicking Animals
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 121 – Florida Man Outruns Cops by Mimicking Animals
A group of 20 golden core cultivators blindly charged toward Leo. They ignored the strength difference and attacked with their palms in unison.
Ten palms hit Leo's chest and back while he hadn't finished changing his clothes. Their hands directly touched his skin.
"Huh?"
Leo frowned while he was in the middle of wearing a new t-shirt. He wondered what their problem was.
"What's the big deal, dudes? Can't you see that I'm changing clothes?"
The cultivators also frowned as their full-power attacks were ineffective. They then rechecked Leo's cultivation base.
The cultists' expressions turned dark as they were offended. However, none of them could see through Leo's cultivation base. The only thing they noticed was his rainbow aura.
"A soul formation cultivator?" One of them guessed Leo's strength, but it was far off.
Leo glanced at them for a moment. When he recalled that he didn't know the cult's headquarters' location, he had an idea.
"You there, boy. Are you one of those cultists? What was the name? Fatui Cult?"
The cultists flinched as if they weren't Leo's opponent. All golden core cultivators took several steps back and pulled out their weapons from their spatial rings. Realizing that they weren't Leo's opponent, one of the cultists asked Leo to de-escalate the situation.
"Senior, this is a commoner's town. Someone with your status shouldn't cause trouble here. It will affect your reputation."
Noticing how quickly their attitude changed, Leo was impressed.
"Ah, finally some smart people. I've met so many stupid cultivators that I feel sick. Or should I say, great strength comes with great idiocy? When a person is weak, that person cultivates brain cells? Too bad, they're a tat stupid. Shame."
"…"
Nobody understood what Leo mumbled about.
10 seconds later, the golden core cultists felt the burn from their palms. They looked at their hands in confusion.
Everybody's hands swelled and turned purple. Their finger bones shattered while their arms grew new boneless limbs at a rapid rate. Two seconds later, the swelling disease reached their shoulders, enlarging their muscle mass and creating new organs at random.
One of them grew a large eyeball on his shoulder as if he was a villain character in Resident Evil. Two grew ribcages from their shoulders and spinal cords while the rest got extra limbs.
The mutation process seemed to benefit the cultivators at first. But when the purple blood reached their hearts, they collapsed and stopped breathing.
Leo finally finished putting on his new clothes. He hummed and gazed at the dead mutated humans in a good mood. Sitting next to the corpses, Leo collected their bodies into his spatial ring, putting them in the same ring as the mysterious blue stone.
"Nice! Free yin fluid."
Nothing was better than free materials. Unfortunately, Leo couldn't steal their lifespan here as he was outside his domain.
After storing the dead cultivators, Leo looked around.
Surrounding Leo were hundreds of cowering commoners. They trembled and looked at Leo in fear, unable to move. As they were commoners, they didn't dare to do anything stupid like the guards.
Noticing how the situation escalated, Leo sighed. He approached one of the onlookers and questioned them.
The person was a wandering merchant, who carried a wooden backpack full of trinkets and tools. He shivered as Leo approached.
The merchant was a 50-year-old man. He had a long and thick mustache, but he had no beard. His long messy hair was already grey, but he had a bald forehead.
"You, there."
"M-Me?"
"Yes, you. Do you know where the Fatui Cult's headquarters is?"
The merchant looked around him to ask for help, but the other commoners finally regained their leg strength and ran away.
Seeing how he was abandoned, the merchant swallowed his fear and answered honestly.
"I'm sorry, sir. I don't know. I'm also a visitor here."
"I see."
Leo lightly snorted as he pitied himself for asking the wrong person. Still, feeling bad for the innocent bystander, Leo thought of something. He scanned his spatial rings, checking if he had something useful in this situation. He also picked up 20 spatial rings of the golden core cultivators earlier.
It was easy to find something valuable among the loot. Leo unsealed one of the rings and ejected a handful of spirit stones. As he directly touched the spirit stones, they were upgraded into essence stones.
Leo flickered one of the essence stones to the merchant, which the latter barely caught it. Leo didn't forget to advertise his store.
"I see that you're a wandering merchant. If you have time, visit my humble store north of here. It's not far from Magpie City. You can't miss it! If you do, I'll sell you something good. Of course, it might be expensive, but they will be worth your time!"
After pitching the sale, Leo left the wondering merchant alone. He leaped to the sky.
.
.
"…"
Jiang Cheng, the merchant, gulped and gazed at the essence stone in his hand for a moment. A few seconds later, he dropped it on the ground as it burnt his skin.
"Ow! It's hot!"
The essence stone fell into one of the puddles. As soon as it touched the water, the clear puddle got contaminated and emitted rainbow light.
Jiang Cheng patted his scarred hands on his robes in pain. Still, as he was curious, he grabbed a pair of chopsticks from his ware and picked up the round stone.
PLOP
As the essence stone looked like a glass marble, a pair of chopsticks weren't suitable for picking the round ball. The merchant switched his tool to fire tongs and picked it up.
Looking at the item closer, the man widened his eyes in shock. He could roughly guess what it was even though it was incorrect.
"Isn't this a spirit stone?! A spirit stone that those immortals use?! I-If I use this, can I become an immortal or a cultivator like them?!"
Jiang Cheng looked left and right. He took off his outer layer of robes and wrapped the essence stone. He then put the bundle of clothes in his wooden backpack and sprinted out of town.
The gate guards didn't stop the man. He let the guy out as many people came in and out every day, so there was no point checking leaving people.
After leaving the city, the wandering merchant dryly laughed. He thought about Leo's words and looked north.
"I remember Magpie City. It's a small town that big firms ignore. Well, since there won't be as many competitors, should I pay them a visit and see what I can buy and resell? Also, I need a place to study about this!"
Jiang Cheng had never had a chance to practice martial arts. He wondered if he could fly like the Fatui cultists in the Frozen Fire City too.
.
.
After ditching the bald forehead merchant, Leo continued scanning the city, searching for landmarks and big buildings.
"Oh, there!"
Leo noticed the tallest pagoda not far from there. He thought of the pagodas in the mystic realm and wondered if weird monsters lived there as well.
Still, the scent of Cat was getting thinner as the odor of commoners, latrines, and food mixed together. It started to smell the same.
After landing, Leo stopped relying on his eyes and solely focused on his nose. He even concentrated and commanded his cells to focus on the olfactory system.
The living cancer cells were cooperative. Leo's face whitened as his transparent blood gathered in his face, carrying countless drops of element essence.
Leo's five senses sharpened. Although his eyes couldn't perceive the color of the scent, his nose created a mental image of scent flow in his mind, filtering and differentiating each odor.
Having another mental map in his mind, Leo's body moved by instinct. He crawled on all four and sprinted like a dog.
Leo didn't understand why he degraded himself to that of a dog. However, by lowering his stance, he picked up the scent better. Although he was ashamed and embarrassed, Leo pushed on and ignored the bystanders.
"WOOF-WOOF COMING THROUGH! Don't stand in my way, or I'll nom-nom woof you!"
At first, Leo ran through the busy streets like a 4-legged animal. But after getting used to it, he started pushing his legs and arms longer, sprinting like a cheetah. Then, he started parkouring instinctively over people and obstacles in front of him.
Running for two kilometers, Leo arrived in front of a shabby wooden cabin in a slum area. However, two nascent soul cultivators stood in front of the building.
Leo stopped running and stood on two legs. He patted his hands twice.
"Ah…"
He suddenly flinched as he remembered something important. Along the way, he accidentally touched random objects with his bare hands when he parkouring through the crowded places.
Leo secretly prayed that no innocent bystanders got hurt by the random radiation that he left behind.
"Oh, no. Anyway…"
He gazed at the nascent soul cultivators, who already noticed Leo's arrival. They sweated profusely as they realized that Leo had a higher cultivation base than theirs.
"Gentlemen, I'll be brief. GTFO, or else."
The two guards looked at each other. They then cupped their fists and flew away without saying a word.
Leo nodded in approval, "Finally, some smart people. I hate dealing with idiots."
Resuming the posture of a 4-leg animal, Leo entered the building and followed Cat's scent.
.
.
It had been a week since every mystic realm portal on this planet was open. However, not everybody came out early as the emperor or Situ Nantian.
Fatui Cult sent many people into the same mystic realm. As there were two portals in their territory, they got to send 20 people in. However, nobody had come out to report about their expedition result yet.
As most big shots were away, the strongest person in the cult was just a soul transformation elder. He was also in charge of sacrificial rituals as he cultivated the rare blood element, which required cultivators to gather the blood of other cultivators to get stronger.
In front of an altar, the elder wore black robes and a black wood mask to cover his face. His scarce white hair couldn't hide his bald head and his pale skin.
The elder stared at the cages of today's sacrifices. He also frowned when he noticed the giant monster, who nonchalantly ate another disciple from his sect.
"What have you idiots captured!?"

chapters.title: Chapter 122 Self-Proclaiming Environment Activist Florida Man Steals Church Pillar And Doors To Recycle Them
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 122 – Self-Proclaiming Environment Activist Florida Man Steals Church Pillar and Doors to Recycle Them
Entering the shack, Leo found a round magic circle with floating Chinese characters. It glowed in purple light, illuminating the dark building.
As Leo had no idea what it was, he sniffed the air, following Cat's scent. Strangely, it stopped in the middle of the magic circle.
Since Leo's clue ended there. He stepped on the circle and inspected the floating characters. He reached out to touch one of them.
The character dissipated to particles upon contact. Then, the entire magic circle dimmed and got deactivated.
"What?"
Leo's disappointment was immeasurable, and his day was ruined. He scratched his head in frustration.
"How the hell do you activate this thing?! Goddammit. I should have dragged one of those fools along!"
Because of his frustration, he stomped out of the building. He looked left and right, searching for one of the cultists in the area. Unfortunately, no cultivator was in sight. Only beggars and poor commoners nearby warily gazed at Leo.
Unable to find a local cultivator, Leo thought of a sick plan. He looked up and stared at the tall pagoda at the center of the town.
Leo paused to contemplate. He would surely find a cultivator there, but they might not cooperate with him. After all, not all cultivators were as friendly as people from the Life Sword Sect.
"Maybe later."
Leo snorted and went back into the cabin. He returned to the deactivated magic circle. Crouching, Leo touched the stone floor.
Another weird idea came to his mind. He gently punched the ground.
BOOM
The stone floor cracked and crumbled, revealing a hollow area underground.
Leo fell into the large hole along with the debris, yet he smiled. His plan worked as intended.
"Ahah! I'm a genius!"
Upon landing, a few pieces of stone and rubble hit his head and his shoulders, but Leo ignored them. His green eyes shone as he scanned through the darkness.
The hollow area was not a natural cave or an underground waterway. Stone beams and pillars were visible everywhere. The ceiling was made from glowing purple metal that Leo had never seen before, and it emitted a foul odor of rotten rats. The purple fog around the metal frame was also thick, hindering Leo's visibility.
Seeing the thick fog and the weird metal frames, Leo rubbed his hands in glee. He fiddled with the newly acquired spatial rings of the dead guards earlier.
Useless grain pills, black clothes, cone hoodies, and random objects came out from the rings as Leo threw them away. He then glanced at the black uniform for a moment before he put them on.
After dressing as one of the cultists, Leo pointed his finger at the pile of items. He silently thought to himself, commanding his cancer cells.
'Can you guys create fire? I need to burn those things.'
The cells were very cooperative. Several transparent blood cells released fire element essence and transformed them into a stream of flame. As if Leo's finger turned into a flamethrower gun, it sprayed white flame at the pile of junk.
The non-element grain pills, clothes, and useless tools of the cultivators melted instantly. After everything turned to ash, Leo patted his finger and removed the fire.
After clearing spaces in his spatial rings, Leo walked toward a purple metal pillar. He widely grinned and linked his Qi string from the purple metal and his spatial ring.
WHOOSH
Just like when Leo sucked the blue gemstone into his ring earlier, the entire pillar vanished into his ring's pocket inventory.
RUMBLE
After one of the pillars vanished, the ceiling slightly trembled. Dust and small stones fell from the tall ceiling.
Leo looked up and rubbed his chin. Then, he thought of the commoners in the city, and his expression turned dark.
'Tsk. I can't be greedy. I might enjoy collecting some idiots' lifespan, but I ain't Putin. I'm not into a senseless massacre.'
Avoiding killing bystanding commoners, Leo stopped stealing another metal pillar. He explored the underground cave instead.
It wasn't difficult to locate new points of interest. Aside from the pillars and beams, four 10-meter-tall doors stood tall in four different directions – North, West, East, and South.
The underground cave's walls seemed asymmetrical. However, its general shape was a square, which was easy to navigate.
Leo sniffed each door. Three of the doors smelled like concentrated smelling salt, which caused Leo to turn his head away and covered his nose. Although the scent heightened his senses and adrenaline, it was unpleasant.
As for the other door, aka the east gate, it had a thick scent of blood.
Trusting his instinct, Leo chose to enter the east gate first. Instead of pushing the two doors open, Leo patted them and stored the massive metal doors in his spatial rings.
It was not about greed. It was about moral integrity. Since local cultivators abandoned these precious metals and used them as metal frames and doors, Leo believed that he could do them a favor by collecting their junk and researching them.
After all, there was a saying – One man's trash is another man's treasure!
After the doors vanished, a large underground hallway stood before Leo. Unlike this room, it was well-decorated with wall torches, human bones, and random Chinese words written in blood. However, no one had lightened the torches in the area.
Leo smiled and was about to follow the path. However, he paused for a moment and made a U-turn. Returning to the north gate, Leo quietly stored the doors to his spatial rings. Then, he went to the other two gates and collected them as well.
Nothing was left behind, except the metal frames that supported the ceiling.
After grabbing the precious metal doors, Leo returned to the bloody hallway. He walked in the dark while he adjusted his robes.
.
Walking a kilometer, Leo came across another gate. This time, it was a single glowing gate. Its purple light was brighter than the beams and pillars in the previous room, and the fog was even thicker and smellier.
On the door's surface, there was an emblem that the previous four doors didn't have. It was the image of a cone mask that the cultists always wore.
Looking at the emblem, Leo was disgusted. He was even more disturbed that he was wearing their uniform.
'I pray that you don't discriminate against another race, or I'll freaking turn y'all into yin fluid!'
Leo braced the fog and put his palms on the single gate. Then, he tried to steal it.
As soon as Leo touched it, the emblem shone and unleashed a shockwave blast. A strong gale made Leo's robes flutter, and his cone hoodie was blown away.
However, that did nothing to him. He stood there, picking his nose. He scooped a centimeter-diameter booger ball out from his nostril. He inspected it because of the old habit, after which he tried to flicker it away, but it got stuck on his finger.
After combating the sticky booger for a minute, Leo surrendered. He pressed the booger against the door and swiped it away from his finger.
Even though the booger was a collective bacteria and small particles, the majority of it was made from Leo's bodily fluid. Thus, it contained a thick amount of essence.
As soon as the booger was planted on the door, it began transforming the metal door. From purple, it turned red, and the metal door expanded larger.
CREAK
The loud sound of moving metal echoed underground before the entire door distorted and bent because of its large size. A few seconds later, it was folded in half, and it stopped glowing.
Leo tilted his head in confusion as he had no clue what just happened. He shrugged and collected the folded metal door and proceeded forward.
After entering another room, Leo came across a populated area. As soon as he entered, he found a hundred cultists in the same clothes, looking at him.
"WHO ARE YOU?!"
Leo paused for a moment. He then pointed at his clothes and feigned ignorance.
"Ain't I one of you?"
"…"
As most cultists always wore masks, they couldn't remember every member's face. They stared at Leo in doubt, but half of them only glanced at his robes and looked away.
"Where's your mask? Why are you coming from that gate?"
"Ah, my mask?" Leo touched his face and smacked his forehead. "My bad. That stupid door suddenly spat on my face and blew my mask away. It should be somewhere in the hallway."
"You haven't answered all my questions. Why are you coming from that hallway? That place should have been sealed!"
"Sealed? Oh."
Leo smacked his lips. He pondered if he should continue playing it cool like Agent 47 or if should he start genociding. Since he found the situation fun, he picked the first option first.
"There was an accident. I tried to use the usual teleportation array, but it collapsed on me. When I realized it, I got trapped in an abandoned room. It took me a while to get back here."
That was a random excuse. Leo crossed his fingers and revealed a bad pokerface.
The cultists stared at Leo for a while. Some of them brought a torch closer to see Leo's face. But as soon as they got a clearer look, the cultists instantly noticed Leo's rainbow aura, which reflected the torchlight.
Noticing Leo's superior cultivation base, a hundred cultists knelt in panic.
"FORGIVE US, SENIOR! WE DIDN'T KNOW THAT YOU WOULD VISIT THE OUR CHAMBER!"
"…"
Leo blankly stared at the crowd. He frowned for a moment.
Noticing that Leo stopped talking, everybody took off their masks and hoodies, revealing their faces. Surprisingly, they were all old men.
Noticing their ages, Leo wryly smiled. He figured out why they weren't intimidated by his look and appearance age.
"Which chamber is this?" Leo continued playing it cool.
"T-This is lowly priest residential area, senior. Only golden core and nascent soul priests live here."
"Oh, just you? Is there anybody else?"
"No, senior. Most of the priests have gathered at the sacrificial city. I think the elder priest will perform another sacrifice ritual soon since they have captured a 7th-grade plant monster."
"Hoh?"
Leo narrowed his eyes. He finally heard something interesting, "Tell me more about the ritual. Who the hell is holding an event while I was away?"
"T-This…"
The cultists sweated profusely. They gave Leo a nervous look, mistaking him for one of the high priests that had participated in a mystic realm expedition.
"S-Senior, w-while you were in the middle of the expedition, our priests managed to capture the monster by chance. T-The elder priest plans to use it to boost his cultivation base and attack the quasi-immortal realm today!"
"Oh?"
Leo nodded as he believed that Cat might be there. He crouched in front of the priest and smiled.
"Can you lead me to them?"
"O-Of course, senior!"
"Then, get up and show me the way. I'm old, and I'm kinda forgetful. I always got lost around here."
"…"

chapters.title: Chapter 123 Armed Florida Man Interrupted Baptism Ceremony To Rescue His Cat. One Pastor Killed.
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 123 – Armed Florida Man Interrupted Baptism Ceremony to Rescue His Cat. One Pastor Killed.
Standing on the altar was Situ Shang, one of many Situ Clan agents. The elder wore cone-shaped headwear like the others. Nobody could see his face or his skin underneath his clothes.
Situ Shang served both Situ Clan and the Fatui Cult as he practiced a unique cultivation method, which enabled him to cultivate Blood Element Qi. Because of such a method, he reached the soul transformation stage before his age even reach 200. However, the next stage required a lot of sacrifices and assistance from the Fatui Cult.
Abusing the authority of the Fatui Cult while all core members were away, Situ Shang managed to abduct commoners, cultivators, and monster beasts around the continent and gather them in the underground city. The next hurdle was to break the limitations of mortal and reach the quasi-immortal stage.
However, Situ Shang needed a catalyst for his blood element essence to reach the next stage. The sacrifices were insufficient for him.
Situ Shang glared at Cat in the cage. Although she never stopped eating random cultists nearby, the Situ elder refrained from making a move on her. Instead, he inwardly sneered at the disciples and Cat.
'Keep eating, you monster. When you're full, I'll kill you and get your monster core. Oh, I can't just stand still and do nothing. I have to command these fools to start the ritual.'
The elder coughed and ordered everybody.
"Start the ritual! Drain the captive' blood. As for that monster, stay away from it! Array masters, seal the cage and prevent the vines from coming out!"
.
.
The priests and disciples rushed to work, hoping to gain some contributions and leftover Qi from the ritual. A dozen cultists threw talismans into the air.
Yellow papers shone and floated around Cat's cage. They formed a dome barrier array, trapping Cat from poking her vines out.
TINK
Her thorn vines touched the array, but an electric current zapped her. She pulled her vines back.
Cat took her time. She chew the last guy in her mouth until his flesh and bones melted into a liquid. After digesting the juicy meat, Cat looked around. Her humanoid torso also came out to explore the underground city.
Noticing how she was trapped, Cat pouted. She had the urge to cry and call Leo for help like a spoiled child. But then, her eyes spotted so many strangers, who never hid their hostile intents and murderous aura.
"Nom-Nom Meow?"
The chomper mouth widely smiled, and so did her human face. Since many edible humans were present there, it would have been a waste to scream and call for Leo to help her. She might as well kill these people for food.
She wanted to hog all cultists to herself.
The girl cackled and lashed eight thorn vines at the cage. The metal bars were snapped in half upon impact while shrapnel and pieces of small steel pipes flew in every direction.
DONG
DONG
The shrapnel and cage's pieces hit the array dome and bounced back. None of the fragments harmed the surrounding cultists.
"NOM-NOM MEOW!"
Cat pushed forward. She swung her pride thorn whips and the barrier.
The first few hits did nothing to the dome. She managed to cause several ripples in the formation, but she couldn't get through the barrier.
Her strength, which had been nurtured through her food and Leo's influence, was stimulated by her desperation. She cladded her thorn whips with wood element essence and tried again. Putting more force into each strike, she targeted the same spot that she had hit earlier.
CLANK
In one hit, the talisman array barrier was broken. All floating talismans turned into normal paper and flew by the wind.
The array masters around Cat coughed blood as they suffered a backlash from the destroyed array. Some of them collapsed to the ground, falling unconscious.
As soon as Cat broke free, she charged at the largest crowd in front of the altar, where the cultists had gathered their captives and sacrifices. Without discrimination, Cat swallowed everybody in her path and captured as many humans as she could with her thorn vines.
"Nom-Nom Meow <3"
That was not all. Cat summoned her dao avatar to merge with her physique. When they became one, she grew 10 meters taller. Her size expanded until her human head hit the ceiling.
"Mya?!"
Cat stopped growing. Instead, she shrank her body mass to reduce her height by a meter. She then looked up and rubbed the top of her head.
When she stabilized, she heard the command of their leader.
"NOW! KILL ALL CAPTIVES AND KILL THAT MONSTER!"
.
.
Situ Shang sneered at Cat after she transformed into a giant chomper plant. He believed that it was time to harvest her monster core.
After ordering his men, Situ Shang summoned his dao avatar. A spirit emerged from his body and floated behind him.
The dao avatar was a tall and slender young man in a robe. He had long vampire fangs and elf ears. However, his bright crimson pupils were the same as blood.
The dao avatar opened his arms and screeched. Suddenly, all liquid blood and blood cells within a hundred meters gathered in him. Each droplet became Situ Shang's element Qi.
After extracting blood from his surroundings, Situ Shang pointed his left fingertip at Cat.
"Blood Sovereign! Blood Spear!"
After shouting his technique name, the dao avatar merged with the collected blood and transformed himself into a crimson spear. It floated in mid-air for a moment. Then, it accelerated toward Cat at the speed of sound.
Cat instantly turned around and opened her chomper mouth. She caught the spear with her teeth.
The blood spear instantly exploded, scattering blood droplets everywhere. Some of the blood splashed on Cat's skin.
SIZZLE
