The crimson fluid was as hot as magma, causing Cat's skin to sizzle because of the intense heat. She frowned and patted her chomper mouth to get rid of the hot acidic liquid from her body.
"AGAIN!"
Situ Shang hadn't finished his technique. He straightened his fingertip and summoned another spear.
The scattered blood droplets earlier gathered in front of Situ Shang. At the same time, his men began slaughtering the captives and other sacrifices, which spilled more blood. As more fluid was within range, Situ Shang's blood spear became bigger and longer.
Cat also noticed the trend. She threw her prey away and focused on the elder. However, she paused for a moment as she calculated how to defeat this foe.
Looking at the elder, Cat recalled how Leo fought. The chomper's mouth curved up into a wide grin as Cat weaved her vines into a massive arm and fist. She applied wood, metal, water, fire, and earth element essence into the fist and threw a punch toward her target.
Sensing the crisis, Situ Shang kicked the ground.
BOOM
The punch hit the altar and destroyed half of the building. However, Cat's attack hadn't finished yet.
As Cat's vine arm and fist had no joint, she used it as a whip, lashing at Situ Shang.
"Impudence!"
Realizing that he couldn't dodge the strike, Situ Shang transformed the mass of blood spear into a blood barrier dome, covering himself.
BOOM
The thorn arm directly hit Situ Shang. However, something unexpected occurred.
The blood dome around Situ Shang remained intact. However, Cat's arm was cut in half!
"MYA?!"
Cat screamed in pain and confusion as she didn't understand how her proud element essence was destroyed by a simple corrosive blood barrier.
"HAHAHAHAHA! Foolish monster! My blood element essence is superior to the basic five elements! Your Qi is nothing but food for my power!"
"…"
Cat gave Situ Shang a meaningful look. She glanced at her severed thorn vines, which rapidly blackened as if they were mutating.
Seeing the mutating vines, Cat thought of Leo again. She imagined what Leo would do in her position. But suddenly, she remembered the teaching of the mysterious voice.
"Munya!"
Mimicking the mysterious master's voice, Cat used a new technique.
Cat's severed vines began producing black liquid. She deeply inhaled and commanded the fluid to gather in front of her human torso. When the black blood mass was as big as the humanoid part, Cat transformed it into a mannequin before she hardened the substances.
A female black mannequin, which was made from Cat's blood, appeared for the first time.
"A summoning art?" Situ Shang narrowed his eyes and sneered at Cat, "Your struggle is futile! Your fate is sealed, monster. Now, surrender and give me your monster core, and I'll give you a painless death!"
Cat said nothing. She commanded the black mannequin.
"Nom-Nom Meow!"
The black mannequin looked up while it was floating in mid-air. Her face and head slowly wiggled and transformed into a pretty woman's face. She slowly grew long black hair and evolved her torso to become as slender as a modern model.
The transformation was completed in seconds. The black mannequin raised her head and glared at Situ Shang. Then, she vanished.
"!!!"
Situ Shang recognized the technique. It was the same technique that Situ Nantian always used when the latter traveled around the continent.
WHOOSH
Instantly, the mannequin appeared in front of the elder. Her punch directly hit the man's gut.
"GAAAH!!"
Situ Shang bent forward upon impact. He vomited a stream of fluid from his mouth before the punch's momentum pushed Situ Shang toward the ceiling.
BOOM
The elder's back hit the ceiling before he fell to the ground.
The mannequin pursued to finish off the foe. But as soon as Situ Shang fell to the ground, his body transformed into a pool of blood.
Cat and the mannequin paused as they were confused. They had no idea how to deal with a shapeshifting opponent.
RUMBLE
As more blood came out from the sacrifices, they condensed and gathered into a dozen blood masses, floating in mid-air. Because of the movements, the mannequins and Cat looked at them for a moment.
That distraction was their mistake.
PU!
The blood pool earlier transformed into a spike and pierced through the black mannequin's chest! The spike quickly wrapped around the doll, and the face of Situ Shang appeared among the floating blood.
"Fool! I'm the blood master! You cannot kill me! I AM IMMORTAL-"
"Say what?"
A foreign voice and the weird accent of an old man interrupted Situ Shang's sentences. He momentarily looked at the person.
Approaching the sacrificial altar and the chaos was a group of hundred cultists, who escorted a strange old man here. In addition, Situ Shang had never seen this old man before.
FFZZZHKKRRGGH
An energy hum echoed in the underground city as a rainbow sword flew toward the black mannequin. It pierced through a layer of blood, but it didn't harm her body.
The mannequin turned to look at Leo and glanced at the lightsaber. She grabbed the handle and weaved it around.
SWUA
The lightsaber sliced and burnt the blood spike and the mass around her. The mannequin fell to the ground and looked at the damage she had caused.
"AAAAAAAHHH!! WHAT THE HELL IS THIS?!"
Situ Shang's real body emerged from one of the floating blood masses. White smoke came out from his body as he narrowly escaped from the burning sword. He glared at the mannequin's lightsaber for a moment before he turned to the intruder.
"YOU! YOU ARE COURTING DEATH-"
BANG!
A rubber bullet, cladded with Leo's element essence, pierced through Situ Shang's head. The latter's consciousness turned black without realizing what hit him.
.
.
Leo calmly stood while he held the gunpoint toward Situ Shang's floating corpse. He yawned.
"Can we finish this quick? I'm tired. I wanna sleep."

chapters.title: Chapter 124 WHO Baffled As Florida Man Successfully Cured COVID By Spitting Into Patient’s Mouth
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 124 – WHO Baffled as Florida Man Successfully Cured COVID by Spitting into Patient's Mouth
A few minutes earlier
Leo followed the crowd to a massive horror hallway, where dried corpses, blood stains, skeletons, and human body parts piled into mountains. He glanced at the scene and pursed his lips, having the urge to contaminate everything and bring them to his alchemy workshop.
"So many treasures," uttered Leo.
The cultists laughed in elation, "Of course, senior. We've brought in so many sacrifices this year."
"Situ Shang?"
It was Leo's first time hearing of Situ surname. He still had no idea that he had defeated Situ Nantian, who was the strongest among Situ Clan's cultivators in this world.
"Yes, senior. After you and everybody has entered the mystic realm, Elder Priest Situ Shang has been managing the cult. He said that he was about to reach the quasi-immortal stage soon. If we can bring him enough sacrifices, he promised to contribute his blood element cultivation method to the sect and allow us to cultivate it."
"…"
Leo narrowed his eyes for a moment and turned his attention to the mountains of corpses. He secretly checked the age and gender of the sacrifices.
Most of the dead bodies were adult and old men. Some beasts' carcasses were in the mix. Although everything looked perfectly fine for a villain organization, Leo was still disgusted by their ethic and warped philosophies.
These guys weren't qualified to be his customers, Leo thought. They deserved to rot in hell.
Looking enough, Leo averted his eyes from the piles of dead bodies. But as he walked without looking at the road, his feet kicked something small.
Leo looked at his feet. Then, he noticed a dead body of a 3-or-4-year-old little boy. The dead body looked like a dried mummy whose blood had been drained.
"…"
Leo's expression turned dark. He knelt and flipped the dead body. When it was flipped over, Leo could see the child's wide eyes. The boy's despair and desperation could be seen in his expression as he died with his eyes wide open.
Silently, Leo reached out and touched the child's face. He closed the boy's eyes and inwardly prayed.
'They will pay. Be patient.'
As Leo directly touched the dead body, the corpse crumbled into dust.
Leo stood up and quietly followed the crowd. He pulled out a pistol and a repaired lightsaber from his spatial ring, preparing a massacre.
BOOM
As Leo was about to activate the avenger mode, a loud explosion from the end of the hallway interrupted his thought. Leo and the cultists looked forward.
"Someone is fighting!"
The cultists sprinted in the direction. As for Leo, he cocked the pistol, preparing to backstab everybody. But then, his nose caught the scent of Cat. In addition, a thick iron-like odor kicked Leo's nose.
Flashback scenes of Cat entered Leo's mind. His pupil color changed from green to red, and his sclera turned black. For the second time in this world, the kind and silly Florida Man was angry. This time, his rage surpassed when Situ Nantian stole his goodies.
Kicking the ground, Leo leaped forward and sprinted on the wall, overtaking the cultists. He arrived at the altar area before the group. Upon arrival, Leo looked up and found Cat.
However, she was not in good condition. Her vines were severed, and she bled black blood. Not far from her, a black mannequin lady's stomach got punctured by a spike, and slime-like blood threatened to devour her.
Leo also overheard their conversation.
"Fool! I'm the blood master! You cannot kill me! I AM IMMORTAL-"
"Say what?!" Leo uttered, but his voice echoed in the chasm.
Not thinking of anything, Leo threw the lightsaber toward the mannequin.
The mannequin lady caught the lightsaber and glanced at Leo. As soon as she saw him, she and Cat reacted in unison as they recognized him.
Although the mannequin's physique was made from Cat's blood, her face was capable of expressing emotions. For the first time, the mannequin lady proudly smiled.
Using the lightsaber, Cat's dao avatar broke free from the blood restraints and the spike. After getting back to the ground, she gazed at the damaged spike and the mass of blood.
Strangely, the blood slime failed to merge or come back to life. They melted and burnt because of the sword's energy.
The mannequin gazed at the lightsaber, impressed and astonished. She then looked at her savior and Cat.
Meanwhile, Situ Shang felt the burn from the lightsaber. He transferred his consciousness to another floating blood mass and reconstructed his body.
"AAAAAAAHHH!! WHAT THE HELL IS THIS?!"
He soon spotted Leo, who had thrown the lightsaber at the mannequin.
In anger, Situ Shang glared at Leo, and their eyes met.
Leo silently aimed his pistol toward Situ Shang's head. His mannequin dao avatar also merged his hand with Leo's, assisting the aim.
"YOU! YOU ARE COURTING DEATH-"
BANG!
The bullet pierced through Situ Shang's head and exploded his brain out from the back hole. No fancy effect occurred as Leo didn't bother adding too many drops of his element essence or Qi.
The floating body of Situ Shang was suspended in the air for a few seconds before it fell to the ground.
"ELDER SITU?!"
The cultists looked at Leo and Situ Shang in shock as the fight happened so fast. The people around the altar were also stunned as they didn't expect a fellow cultist to kill each other. Moreover, none of the cultists had seen the artifact in Leo's hand before.
The cultists shivered and trembled in fear. Even though Leo had murdered one of their elders, they didn't have the guts to retaliate. After all, the strongest cultivators here were nascent soul cultivators. They were aware that they couldn't defeat Leo, whose aura resembled soul formation cultivators.
Leo complained and yawned.
"Can we finish this quick? I need to sleep. I'm tired."
Ignoring Leo, Cat shed tears of joy. She jumped.
"Meow <3"
"Yeah, yeah. I love you too. Also, who is this black lady? Is she your friend?"
Cat turned to the black blood mannequin. The hole in her stomach was already healed as her physique was made from liquid. She faced Leo and slightly bowed her head.
Leo looked back and forth between Cat and the mannequin. He let out a short sigh.
"Fine. I'll ask you two later."
He turned his attention to the other cultists around him.
As random combat would have been troublesome, Leo came up with an idea. He shouted.
"FORM RANKS, IDIOTS! STAND 10 ROWS IN FRONT OF ME IF YOU DON'T WANNA DIE!"
"!!!"
The people jolted and ran toward Leo. However, as Cat was still in her giant form and the mannequin was still on the loose, not everybody followed his order.
Noticing that the crowd didn't follow Leo's instructions, he pointed at Cat.
"Guess what?! That monster over there is my freaking DAUGHTER! WHOEVER MESSES WITH HER MESS WITH ME! CAPISCE?!"
Hearing Leo's words, their brains computed and understood why Leo killed Situ Shang. They rushed toward Leo and stood in rows and columns, ignoring the presence of Cat and the mannequin lady.
When everybody in the chasm finished gathering, Leo let out a sigh of relief. He stared at them, pondering if he should massacre everybody here at the same time or capture them in his domain.
Still, human trafficking, senseless murdering, and promoting dubious rituals were unforgivable crimes by Leo's standards. He had no intention of leaving them alive.
'I might as well terminate this stupid organization. I need to expand my store domain south one day, and these idiots are in the way. Welp. Time for some yin liquid harvesting!'
Coming up with an idea, Leo also purchased a large bucket from a system store. He then spat several times into the bucket and filled it with water, using his water Qi.
After the bucket was full, Leo ordered the crowd.
"One by one, bring your cup and scoop the water from the bucket! Do not drink it yet!"
"???"
The crowd was confused. As they saw Leo spit into the container, their expressions were complex as they were disgusted. Still, as it was an order from a senior cultivator, they had no choice but to comply.
One after another, the cultists brought out a cup, a glass, or a bamboo canteen from their spatial rings. They took the water from the bucket and went back to the line.
As over two hundred cultists were present in the chasm, Leo quickly ran out of water. He was forced to spit several more times and refilled the container with his Qi. Then, he continued the process until everybody got theirs.
Three hours later, everybody got their water. They stared at the containers in their hands, wondering what Leo was trying to do. As they inspected further, they discovered that the water surface glittered in rainbow light.
"What is this water?"
"T-The elder spat in it. What is he doing?"
"Isn't this element Qi?"
Nobody could guess Leo's intention. They waited for his next order.
When everybody returned to their position, Leo gave them the next order, which shocked them.
"VERY GOOD! NOW, DRINK THE ELIXIR IN YOUR HANDS! NO EXCEPTION!"
"W-What?!"
Everybody was taken aback as they hadn't forgotten how Leo spat into the bucket. They looked at the water containers in their hands in disgust.
Still, Leo's order was absolute. Fearing death, more than half of the cultists drank the water while the rest waited to see the result.
Leo wasn't naïve when he dealt with his prisoners. He looked at Cat.
"Cat. Nom-Nom the idiots that haven't drunk the water yet!"
"Nom-Nom Meow!"
Without hesitation, Cat regrew her vines and snatched 50 cultists in the yard. Not bothering with their clothes and spatial rings, she threw them into her chomper mouth and chewed them in glee.
"NOOOO!! FORGIVE US!!"
As Cat hadn't captured all of them in one try, the rest of the cultists covered their noses and downed the water in their throats. After drinking the diluted spit, they knelt and begged Leo.
"We drank it. We've drunk it, senior! Please forgive us!"
"We didn't know, senior! It was Situ Shang's fault!"
"Please don't kill us!"
Leo snorted. He walked toward the mannequin lady and took back the lightsaber. He deactivated it and put it back into his spatial ring, after which he crossed his arms and silently stared at the remaining crowd.
He counted as he waited.
"Seven… Eight… Nine…"
The people were more confused. They counted along.
"Ten? Eleven? Twelve… UGH!"
A cultist squeezed his throat and collapsed to the ground. He trembled and uncontrollably convulsed. After the first guy showed the symptom of mutation, the others also began to scream.
"AAAAHHH!!"
"P-POISON!!"
"NOOOOO!!"
The remaining cultists in the chasm courtyard squirmed in pain. Their muscle mass swelled and bloated as their blood multiplied.
"Shwifty-one…Shwifty-two…"
As torturing these cultists improved Leo's mood, his accent degraded. He started counting and using baby language.
"Shwifty… Five? Man. This takes me back to the classical age of YouTube."
.
That day, Cat and the mannequin watched how Leo mutated and killed 200 cultists at once while the guy randomly danced like a lunatic in the middle of the corpse field.

chapters.title: Chapter 125 Florida Man Accused Of Being Pedophile After He Escorted Lost Child To Her Parent’s Home
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 125 – Florida Man Accused of Being Pedophile after He Escorted Lost Child to Her Parent's Home
After tricking 200 cultivators into drinking diluted saliva, Leo started collecting their rings and talisman papers. Meticulously, Leo inspected every spatial ring and ejected useless items. Then, he used them to store the mutated corpses to bring back home.
When he finished cleaning the mess, Leo went back to the pile of human corpses that the cultists had discarded.
Although Leo wasn't a religious person, he held his hands and prayed.
"Y'all can rest in peace. I've avenged you. Those mofos are now rotting in hell."
Leo bitterly smiled and patted the mountains of corpses with his bare hand. Dried bones and old dead bodies instantly turned to dust while wet corpses turned black.
As Leo had no intention of desecrating regular people, he pointed his finger at them.
"Cancer cells, can I have some fire Qi, please? I need a torch to burn them."
FWOOSH
Leo's blood cells were always cooperative. A stream of flame came out from Leo's fingertip and burn the victims' remains.
Meanwhile, Cat and her mannequin subordinate had nothing to do. As Leo seemed busy, they helped him gather the mutated corpses into one place. While they were at it, they secretly stole a couple mutated corpses and shoved them in Cat's mouth.
As the black mannequin lady was originally Cat's blood, her time in this world was limited. 10 minutes after coming out to life, she reverted into a puddle of black blood and returned to Cat's body.
Cat's dao avatar also returned to her side after she had possessed the mannequin. She patted her master's human head and laughed at her.
.
When all the dead victims got their respective cremation, Leo turned his attention to the living. He gazed at the captives, who survived the onslaught earlier.
A hundred cages trapped over a thousand men and women. Most of them were poor people in ragged clothes while over 100 of them were children.
Unfortunately, not everybody was lucky. When the cultists extracted their blood earlier, they got hit by their Daoist techniques. Everybody in the cages was dead.
Leo opened the cages and inspected the victims one after another, searching for survivors. Unfortunately, no miracle existed for the weak.
Although sad and angry, Leo patiently burned the carriages along with the corpses of the victims, disallowing the other cultists from outside to use their dead bodies for dubious purposes.
After thrashing and burning everything, Leo looked at Cat.
"Have you played enough?"
"…Meow," Cat pouted as she thought that Leo would scold her.
"Let's go home."
"Meow <3"
"Also, you have a lot of explanation to do. Did you steal my food again?!"
"MYA!!"
Cat's pupils dilated. She reverted to her chomper form and sprinted away from Leo in panic.
"COME BACK HERE, YOU LITTLE SHIT!"
Leo laughed, but he didn't run after her. He gazed at the underground city and narrowed his eyes.
He hadn't found the Fatui Cult's treasury yet. Unless he could steal their valuables and treasures, this cult could always recover their losses. For the sake of annihilating the Fatui Cult to its roots, Leo didn't follow Cat home. He explored the city and searched for other cultists. After all, the underground city was huge.
.
Walking randomly in the underground city for six hours, Leo got a lot of souvenirs for Gao Yan and Wu Buyi. He found several bottles of pills and herb fields in some gardens and collected everything.
After ransacking the last house, Leo stopped exploring the underground city. He turned his attention to the other sections of the underground labyrinth.
Aside from the sacrificial altars and the city, Leo found a hundred doors, which connected to other rooms and hallways. When Leo explored them, he discovered that the hallways brought him to the surface instead.
Not wanting to leave yet, Leo returned to the underground city. He backtracked to the area that he had fallen into earlier as he remembered that there were other paths that he hadn't checked yet.
Getting back to the abandoned underground area with smelling salt doors, Leo looked at the south gate, the north gate, and the west gate. He shut down the sense of smell for the sake of his sanity and approach the south gate first.
Once Leo stored the purple doors, a new path led him to a new area. Walking along the hallway, Leo came across a prison area.
The same purple steel bars and prison rooms were made from the same material, which seemed odd. Leo looked into each cell to see if anybody got trapped there.
Unfortunately, only old skeletons remained. Spider webs, stale air, and trick layers of dust told Leo that nobody had come here in ages.
Leo covered his nose and explored further into the prison to search for a survivor.
At the end of the prison hallway, Leo came across a 10-meter-tall prison cell. Inside the room was a dried corpse of a little girl, whose arms and legs were chained to the wall. Strangely, on the bars, silver talismans never stopped shining, emitting strong yang element essence.
Leo glanced at the talismans. Then, he looked at the prisoner's corpse. After that, Leo checked the talismans again.
"I have a feeling that something will go wrong if I steal these talismans. Should I remove it? Decision. Decision."
Leo crossed his arms and deeply pondered, calculating the pros and the cons. His instinct cried that he shouldn't remove the talismans as they might be sealing something dangerous inside, especially the chained little girl. However, his greediness urged him to snatch the talismans and eat them to boost his lifespan.
But in the end, Leo's confidence in his abilities supported his greed. He pulled the silver talismans on the bars and shoved them in his spatial rings, keeping them as food.
RUMBLE
The earth trembled as soon as Leo removed one of them. The other talismans also ceased emitting light, and the yang element essence around the cell was gone.
Leo paused for a moment as he had a bad feeling about this. He wryly smiled.
"Meh. What could go wrong? At best, I'll just die again."
He shrugged and pulled other silver talismans, not leaving anything behind. After collecting the last lifespan paper, Leo glanced at the dead loli on the wall.
But the corpse was no longer there.
"…"
Leo's expression turned into a pokerface meme. The corners of his mouth slightly curved up into a grin, and his eyes looked up as if he mischievously mimicked a meme.
"F*ck."
CHOMP!
Something small latched onto Leo's back and bit his nape. Four small fangs poked his skin, but they failed to penetrate it. Still, the fangs managed to push his skin one centimeter deep.
While being attacked, Leo stood still. He tried chatting with the assailant.
"Erm, you might die again if you touch my skin. But I guess it's too late to warn you."
GRRR
The little girl inside the cell earlier clung to Leo's back. Leo wasn't surprised that she suddenly came back to life after he removed the talismans as he had seen this template in movies before. Still, he found it funny that he experienced this horror scheme first-handed.
The girl kept trying to bite him. A minute later, her four fangs broke in half.
"…Ugh."
Finally, the girl groaned. Then, her hoarse voice entered Leo's ears.
"…What…are…you?"
Leo snickered. While the girl clung to him, he leisurely walked out of the prison. He also introduced himself.
"Just a passing-by Florida Man. Nice to meet you, kid. Also, you're welcome."
The girl stopped talking. She seemed exhausted after the biting attempt. Still, she seemed immune to his cancer cells for some reason.
Leo was also surprised that the girl didn't mutate after touching him for a minute. He thought of the monsters in the mystic realm, such as a giant tarantula spider and thunder unicorns. He wondered if strong monsters managed to naturally evolve and develop immunity to cancer cells.
As the girl wouldn't die from cancer, Leo decided to give her a hand. After all, he might be able to extract her lifespan after this. Since she seemed to be thirsty, Leo created water with his Qi and splashed it on her face.
"You thirsty, kid?"
The girl accidentally swallowed the water. She coughed several times, but she drank it anyway. However, the water and Leo's attitude irritated her.
"…I'm… no kid."
"Really? How old are you, then?"
"…Older… than your grandfather."
"Oh? Are you over 50,000 years old?"
"Huh?"
The girl squinted her brows, confused. She slowly grabbed the back of his neck with her small hands and extended her fingernails. Slowly, she clawed Leo's nape.
Again, the claw was ineffective. Leo's skin was unharmed.
"…You… You're a monster."
"I got that a lot when I beat up some talking Kaijus. Anyway, thanks for scratching that. Can I ask you a favor and scratch my left back? I think my stupid cancer cells are having a feast of dust mites over there, and it's itchy. Can you scratch it for me?"
"…"
The girl froze. For the first time in her life, she met a weirdo, the strongest weirdo.
While chatting, Leo reached the west gate of the previous room. He walked along the hallway and reached another area. This time, it was a room, full of skeletons.
Leo sat and inspected a skull. Strangely, the skull had long fangs, but it resembled a human skull.
The girl glanced at the skeleton mountain. She groaned again.
"Damn cultivators. If I was in my prime, the likes of Situ and Yan couldn't possibly harm my kin!"
Leo smiled as she sounded a lot clearer, "Say, kid. Are you one of these dead people?"
"They're my people, so what?"
"Then, are you a vampire or something? Your kin's fangs are kinda long."
The girl snorted, "Don't lump us together with those blood-sucking fiends. We're the nobles of the night! We don't even need blood to live!"
"But your fangs…"
"Those are for hunting!"
Leo shrugged. He turned around and returned to the room earlier. Afterward, he tried the north gate next.
While walking the girl didn't give up trying to kill Leo. She clawed him, using the best of her abilities. However, he didn't budge, and his skin was unscratched.
Frustrated, the girl revealed her identity.
"You're not human! What are you?! Why can't I, the Immortal Lich Empress, kill you?!"
Leo stopped walking. He then burst into laughter.
"Immortal Lich Empress? You? HAHAHAHAHAHA!"
The lich loli was enraged. She punched the back of Leo's head, but it did nothing to him. From an onlooker's perspective, she looked like a little girl throwing a tantrum.
"How dare you humiliate this queen!? I'll kill you!"
"Yeah, yeah. Keep trying, kid."
"You…"
Ignoring the kid, Leo entered the north section of the abandoned area. Then, he arrived at a small courtyard with a decayed mansion.
Stone statues of gargoyles were half broken as they all lost their heads. The walls and the doors were also in ruins. In front of the mansion was a garden area, but only dead plants remained.
As for the mansion, it still looked as new. A red dome covered the entire building, protecting the resident from external influence.
When Leo approached the mansion, he discovered the same silver talismans around the area. Someone deliberately placed them around the structure as if they wanted to seal the residents inside.
Leo scoffed and collected the talismans around the mansion. Again, as soon as he picked one of them, the formation array was broken, and the array's effects were dispelled.
The girl narrowed her eyes as she observed how Leo collected the talismans.
"Why are you helping us?" Asked the girl.
"I'm not helping you. I'm just a scavenger, and I'm taking some goodies home."
"…"
"Anyway, nice to meet you, empress. Can you get off my back now?"

chapters.title: Chapter 126 Florida Man Abducts Children Home, Discovers They Are Adult Cosplayers
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 126 – Florida Man Abducts Children Home, Discovers They Are Adult Cosplayers
Esen was the empress of an ancient civilization, the Molg Empire. She was once the lich empress, who ruled over a million vampires, death knights, and arch liches, aka the country's only population.
5,000 years ago, Esen and her undead empire governed the main continent of this planet. She coexisted along with the local creatures as she kept the undead population minimum. Because of her policies and laws, her people learned to be kind and gentle to living creatures.
The undead empire operated like a church to the local creatures as they taught them the way of life. They preached about peace and the afterlife.
Usually, they chose well-behaved animals and beasts to resurrect as undead. Then, they trained the chosen ones until they evolved into liches, vampires, or death knights. As for the disqualified ones, their bodies returned to the soil.
In short, the Molg Empire was full of pacifists. They were harmless to the living.
Everything was peaceful and tranquil until immortals from another world invaded them. Millions of cultivators accused them of being heretics and they needed to be subjugated. Then, war broke out.
The war didn't last long. As the pacifist undead creatures never fought in such a war, they were annihilated within a month. Esen's empire vanished from history.
However, not everybody was weak. The empress of the Molg Empire, Esen, led her remaining army to fight back. She managed to slaughter and enslaved 100,000 immortals during the counter-siege. During the war, she proved that she was stronger than average immortals from the otherworld.
Unfortunately, cultivators were good at adapting and flexibility. They soon trapped her with their tricky arrays. As they weren't strong enough to kill her, they chose to seal her and left her to rot in an underground dungeon.
Time passed. The legend of the invasion was forgotten through time. However, Esen and other survivors were still stuck in their prison.
One day, people from the Yan and the Situ Clan found the underground ruin. They soon explored the area and found the entrance to Esen's prison.
However, the seal arrays of the immortals in the past were too complicated for the cultists. None of them could enter or journey beyond the doors and the rooms, full of purple pillars and beams. Thus, they left the places alone.
Then, Leo came along.
.
.
Esen, the Lich Empress, stared at Leo with a deep frown. She was once the strongest undead immortal that vanquished 100,000 immortal cultivators from the other worlds, but she couldn't even leave a scratch on Leo's skin.
"You're weird." Esen clicked her tongue.
Leo rolled his eyes and walked around the mansion. He continued picking the dimmed talismans around the building. He also thought to himself.
'What the hell does this zombie want?! I'm fine if she bites me, but she keeps getting on my nerve. Man, I hate dealing with children, especially zombie children.'
Leo already accepted the fact that he had freed a freaky zombie kid. Thus, he maintained his composure throughout the interaction. As Leo wanted to chase the lich girl away, he complained.
"Whatever. Now that I've freed you, you're free to go. Go home already."
"That mansion is my home. You're the one intruding."
"Then, get the hell down from my back, kid. Why are you still clinging to me and scratching my neck? I'm not interested in kids and weird fetishes."
"…"
Esen was offended. Still, realizing how Leo never tried to harm her, she let go of him and stood behind him.
Esen thought, 'This man is too strange. He has an air of an immortal, but he is not. He is definitely stronger than regular immortal cultivators, though. Isn't he on the same side as those raiders?'
Although Esen was grateful that Leo had freed her, she didn't let her guard down. She slowly climbed down from Leo's back while she maintained her fighting stance, getting ready to fight to the death.
Betraying Esen's expectation, Leo turned around and gave her a meaningful look. Upon gazing at the girl up close, he got to see her true appearance.
From Leo's perspective, Esen looked like the corpse of a six or seven years old girl. She had no eyeballs, and her dry skinny limbs were already dark. Most of her long hair already fell off, revealing her scalp and skin on her head.
Leo pursed his lips. Although it was his first time seeing a talking zombie, he was amused. His mood also got better, and he teased her.
"I see. That explains a lot. Now, I understand why you tried to bite me. Anyway, kid. Are you thirsty or hungry? Do you need food?"
"I'm not a kid," Esen was annoyed. In anger, she revealed her secret to winning the argument, "I've been living for over 10,000 years! I'm older than your grandmother!"
Leo rolled his eyes. His immature side also wanted to win the argument, "As I said. You're still a kid to me. I'm already 50,038 this year if you wanna know. I'm five times older than you!"
Like bantering children, the duo yelled at each other for a minute before they stopped because of their exhaustion.
In the end, Esen didn't believe him. She kicked Leo's shin in anger.
CRACK
Instead of breaking Leo's leg, Esen's leg was broken in half.
"…"
Esen felt no pain. She looked at her broken leg for a moment and clapped her hands.
CRACK
Random bones from the other room flew toward the mansion. They gathered behind Esen, piling into a big mountain.
Esen turned around and picked a random skull of a vampire. The white skull melted upon touch and merged with Esen's boney body.
After absorbing the mass, Esen's broken bones were instantly repaired. Though she was still lanky and skinny.
When her leg was in good condition, Esen turned to Leo. She shamelessly demanded him and opened her palm.
"I'm hungry. Give me something to eat."
Leo shrugged. Esen's behavior might be rude and immature, but Leo didn't mind it. After all, he couldn't get mad at a child.
'A kid is always a kid. I shouldn't behave like a Karen. I'm a mature and responsible adult!' Leo thought to himself. Then, he asked her.
"What do you prefer? Fresh meat, blood, or brains?"
"Are you an idiot?!" Esen grumbled, "I only eat vegetables! We, the proud Molg Liches, never eat meat! We only eat leaves and vegetables!"
"A vegan zombie, I see. How peculiar."
"I'm a lich, not a zombie!!"
Again, Esen wanted to beat Leo to a pulp, but she was helpless against this monster. Shouting and yelling at his face was the only thing she could do to quell her anger.
Leo sighed and searched his rings, checking if he had anything edible. He pulled out a mutated dragon fruit tree from his ring.
As the tree already produced dragon fruits, Leo picked a few and gave them to Esen.
"Can you eat these?"
Esen frowned and stared at the black fruits. She flipped it around for a moment before she noticed something odd.
"Yin fruit?! W-Where did you get these?!"
"Obviously, I grow them."
"…"
Esen gave Leo a meaningful look before she started nom-noming the fruits in her hands. She quickly devoured everything in seconds, not leaving the seeds behind.
After consuming the fruit, her hair and her eyeballs regenerated. Her coarse and dry white hair turned gold, and her dark skin whitened. Still, Esen needed to increase her body mass.
"More."
Leo shrugged. He loved feeding kids and homeless people, "Sure, your majesty. Man, looking at you reminds me of the old days. I wish I could make a YouTube channel to compete with Mr. Beast. My channel name would have been Mr. Florida Man. That would have been fun."
"???"
Again, Esen didn't understand Leo's mumbling. She snatched dragon fruits from Leo's hands and continued eating them.
As soon as Esen finished eating the 20th fruit, she was full. Her stomach was slightly bloated, and she burped.
"How unladylike," Leo chuckled.
"This empress does whatever she wants!"
"Sure. Sure."
Leo stopped entertaining her. He continued exploring the exterior of the mansion, picking the remaining talismans in the area. As for Esen, she followed Leo around, observing his actions.
Walking around the mansion in a circle, Leo secured a total of 666 silver talismans. He stuffed them in his spatial ring and turned to leave.
Before Leo left the mansion's garden, he waved his hand at Esen.
"Take care of yourself. I'm leaving."
"…"
Esen flinched. She opened her mouth and raised a finger for a moment. However, she changed her mind.
The next moment, Esen vanished as if she teleported. Afterimages appeared inside the mansion as if she searched for something inside. Five seconds later, Esen appeared in front of Leo, bringing seven knight helmets, five tailcoat robes, and three black gowns along with her.
Esen then shoved everything to Leo.
"Store these in your magic ring. Take those along."
Leo frowned and looked at the stuff, "What are these?"
"My subordinates."
"Your… what?"
"I'll resurrect them later. They have been sealed for so long that their souls are hibernating. Until I regain my power, keep them with you."
Leo crossed his arms. Although he cared for children, he didn't like being pushed around.
"What's in it for me? Why should I bring them along?"
Esen took a long pause. She flustered, looking left and right as if she hesitated on something. Then, she made her decision.
Since her empire was already ruined and Leo helped her, Esen tried to seduce him.
"I'll teach you the power of necromancy! You can become an immortal like me and live forever!"
"No, thank you."
"WHAT?!"
"I'd rather keep my flesh and blood. Also, I don't like living inside a rotting body. My current body looks more aesthetic than those of a zombie."
"…"
Even though Leo said that he cooperated with Esen, taking the clothes and the skulls into his spatial ring.
"By the way, empress. If you want to repay me, you can do something else in return."
"What?" Esen was curious why Leo would want her help, judging from his demeanor and attitude toward her.
Leo might be silly and crazy most of the time. However, when it came to dealing with kids, his brain functioned normally like human beings. He had an idea of how he could exploit the self-proclaim empress.
'Well, since you keep saying 'empress-this', 'empress-that', why don't I put you to work? I already have a bunch of unicorns and mannequins at home. Why don't I bring in some zombies to work for me? They're free laborers!'
Leo rubbed his hands and grinned.
"Instead of teaching me necromancy and evil magic, how about you use those magic for me? You see, I happen to run a shop, and I need a lot of employees, security guards, and stable caretakers. Are you interested, kid?"
Esen pondered for a moment before she sneaked a glance at the mutated dragon fruit tree. She pointed at the tree.
"If I help you, will you give me more of those?"
"Sure."
"Then, can you help me resurrect my subordinates?"
"If I can…"
"Then, that's a deal! I'll help you watch over your shop, and you will help me restore my Molg Empire!"
"Molg what?"
Leo scratched his head. He had a feeling that he was missing something. Unfortunately, it was too late.
Esen latched on Leo's back and sat on his shoulder. Then, she pointed forward.
"Let's go, Florida Man! To your domain!"
"…"

chapters.title: Chapter 127 Florida Man Steals Man's Underwear To Smell Its Crotch
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 127 – Florida Man Steals Man's Underwear to Smell Its Crotch
The return trip was fast. As Leo had a clear destination, he ignored everything and traveled north by leaping and jumping.
Esen exploited the privilege of a petite body by riding on Leo's shoulders. The latter also allowed her to play as she wished since he couldn't say no to a little kid.
When they returned, they found a hundred thunder unicorns on the farmland, sniffing and eating the crops. Cat was also there, and she had been screaming at the ponies.
"MEOW!"
Cat was furious. The crops belonged to Leo, and she was the only one who had the privilege to steal them. When the unicorns competed for the loot, she threw and fit and lashed her whips at them.
Unfortunately, the unicorns were a bunch of 9th-stage monsters. Only immortals or an army of quasi-immortals could be their opponents. Cat's attacks failed to harm the ponies.
Although Cat was hostile to the unicorns, the ponies didn't harm her as she had a strong scent of Leo. Moreover, she was a virgin child, whose virgin yin Qi was as pure as Leo's virgin yang. All thunder unicorns on the farm treated her as a potential energy bank and waited for her to become a refined adult.
Among the crowd, a certain unicorn tried to woo Cat.
"Smash <3"
"MEOW!!"
"Smash? ;)"
"MYAAAA!!"
"Smash D:"
"HISSSS!!"
"…Smash T-T"
Taxi sulked after the failed attempt. He lowered his head and walked away from the crowd while his colleagues laughed and neighed at him.
Leo arrived when Taxi got rejected. He witnessed the entire event, and he also laughed at Taxi.
"Bad donkey! That girl is a newborn child! Why are you trying to woo her?! Are you a pedo or what?!"
"Smash T-T"
Taxi cried a river and ran away from the farmland. He then cried to the unicorn elder, who gave Leo his horn.
Elder P.Hub snorted and bonked Taxi with his half-horn. He then roared, unleashing lightning Qi to suppress the rowdy unicorns.
As soon as P.Hub's overwhelming Qi exuded, all unicorns stopped eating. They ran toward the elder and gathered around the senior.
Leo and P.Hub's eyes met. Both nodded at each other as Leo thanked him for watching over the naughty horses.
When everything was in order, Leo walked toward the crowd of unicorns while sneaking glances at the apartment building.
On the balcony of the apartment, the disciples gathered there, watching the unicorns from above. As they were too weak to interact with them, they kept their distance to avoid trouble.
Wu Buyi also stood beside them, retelling the tale of how Leo tamed countless thunder unicorns and vanquished strong monsters in the mystic realm.
Leo looked up and found Wu Buyi. He waved his hand, calling him over.
"Bring the disciples! I'll formally introduce the new workers!"
Wu Buyi acknowledged the order and guided the scardy teens down. They joined the gathering and gazed at the tall unicorns in astonishment and awe.
The unicorns also sensed their respect. Some of them sniffed the young boys and discovered that they were all virgins. As soon as they recognized the scent, female thunder unicorns rushed toward them and nudged their heads against the disciples, showing affection and courtship.
The disciples were taken aback, but they laughed. Some of them innocently petted the female unicorns, unaware of their motifs.
"Ahem!" Leo coughed to get their attention. The crowd's eyes fixated on Leo, waiting for his announcement.
"Eh, where should I start? For now, I need to introduce everybody here to your new friends. First off, the young men over there will be your working colleagues and your caretakers…"
The introduction was brief.
Leo got the disciples and the thunder unicorns to know each other. He also requested Taxi and P.Hub to control the rowdy unicorns so that they wouldn't hurt the disciples.
As for the disciples, they got a new job. Leo ordered them to build a large stable for the unicorns so they could sleep or rest under a rooftop. They were also in charge of distributing food to the ponies.
Next, it was Esen's turn. At first, nobody paid attention to the girl as they mistook her for Leo's weird experimental material. But when she got down from Leo's shoulders and walked on her two feet, the crowd stared at the loli.
"I-Is that a jiangshi?!" One of the disciples trembled in fear as he was afraid of zombies and undead.
Wu Buyi looked indifferent in the beginning as he mistook Esen for another harmless pet of Leo. But when he inspected her further, Wu Buyi sweated profusely.
He could not measure her cultivation base or strength. Esen had no dantian. Instead, she was a walking mass of yin essence.
Esen calmly looked around and smirked at the thunder unicorns. She found them weak and insignificant.
"I have never seen these horses before. They seem strong, but they are too weak to be my servant."
Leo coughed, "Ahem! Kid… I mean, your majesty. Could you please grace us with your name and your words of introduction, please?"
"Since you ask nicely, fine!" Esen turned to the disciples and gazed at them even though she had no eyeball. "My name is Esen, the 12th Monarch of Molg Empire and the Empress of all liches! I AM the true ruler of this realm, not you, descendants of vile cultivators!"
"…"
Aside from the thunder unicorns and Wu Buyi, the disciples didn't know what to think. They looked at each other and shrugged as they found Esen's backstory weird.
Gao Yan narrowed his eyes for a moment as he faintly saw Esen's dark aura and the menacing presence of evil spirits around her. He turned to Thora, asking for her opinion.
"Is she for real, Thora?"
Betraying Gao Yan's expectations, Thora hid behind Gao Yan, shivering in fear. She whispered to him, avoiding Esen's detection.
'S-She's a real deal! T-That girl is even stronger than the spirit queen! D-Don't provoke her!'
"EH!?"
Unfortunately, the unicorns had sharp senses. They heard Thora's voice, and they were shocked as well. Because of the stunning info, they caused a commotion and neighed in fright.
"ORDER!"
Leo clapped his hands, trying to calm the horses. Unfortunately, the unicorns were already in panic mode, and they were ready to flee from here.
Esen rolled her eyes as she found the horses annoying. She pulled a large tomato from the farm and ate it to replenish her energy.
While Esen ate the tomato, her shadow expanded toward the unicorns. When their shadows overlapped, the horses stopped moving as if they were frozen.
"Stop making useless noises, foolish creatures! This empress is not some vile bandit that senselessly takes lives! We govern life and death! Those who respect the dead will enjoy a peaceful life. Those who respect the living can enjoy life after death!"
While preaching, Esen branded the unicorns with her aura marks, linking her thought with theirs. Then, she communicated directly to their brains.
The unicorns stopped resisting or panicking. They stared at Esen in a daze before they lowered their heads. Only Taxi and P.Hub refused to bow to her.
A second later, half of the white thunder unicorns turned black. Their pupils, mane, and tails were as red as blood.
POOF
Suddenly, their bodies were ignited on fire.
Just like that, half of the thunder unicorns transformed into nightmares from hell.
Leo flinched for a moment as he didn't expect this result. He stomped toward Esen and grabbed her crown, lifting her in the air.
"Oi, brat. What the hell have you done to my beautiful donkeys?!"
Esen didn't resist. She allowed Leo to lift her up by holding her head with one hand. Then, she explained.
"Those unicorns have evil thoughts, and they are planning to ravish those young men and that plant monster. I brainwash them and turn them into my servants before they cause damage to your farms and your people. Instead of cursing me, you should thank me, Florida Man."
Leo raised his eyebrows and rechecked the transformed unicorns. Although they became black horses, they still retained the lightning Qi and the horns. In exchange for the transformation, they looked composed and calm, which was the opposite of their nature.
Esen smirked at Leo. She then offered her services, "I'll be in charge of managing those nightmares. Just provide me food and shelter, and I'll help you train them. Oh, if you change your mind and want to learn my secret art of necromancy, come talk to me any time."
"…"
.
.
The introduction process was hectic, but the old and the new members got along well.
Esen seemed to be prideful and arrogant at a glance, but she was quite a sociable person. She went around and talked to everybody, including Cat, Gao Yan, Wu Buyi, and the disciples. She even chatted with Thora for a while.
For some reason, Cat hit it off with Esen. The latter introduced her to the granaries and the domain's infrastructures. She also shared giant potatoes with the lich empress.
As everything was in order, Leo stopped worrying about his people and went to check on his mannequins. He visited the cloth shop first, checking on the tailor.
When Leo got inside the store, he found a lineup of long pants, shorts, long shorts, and men's underwear. All clothes were as white as a sheet, but they smelled nice.
Leo's sensitive nose was drawn toward a pile of men's underwear. He picked one of them and sniffed it.
It smelled like sunlight mixed with the back of his oily ears. The vomit odor and the warm ultraviolet gave birth to a pleasant puke aroma.
"Yup. Smell like my buttcrack."
Leo laughed and took off his clothes in front of the tailor mannequin. The mannequin slightly brushed, but she stared at Leo's refined body, especially his assets.
After putting on a new set of underwear and long pants, Leo collected a dozen sets in his spatial rings for a spare. Then, he gave the mannequin girl a new order.
"Stop making pants for now. I'll give you a new work to do!"
Leo purchased a full set of man's suits, a long coat, jackets, and sweaters from the online store system. He then gave them to the tailor mannequin, hoping that she could replicate those.
The mannequin stared at the clothes and repeatedly nodded. However, she kept staring at Leo while she poked his skin.
"What? You run out of material?"
The mannequin nodded. She then stared at Leo's arm, waiting for him to skin himself.
"Eh, fine. Give me a moment."
Skinning oneself was easy if one could withstand pain. Leo grabbed the tip of his index fingernail and pulled it backward.
CRACK
Leo pulled it off the nail plate, which revealed his transparent blood and the skin beneath the nail. Tossing away the nail piece, Leo dug into the wound with his other finger, grabbing the soft skin that was attached to the nail bed.
KWAK
Peeling from the nail, Leo dragged the sticky skin until it reached his elbow. Then, he cut off the skin and tossed it to the mannequin girl.
The wound was deeper this time as Leo was too heavy-handed. Fortunately, it was instantly healed.
After receiving the piece of skin, the mannequin installed it into her arm and began analyzing the cloth's patterns. She got fired up, and her needle arms began moving, sewing, and weaving new clothes from nothingness.
Leo left the mannequin alone. He strolled out of the shop with his new white pants.
When Leo got out, he ran into Esen, who had been peeking into the store.
Esen gazed at the store's interior through the front window, eyeing the rainbow evening dress. She didn't realize that she drooled.
"Do you want those?" Leo teased Esen.
Esen turned to Leo. In her eye sockets, purple fireballs were ignited, and she repeatedly nodded.
"Alright, sure."
Leo went back into the store and fetched a completed evening dress for Esen. He passed the dress to her.
Unfortunately, the dress was made for an adult woman. It was too big for a little girl like her.
Esen grabbed the dress and widely grinned. A moment later, she vanished into thin air, disappearing along with the new dress.
Leo shrugged as he stopped caring about unusual techniques, teleportation, and the cultivator's logic.
Before Leo could go elsewhere, Esen flew back and carried a mountain of monster bones with her. She dumped the bones in front of the store and pointed at them.
"Florida Man. This is the payment for this artifact! Take them!"
"…What?"
Leo was confused. He planned to give the dress to her for free since she had been wearing a piece of rag. Even if that was Esen's payment, Leo had never expected to receive a mountain of bones as a currency.
"What am I going to use these for? Oh, wait. Alchemy?"
Esen puffed her chest and laughed, "That's right. We, the liches, vampires, and death knights cultivate our yin in our bones to strengthen our power. Each piece of bone contains even more Qi than soul stones or essence stones! Anyway, use them as you see fit!"
"…"
Leo picked up a hand of a skeleton to check it. Indeed, it carried a thick dark purple aura.
As Esen reminded him of its quality, Leo brought a piece of it and walked to the back of his general store. Upon arriving at the alchemy workshop, Leo smiled at the working mannequins as if he was finally at home.

chapters.title: Chapter 128 Florida Man Announces He Will Open Kindergarten For Elders
chapters.content:
﻿
Chapter 128 – Florida Man Announces He Will Open Kindergarten for Elders
"It has been a while. I miss this place."
Leo visited an alchemist mannequin, who was busy making another batch of rejuvenate tea. When Leo approached him, he turned around to look and stood there, waiting for a new instruction.
As Leo remembered its past deeds, he scanned through the workshop. Fortunately, the mannequin got smarter as it stored the finished product in the barrels and the containers that Leo had prepared for it.
He lifted one of the barrels to check the content. Sure enough, it was full of the perfect-grade tea.
.
Pinnacle Grade Rejuvenate Tea
- Evolve bone marrow and blood cells.
- Decrease physical age by 20 years per liter.
- Increase metabolism by 100% for 480 hours.
- Remove cancer cells.
.
The item seemed dangerous for Leo as he was the host of evolved cancer cells. From a glance, drinking this tea could potentially kill him.
Leo once tested the tea's effects. Indeed, it damaged his cells, but it was not strong enough to kill the blood cells in his system. A small dose of tea managed to immobilize the transparent blood cells for a few minutes. After that, the cells self-resurrected and corrected the repaired damaged organs as if nothing had happened.
Still, during the immobilized period, the tea made Leo slightly tipsy!
The tea had the same effects as alcoholic beverages!
Looking at the barrels of tea, Leo snickered. He had enough drink to enjoy for ages. Moreover, he could flex by serving this drink to his future guests and employees.
Leo thought of Wu Buyi. He wondered what that dumb alchemist would look like in his youth.
'I should keep feeding him the tea until his physical age is as young as that brat. Oh, once he's that young, I'll trick the other geezers into drinking more of my tea. Then, this entire place will be full of grade-schoolers. PFFT. This should be fun.'
The immature thought took over Leo's brain once again. He carried one of the barrels and brought it in front of Wu Buyi's house. Coincidentally, the guy was also in his house. As usual, he was busy watching his smartphone and enjoying the internet.
Leo noticed Wu Buyi's deed through the foul scent of the latter's bodily fluid. As he respected the latter's privacy, Leo knocked on the door and shouted.
"Wu Buyi. I've brought you your overtime pay! The tea barrel is in front of your house. Make sure to drink this while it's still fresh! Oh, don't overdrink it and turn yourself into sperm! One cup a day is enough!"
"Huh?"
Wu Buyi's boner was killed. He put on his pants and rushed outside. Upon opening the door, he found a wooden barrel. However, Leo had already left.
Looking left and right, Wu Buyi silently carried the barrel into his house and shut the door. Then, he continued his research, broadening his horizon.
He hadn't realized that the unicorns and Cat could detect his scent.
Meanwhile, Leo went back to the workshop. By the time he arrived, the first workshop's mannequin already finished making the latest batch of rejuvenating tea.
Leo stopped the worker and ordered him to take a break. The mannequin nodded and returned to the building, opening the door and getting inside the house.
While the mannequin was entering the workshop building, Leo took a peek inside. Then, he was astonished.
Inside the workshop was a warehouse of thousand tea barrels. Even though the interior space was expanded, the wooden barrels filled the room to the brim, leaving only a small space for the worker to sit.
The mannequin silently sat and hugged his knees, staring at Leo's face. He then looked at the work he had done.
"…"
Leo had a complex feeling about this mannequin. He felt bad for the automaton.
Since Leo had learned the spatial ring's function and usage, he entered the workshop and stored half of the barrels in his spatial rings. After clearing a portion of the room, he opened the online shopping system and purchased some furniture for the automaton.
A bed, a couch, a cabinet, flower vases, and random portraits of scenery came out. Leo arranged the future and patted the mannequin's shoulder.
"Next time you rest, you can sit on the couch or sleep in the bed. Oh, make sure you take a bath before you take a long rest."
The automaton's eyes gleamed. He repeatedly nodded and walked toward the bed and the couch to inspect them. Remembering Leo's instruction, he inspected his body, which got sandy and rough because of the accumulated dirt, dust, and mud.
After discovering the dirtiness, the mannequin understood why a bath was a must. He left the building and entered the general store as the bathrooms there provided infinite tap water.
Leo had been observing the mannequin's actions. When the wooden doll entered his store, Leo had a bad premonition. He immediately purchased rubber door mats that he usually found in department stores. Rushing into the general store, he placed the mats in the air filtering room and in front of the public toilets.
That was not enough. As people might be using the public toilets as their bathhouses, Leo bought a clean towel and threw it toward the mannequin.
"Before you come out after a bath, dry your body with it. When you're done, make sure to do the laundry so you can use that again."
The mannequin tilted his head. He didn't understand what LAUNDRY was.
Looking at the mannequin, Leo had a headache. He purchased a laundry machine, a cloth dryer, and a huge canteen of liquid detergent.
As the machines couldn't operate without electricity, Leo had no choice but to upgrade them once. The machines cost only 20 years of lifespan, but upgrading both of them cost 2,000 YOL.
After upgrading the machines, Leo paused to think. He wondered how far he could upgrade the modern electrical appliance. Putting his inspiration to work, Leo upgraded it to level 8, spending an additional 12,000 YOL.
DING
Both the cloth dryer and laundry machine looked the same. However, all buttons vanished.
Leo frowned. Without a button, he had no idea how the machines worked. Thus, he tested them by throwing the dirty uniform of a cultist into the laundry machine.
After closing the hatch, the machine hummed. A second later, colorful water soaked the clothes, and a pleasant flowery scent kicked Leo's nose.
The machine didn't need detergent anymore. It came with a built-in detergent generator, and it also created water for the laundry!
However, without an external water pipe, Leo got curious about how the machine would dispose of the used water. He and the mannequin observed the machine.
DING
It took the machine 20 minutes to wash the clothes. It looked like a normal washing machine at a glance. But when Leo looked inside the machine to see the washed clothes, he was astonished.
Every piece of clothes glittered even though they were still wet. Leo pulled one of the wet robes out to inspect its color and quality. Checking its durability, Leo lightly stretched it.
The wet clothes didn't rip. Had it been regular clothes, it would have been torn in half.
"How the hail…"
The robe was upgraded after the laundry. From a black uniform, it became white. In addition, the texture was softer, but the durability and flexibility improved.
With such a sturdy cloth, Leo wondered if others could use it as armor.
Leo's eyes glinted as his capitalist side got another inspiration. He explored the online shopping system, searching for a coin meter system to install on top of the washing machine.
It was easy to find as there were many brands. Still, Leo chose not to purchase them due to a troublesome reason – Nobody here used coins.
'Tsk. I wish they sold spirit stone machines. Do I have to invent one myself?'
Leo closed the menu. For now, he put the project aside and left the washing machine there as an exclusive tool for himself. He turned his attention to the cloth dryer next.
The next machine's function was a lot simpler. Leo tossed the wet clothes in there, but the machine instantly ejected them out. All clothes were instantly dried and ironed. In addition, they came out folded.
Leo inwardly laughed. This machine would have been popular among lazy housewives and salarymen in the modern world.
"Welp. This is perfect for me. I don't have to keep buying new clothes from the store anymore."
.
After instructing the mannequin and showing him how to use the machines, Leo left the mannequin alone in the bath. He then purchased another set of rubber mats to place in front of the public toilets.
Coming out of the general store, Leo returned to the workshop. He hadn't forgotten his primary objective yet.
When Leo arrived, he put a glowing purple bone that Esen had given him into the cauldron. He then pressed the research button.
DING
.
Molg Lich's Femur
This piece of bone once belonged to an immortal celestial general of the destroyed Molg Empire. Even though 10,000 years have passed, this piece of bone still contains a great amount of yin essence. It can be used as a catalyst for necromancy or converted into soul stones with alchemy. However, top immortal alchemists can turn this piece of bone into something greater.
[Alchemy Recipe – Soul Stones]
One Molg Lich's Bone (Any Piece)
Yin Essence
[Alchemy Recipe – Luck Crystal]
Seven Purified Molg Lich's Bones
Blood of 10,000-Year-Old Virgin Maiden
Blood of 10,000-Year-Old Virgin Man
Yin and Yang Essence
.
Leo had a lot to say when he read the recipe of Luck Crystal. He wanted to curse his system for demanding impossible ingredients.
"Where the hell can I find a 10,000-year-old virgin maiden!? Are you nuts?! Also, virgin man? You… are you dissing me?!"
Because of his innocence, Leo took a defensive stance and bellowed at the blue window in front of him. He didn't realize that the unicorns, nightmares, and Esen could hear him.
Taxi and P.Hub smirked and shook their heads. The emotionless nightmares simply snorted, but Esen was taken aback.
Curious about what Leo was doing, Esen checked on him. He lightly poked Leo's butt with another femur bone that she had brought.
"What's the problem with a 10,000-year-old maiden? Are you talking to me?"
"Hah?!"
Leo turned around and looked at the loli lich. He didn't get it at first. But when he saw the deep frown on Esen's face, Leo figured it out and was surprised.
"You… dammit. Did someone set me up?"
"What's the matter? Why are you looking for a virgin maiden?"
Leo sighed and confessed, "I need her blood in alchemy."
"Oh. Is that so? Well, once I recover my power, I'll donate some to you. By the way, what are you making? Can I know the alchemy recipe?"
"…"
Leo was speechless. He didn't expect the arrogant girl to be this kind. Still, he appreciated her offer nonetheless.
Nobody hated free goodies!
"Ahem!" For the sake of the long-lasting relationship, Leo told her the truth, "I'm planning to make Luck Crystal. Well, coincidentally, it takes seven pieces of your people's bones, blood of a virgin 10,000-year-old man and woman… and some basic essence."
Esen narrowed her eye sockets even though she had no eyeballs. Her expression was solemn for a moment before she suddenly smiled and laughed.
"FUAHAHAHAHAHAH!!"
Leo was offended. He yelled at the loli, "What's the matter with you? What's so funny?!"
"If I guess correctly, you must also be a virgin. Am I right? How old are you again? 50,000? PFFT! BAHAHAHAHA!!"
"…"

chapters.title: Chapter 129  Florida Man Claims He Understands Life  Better After Talking to Statues
chapters.content:
Chapter 129  Florida Man Claims He Understands Life Better After Talking to Statues
Chapter 129 – Florida Man Claims He Understands Life Better After Talking to Statues
Because of the reminder, Leo believed he had all materials, except the purified bones.
"Kid, do you know how to purify the bones?"
Esen snorted, "How should I know?"
"…Forget it. I'll take care of it eventually."
Because of the lack of key ingredients, Leo put aside the new project. He turned his attention to the old recipes that he had never tried yet. He opened the alchemy workshop's status menu and explored the known recipes.
.
[Alchemy Recipe – Pill of Youth]
One Hundred Blades of Immortal Grass
One Drop of Virgin Sage's Blood
One Drop of Unicorn's Tear
One Liter of Pinnacle-Grade Holy Water
Five Elemental Essence
.
[Alchemy Recipe – Longevity Pill]
One Blade of Immortal Grass
One Liter of Pinnacle-Grade Holy Water
One Black Heart of 9th-Grade Demon Beast
*Optional* Any Fire, Water, Earth, Metal, or Wood Element Catalyst
Any Elemental Essence
.
"Whoops."
Leo smacked his forehead. He mistook the unicorn's tear for a unicorn's horn. Also, he stocked 9th-grade monster cores instead of collecting their black hearts. Realizing his mistake, he had the urge to return to the mystic realm and bring the alligator monsters back.
Still, it was a slight setback. Since Leo got those ingredients in his hands, he might as well research them.
Leo brought out P.Hub's horn and broke the tip. Then, he tossed it into the cauldron and pressed the research button.
DING
.
Horn of Thunder Unicorn
Can only be found on a planet among Forbidden Constellation Star Sector as Thunder Unicorns only live there. As Thunder Unicorns utilize their horns as their second dantian, every piece of it contains a thick amount of lightning element essence. Because it contains a rare element, many celestial beings from immortal realms put a bounty for it, and they are willing to pay an arm and a leg to get a piece of it.
[Alchemy Recipe – Lighting Dantian Pill]
One gram of Thunder Unicorn's horn
One drop of Thunder Unicorn's tear
A Spark of White Tribulation Lightning Bolt
A Spark of Green Tribulation Lightning Bolt
A Spark of Purple Tribulation Lightning Bolt
A Spark of Yellow Tribulation Lightning Bolt
Lightning Element Essence
.
Leo scoffed as he found the recipe obnoxious as it required lightning element essence.
"Yup. It's one of those idiotic kind of recipes. Without the lightning essence, you can't make lightning element pills. But without pills, you can't cultivate lightning elements. It's like which came first – chicken or eggs."
The recipe was also difficult because the pills required tribulation lightning's sparks, which was new to Leo. Fortunately, the list only went up to the yellow grade. Had it demanded red lightning or black lightning bolts, Leo would have flipped the cauldron out of rage.
Leo closed the window and postponed this project. He researched another item. This time, he threw a 9th-grade monster core into the cauldron.
DING
water and lightning elements, and their meat is delicious. This monster core is their crystalized dantian. Alchemists love these .
9th-Grade Monster Core of Horned Caiman
Horned Caimans are common in immortal realms as they are the bottom-feeders of the river. They are known to be the master of water and lightning elements, and their meat is delicious. This monster core is their crystalized dantian. Alchemists love these monster cores as they can be refined into Water or Lightning Dantian Pills. However, nobody has discovered a secret recipe, which can bring chaos to any mortal realm.
[Alchemy Recipe – Lighting Dantian Pill]
One 9th-Grade Monster Core of Horned Caiman
One Yang Element Catalyst
Lightning Element Essence
[Alchemy Recipe – Water Dantian Pill]
One 9th-Grade Monster Core of Horned Caiman
One Yin Element Catalyst
Water Element Essence
[Alchemy Recipe – Floridian Dantian Pill]
One 9th-Grade Monster Core of Horned Caiman
One Drop of Florida Man's Blood
One Piece of Florida Man's Flesh
.
"…"
The first two recipes looked normal as they required catalysts, which were the same as other regular pills and dans. However, Leo was stunned by the third recipe.
Floridian Dantian Pill?!
Leo couldn't laugh. He believed the system made this up to bully him, and he was offended.
"Is this some kind of a joke? Floridians have a dantian now? We can be made into pills?!"
DING
Unlike usual, the system replied to Leo's inquiry instead of ignoring Leo's questions.
<Research Feature automatically calculates and analyzes the material and comes up with every possible recipe, using the existing materials in every mortal world and immortal realm. Your existence is included in the calculation.>
"…I'll be damned."
It was not a pleasant feeling when he became one of the alchemy ingredients. Leo feared that one day, the system might want him to sacrifice his organs to make something absurd.
But since the recipe seemed easy this time, Leo let it slide. He bit his arm and pulled out a chunk of his flesh. Then, he tossed it into the cauldron.
As the flesh had some of his transparent blood, Leo fulfilled the requirements. He then threw a caiman's monster core in there and spat into the fireplace as usual. After closing the lid, Leo initiated the pill-making procedure.
DING
<Refining Floridian Dantian Pill…>
<Remaining Time – 29 Days, 23 Hours, 59 Minutes, 59 Seconds.>
Something was not right about the timer – It took too long to complete! In the past, the longest pill-making time was only a few days. However, this one required a whole month!
Fortunately, Wu Buyi was not there, and the alchemist couldn't read Leo's mind. Otherwise, he would have vomited blood and died out of rage because his cultivation pills took him longer than a month to make. Thus, one month was a short refining time among local alchemists.
Because the first cauldron would be busy for a month, Leo moved on to the other workshops. He went to check the yang flame dan factory and yin ice dan factory.
Both workshops did well. The automaton mannequins stood there, pressing their hands on the cauldrons. They focused solely on their tasks, ignoring Leo.
Leo entered the second workshop building. Inside the workshop, frozen crates full of yin ice dans filled the building. Looking at the finished products, Leo wondered why the warehouse worker didn't put them in the warehouse buildings.
He visited the yang flame dan's workshop next. Upon getting inside, he found an opposite world.
The dans were on fire, and they were piled inside a metal container, which Leo had never seen before. It glittered in silver light, which resisted the dans' extreme heat.
"What the hell? Where did they find these?"
Leo walked out of the workshop to ask the mannequins. But when he looked at their faces, he smacked his forehead.
"Right. They can't speak. What the hell, my workers? What have you been doing? Where did you get all these goodies and containers?"
While Leo complained, a warehouse worker passed by. He heard Leo's questions and poked his master.
Getting poked, Leo turned around, "What?"
The warehouse worker waved his hand and pointed at the junkyard. Leo tilted his head in confusion, but he followed the warehouse mannequin anyway.
When Leo arrived at the junkyard, he found a new world. Instead of seeing a mountain of trash and his past collections, he found the recycle center workers, who were in the middle of transforming iron pine lumber into random furniture.
"…"
Leo blankly stared at them. He didn't remember giving them such an order.
"Who asked you to make furniture, damn bots?"
The recycling center workers looked at each other. Then, they pointed at the floating platform in the sky.
"What? Heaven?"
The workers shook their heads. They started drawing a picture of four statues over there and drew a circle around the fisherman.
"Huh?"
Leo still had no idea what they were trying to communicate. He looked up and frowned.
"Are you saying that a freaking statue ordered you to make those?"
Every worker nodded.
"Haiya…"
Leo was at a loss for words for multiple reasons. First, the workers did something without his permission, which threatened his authority. Secondly, someone had the power to influence the workers, which Leo didn't like.
And lastly, from the workers' testimony, they pointed toward the mysterious statues on the mystic realm portal platform.
"I guess I have to go see those statues next. Anyway, what else have that fisherman statue told you to do?"
The mannequins looked at each other. Then, they pointed south, where Leo had ordered them to dig the fish pond. However, it became a grand canyon trench.
One of them gestured to Leo to follow him. Leo did so and reached the cliff of the trench.
The guiding mannequin stopped at the edge and made a T-Pose. He then raised his right arm 90 degrees upward for a moment before he robotically raised his left arm while maintaining 90 degrees between his both arms. Then, an unthinkable thing occurred.
ZAAAA
The mystic realm platform suddenly poured a stream of water from above, raining upon the trench. Like a leaking dam, the stream got bigger over time.
Soon, it became a massive waterfall from the sky. A rainbow came out and beautified the scene.
<AHEM!>
As if the mannequin had unlocked something, Leo heard an elderly man's cough. He turned to look at the flying platform.
Unfortunately, the elder didn't continue speaking. Leo frowned and was confused.
"I clearly heard a sound."
Leo jumped up to the platform. He stomped toward the fisherman's statue and confronted it.
"What did you do? I heard you."
<…>
No statue responded.
Leo slightly tilted his head and gave the statue a "Are you serious" look. He cracked his knuckles.
"Will you talk nicely or do you want me to smash every statue here?"
<…>
The four statues sweated profusely, yet they refused to talk for some reason.
Fortunately, one of them gave in first. The round slime-like cat with tentacles shifted his eyes.
<Calm down, master, munya!>
"Hmm?"
As soon as the catopus talked, the others stopped the façade. They all deeply sighed.
<Please calm your anger, woof!> Said the wolf statue.
The black-winged angel statue also stood up, but he knelt on one knee to pay respect.
<Don't be angry, master. He means well.>
The fisherman statue lowered his head next.
<I used your golems without your permission. Please forgive me.>
"…"
Leo blankly stared at the four talking statues in shock for a minute. When he came to terms with the weird things around the domain and the system, Leo slapped his forehead and complained.
"An introduction is in order. Tell me who you are and why are you're here? Who are you? Why do you come out? What are your purposes?"
The four heavenly guardians looked at each other and smiled. The fisherman began his introduction first.
<We are… originally a part of you, master.> Said the fisherman.
<We were your shadow, to be exact.> Said the black-winged angel.
<You created us, munya!>
<Or should we say… we exist because of your entity fate crystal, woof?>
As soon as the wolf blurt out the keywords, the other statues glared at her.
<Bad dog, munya!>
"…"
Leo narrowed his eyes as he heard something interesting. He also tried to recall his past when he first got the alien rings.
He vaguely remembered something similar. Also, strangely, the expedition objective was related to an entity fate crystal. Leo wondered if they were connected.
"Next question, what is entity fate crystal? Why does it have to do with y'all?"

chapters.title: Chapter 130 Local Floridians Concerned as Florida Man Erects Caiman Farm Instead of Alligator Farm
chapters.content:
Chapter 130  Local Floridians Concerned as Florida Man Erects Caiman Farm Instead of Alligator Farm
Chapter 130 – Local Floridians Concerned as Florida Man Erects Caiman Farm Instead of Alligator Farm
A few hours later…
DING
<A permanent portal to Planet Rabbit Trent A-3 has been opened.>
<The Planet "Rabbit Trent A-3" has been renamed to "Orlando".>
DING
<One of the Mystic Realm Portal's Guardian "Kitten" has been assigned as Governor of Orlando Planet.>
<Because of the guardian's domain abilities, all Horned Caimans and Cockatrices will no longer be hostile toward you or your employees. However, they will fight back if their lives are in danger.>
<Because of the guardian's domain abilities, the fertility rate of all freshwater creatures and sea creatures have been tripled. Water-based creatures have been strengthened. The density of water element essences have been doubled.>
<Guardian "Kitten" will collect life force from the local population of Orlando Planet as local taxes. Every month, the guardian shall transfer the accumulated life force to you directly.>
Leo gazed at the fisherman statue, who transformed into an elderly fisherman and vanished into the newly erected permanent portal to the previous mystic realm. He waved his hand to the elder.
"I'll call you back when I can find a better governor. Be patient… Kitten."
The fisherman statue bitterly laughed at his new nickname. He slightly bowed and vanished into the permanent portal.
After the fisherman statue was gone, the three others returned to their previous position. They resumed their poses, pretending to be regular statues.
Leo glanced at the trio and deeply sighed. He had heard everything from them, and he got a better understanding of his system and the entity fate crystal.
Still, as the entity fate crystal's secret was too heavy, Leo still couldn't calm down. He also couldn't stop sighing.
"What the hell have I gotten myself into?"
As overthinking deteriorated his sanity, Leo threw everything he had learned earlier to the back of his head. He glanced at the three statues.
"Keep up the good work. I'll summon you when I need your help in the future."
<Roger, Munya!>
<Of course, Woof!>
<Understood, boss.>
The black-winged angel, the catopus, and the wolf respectfully bowed. Their eyes dimmed as they went back to dormant mode.
Leo turned around and jumped down from the platform. He still had a lot of things to do, such as building the Gunsmith Workshop, upgrading the general store, tidying the junkyard, sorting spatial rings, and overseeing the warehouses.
Managing an entire company alone was a tough job. The Florida Ceo would be busy for a long time.
.
.
It had been two weeks since every mystic realm portal in the world was opened. The expedition teams from big sects and clans returned to deliver their results.
The Tang Clan returned in full numbers as they never ventured far into the dangerous forests. They lingered around the pagoda town for a week before everybody returned.
Tang Xuan and his young junior received a full boon of the mystic realm. Some of them awakened either wood or water element while a few youngsters managed to advance to the golden core stage by cultivating the elemental Qi.
Yang Xiang and the first prince's teams managed to come back to tell a tale as well. The former's group returned early after they had discovered the sweet dream mushroom. As for the first prince's group, they salvaged a strange metallic ship and brought it home.
