For the sake of preserving the fur, Leo pulled out his pistol and shot the werewolf's head.
BOOM
The direct hit blasted the head of the golden wolf and splatted his brain everywhere.
After the wolf died, Leo tried to store the corpse in his storage rings. However, he noticed that the rings were almost full to the brim.
Keeping meat in a dimensional pocket full of floating metals and steel bullet heads was unhealthy. Although Leo was reluctant, he started using the system's inventory menu. He stored the corpse in there.
DING
<You have stored a carcass of Fenrir Werewolf.>
<Please note. All stored items can be directly transferred to your shopping mall's warehouse.>
"HMM?!"
Leo widened his eyes. He learned a new thing.

chapters.title: Chapter 246 Florida Man Arrested for Breaking into Neighbor’s Home and Stealing a Weed Joint from Furry Burglars in the Same House.
chapters.content:
Chapter 246 Florida Man Arrested for Breaking into Neighbor’s Home and Stealing a Weed Joint from Furry Burglars in the Same House.
Chapter 246 – Florida Man Arrested for Breaking into Neighbor's Home and Stealing a Weed Joint from Furry Burglars in the Same House.
Leo's eyes gleamed. He shifted his attention to the colony and the werewolves in a space marine suit.
"Resources… Materials…"
The werewolves sensed his killing intent. Their fur stood up while their tails tugged between their legs.
It was too late for them to retreat. Leo charged at them.
"THIS IS ROBBERY!! GIMME YOUR WALLET, YOUR CLOTHES, AND YOUR MEAT!"
.
.
WHOOSH
The airtight room's interior automatic door was opened. The elder in a suit entered the colony's entrance door and looked inside. The interior was a steel corridor resembling the interior of a spaceship.
Leo hummed as he got several sets of bulky spacesuits and saw swords. He looked forward to reselling them to his employees.
RUMBLE
Steel shuttles descended from the ceiling and trapped Leo in front of the airtight room. The air vents poured green gas into the sealed area.
Leo was amused. He sniffed at the green gas and compared it to the toxic air that he once tasted.
"About the same smell as the mustard gas but the potency is lacking. Godzilla's bad breath is stronger than this. At least their breath can melt diamonds, concrete, and metals. This thing only burns."
Leo purposely inhaled the gas, treating it as good smoke. He exhaled and licked his lips.
The gas did nothing to Leo's lungs, skin, or internal organs. Instead, it only made them slightly tingling as if someone stroked his internal organs with a feather.
"Ah, that's a good smoke right there. It's a shame to waste it. Can I have some more?"
Leo tested his inventory system by gathering green gas with his Qi. He then shoved the mass of the gas ball into the inventory screen.
The gas passed through the screen, but it wasn't stored. The system also warned him.
<Only solid materials can be stored in the inventory.>
"Shame."
Leo shook his head and leisurely browsed his system shop. He searched for tools to compress air into a container, and the first result was a balloon.
"Ah, yes. Balloons! I miss my childhood days. Those helium balloons were the funniest toys back then."
When Leo was a child, he got stuck inside a room with nothing but glass windows around him. He remembered that his parents sometimes visited him in his room and brought him either food or toys. Usually, they were accompanied by strangers in white coats.
It was a vague and hazy memory. Leo roughly remembered that his parents reluctantly showed him a helium balloon and inhaled the air inside. Then, their voice changed. Leo also tried it and got addicted to the weird gas.
Afterward, strangers in white coats brought various balloons with unknown substances and smelly air to Leo. They forced him to inhale them and watched him suffer from various side effects. Fortunately, the pain never lasted long as his parents always returned to feed him delicious water.
The strange memory was short as Leo's parents brought him home when he was 10. He then met a sibling, who came from the adjacent glass room.
The rest of the memory was confusing and hazy. Leo couldn't recall anything after that, except the time when he emerged out of the alien spaceship.
Thus, the balloons gave Leo a nostalgic feeling. He purchased a package of a thousand balloons and used his Qi to fill them with gas. When a balloon was filled, Leo tried to store it in his inventory.
DING
<You have stored a soul-corrupting balloon in your inventory.>
It didn't pass through the inventory screen this time. The system recognized it as an item and listed it as a balloon.
"Soul corrupting? More like a mild weed to me. Anyway, thanks for the treat. I need those. I miss smoking. If I can mix this with those abundant immortal grass and sweet dream mushrooms, I should be able to make the ultimate joint!"
Had Esen and others heard and understood Leo's intention, they would have cursed him for decades because of his stupidity and silliness. No sane cultivator smoked poisonous gas or used it as a reliever.
As Leo stood there and collected the gas leisurely, the vents kept pouring gas inside while the CCTV cameras fixated on him.
An hour later, the vents stopped releasing gas. Instead, they poured sticky liquid inside the sealed area.
Meanwhile, Leo just stored the 1,000th poison gas balloon in his inventory. He was about to quit as he ran out of containers.
"Oh? What is this? Gasoline? Tar? Oil? Or… is this new meth I can use?"
.
.
While Leo forgot about the urgency and messed around, a large portal in the void was opened, and a large battleship exited the gate.
The battleship was one of many survivors from the previous raid. Overlord Milo personally took control of the ship and used it to travel here.
At the bridge of his battleship, a system screen informed him of the raid.
<A Player has invaded your Max Fenrir's home planet. The population of your friend's capital city is requesting reinforcement.>
<If you can repel the invader, the local population will acknowledge you as their lord. You may also claim his system perks, system buildings, and assets as quest rewards.>
Overlord Milo reread the message for the 10th time. Although he wasn't fond of Overlord Max, the rewards were too tempting. He wanted all colonies of his dead friend right away.
"Which idiots raid an overlord's town? Are they dumb? Don't they know that poking an overlord's town is automatically a death sentence? There are a bunch of system users in hiding. It's not like all system users show up at the Fate Stadium and register their names. Max also befriended a hundred system users. They should have arrived here by now."
This wasn't Overlord Milo's first rodeo. He had claimed several cities of his dead friends, and he used to defend ownerless cities several times. Thus, he was familiar with the clan battle system.
The key to victory wasn't just defending the main base. It required the defenders to buy time and run the clock. After all, the invading side only had 24 hours to destroy or take control of the main base. In case of failure, the invaders would always be sent home and suffer from a system's penalties, such as their bases being exposed to other system users.
Overlord Milo operated his ship's console and deployed a hundred observation drones. The drones descended the atmosphere and entered the orange world.
Each drone was as large as a F16. Its main equipment was cameras, a pseudo-deity shield system, and an emergency bomb, which could turn the observation drone into a suicide drone if necessary.
The drones scattered and passed through the tribulation lightning clouds. Orange thunderbolts hit them as a result, but none of them were harmed. An energy shield protected the hulls and the components, allowing them to enter the hazardous world.
Because of Leo's previous deed, several parts of the world were in flame, though most of the fire died down because this world contained very thin burnable gas.
Aside from the colony that Leo was in, this planet was a wasteland with nothing but raging tribulation lightning bolts.
Overlord Milo deeply sighed while he gazed at Max's home planet. He complained.
"This is what happens when you ignore the laws of a mortal world. If an immortal, a deity, or any powerhouse prolongs its stay in a mortal world, orange tribulation clouds will descend and burn the entire world. Now, look at your population. Only one city is left standing. I bet they already run out of food and resources."
Milo stood up. He vanished from his spaceship and reappeared directly on top of the colony dome. He looked down and observed the local population.
Betraying Milo's expectation, there was no population. Only a bunch of players and their subordinates were inside. As for Milo's subordinates and his population, they were piled into a mountain in front of the gigantic manor, which was Max's former house and headquarters.
"News travels fast. That idiot died a few days ago, but hyenas from various clans already made their moves. I bet the other city has already been raided and robbed clean. Still, why haven't they destroyed the manor? They could have gotten everything that way…"
Milo was baffled. He teleported again and appeared directly inside the colony.
Overlord Milo reverted to his true form, which was a gigantic Fenrir wolf. He landed in front of Max's manor and found a dozen werewolf sages in the front manor's yard.
The sages sensed the presence of a great wolf. They rushed toward Milo and lowered their heads.
"Greetings, overlord. Are you here to raid this domain or are you here to defend it?"
The 12 sages were bolder than Milo had imagined. He questioned them.
"You should be answering my question! What are you doing here?! Don't you know that Overlord Max is my colleague?!"
"…We know. That's why we have been protecting this headquarters since Overlord Max died."
Milo narrowed his eyes as he discovered the inconsistencies in their words. First, Milo just received a report that a player had recently invaded this planet an hour ago. This short timeframe wasn't enough for these hyenas to enter this colony before him.
Secondly, the corpses of the local population seemed fresh. Judging from the scent, they died a few hours ago, which was definitely before the invader appeared.
The evidence showed that they didn't come here through by relying on the system's help. Instead, they traveled here by themselves and slaughtered the local population for some reason.
Milo turned around and observed the life signatures in the massive colony. Several Fenrir werewolves still ran inside the skyscraper buildings as if they were searching for something. Many objects inside the buildings vanished whenever a werewolf got closer.
It wasn't hard to guess what they did. There werewolves were looting and plundering the empty city.
"Smart, but not wise," Milo commented. "You people came here, slaughtered the townspeople, and robbed them without destroying the main headquarters. Because you traveled here yourselves and the local population opens the doors to welcome you, the system doesn't inform me or others that the domain is invaded. Even after you killed them, the system ignores it because it treats the incidents as local genocides."
"…"
The expressions of the sages changed. They pulled out their weapons and glared at the giant wolf.
"Overlord. Please respect our choices. Overlord Max is dead. His properties, cultivation resources, and artifacts should be passed down to fellow fenrirs of the junior generation. You can't possibly hog all of them since they are not yours."
"PFFT! You finally show your true color, you hyena thieves!"
Overlord Milo opened his mouth and pulled out a long burning sword from his throat. His wolf's hand transformed into monkey-like hands so that he could hold the giant flame sword.
"Drop all your spatial rings and all items in your inventory system. Otherwise, I'll cut you down and attack your colonies, too! You don't wanna know what I can do to your families, do you?"
The sages glared at Overlord Milo and shouted. "Don't get cocky! Our cultivation bases are only better than ours! You alone can't defeat us all!"
"Wanna try?" Overlord Milo cackled and was about to swing his black flame sword.
BOOOOOOM
Suddenly, a large explosion erupted from the front of the colony's entrance gateway. It was so loud that Milo turned around to look.
WHOOSH
A black silhouette flew out of the dust and floated in the sky under the colony dome. He patted his suit and looked around.
"This is getting annoying. I just want some good smoke. Why did those wolves fire rocket launchers at me? I've come in peace!"

chapters.title: Chapter 247 Florida Man Advised Doomsday Preppers to Stock Booze, Beer, and Wine Instead of Food Before the Second COVID Spread.
chapters.content:
Chapter 247 Florida Man Advised Doomsday Preppers to Stock Booze, Beer, and Wine Instead of Food Before the Second COVID Spread.
Chapter 247 – Florida Man Advised Doomsday Preppers to Stock Booze, Beer, and Wine Instead of Food Before the Second COVID Spread.
"I've come in peace. I came in peace. I cum in peace. Meh, whatever." Leo shrugged and gazed at the ruined town below.
The city consisted of tall buildings, concrete roads, and cars. If he didn't know that the city was a colony of an alien, he would have mistaken this place as a city in the modern world.
Although the landmarks and the high-rise buildings seemed interesting, Leo found it weird as none of the street lights shone. None of the operating cars and other vehicles were visible on the street. Instead, only wrecked cars and burning cars could be found.
Moreover, piles of corpses exuded a foul iron-like scent in the air. Their blood soaked the streets while their innards and militated flesh dirtied the sidewalks.
Leo glanced at a large square building with a large parking lot. He spotted several shopping mall carts there and figured that the building might be a supermarket. However, corpses of werewolves were scattered everywhere.
In the middle of the parking lot, Leo found an unsettling scene. A female werewolf corpse with a hole in her head still held three puppies in her arms. The babies barked at their mother in a hoarse voice. Next to the dead mother, a tattered bone plushy doll was left there on the ground along with the other grocery items in paper bags.
The massacre disgusted Leo. Even though he came here to destroy Overlord Max's headquarters, he never planned to harm innocent townsmen, especially kids.
Leo's expression softened. He descended and rushed to rescue the three puppies. When he reached out to them, they bored their little fangs and barked in unison.
Leo flinched and recalled that they would die if he touched them. Thus, Leo ejected the good old hazmat suit and put it on. Then, he tried again.
The puppies resisted. They kept barking and threatened to bite the suit. Fortunately, their fangs were too soft to cut through it.
Leo carried the puppies in his arms and weighed them. As they were werewolf babies, they were the size of a fat human infant. Leo felt like he was holding three chubby golden retriever puppies.
The dogs resisted and tried to flee from Leo's arms. The latter deeply sighed.
"Doge. Can you stop moving? I'll give you some meat if you cooperate."
The dogs still resisted as they couldn't understand Leo's words.
"Alright. Fine."
Leo put them down and ejected a dead cockatrice from his spatial ring. He removed the feathers and tore the carcass meat apart.
The puppies froze and raised their noses to sniff the sweet scent of a raw chicken. They turned to Leo and drooled. One of them tip-toed toward him and wagged his tail, smiling.
"You stupid dog. How old are you? 2 weeks? 3 weeks? Can you eat hard food yet?"
The dogs didn't reply. They only eyed the sweet chicken in Leo's hands.
Leo wryly smiled and wondered if their stomach could digest hard food yet. He thought of purchasing an overpriced milk replacer from the system store, but there was a supermarket in front of him. They might have something for the babies.
'Heh, I'm such as hypocrite. I killed so many people, but I become a softy when I see children. It doesn't matter. Saving lives come first. I can't get peace of mind if I let them die like this.'
Leo stopped overthinking. He snapped his fingers and activated Overlord Mao Miaomiao's time and space domain.
CLICK-CLICK
The entire star system stopped moving. All stars, asteroids, particles, and lifeforms were frozen in time.
Leo rushed into the supermarket while the time was frozen.
Inside the supermarket, traces of combat and massacre were noticeable. Shelves and merchandise collapsed. Trails of blood and footprints soiled the clean marble floors. Canned products rolled on the bloody ground while the corpses of the shoppers still remained.
Leo ignored the half-wrecked supermarket and proceeded inside. He prayed that the supermarket layout was the same as the modern world.
He wasn't disappointed. The milk section was next to the alcohol section. Thus, Leo found countless packages of dog milk on the ground and under the collapsed shelves.
While Leo picked up the milk for the puppies, in the corner of his eyes noticed a group of werewolves around the alcohol section. He turned around to look at them.
The group of five werewolves huddled together. Two of them were in the middle of touching their spatial rings as if they were sorting their items. On the other hand, the remaining guys were busy shoving boxes of wine into their spatial rings in glee.
Leo raised his eyebrows as he found them smart.
"Yup. The first thing you rob from the supermarket during the apocalypse should be booze, beer, and wine! You can use them to dress wounds. You can drink it to relieve boredom. Or you can even turn them into Molotov cocktails! This is killing three birds with one stone!"
Because Leo approved of the action of these werewolves, he approached them and gently pulled their spatial rings. Afterward, he lightly punched their faces, causing their heads to distort.
After giving them a well-deserved punch to the face, Leo copied their action. He stored every intact merchandise in his system inventory and spatial rings. When the booze department was empty, Leo returned to the milk section and collected them as well.
Robbing a supermarket while stopping time was a fun activity. Leo forgot about the time while he was shopping.
An hour passed by, but everything in the solar system was frozen. Leo finished looting and sorting his inventory screen.
He was grateful to the system that the inventory existed. It solved a lot of problems when he had so many items inside as the items stacked. Every item in the system inventory showed up as an icon inside a grid box, and identical items were stackable. For example, two bottles of wine of the same brand took one inventory slot, but they showed as two bottles. As a result, it was a lot easier to sort and find a certain item.
Although Leo hadn't checked the warehouse area yet, he stopped shopping for the moment. He returned to the puppies at the parking lot. When Leo reached them, he brought out cartons of dog milk and three dog bowls. He then poured some milk for them. While he was at it, he crushed the chicken's meat into tiny pieces and mixed them with the milk.
When the preparation was ready, Leo resumed the flow of time.
CLICK-CLICK
Time resumed in the solar system. The five werewolves in the shopping mall earlier let out a weird whine as their heads exploded into blood mist. As for the puppies, they were surprised to see bowls of milk coming out of nowhere.
"Eat up before I change my mind. I'll be taking you home, okay?"
The three puppies didn't pay attention to Leo. They rushed to the milk bowl and started drinking. Their tongues scooped some tiny chicken pieces into their throat.
*COUGH*
As they had never eaten hard food before, the dogs coughed. Leo smirked and inspected them with his Qi to ensure that they weren't choked by the chicken meat.
The hungry dogs finished everything within 30 seconds. They licked the bowl clean and glanced at Leo's face in wary.
"Alright. I'll be back shortly. Stay here with your mom and dad."
Leo patted their heads and turned around. He planned to stop time again and finish this raid.
When Leo turned around, he sensed the aura of an entity like Aslan. However, his Qi volume and pressure were a lot weaker.
Overlord Milo in his true form hovered in the sky while he held his black long sword. He glanced at the puppies for a moment and shifted his attention to Leo.
"STATE YOUR NAME, NU'EARTHE! WHO ARE YOU?! WHY ARE YOU ATTACKING THIS DOMAIN?!"
Leo snorted in a bad mood. "None of your business. Get lost while I'm still feeling generous."
"…"
Overlord Milo didn't realize that Leo was the Florida Man he was looking for. He lowered his sword and turned around.
"Judging from how you treated the pups, I'll let you live for once. Go home while you still can. I'm taking over this domain!"
Leo rolled his eyes and complained. "Stop playing a cliché villain role. I've seen this type of trope multiple times."
"LISTEN HERE, NU'EARTHE!" Milo turned around and pointed the giant sword at Leo's face. "A weakling like you have no idea what the high-ups are doing. When the time comes, Queen Eleanor will purge the universe and unite all races as one! Your kind is fated to doom! Therefore, go home and treasure your life while you still can!"
Hearing a piece of information, Leo pursed his lips. At first, he planned to end this guy right here. But judging how considerate he was, Leo changed his mind.
"You're very kind for a racist werewolf. Thanks for the tips. I'll let you live for another day."
"WHAT?!"
Leo snapped his fingers and stopped time again. This time, he activated a domain of death sword.
Two domains overlapped each other. The first was the time and space domain while the second one was the death sword domain. Everybody who was inside Leo's domain became a life target for him to cut down.
Leo closed his eyes as he could sense the presence of 300 werewolves in this colony. All of them carried bloody weapons as they were responsible for the town's massacre.
He took off the upper hazmat suit and brought out the pen sword. He injected his Qi into it and turned it into a lightsaber. Then, he swung it once.
The lightsaber didn't let out a sound. However, the 300 werewolves in the death sword domain received a cut to their soul.
Leo didn't stop there. He flew toward Overlord Max's manor as it emitted the strongest aura. When he got closer, his alien ring vibrated.
"Is it here?"
Leo followed his instinct and injected his Qi into the lightsaber. Instead of cutting the soul of a living being, the sword transformed into a large energy hammer. He swung down and hit the building.
The energy sword hit something hard and bouncy. However, the hammer crushed the barrier and destroyed the entire building in one hit.
After crushing the building, Leo resumed the flow of time to check the result. As soon as he did that, the system prompted him with a confirmation message.
DING
<You have destroyed Overlord Max's headquarters!>
<Overlord Max's domain had 52 system buildings and 0 system personnel. You have received 52 gacha tickets (Building).>
<Overlord Max has zero treasure left in his warehouse. You have gained nothing.>
<Overlord Max has zero lifespans remaining. You have gained nothing.>
<You and your allies will be teleported home in 10 seconds. Please stand by.>
RUMBLE
The entire colony shook and slowly dissipated into dust.
"WHAT?! HOW?!"
Overlord Milo witnessed the changes and was shocked. He looked around to find Leo, but the guy already disappeared from his sight.
WHOOSH
Leo returned to the puppies. He collected them in his arms and smiled at Milo.
"See you around, racist bitch. I'll be taking a round at the Fate Stadium soon. If you want to see me again, make sure to book a match there and wait for me."
"YOU WHAT?!"
WHOOSH
It was too late for Overlord Milo to capture Leo. He and the three puppies vanished.

chapters.title: Chapter 248 Florida Man Quit Job and Spent His Entire Saving in a Phone Game.
chapters.content:
Chapter 248 Florida Man Quit Job and Spent His Entire Saving in a Phone Game.
Chapter 248 – Florida Man Quit Job and Spent His Entire Saving in a Phone Game.
The entire colony dissipated into dust. Some supplies, furniture, debris, and random objects remained. The corpses also remained in the same places.
Overlord Milo watched everything in disbelief. A few seconds later, he gasped in realization.
"That's a player with a kingdom system! Damn, Nu'Earthe! Don't let me see you again!!"
Milo grudgingly turned toward the corpses of the hyena werewolves. He blamed them for the destruction of Overlord Max's headquarters.
"Tsk! If you hadn't been greedy, we would have crushed that Nu'Earthe and shared the city's loot! Serve you right!"
Milo was similar to Leo. He collected everybody's corpses and remaining supplies to his storage ring. Once everything was accounted for, Overlord Milo reverted to a humanoid werewolf form and teleported back to his battleship.
Upon returning to the bridge, Milo ordered his soldiers.
"Set the course to the rendezvous point of the 7th princess. We'll regroup with them so that we can rebuild our mothership!"
The crew silently barked in response and shifted their attention to the station console in front of them. They adjusted the ship's output, turning it around.
BOOM
The battleship fired seven laser beams in front of the bow and opened a wormhole. It blasted its engine and disappeared into the warp gate.
.
WHOOSH
A day later, Overlord Milo's battleship exited the wormhole and appeared 50,000km away from a fleet of a dozen artificial planets, five cubic motherships, and a thousand of star-destroyer battleships.
Overlord Milo's ship seemed small compared to the local battleships here. He gazed at the dazzling lineup and snorted.
"As expected of the war-addicted princess. At this rate, she will become Queen Eleanor's successor."
Milo thought of the princess with mental health issues. She might be the prettiest divine elf in the royal family, but her bipolar behavior made it uncomfortable to work with her. He still remembered how the princess killed her subordinates over the slightest disagreement.
"Ha… I still have to report back to her. I might die."
.
.
Leo returned to his domain before Milo could even exit the wormhole. He and the three puppies appeared at the Altar of War.
DING
<You have successfully raided a player's home!>
<The Altar of War will undergo a maintenance process for 360 days.>
"Holy moly!"
Leo was stunned by the cooldown time of this building. Realizing how long it took to recharge, Leo understood the importance of the cooldown level of this facility.
<Quest completed.>
Finally, the last phase quest was completed. With this, Leo could move on to the next phase and increase his domain's maximum level.
.
Entity Fate Crystal Quest – Phase 3/13
Mission Objectives: Complete 10 tasks to complete this phase.
Phase Completion Rewards: 300,000 Years of Lifespan, One Selectable SR Building, Increase the Shopping Mall's max level to 17, Increase the Sub-Building's Max Level to 17, and Enable TOP-UP Feature.
Phase Three Tasks (10/10 Completed)
- Recruit at least 2,000 workers. (Done)
- Complete at least one true fate crystal (Done)
- Successfully defend against an invasion from another player (Done)
- Successfully invade a player's home planet (Done)
- Embed a true fate crystal to a pylon tower (Done)
- Upgrade 20 buildings to level 15 (Done)
- Upgrade shopping mall to level 15 (Done)
- Get a girlfriend and fail NNN! (Done)
- Manufacture at least 1,000 weapons using strategic resources. (Done)
- Recruit at least 100 immortals as your soldiers (Done)
*For every completed task, you will receive one Lucky Draw (Building), and one Lucky Draw (Automaton).
.
DING
<Your lifespan has increased by 300,000 years.>
<You have obtained one selectable SR building ticket.>
<Your shopping mall's max level has increased to 17.>
<The max level of your buildings has increased to 17.>
<You have unlocked the TOP-UP feature!>
The third phase of the entity fate crystal quest was completed. Leo got what he wanted at last.
"Hah! Finally, I can WHALE the gacha! What currency do you need? I bet it's my lifespan."
Leo closed the quest menu and checked the TOP-UP option. It showed a new textbox with a string of numbers. Leo's lifespan was highlighted.
[16,912,248]
"Huh?!"
Leo hadn't counted his lifespan for a long time. When he saw the balance, he was taken aback.
"Man, I'm rich. I guess I can splurge a bit."
There was no button to recharge the currency. However, behind the textbox, another number textbox was visible and flashing. There was also a [+] icon behind the number.
[0] [+]
Leo rubbed his chin and grinned. He pressed the plus icon to check how he could top up the currency.
DING
A new screen appeared, revealing the exchange rate of the new currency.
.
1 E-CRYSTAL / 35 YOL
10 E-CRYSTAL / 340 YOL
100 E-CRYSTAL / 3,300 YOL
1,000 E-CRYSTAL / 32,000 YOL
10,000 E-CRYSTAL / 300,000 YOL
.
The exchange rate looked average for a gacha game knockoff system. However, there were multiple tabs on this top-up screen.
Leo pressed on one of them to inspect it. Unfortunately, the system informed him of a piece of bad news.
<Promotion Feature is currently locked. Please complete more entity fate crystal quests to unlock this feature.>
"…Is this a scam?"
Leo deeply sighed. He tested the feature by purchasing the cheapest e-crystal package, aka the 10,000 e-crystal package.
CHA-CHING!
Leo's lifespan decreased, but the mysterious currency number box increased by 10,000.
After getting the premium currency, Leo swiped the system screens. He navigated to the gacha page.
As Leo had been saving up, he had 62 tickets for building gacha and 10 tickets for servant gacha. This didn't include a selectable SR building ticket.
"Hehehehe! Alright, f2p rolls first. SHOW ME THE MONEEEEEEEEEEY!!"
Rolled pressed the 10+1 button and gambled his life away.
…
66 rolls later, Leo glared at the gacha page with bloodshot eyes.
He didn't get a single SR building from the 66 rolls! Instead, he got 60 normal buildings and 6 rare buildings.
"THIS GACHA IS CURSED! MY ID IS CURSED! THIS IS A SCAM!!"
A PTSD flashback from the childhood days came back to haunt Leo. He recalled the days when he spent all his allowance on a gacha game and didn't get a desired character from the game.
Fortunately, the situation was different. Leo was no longer poor and dependent on his parents' wallets.
He had money to spend!
"It doesn't matter. Those were trash tickets. Come on. How much do you need to roll a 10+1?"
Leo rechecked the confirm button. The detail above the buttons changed.
Instead of demanding tickets, the game allowed Leo to spend the premium currency to get the goodies. Still, the price was concerning.
.
One Roll = 1,600 E-Crystals
10+1 Roll = 16,000 E-Crystals
.
Leo almost vomited blood. This gacha was too expensive.
"Are you kidding me?! I swiped 300,000 YOL, but I don't have enough crystals to roll 10+1?! Which gacha game company runs this system?! EA?! MIHOYO?! Are you trying to compete with FGO?!"
Leo thrashed and tossed his arms in anger. He wished he could refund his lifespan.
"Dammit! Fine. It would have been a waste if I hadn't tried it at least once. I'll spend some more."
As Leo had two extra tickets, he received a small discount. He only needed an additional 2,800 crystals to do the 10+1 roll.
Unfortunately, Leo's muscle memory acted up. He reopened the top-up menu and chose the 10,000 crystal package without thinking and confirmed the purchase.
Old habits died hard.
"…Huh?"
Leo's brain successfully computed the data and made him realize the mistake one second after he pressed the button.
"NOOOOOO!! I WASTED MY LIFESPAN!!"
Leo shed a tear of regret. He scratched and ruffed his hair in frustration.
A few minutes later, Leo recovered from the mental breakdown. He deeply sighed and switched the gacha page to the mannequin gacha.
Leo had enough free buildings. He wanted more helpers.
Not expecting anything, Leo pressed the 10+1 roll and spent the free tickets.
DING-DING-DING
10 grey balls and one blue ball came out. As Leo had seen them 66 times already, he closed the screen.
10 mannequin workers and one cashier emerged. They stood in formation, looking at their new master.
Leo blanky assigned them tasks according to their specialties. The crowd dispersed and ran toward their new workplaces.
After the crowd was gone, Leo picked up the confused puppies and dragged his feet back to his bus. He ignored the local people and entered his bedroom.
He didn't notice that his people were busy carrying pieces of broken drones, jets, and battleships toward the junkyard.
.
.
In the bedroom, Leo found Esen sleeping in his bed. He frowned and checked the time.
2PM. It was too early for someone to go to sleep.
"This brat. She's getting lazier."
Leo carried the puppies outside the bus to find someone to take care of them. When he left the bus, he found Yao Qiqi, who explored the parking lot for fun.
"Oh, hey little girl. Come here for a second."
Yao Qiqi stopped exploring the empty parking lot and ran toward Leo. She spotted the three golden retriever puppies and brightly smiled.
"They are so cute! Can I have them?"
"…"
Leo was about to ask Yao Qiqi to find a caretaker. Since Yao Qiqi was a monster tamer, she might suit the job.
"Alright. I'll give you some special food to feed them. Take care of these guys. They just lost their parents."
"Awww. Poor babies."
Yao Qiqi hugged the dogs. The puppies sensed her emotion and licked her to cheer her up.
"Hehehe! I think they like me!"
"…Yeah. Sure. Take them to see your master."
"Yes, senior!"
Yao Qiqi carried the three puppies and flew out of the parking lot.
Mentally tired and physically exhausted, Leo felt like taking a nap. He entered his bus and took a bath. Afterward, he slipped into the bed to cuddle with his lovely wife.
Sensing Leo, Esen slightly opened her eyes. When she noticed that he only cuddled with her and fell asleep, she faintly smiled and nudged her head against his chest to mark her scent on him like a cat.
"…Welcome home, hubby."
Esen uttered in a faint voice. She was embarrassed but it gave her a fuzzy feeling in her chest.
Soon, it would be their official wedding ceremony. She looked forward to it.

chapters.title: Chapter 249 Local Floridians Shocked as Snowstorm Approached While Ohio Man Mocked, “First Time?”
chapters.content:
Chapter 249 Local Floridians Shocked as Snowstorm Approached While Ohio Man Mocked, “First Time?”
Chapter 249 – Local Floridians Shocked as Snowstorm Approached While Ohio Man Mocked, "First Time?"
Fate Stadium
In a lavish suite within the hotel, numerous bookshelves adorned the walls, holding thousands of substantial books. Seated at a central black wooden table was a sophisticated divine elf with refined blond hair.
Ellen reclined on a black leather chair, propping her feet up on the table. Using a Qi string, she meticulously trimmed her nails from the tips of her fingers, smoothing them afterward. "Max's headquarters is destroyed by a random player. Am I hearing that correctly?" Ellen sneered.
Milo, the Overlord, remained motionless, folding his arms behind his back. He steadfastly maintained his gaze on his master, never shifting his eyes away.
"The opponent is a mysterious entity or a karmic sovereign. He is also a fate crystal bearer since he has a kingdom-building system. I can't help it."
"Is that your excuse?"
"It is the unforeseen circumstance, not an excuse."
"It's the same. If you fail your mission, everything that comes out of your mouth is an excuse."
Milo snorted and glared at Ellen, "What do you want me to do then? Get myself killed pursuing the mysterious system user?"
"Yes. Is there a problem with that?"
"That's an abusive order and a waste of manpower. Would you prefer losing one of the few entities of our army before we could get a showdown with Overlord Xiaomao and his Cathulhu minions? This doesn't include Overlord Kishin who has been making suspicious moves recently. Had Overlord Mao never been killed, we would have been at risk of being besieged by three karmic sovereigns!"
Ellen glanced at Milo's face. She sneered. "I know. That was a joke. I was just testing you."
"…That wasn't even funny."
"Sometimes, you just have to act crazy to differentiate between competent subordinates and the bootlickers. I'm glad you're the former."
"…"
Ellen stood up and snapped her fingers. The cabin's walls turned black as she released a domain to block their voices from leaking outside.
"In a few days, my mother will probably order me to return to the palace. But that's obviously a trap to lure me."
Milo narrowed his eyes. "Shouldn't you be complying with Her Majesty's mandate?"
"And allow her to destroy my soul and steal my body and dantian? Why should I?"
"…I don't understand what you mean."
Ellen widely smirked and walked toward a wine table. She poured a black wine into a glass and downed it in one gulp. Then, her expression turned dark.
"My mother has been cursed by the karma river because she destroyed and devoured too many souls. All fate crystals denied her existence and disabled her existence power. She could not increase her lifespan no matter how hard she tried…"
"…Past tense? Does that mean?"
Ellen deeply sighed.
"Her influence is far and wide. Years ago before I was born, she sold obsolete technologies to inferior races in various worlds in exchange for their research cooperation. Many divine elves were dispatched to inferior planets and disguised as the natives. One of them was a planet called 'Earth'."
"…"
Milo narrowed his eyes. He remembered the name as he once invaded the planet to search for Leo.
Ellen continued. "At that planet, the dispatched divine elves received the order to establish a colony there permanently. Some of them married with a local and gave birth to inferior elves."
"Isn't that allowed? I mean, no law forbids them to do so."
"Indeed, it's legal. However, do you know what my mother ordered them to do next?"
"…Please enlighten me, Your Highness."
Ellen burst into laughter. "My mother went around and tricked Overlord Xiaomao, Overlord Mustafa, and even your lord Overlord Lucky. She offered them so many stars in exchange for a few drops of their blood essence. She distributed them to every research facility and ordered them to clone their blood!"
"…What? Is that even possible?!"
"Yes. It's obviously impossible since karmic sovereigns and entities' blood can't be cloned or reproduced with science or backwater technologies. But guess what? A bastard did it. You know who it was?"
"Who?"
"Overlord Mao Miaomiao!"
"!!!"
Ellen slapped her forehead and burst into laughter.
"That man did something impossible! He demanded my mother to give him her blood essence and let him be one of her consorts!"
Overlord Milo widened his eyes in astonishment. He couldn't imagine how the matriarch would react in that situation. "Did she kill him?"
"No! Instead, she double-downed her insanity by ordering the man to create a homunculus using her blood essence and the other overlords' blood! They captured every child on the planet and experimented on them with the incomplete diluted blood."
Ellen walked toward her working table and pulled out a drawer. She picked up a photo of a young African-American child and a white boy with green eyes.
"Out of 100 million children, two survived. The black guy is none other than the husband of Ester. As for the other one, do you know what happened to the boy?"
Ellen flickered the photo to Milo. The latter received it and gazed at the picture.
The brown boy resembled the infamous informant, who was known by the alias Ohio Man. As for another boy, his green eyes reminded him of the old man that he saw the other day.
"What happened to the boy, Your Highness?"
"20 years later after the picture was taken, Overlord Mao Miaomiao who was a human at that time used a new technique that he and my mother researched on the test subject. Overlord Mao Miaomiao transferred his soul into the body and stole it!"
"…What?"
"Incredible, right? A human with no cultivation knowledge managed to do something that we, karmic sovereigns and entities, cannot accomplish. My mother was so overjoyed that she destroyed the entire planet's population and welcomed Overlord Mao Miaomiao as her consort. They even gave birth to the devil race!"
Overlord Milo was astonished. He had been wondering how and why Overlord Mao Miaomiao and his Devil Race suddenly appeared 50,000 years ago. Everything made sense after listening to Ellen's story.
"And that comes to my problem. You see, my mother completed the research on a soul transfer technique, but she can't simply use it recklessly. The old once said – A body is a container of a soul. If a soul is too big, the container will break. As such, to use that technique, my mother needs a sturdy container that can shelter her soul. You know that she's a karmic sovereign like me, right?"
"!!!"
Milo was not stupid. He connected the dots and understood the hidden message.
Ellen stopped speaking. She grabbed the bottle of black wine and drank it directly. When Ellen was done, she told Milo her plan.
"I'll never return to my mother and die for her lust for youth. My body belongs to me, not her. This entire mobilization is a distraction. I'll be forming an alliance with the Cathulhu and Overlord Xiaomao with these forces instead!"
"T-This…"
Ellen snapped her fingers and dispelled the soundproof domain. She shouted and called the person in front of the cabin's door to come in.
"You can come in, brother-in-law. The door is unlocked."
Overlord Milo turned around at the same time the door was opened. Behind the door was Simba in his human form.
Simba entered the cabin and stood next to Overlord Milo. He crossed his arms behind his back like a modern soldier.
"Mercenary Ohio Man reports for duty!"
Ellen nodded in approval. She shifted her gaze toward Milo.
"From now on, I want you two to work together. I want you to go back to my fleet and lead them toward the Cathulhu Star Sector. When they make contact with you, raise a white flag and surrender immediately."
Simba nodded while Milo reluctantly placed his fist on his left chest to salute.
"You're dismissed." Ellen chased them out.
.
.
Florida Domain
In the junkyard, an extensive collection of spaceship parts, damaged hulls, and discarded spacesuits formed a towering heap. Local workers congregated around this heap, examining the unusual metals.
Among the workers, Wu Buyi and Tang Xuan were the most industrious researchers, scavenging for metal sheets to study. In the process, they stumbled upon several abandoned storage rings within spacesuits and miscellaneous containers.
Despite both individuals having the rightful claim to the rings, neither chose to keep them. Instead, they entrusted the rings to the local mannequins, tasking them with passing the items on to Leo.
RUMBLE
While the alchemist duo rummaged through the junk, Ivy's team carried a half-destroyed battleship from the east and dropped them north of the junkyard. A portion of the spaceship touched the half-cooled lava field and sunk into the ground. However, none of the hulls showed signs of being melted or burnt.
Marc and Beatrice took a short break and gazed at the spaceship. They let out a long sigh as they knew what it was.
"It has been a long time since I last saw this battleship. You know, sister. I used to dream about becoming a spaceship pilot when I was a little."
"What about now?" Asked Beatrice.
"The divine elves are all racists! Because I'm a Molg, they disqualified me before I could even get a chance to take the admission test! They forced me to become a knight like you."
The Molg race represented among the various Halfling races scattered across the universe. Their lineage bore traces of both divine elf ancestry and an inherited true vampire bloodline. Consequently, every member of the Molg race possessed elongated fangs and distinctive white hair. They also exhibited an affinity for death magic and cultivation techniques associated with mortality.
Historically, the Molgs had served the divine elves as expendable slaves, deprived of proper resources for cultivation unless specifically permitted by their masters.
The Molgs' dynamic with the divine elves underwent a transformation with the arrival of Esen. At just five years old, Esen ascended as an immortal and utilized her authority to purchase 70% of the Molg population from their slaveholders. Procuring a planet, she liberated them from bondage.
Among the fortunate Molgs were Marc and Beatrice, profoundly grateful to Esen, pledging their unwavering loyalty to her.
However, fortune took a turn. By the time Esen reached the age of seven, her younger sister, Ester, falsely incriminated her, leading to her banishment to a distant planet. Subsequently, Eleanor murdered Esen and placed a curse upon her and her followers, transforming them into undead beings. This dark chapter became part of their history.
Reminiscing about the past evoked deep emotions. They harbored gratitude towards Leo, who rescued Esen and facilitated their resurrection. They voluntarily worked without rest.
"I'm sure one of the battleships can be repaired. Let's find another one. I think it crashed somewhere south."
Beatrice silently nodded and followed her little brother.
.
.
Meanwhile, the Yan Dynasty Planet's atmosphere underwent a dramatic shift. Vibrant rainbow auroras manifested above both the North and South Poles. The local temperature plummeted by ten degrees Celsius, leading to a segment of the sea freezing over. The planet's snowy expanse expanded, extending closer to the equator.
The planet was on the brink of entering an ice age, heralding the arrival of dense yin Qi permeating the air.
Concurrently, the planet's core underwent a metamorphosis. The previously white core transformed into a rainbow hue as the exceedingly yang Qi from the atmosphere descended and condensed within the core. As the accumulation of yang energy intensified, heat surged.
Under the intense heat, rocks and minerals melted, giving rise to torrents of lava that gradually seeped through subterranean crevices. Volcanic mountains, both on the surface and submerged underwater, erupted in succession, spewing lava akin to fountains, inundating the land with molten soil from the depths.
The collision of extreme yin and yang energies caused a resonating buzz, solidifying into small hailstones. These condensed yin and yang energy formations descended to the ground as essence stones - a product of this natural phenomenon!
Unfortunately, local cultivators found themselves unable to seize the opportunity to collect these naturally occurring essence stones. Most secluded practitioners fled from the volcanic mountains and the piercing cold, seeking refuge in warmer regions.
One such location was Leo's domain, positioned 3,000 kilometers north of the equator line, soon to face the onslaught of the extreme cold.

chapters.title: Chapter 250 A Florida Man Penetrated Airport Perimeter to Engage Alien Delegates on Runway for Cannabis Import Negotiations
chapters.content:
Chapter 250 A Florida Man Penetrated Airport Perimeter to Engage Alien Delegates on Runway for Cannabis Import Negotiations
Chapter 250 – A Florida Man Penetrated Airport Perimeter to Engage Alien Delegates on Runway for Cannabis Import Negotiations
Leo, well-rested from a good night's sleep, took a leisurely walk through the junkyard to survey the amassed treasures. His expectations were met with satisfaction.
The diligent mannequins toiled throughout the day, managing to haul in two wrecked battleships. Regrettably, these spaceships were too large to fit within the confines of the junkyard. They were left north of the premises.
Showing thoughtfulness, the elves and molgs froze a section of the lava field to serve as storage area for the ships, ensuring none of the salvaged spaceships disappeared into the molten pool.
Leo gathered several pieces of metal hull and components, executing his plan. He transported them to the 5th floor of the shopping mall. Upon revealing them to the blacksmith mannequins, Leo's materials were swiftly retrieved and transported to their workshop's furnace, where they were melted down and refined.
Leo received a system notification message:
DING
<You have discovered Styx Blood Metal.>
<You have discovered Styx Blood Ore.>
<New armors can be crafted.>
Musing to himself, he wondered, "What can these do?"
No blacksmith answered Leo's inquiry. Focused on the furnace, the mannequins threw immortal coal, mined from the quarry, into it, intensifying the flame and generating extreme heat.
As the hive-mind mannequins shared their thoughts, ten junkyard workers brought over components and metal plates from the wrecked ships a minute later. They left large metal scraps in front of the blacksmith before returning to the junkyard for more.
Once again, Leo was curious, peering closer to observe what they would do with the metal plates.
Several minutes passed, and the scraps and junk transformed into ingots. The mannequins cooled them and handed a sample to Leo for inspection.
Leo touched the ingot with his bare hand, anticipating a mutation. Unfortunately, it showed no signs of reacting to his flesh, Qi, or blood.
Failing to get an answer, Leo shifted his attention to the overall levels of every facility in the shopping mall. He upgraded the building and every facility to level 17.
DING
<New construction options!>
Refusing to stop there, Leo opened his inventory menu and browsed the list of new buildings he obtained from the gacha. As most were common ones, he proceeded to build them to fill the shopping mall's empty slots.
Among the common buildings acquired in the previous gacha frenzy were 10 Alchemy workshops, 15 blacksmith workshops, 10 clothing stores, 15 gunsmith workshops, and 10 fast-food chain restaurants. Leo built everything and arranged them within the shopping mall.
Sixty new facilities occupied 60 empty slots in the mall. All workshops remained on the fifth floor, while the rest were placed on the first floor. The additional facilities increased the production rate, prompting Leo to upgrade their levels.
.
Basic Alchemy Workshop Level 17
Active Cauldrons: (5/5)
Alchemy Automatons (5/5)
Production Quality (5/5)
Production Quantity (2/5)
.
Blacksmith Workshop Level 17
Automaton Blacksmiths (5/5)
Furnace (5/5)
Product Quality (5/5)
Production Speed (2/5)
.
Gunsmith Workshop Level 17
Automaton Gunsmith (1/1)
Automaton Hand Loader (1/1)
Firearm Technology (6/6)
Product Quality (6/6)
Structure Quality (3/6)
.
Clothing Store Level 17
Automaton Worker (4/5)
Automaton Weavers (3/5)
Weaver Skills (5/5)
Store Quality (5/5)
.
Food Court Level 17
Automatons Cooks (4/5)
Accommodation Size (3/5)
Food Quality (5/5)
Food Variety (5/5)
.
Fast-Food Chain Restaurant Level 17
Automatons Cooks (4/5)
Cooking Speed (3/5)
Food Quality (5/5)
Food Variety (5/5)
.
The basic facilities nearly reached the maximum level, allowing some of them to commence producing top equipment immediately. However, the increased production came at a cost.
Thirty weaver robots from the new and existing clothing stores rushed to the fifth floor and surrounded Leo, requesting him to donate his flesh and blood.
"Dang it!"
Leo silently cursed the mannequins while reluctantly biting his arms, tearing his flesh and spilling transparent blood for the weavers. The clothing store's weavers retrieved Leo's pieces of flesh and paraded to their stores. Without relying on Leo's instruction, they learned the clothing designs from the existing stores and planned their merchandise.
When everything was over, it was already midnight. Leo rested on the floor, focusing on regenerating his lost flesh and blood. All wounds instantly healed, but the pricking pain annoyed him.
The trouble persisted as new alchemy workshops started operating, and the alchemist mannequins required instruction. They gathered around Leo, pressuring him with their red eyes.
"Okay! Okay! I'll assign you a new task. Jeez!"
Ten new workshops featured 50 cauldrons to work with. To acquire soul stones, he assigned all of them to convert existing essence stones.
The mannequins darted from the fifth floor to the first floor, some taking the elevator to the underground warehouse to fetch materials. After their departure, Leo let out a long sigh of relief, planning to check on the newly unlocked buildings.
However, Leo forgot that other workshops also demanded new jobs. Blacksmiths, gunsmiths, and cooks mannequins gathered around Leo, menacingly staring at him.
"Oh, boy."
.
.
3 AM
"Hah…"
Leo wiped his sweat and stood on the rooftop of his shopping mall. He finished assigning new tasks to the mannequins, including placing new orders to craft new weaponry and armor.
The previous prototype M16 was lackluster due to its limited firepower. However, Leo looked forward to seeing the other's reactions when the new weaponry emerged.
Some of the employees still carried flintlock rifles around even though they were obsolete. He took notes to himself that he needed to order everybody to exchange their old weapons with the new ones.
DING
<Insufficient resources.>
"Hmm?"
Suddenly, the system message interrupted Leo's thoughts. He pressed on the notification message screen, asking the system to elaborate.
"What resources?"
DING
<Your fast-food chain restaurant number 6 lacks ingredients to make spicy chicken noodles.>
<Your fast-food chain restaurant number 7 lacks ingredients to make steak sandwiches.>
<Your fast-food chain restaurant number 8 lacks ingredients to make Hawaiian Pizzas.>
<Your fast-food chain restaurant number 9 lacks ingredients to make French fries and salad.>
<Your fast-food chain restaurant number 10 lacks ingredients to make dim sum.>
<Your fast-food chain restaurant number 11 lacks ingredients to make carbonara spaghetti.>
"Holy crap…"
Food suddenly became an issue before the stores could even operate. Leo rushed to the underground warehouse to check the storage in panic. Then, he was stunned.
Half of the shelves and baskets were empty. Even 90% of the fast-grown yin cabbages disappeared.
The self-grown food wasn't an issue since they could be harvested from the farms. However, the meat section was the big issues. All giant potatoes and thunder alligator's meat were gone. No cockatrice chicken remained in the coolers. Only the werewolf meat that the mannequins had extracted from the corpses remained.
"I guess I expected too much from the restaurant department."
At a time like this, Leo wished he could have a business partner who specialized in agriculture to assist him. He hoped that he could import meat, cheese, and other ingredients from elsewhere.
The system store was out of the question. A single cabbage cost over 1,000 YOL a piece. Thus, importing it from the system was money-sinking.
Not all issues were impossible to solve. Leo smiled as he glanced at one of the two new system buildings.
.
Trade Center
Max Visiting Merchants (0/10)
Receptionist Mannequins (0/10)
Shipping Size (0/10)
Shipping Speed (0/10)
Price – 10,000 YOL
Can be built in Shopping Mall.
.
This was exactly what Leo needed. He hoped that the trade center would help him solve the food shortage issues.
Leo built the new facility on the fourth floor, utilizing this section as an entertainment district and a guest center. He upgraded it to level 17 and operated it to test what it could do.
.
Trade Center Level 17
Max Visiting Merchants (5/10)
Receptionist Mannequins (5/10)
Shipping Size (5/10)
Shipping Speed (2/10)
.
The trade center emerged on the fourth floor, boasting an interior far larger than the other stores and workshops.
It housed an entire airport!
Leo hurried inside and discovered an airport terminal with a breathtaking view of a starry sky, intricate runways, a control tower, and endless space beyond the glass.
"What is this place?!"
Five female mannequins materialized from the floor, dressed in blue suits akin to the regular employees. One of them used a sound transmission technique to talk directly to Leo's mind.
"Welcome to the trade center, master."
Leo struggled to acclimate to the talking mannequins, pondering if their intelligence relied on the shopping mall's levels or some other factor.
"Right. Well, what is this place? Where does the space lead to?"
"The airport directly connects to the Orlando Realm, master. Sir Kitten has long secured this area, catering to visitors from other planets. It provides privacy and conceals the true coordinates of our planet from wandering visitors. It also prevents spies, restricting visitors from entering your shopping mall and other facilities."
"Oh, interesting. But what if they want to become my customers? What then?"
"You can issue Visas to trustworthy visitors, master."
"…Oh."
Leo was acquainted with this system, wondering if he'd have to establish a consulate or embassy on alien planets in the future to issue visas.
Before Leo and the mannequins could continue their conversation, the first visitor spaceship suddenly landed at the airport. Leo and the mannequins turned to gaze at the spaceship. When Leo recognized its shape and size, he gasped in astonishment.
It was the same model he had reserved at the Fate Stadium. It bore a striking resemblance to the spaceship he arrived in.
The ship landed, and a hundred humanoid aliens in snug spacesuits rushed out, carrying sci-fi rifles. After securing the landing site, their commander emerged from the spaceship - A human clad in bulky spacesuits and a space helmet.
Leo squinted, attempting to gauge their cultivation base.
"Oh, just a bunch of immortals with railguns," he remarked, relieved.
Leo departed from the terminal, approaching the uninvited guests with the mannequins trailing behind.
As the space soldiers spotted Leo, they aimed their rifles at him, even their leader brandishing a white pistol and a lightsaber handle.
Leo folded his arms behind his back, maintaining distance, and greeted them in English.
"Welcome to my domain. Who are you, and what brings you here?"
"…"
None of the soldiers reacted to Leo's words, but their commander accessed a system screen and tinkered with it. A moment later, he lowered his weapon and spoke in English.
"I'm Caesar Ballers. We're from Planet United Nations."
"United Nations? UN? What the hell? Are you from Earth?"
"Earth?" The commander seemed taken aback. "That was indeed our mother planet. However, we migrated from there several 10,000 years ago."
"…I see."
The commander sized up Leo before asking the crucial question.
"Mister, are you from Earth?"
Leo grinned widely, revealing his identity.
"Yes, I am Florida Man, the last survivor from Earth."

chapters.title: Chapter 251 Woman Reported Missing after Business Trip. Local Found Her a Day Later Having a Yoga Session With Homeless Florida Man Who Provided Her Temporary Shelter.
chapters.content:
Chapter 251 Woman Reported Missing after Business Trip. Local Found Her a Day Later Having a Yoga Session With Homeless Florida Man Who Provided Her Temporary Shelter.
Chapter 251 – Woman Reported Missing after Business Trip. Local Found Her a Day Later Having a Yoga Session With Homeless Florida Man Who Provided Her Temporary Shelter.
"Florida Man? What an intriguing name. Are you truly rom Earth?" the commander pondered aloud.
Leo was startled. Something seemed awry with these individuals. "Wait a moment. Is there a nation called the USA? The United States of America?"
"Never come across it," came the response.
Leo furrowed his brow in bewilderment. Then, he considered that 50,000 years had elapsed, so migrants might have forgotten about the country. Perhaps something had transpired during the time Leo was confined in a test tube.
He rephrased his query. "So, which nation wields the greatest influence today? France? Germany? China? India? The UK?"
"Oh, those ancient nations? I've read about them in textbooks. They collapsed when everyone gained access to cultivation methods. Governments fell within a year."
"Even China?"
"Similar fate. Their supreme leader was assassinated, chaos ensued. Warlords and generals exploited the country's resources and tore it apart."
"...And which nation leads the UN?"
"Poland."
Leo had a hunch about the reason. He ceased prying for more details and changed the subject. "Anyway, welcome to the Florida Domain. Regrettably, my airport can only host five delegates from your side. We beg your pardon for this, as it's related to our security."
The commander nodded in comprehension. He turned away and conversed in his native tongue, yet Leo still comprehended their words.
"Andria and the three of you, come with me. The rest, guard the ship. Oh, right." The commander pivoted and saluted akin to a modern soldier. "I'm Lieutenant General Filip Petroski of the United Nations Self-Defense Force. You can call me Filip."
"Nice to meet you. Welcome again."
Filip and four companions strode into Leo's airport. Some of the guards from the ship attempted to enter the terminal but encountered an invisible barrier. He stepped back, bewildered, and touched the transparent wall in surprise.
Suppressing a smile, Leo guided the visitors to his shopping mall. While they walked, Filip and his soldiers removed their space helmets as a sign of respect.
Filip, a middle-aged man with a crew-cut brown hair, a neatly trimmed full beard, and well-defined muscles, seemed to be in his 40s. Among his followers was a blonde woman with a pointed ear protruding behind her. She also possessed long, light brown hair and blue eyes. Judging by her lovely countenance and smooth skin, she appeared to be in her early 20s. The others, all with Caucasian features and dark brown hair, looked younger than Filip.
Leo paid little heed to their appearances, surmising that their true ages might exceed their looks, given an air of immortality they exuded.
As the visitors departed from the airport, they furrowed their brows, surveying their surroundings. It had been a long time since they had last encountered a structure resembling a modern shopping mall.
"A shopping complex?" Filip pondered.
"Yes. Welcome to my base. Apologies for the modest accommodations and lack of reception. I wasn't expecting visitors today."
"No, it's our fault for intruding on your domain. By the way…"
Filip glanced at the front desk of the fourth floor's casino and peered inside with his keen sight. He observed the interior's apparent size, larger than the shopping mall's slot, which puzzled him.
"By any chance, are you a master of time and space array?" inquired Filip.
"Yes. Is that rare?"
"It is indeed rare. Few experts in our world could practice it as the top brass kept the cultivation method a secret. Only the parliament cabinets and senators had access."
"Are they monopolize the methods?"
"We had no choice. Otherwise, the local population might have obliterated every civilization for their own gain. It was for the greater good."
"I see."
Leo escorted the visitors to the tavern of heroes and arranged a lavish suite for their accommodation. Seated in the lobby, he invited them to rest and began conversing.
Getting to the point, Leo said, "This might sound abrupt, but I'm pressed for time. I'd like to finalize negotiations and treaties here if you don't mind?"
"No problem. It's better for us. Our men need to resupply. Our inferior technologies lag several million years behind the Divine Elves, Devils, Cathulhus, and Onis. We still rely solely on soul stones for space travel. So, could we begin by inquiring if we could purchase some soul stones from you?"
This was what Leo had been anticipating. He readily agreed but sought information on trade methods and currency.
"How will you pay? Barter trade?" asked Leo.
Filip turned to the blond girl, who nodded and tapped a smartwatch on her wrist. A light yellow holographic screen projected from the device, displaying the ship's cargo goods list.
She presented the list to Leo, highlighting blue lumber, gold bars, tree saplings, fertilizers, and vegetables as the main items.
Leo scanned the list and felt disappointed. Besides the vegetables, he had no use for anything else.
"How much veggies can I get for soul stones?" inquired Leo.
Filip wore a bitter smile. "How about ten tons per soul stone? We don't have much. At best, we can trade for three soul stones."
The standard rate for fresh vegetables stood at 10 tons per soul stone in the Fate Stadium. Despite their rarity, not many immortal beings consumed them as food. They were primarily used for fertilizers and animal feed.
Filip couldn't offer much else as his world lacked anything valuable beyond food and cultivated lumber.
"Would you consider trading your soul stones and other goods for our lifespan?" proposed Filip.
"Lifespan?!" Filip was taken aback.
Leo demonstrated by revealing their lifespan status as an example.
.
Name: Filip Petroski
Age: 4,950
Remaining Lifespan: 10,251 Years, 9 Months, 5 Days
.
The others, surprised by the appearance of the system screen, heard Adria, the woman beside Filip, speak in astonishment.
"Are you a system user?!" she exclaimed.
"Yes, I am," confirmed Leo.
Filip's expression darkened, and he lowered his head without hesitation. "Could you permit us to purchase your soul stones with our lifespan? We desperately need a substantial quantity!"
Leo chuckled, "You haven't inquired about the price yet. Are you sure?"
Filip swallowed and looked up. "How much, sir?"
"I haven't decided yet. Normally, I've sold an essence stone for a year of lifespan each. It takes 1,000 essence stones to make one soul stone, so it will be quite costly. Not to mention an extra charge for the conversion process. But how about this? I'll offer you a wholesale price: 1,000 years of lifespan per soul stone. How does that sound?"
Filip and the others rechecked their lifespan, sighing deeply. Everyone in the group lived over 3,000 years, with an average lifespan between 7,000 and 8,000 years. Only their commander had a longer life expectancy.
Whispering among themselves, they consulted the commander.
"Sir, what if each of us sacrifices one or two thousand years of our lifespan? With around 5,000 crew members aboard, we could acquire 10,000 soul stones. This would should be enough for our world for another 100,000 years."
The commander agreed. He shared a bitter smile with Leo and asking about their discussion.
"Would it be possible to pay with the crew's lifespan? Is that acceptable?" inquired the commander.
"That's fine by me. But you should discuss with your crew on the ship if they're willing to donate 1,000 or 2,000 years of their lifespan for soul stones."
"Thank you very much." Filip glanced at Andria, who nodded and hurried back to the ship.
Once Andria had departed, Filip and Leo changed the subject, exchanging information about their respective cultures and origins.
.
Andria spent four hours persuading the crewmates. A few disagreed initially about sharing their lifespan. However, under their commander's direct order, they reluctantly consented.
During her return trip, Andria encountered a familiar face. Hua Taixu emerged from the time chamber after training a group of curious youngsters. In the midst of seeking new prospects, their eyes met.
Andria raised her eyebrows, recognizing him as a famous historical figure who aided their migration to another world and propagated the dao of swords.
"You, woman!" Hua Taixu pointed at Andria.
"Me?"
"You, strong! Come train. You stronger!"
Andria wryly smiled, unable to decipher his language. She excused herself, "I'm sorry, I'm busy at the moment. Please excuse me."
"Tsk!" Hua Taixu didn't insist, turning away to seek new individuals to train.
Before leaving, Andria couldn't resist asking, "Sir, are you by any chance related to the sword saint Hua Taixu?"
Hua Taixu turned back, beaming with a bright smile. "I, his shadow. Me, HIM!"
"What?"
"You, come! WE TRAIN!"
"Err…"
Hua Taixu acted swiftly, seizing Andria's hand and pulling her into the time chamber. He activated the facility, locking her inside.
Leo and Filip would need to wait a while before she could return. By the time they realized, they already waited for her for the entire day.

chapters.title: Chapter 252 Florida Man Requests Pronoun Change at Government Office to Identify as 'Texas Man,' Citing Ownership of Machine-Gun-Armed Cows as Justification.
chapters.content:
Chapter 252 Florida Man Requests Pronoun Change at Government Office to Identify as 'Texas Man,' Citing Ownership of Machine-Gun-Armed Cows as Justification.
Chapter 252 – Florida Man Requests Pronoun Change at Government Office to Identify as 'Texas Man,' Citing Ownership of Machine-Gun-Armed Cows as Justification.
"Her tardiness is quite something," Leo remarked as he, Filip, and three others sat in the lobby, their expressions darkened.
Andria's absence had stretched the day unbearably long. Although the eternal nature of the immortals helped endure such waits, Leo felt a tinge of drowsiness after an intense staring contest with the visitors.
"Should we search for her?" Filip inquired.
"Nah, I can sense her life force. She's likely around here, lost in something," Leo replied confidently.
True to Leo's intuition, Andria eventually made her way to the tavern of heroes, accompanied by Hua Taixu. Strangely, both had ascended to the deity realm in their cultivation.
Hua Taixu sought Leo out for an upgrade, while Andria arrived to report her transformation.
"C-Commander, I've made it. I'm now a deity," she announced.
"What?!" Filip exclaimed, attempting to gauge her newfound strength but finding it impenetrable.
"Me, STRONK! Master, Help, STRONGER!" Hua Taixu chuckled, joining Leo and proudly brandishing a cup of the rare holy water of true fate crystal, which he obtained from the pylon tower's fountain.
Leo, feeling a headache looming, reclined against his couch and accessed Hua Taixu's status menu to review the upgrade costs for the summoned shadow.
Hua Taixu stood at level 10, aka the deity realm's starting point. The next level required a drop of fate crystal's holy water and 1,000 YOL to boost his strength by a star. However, there was no maximum limit how many stars Hua Taixu could hold.
Leo realized the potential for inflation and the financial drain this could become.
Turning to Hua Taixu, Leo posed a pointed question, "How many stars do you intend to attain, Hua Taixu?"
Hua Taixu beamed, "MANY!"
"How many?"
"MANY!"
"…"
Leo couldn't justify expending 10 million years of lifespan just to bolster the foundation of one or two subordinates. He believed that one million YOL or 1,000 stars should suffice for an employee. If Hua Taixu desired more, he'd have to offer something in return.
"I'm using up so much life force for you. You've got to put in more effort than before, alright?"
"ME STRONK! ME WORK HARDER!"
Shaking his head, Leo lamented the investment of hard-earned lifespan into this caveman. Still, he elevated the guy's cultivation base to a 1,000-star deity.
Though Hua Taixu's level remained at 10, his strength surged drastically. His aura emitted the presence of a supreme expert, and muscular size grew.
However, overzealous upgrading of the shadow bore consequences. The system notified Leo of an unprecedented event.
DING
<Your subordinate Hua Taixu no longer shares a karmic tie with the original Hua Taixu's karmic soul.>
<The soul of the original Hua Taixu has sensed your presence.>
DING
<Hua Taixu has sent a friend request.>
"Hmm?"
Leo felt perplexed. According to the biography, Hua Taixu should have been long deceased. Yet, the recent message contradicted this information.
There was something off about this individual. Nevertheless, in the pursuit of gathering more information, Leo accepted the friend request.
The friend system became available after Leo constructed the tavern of heroes. He could add any system user as a friend, including Acku. However, at that moment, Leo tested it with the original Hua Taixu.
DING
Upon accepting the request, the name appeared, but strangely, the portrait depicted a different person. He seemed younger and considerably more astute.
"Um, could you finalize the deal?" Filip interrupted Leo's absentmindedness.
"Oh, right. My mistake. Here," Leo activated his system and collected the payment, "I'll go fetch the soul stones. You can rest here. But you, come with me, you monkey!"
Leo dragged Hua Taixu's shadow along, knowing there was much to discuss.
.
.
Meanwhile, Filip inquired of Andria the reason for her delay.
"What happened yesterday? How did you ascend!?" he asked.
Andria admitted, "That strange old man pulled me into an odd location. It felt like it existed within a space-time array. Time passed differently there, much longer than usual."
"I'm having trouble grasping this."
"You'd have to experience it firsthand. I was stuck there for what felt like over a year, I believe."
"…Incredible."
Filip and the other three soldiers became intrigued, discussing a plan to visit the facility once their current deal concluded.
.
.
After pulling Hua Taixu aside, Leo questioned him, "Aren't you Hua Taixu? Why is there another individual?"
Hua Taixu snorted, "Me, shadow. He, real. We, no same!"
"Yeah, I get that. But weren't you supposed to be deceased?"
"Dead, he. Me clone! Me alive!"
"…I see. Next question, why is the real one alive?"
"Rebirth! He baby again!"
"Ah."
Leo found this explanation enlightening, yet it raised numerous questions and mysteries about the cycle of reincarnation. He wondered if Sierra's situation was similar.
While Leo conversed with Hua Taixu, the original finally messaged him.
"You're exploiting my clone, aren't you?"
Leo replied, "Your descendants longed for your return, but you never did. It's not my fault."
"Whatever you just did has damaged my reputation and my safety. I've recently reincarnated and am on the verge of becoming a sage. Raising my clone's cultivation base might have alerted my enemies to my existence. They'll start searching for me, and I'll be in trouble!"
"But he isn't you."
"He's my shadow! He has my former face. His actions affect me!"
"Ah, my mistake." Leo began feeling guilty about Hua Taixu. Yet, he believed it wasn't solely his responsibility as Hua Taixu never returned to assist Hua Jiashan and the Life Sword Sect.
"Anyway, I'm currently at the Fate Stadium. If you swing by, let me know. I have something to pass on to Hua Jiashan."
"…Alright."
The two conversed for a while before Leo resumed his duties.
.
.
The alchemy workshops had been bustling. Nearly reaching their maximum level, these buildings delivered satisfactory performances.
Soul stones, grain pills, and other products poured from these workshops, their production rate so rapid that the alchemist trainees felt dizzy.
Arriving at the fifth floor, Leo hurried into one of the workshops and inquired about the storage of finished products. He then swiftly gathering everything.
Creating soul stones proved simple using essence stones as primary materials. Moreover, the conversion rate was based on the workshop's quality. Instead of the usual one soul stone per 1,000 essence stones, each cauldron produced 50!
Leo was astonished but kept quiet. He gathered these precious cultivation resources to exchange with the visitors.
These soul stones were significantly larger than hand-sized essence stones, each almost the size of an adult human. Leo stowed them in a spare spatial ring, aiming to fulfill the request.
However, time was pressing. A workshop with five cauldrons managed 250 soul stones daily. With 10 workshops, Leo procured 2,500 soul stones for the moment.
"Well, this might take a while. They might need to stay for 3 or 4 days," Leo mused.
Returning to Filip's group, he informed them of the delay.
"It'll take about 4 days to transfer 10,000 soul stones. For now, here's 2,500," he said, passing a storage ring containing the fresh soul stones to Filip.
Filip examined the ring's content. His eyes lighted up at the sight of such potent soul stones.
"Senior Florida Man, this is incredible! We'll gladly wait! We'll gladly even if it takes a year!"
"I see."
Filip passed the ring around for the others to see. Andria and the rest were elated as these soul stones held more energy than any they had encountered before.
Realizing they'd be stuck for a while, Filip turned to Leo, "While we're here, could we explore your place? We're eager to check out the facility my comrade visited."
"Of course!" Leo welcomed the idea. "Some might require your lifespan as a fee. Talk to the mannequins by the shops. They'll guide you."
"Thank you! Oh, about the vegetables…"
"I'll trade for those, too. They'll spoil if kept on your ship, right?"
"Thank you for understanding, senior!"
Filip couldn't contain his happiness. This deal would benefit his world's local population. Plus, if Andria could advance her cultivation base within a day, Filip wanted to give it a try as well.
.
.
Leo left Filip and the group alone. Again, he was a busy man. After all, he hadn't used the SR gacha ticket and the premium currency to try his luck yet.
As Leo believed that fate crystals affected his luck, he entered his bus and poured all collected fate crystals on his bed. He then knelt and prayed.
"Bless me luck, my lucky charms! I want some good URs!"
Leo spent 16,000 premium currency and drew 11 building gacha balls from the machine!
DING-DING-DING
Leo closed his eyes, afraid to face reality. He only listened to the sound effects and pursed his lips.
DING-DING-DING
The sfx was loud and weird. Leo slightly opened his eyes to take a peek at the system screen.
A rainbow ball…
One rainbow ball…? Wait, there was another…
Two rainbow balls…?
TWO RAINBOW BALLS?!
TWO RAINBOW GACHA BALLS CAME OUT!!
Leo gasped for air. He smacked his chest as his heart almost stopped beating from shock.
Unfortunately, this king of luck had a consequence. Two of the sky fate crystals turned into dust!
"WWWWHAAATTTT?!"
Leo noticed the dusty pile on his bed and realized why it happened. He collected all fate crystals and sweated profusely. Instead of praying for a good roll, he wished the fate crystals wouldn't be all broken because of his stupid desire.
Fortunately, aside from the two sky fate crystals, the rest remained intact.
"Whew." Leo wiped his sweat and glanced at the UR icons. He brightly grinned.
.

chapters.title: Chapter 253 Florida Man Took Picture of a Cow on a Couch Surrounded by Five Black Horses. Tw*tter Exploded as Men Expressed Their Desire to Replace the Cow.
chapters.content:
Chapter 253 Florida Man Took Picture of a Cow on a Couch Surrounded by Five Black Horses.? Tw*tter Exploded as Men Expressed Their Desire to Replace the Cow.
Chapter 253 – Florida Man Took Picture of a Cow on a Couch Surrounded by Five Black Horses.?Tw*tter Exploded as Men Expressed Their Desire to Replace the Cow.
"T-THE LEGENDARY COW LEVEL!"
Leo hysterically cackled like a madman, imagining himself engulfed by a horde of enraged humanoid cows wielding scythes and halberds. He eagerly anticipated the chaos and weirdness of the adventure.
The two structures appeared to be buildings but were, in fact, portals to another world. Leo was intrigued by these changes.
Eager to test the portals, Leo hurried to the platform. Upon arrival, he found Meowmeow, Lucky, and Mu-Nyang in their usual place. Meowmeow's attendants stood respectfully behind him as he was in the middle of recuperating from the previous skirmish.
